description:
The overall atmosphere of this place is awesome! 

The drinks were good and I was especially happy about Wednesday deal (25 cent wings with a purchase of two drinks) can't beat that! 

You could hangout on the patio or watch sports inside the bar. Either way its a good time. I definitely recommend for a fun dive bar!
author: Sarah M.

description:
Visited on a Wednesday for one thing and one thing only -- 25 cent wings with two drink purchase.  How this is still possible in 2018?  Not sure but I'm not complaining.  I am a wing connoisseur and will never turn down a buffalo wing, fact.

Ended up getting there around 9 ish.  The place was packed.  Wall to wall, uncomfortable, can't breathe.  You line up like cattle at the bar and place your order with the bartender.  There are a few sauces to choose from, I went with buffalo.

We were able to find a seat on the outside patio.  The wings were delivered right away-- they were okay! I mean, does anyone really have the right to critique a wing that you paid a loose coin for?  Probably not.  It was a decent wing, a little soggy but if you like super saucy wings, this is for you.  The BBQ wings tasted like corn syrup.  Again, if sugar is your thing, those wings would be right up your alley.

The atmosphere was fun until the bouncer started screaming at us to clear the patio.  Cool, you have a loud voice.  We get it.  I gathered the remaining wings I was eating and headed back inside with my group to watch the Lakers game.  There weren't any tables open so be willing to get creative.  We ended up using the busted shuffleboard table as a place to eat.

All in all, okay experience.  I've had better wings, I've had better experiences.  Honestly, I would chalk this up to a Wednesday only scenario.
author: Lindsey P.

description:
First of all: they charged my credit card more than I authorized on the receipt! There are other reviews below of the same thing happening so watch out! It's ridiculous and annoying when businesses/employees do that. They have not responded to my email about this. 

Moving on...
We came for Wing Wednesdays. Each person has to order 2 drinks in order to get the 25 cent wings. We got some bottled beers and also craft - pretty good choices! As for the wings, we ordered habanero, bbq, and buffalo. The habanero was sweet and quite spicy but really delicious. Comes with ranch or blue cheese. The wings were spot on in general and at 25 cents can't be beat! They don't allow to-go boxes for wings!! Be prepared. 

The place was super crowded and people really just find any spot to squat in which is fine because that's the vibe here. It gets emptier after 8pm if you want to avoid the line/crowd.

Overall I enjoyed the food here and it's very fun to go to with friends but def check your statements!
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
Pros: loud Bass and good hip hop and Bay Area Music especially for an SF native like me.

Why I will never go there again? I bought a drink at last call I was literally forced to leave within two to three minutes after that. We spent good money on lots of drinks during our time here and made no trouble whatsoever. They treated us like we were nothing. The security guard kept saying they want to go home to their kids when it was literally 1:43am. I went to use the bathroom because we spent money here and we were patrons and I should be able to use the bathroom in a bar before I leave when it's way before 2 a.m.. On my way out they said I'll never be back the owners don't want me there and they called me a wh*re!? Disgusting... my boyfriend never wants to spend a dollar there ever again.

Pro tip teeth SF... Bars like you come and go SF natives like me spend my money where I'm treated like a normal person.
author: Leslie C.

description: Wait, the backyard is such a pleasant surprise! I've been here a couple times and have no idea what was back there. They have some tasty tots too.
author: Kelly G.

description:
Teeth SF is one of my favorite spots to go for Wings, bar food, drinks etc! The atmosphere is real Divey, but very inviting. You'll see all types of people there as well. 

Now to the good stuff. The FOOD. Factoring in size of wings, price and flavors Teeth SF is probably my favorite spot for wings in the city. They have 25 cent wings all day Wednesday, with a 2 drink purchase. Which isn't bad at all. 

The last time I went was during happy hour, which I believe is from 4-7, and you will never get a bette deal. We ordered 25 wings, TOTCHOS, and the two beers, which were $3 dollars each during happy hour. The wings were on point per usual. Tasty, crispy, and not one wing was undercooked. The Totchos, which are tater tot nachos were super bomb. The tots were perfectly crispy, which is important when using them for nachos, and the toppings were tasty as well.

The service was great, even on a busy wing Wednesday afternoon. 

I've been here a number of times and each time has been consistently great. Teeth SF always delivers!!
author: John James M.

description:
I love this place. Give me amazing chicken wings and a space outdoors that often hosts political
fundraisers and I am sold. Thank you!
author: J A.

description: Staff is awesome and the Totchos were great for breakfast. Bathrooms are classic dirty SF bathrooms though.
author: James O.

description:
Mega divey bar in the Mission. Great for groups - especially if you can snag one of the tables outside. The wings smelled delicious.

Where's the last place you saw fernet liquor on tap?

A little grungy and best enjoyed when squished tightly among friends.

Lots to read in the bathroom.
author: Jess L.

description:
Solid spot for brunch and a great Bloody Mary!

I love the atmosphere - it's pretty much a dive bar but a bit more quirky than that. They have weird/interesting decor with a display case containing a hodgepodge of oddities behind the bar, and mannequins in interesting attirr. The rest of the decor feels kind of modern/industrial. The mix of elements comes together really well! Perhaps because of this, it draws in a diverse of people of varying ages and styles. 

We sat at the bar and the service was awesome! The bartender took the time to chat with and get to know everyone and we felt right at home. We ordered our drinks and the bartender made us memorably good Bloody Marys - they were nice and spicy and full of flavor (it tasted like they used Old Bay or a similar spice blend and it was so good!). 

Food-wise the brunch menu is definitely comfort food, with an array of gluttonous items to choose from (e.g. do you want a fried chicken sandwich served on a donut? How about tater tot nachos? Or biscuits and gravy? They've got your back!). I opted for the Giants Platter which had a biscuit with gravy, french toast, eggs, breakfast meat of your choice and tater tots. Everything was delicious and it was a HUGE plate which was super satisfying. My boyfriend ordered the Breakfast Totchos which we also enjoyed and was a similarly huge plate of goodness. 

As added bonuses, the brunch is quite affordable for SF (most entrees are $15 or less!) and there was no wait when we went! By the time we left it did look busier with more of a wait, but nothing compared to some of the more intense brunch-waiting situations you might encounter elsewhere in the city.
author: Christine G.

description:
I went to Teeth yesterday for their 25 cent wing Wednesday and though I got there at 5pm exactly (which I thought was early, considering it wasn't a Friday), the bar was already packed. The line to order was definitely a solid 20-30 minute wait, and it's clear that Teeth is pretty understaffed - the cashier is also the bar tender. In order to get in on the 25 cent wings, you'll need to purchase 2 drinks. It wasn't immediately clear to me what the limit was, but the bartender let us know for the 4 dozen wings we ordered, we needed to get 6 beers. Everyone gets Modelo because it's the cheapest beer you can get at $4, but there's a few other cheap beers on the menu as well (though admittedly, they're not very good - think Bud Light quality beer). For 4 dozen wings and 6 drinks, it came out to roughly $50 after tax/tip/SF-health-tax which is pretty well priced. It's like getting free drinks on the house considering wings are normally about a dollar each on non-Wednesdays. I stayed for a while because one of our friends was running late, and I would advise you to bring a jacket for if you're sitting outside on a summer night because there aren't any heat lamps and it gets pretty cold in the back. If you're sitting inside, I'd suggest you bring some earplugs as the inside is LOUD; your ears might sustain some permanent damage if you come here frequently, as the music is as loud as your typical club. Expect to yell in order to communicate with your friends inside. Would I come again? Definitely! But just set proper expectations before coming in for wing Wednesdays. 

FYI. the death wings are extremely spicy, but the burn wears off in a few minutes. Definitely try one out if you're a fan of spice.
author: Austin W.

description:
The bar formerly know as Dr. Teeth. A staple of the mission dive bar scene, this place has no problem filling up the weekend for a drink, and definitely for wing Wednesday. I most recently came here for one of these wing Wednesdays, and I got here around 5:30pm and was LUCKY to get a single seat at the bar for 5 people.

FOOD:
It's hard to go wrong with 25c wings, so there are really no complaints. Decent buffalo wings which were tangy and spicier than your standard wings. Blue cheese dressing to help wash it all down. Only real critique is I wish it were fried a bit more to be crispier.
BBQ wings were a tad light on the sauce, but were a nice simple sweetness that somehow also went well with the blue cheese dressing.
When it's busy, like on a wing Wednesday during a warriors playoff game, the line for a drink (which there are two and they are usually located at the opposite corners of the bar) can take quite some time. Sitting at the bar, we had to wait for one of the bartenders to come back from her break to get a drink, even though we were literally sitting at the bar.

In the end, no complaints. 25c wings that were good, but not even close to great, on a packed night. I enjoy this place sometimes. Definitely a place you can come back to.
author: Bryant C.

description:
I don't spend too much time drinking in the Mission area, but when I do, I somehow always end up at Teeth. This bar has solid, reasonably-priced drinks at about ~$10 each. What gets us coming here seems to be the bar food they have. The tater tots, fries, nachos, wings, etc. are perfect bites! I especially love how crispy their tater tots are considering I'm not usually crazy about tater tots.

During the daytime, they also have an outdoor patio in the back that's really fun to hang out at. Great spot to stop along the many bars along Mission St.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
Got here for wing Wednesday ($.25 wings) and it was packed by 5:30pm and some people ended up standing and eating starting around 6:30pm.
As it was my first time here, I thought it was just a restaurant with a bar so i was surprised to get carded walking in when it was still day light out. Indoors was hot, crowded, loud and smelled like chicken. Thank goodness they have a patio section with some picnic tables and tall tables. They also have one TV but nothing was playing at the time. 2 unisex restrooms covered in graffiti and stickers (per usual, you won't get bored in the bathroom). 

We ordered the sweet chili habenero, bbq, and buffalo wings. For $.25 wings, they were normal sized and drenched in sauce which is a good thing. The mayhem tater tots were good, but like all things with toppings, it wasn't evenly spread. Not a biggie, their tots were still edible and crispy. 

The reson for 3 stars is the method of the madness. I think they can be more efficient when it comes to service. Maybe more staff in order to have table service? (You have to order everything at the bar then get served at the table, even for extra dipping sauce). Maybe have a mini bar outdoors just for drinks? It'll break some of the crowd and make the line a little less long? Granted, it was wing Wednesday and it probably only gets that chaotic some nights. I would give it a shot again just maybe on a regular night.
author: Jenna T.

description:
One word: WINGS! More specifically; sweet chili habanero! That's it. Go ahead and get your entire life here whilst scarfing down these incredible chicken wangs! Warning: these wings are hot and spicy! Oh yes boo, your mouth will be on fiyah! But like a drug, you just won't be able to stop yourself from eating them. Don't forget to get some water and try not to bite your fingers off as you devour these Godly sensations. I am now having chicken wing withdrawals as I write this review on none other than a wing Wednesday! Uuuhhhh! They're just too good.
 
Now, normally I don't get straight to the point like that, but these wings are truly the business. And now for the hoopla! When I first learned of the name of this place, I immediately cringed. DR. TEETH?! Shayla is not a big fan of dentists. When I heard that it was in the Mission, I slightly cringed again. I don't normally hang out in the Mission, but I haven't always had the greatest experiences in the past. I was still confused when I learned that it was a bar... like, what the? But then it happened.... I went inside. Let's just say that these teeth were poppin'!
 
The space is lively! Lots of people, great music, and a super diverse crowd. It's not the largest space, but the back patio is where it's at in the summertime! If you plan on coming here during the games, don't expect to find a seat unless you plan on getting there early! Wing Wednesdays are super crazy too. The wings are just amazing here and they have an amazing $.25 wings deal all night long on Wednesday nights with the purchase of at least two drinks.
 
Speaking of drinks; the bartenders here really know how to whip up a mean cocktail. The drinks are made super strong here, so just beware and make sure that you pace yourself. Happy hour is from 4-7 during the week and aside from wing Wednesdays, they also have some really good weekday specials!
 
If you decide to get the wings... because I KNOW you're going to get them: you have to try the sweet chili habanero wings! I could just rave about these damn things foreva, foreva-eva, foreva-eva! The flavor on these things are just so ridiculous! I think I ate about 50 of them all by myself and my mouth just about went numb! But it was OOOOHHH sooooo good! Take advantage of this Mission district gem, and treat yourself to a great happy hour here! I promise, you won't disappointed... but you might blame me for your chicken wings cravings. And, that's alright... I will happily take the blame THIS time around! ;)
author: Shayla B.

description:
Interesting place to go to. It's a bar, but it doesn't feel like a bar. My friends and I were confused about the atmosphere Teeth was going for. 
My friend got a sandwich, and I tried some. The bread was very toasty to the point where it's too hard to enjoy. 
The wings were amazing though!!! We got the group deal to share. Those were delicious. 
The drinks were okay. We tried the mixed drinks, and they were not the best. My friend got me a drink that was customized to my liking. It was better than the ones on the menu, but it still wasn't the best. 
The employees were super nice though!
author: Ngoc Tran D.

description:
Solid Establishment, 
Good drinks
Good food
Crappy part of town (kinda)
It's a hole in the wall until it opens up into a little diddy that's serves a solid B-Fast a stiff drink and a mediocre mimosa. Check it out.
author: Cal J.

description:
Outdoor seating, decent happy hour deals, shuffleboard, all the makings of a solid dive bar! They could do a little work on the restroom situation.. 

The staff is really accommodating. Went in and got a beer, burger and tots for $10. I would definitely come back!
author: Melissa H.

description:
Such a great happy hour spot and seriously so cheap! You really can't go wrong with the Totchos and Chicken Wings here. It's a great spot for watching the game with friends while sipping on some cocktails and munching on some tasty snacks!

Came here on a sunny Sunday afternoon with a few friends to watch the football game. Of course we opted for the Bottomless Mimosas (it was a Sunday afternoon), Chicken Wings, and Totchos with Truffle Oil. The waiters were really generous with their mimosas pours and literally kept coming to our table every 5 minutes to refill our cups. Talk about dangerous, and a terrible hangover a few hours later, haha. 

Besides the Mimosas, the Chicken Wings & Totchos are also worth trying, especially if you're with a few friends. The Totchos with Truffle Oil is definitely a game changer and so addicting with the generous serving of guacamole. And you can't go wrong with the Chicken Wings, especially when they're only 25 cents on Wing Wednesday!
author: MyTien P.

description:
A good place for after work festivities! Think weekly specials, weekday happy hours, and great appetizers. Teeth also sells burgers, sandwiches, and salads but most people usually come here for drinks and WING WEDNESDAYS! 

Just wanted to highlight that Wing Wednesdays are 25 cent wings with 2 drink minimum all night. On weekdays from 4-7pm, there are $4.50 well cocktails (think simple cocktails like cranberry & vodka, rum & coke) and $1 off bottles and cans. Tables can be tough to get on Wednesdays. I recommend getting there early so you can make it to the happy hour special AND order wings! Parking can also be difficult around the Mission area. There's a lot of metered parking, but it is free after 6pm.

Overall, the wings are pretty decent; it's definitely not the greatest but it's good for the price. Wing flavors come in natural, buffalo, sweet chili habanero, barbecue, or "death". You can mix and match the selection of flavors! I also HIGHLY recommend the totchos (imagine a loaded nacho plate but with tater tots instead of chips). Service is pretty slow so I suggest ordering enough wings and drinks in one sitting beforehand.
author: Michelle L.

description: I first tried this place out when it was Dr. Teeth but came back recently for the homie's birthday. Service was good and plenty of seating. The only challenging part is parking. Came here while waiting for everyone to arrive in time for our reservations for dinner next door (at Cha Cha Cha). I remembered their totchos were good and they also had a daily special. Wing Wednesday's?
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
Okay so I've been here more times than I care to admit now, but I feel like it deserves 5 stars. 

Weekends: Brunch is great and this place is my jam for bottomless mimosas (I hope the city doesn't force them to close their patio!)

Monday: Marty runs trivia here every Monday ("starts" at 8 but really starts at 8:30). Trivia is a lot of fun, and it's four rounds so you don't lose your whole night. Also every Monday is the burger and beer deal where you get a pint of draft beer and a burger + side for $10. So good. 

Wednesday: $0.25 wings!!!! Come here for wings for sure. Just realize that this place gets busy as hell. Two drink order minimum for the wings deal, but let's be honest with a price like that you're getting a pitcher. I enjoy most flavours, my favourite being sweet habanero. The BBQ flavour is a little too kerchupy for me. 

Can't remember being here on a Friday yet, but there looks like a decent sized group that rolls through.
author: Rajeev S.

description:
I am definitely a repeat customer here! 

First impression was that it was a little chaotic. I learned that its always like that on Wing Wednesday. It starts at 9pm and goes on till 11pm. Wings are 25 cents each after two drinks. My favorite is Au Natural and sweet chili lime! Load up on the wings and grab their tater tot nachos and you are all set for the night!

Bringing it back to impressions, it can get chaotic during certain nights. The place is always packed by a younger crowd between 21-35 years old. It is a cool date spot if you don't mind getting your hands dirty. Definitely not a romantic scene, but its fun. It is great for a smaller group of friends. Any bigger than 4, and you might have a hard time securing  a table. They have tables in the back passed the bathrooms which can be nice when the weather is nice.

Parking normally isn't hard to find if you go a little early. They don't have a parking lot, so it is all street parking.

Otherwise, I've always had a great experience.
author: Brennen D.

description:
$.25 for wings?!?!?! Now that's a price I like.

Wings cost $.25 on Wednesdays. There's au natural (my favorite), buffalo suace, barbeque sauce, and sweet chili lime. We got death sauce on the side. Don't underestimate the sweet chili lime wings...super super spicy.
author: Jenna W.

description: I will never go in this bar because it is not a place I would feel safe. Tonight when walking by I witnessed the bar's bouncer body slam a man's head onto the pavement to the point where he was knocked unconscious and would not wake up and an ambulance had to be called. There is no reason for a bouncer to escalate violence to that level and it was disturbing to see.
author: Maya D.

description:
Came on a Wednesday for the $0.25 wings, and it was super crowded! There is a back patio with some extra space and where it's less stuffy but they close that around 10PM and make everyone go back inside.

The wings are a great bargain, but there are some limitations. You can't order more than 100 wings, and there is a 2 drinks per person minimum, but it's still a great deal and an enjoyable experience regardless. There aren't many seats available, so be prepared to hunt and grab seating arrangements whenever they are free, especially if you're in a big crowd.

I personally liked the regular, dry flavor and the sweet chili flavor the best. The sweet chili is sweet and quite a bit spicy, so be prepared for that, and both of these flavors don't feel too drenched. I normally like BBQ and Buffalo sauce, but it didn't really taste that good here, it was a bit too drenched in the sauce and the sauce was so-so.

Overall a pretty fun place, might be back on some other night!
author: Tyler T.

description:
If you come here and it's not a Tuesday or Wednesday, that means you've got to come back. Today, I went on a Tuesday for one dollar tacos. On Tuesdays, they also have two-for-one margaritas. You have two options: either you can get a double margarita or two singles. I could not believe that that's even an option. Most restaurants will just make you buy two drinks or at least not have a choice for you.
I came for the one dollar tacos. I tried the fish taco and a veggie taco. Both were delicious but I definitely preferred the fish taco. Most one dollar taco places will literally put small pieces of the meat in the taco and maybe two strings of lettuce. Although the tacos were small, there was a good amount of toppings and sauce for the proportion of the tortilla. And for one dollar, it tasted really good. The veggie Tacos were also good but it was just tomato and spinach with some ranch sauce on top of it. Veggie tacos usually Have Avocado Ave., East, something of value in them and not just the cheap photos.
This place also has a back porch with a good amount of seating. I definitely recommend this place for a big group of people.
author: Angela L.

description: Cool bar to visit in the afternoon or at night. I mainly enjoy having a drink in the backyard patio which is a nice feature to the place. Or step inside and enjoy their happy hour menu. If I am with friends in the mission I most likely will stop here for a drink
author: Manny R.

description:
never been in here, but from what I saw this past Friday (8/31), i don't think i ever will.

i was walking down Mission a little after 6 PM and saw a couple of guys grappling in front of the bar towards its border with Cha Cha Cha. a little early for that kind of thing, but i tried to go around it. then i heard someone yell "look out" and i turned around to see one of the guys, who turned out to be Teeth's security guard, flip the other guy over his back and bodyslam him into the sidewalk. the guy's head hit the ground really hard, and he seemed to lose consciousness. an employee from Cha Cha Cha next door tried to wake him up, but he didn't respond. someone called an ambulance. the security guard just walked away like nothing.

i understand that people get drunk and unruly and angry, i understand that sometimes you have to protect yourself. but the security guard had like 6 inches and probably 50-75 lbs on the guy he bodyslammed into unconsciousness. you can't just jump to extreme violence like that. there are plenty of other ways to get the guy out of your face. if this is how Teeth SF deals with drunk and unruly customers then i really don't think it's a safe place to drink.
author: Matt R.

description:
This is probably one of my favorite dive bars. Well drinks are cheap. Definitely a fun spot to go to with friends. 

Other than the drinks, the reason I come back is for the fried chicken sliders! $3 each, so expect to order 12 (kidding). Also a dope place to watch games!
author: Rachel M.

description:
I am seriously not kidding when I say that I come here at least once a week. WING WEDNESDAY! 25 cent AMAZING wings w/ a purchase of two drinks (or a pitcher for 2). Not only is it a good deal, it is actually a REALLY GOOD meal.
I am not a huge fan of spicy food, but I still can't resist the sweet chili habañero flavor. You can never go wrong with BBQ either! So not only are there wings amazing, YOU MUST TRY THE TOTCHOS! Those are tater tot nachos in case you were confused. It comes smothered in cheese, guac, sour cream, salsa, olives, and jalapeños. It is truly amazing. The cocktails are also very generous and good!

If you are coming on a Wednesday, and there's some sort of sports game going on, get there early! Seriously... especially if you are with a group and want to get any sort of seating at a decent time. During the weekends it is a very popular place to get your night started, or if you want an environment with good music but not too many people, it is also a good place to stay at all night. During the day they have a back patio which is pretty neat.

I would definitely suggest coming here for your next wing Wednesday!
author: Kassie E.

description: This place is a fun, cool dive bar. Plenty of seating with an awesome outside patio. Both times I've been here I've had positive experiences! The tater tot nachos are super yummy! Their bar food menu puts any other bar menu to shame. Their buffalo wings were also to die for! We tried the habenero wings which were so spicy I started crying! I wish the server would have said they were pretty spicy. She did give us a glass of milk on the house which was nice of her. But man! Those wings killed me. I will definitely come back here with more friends bc of the food, drinks, and a good time!
author: Melanie S.

description: Spend good money, don't cause any trouble and you might be lucky enough to be banned from this sorry excuse of a bar. Security is beyond unprofessional and will take it too far.
author: Jerelle M.

description:
We came here on a Wednesday evening for Wing Wednesdays, which is the craziest deal I've ever seen in my life so far: 25 CENT WINGS (with the purchase of 2 drinks, but they are pretty lenient with that rule).

Our large group of 10 sat at a table in their large outdoor seating area in the back and ordered 150 wings, split between their buffalo sauce and their regular flavor. Both the buffalo wings and the regular wings tasted average, and the buffalo wings were pretty saucy, which I didn't mind. I hope to try the BBQ wings next time, but I wouldn't say that the wings here are good; they were average and super cheap!!! The place fills up really quickly on Wing Wednesdays, which starts at 4pm, so try to get here early, especially if you're coming with a large group. 

I recommend sitting outside in the back to enjoy the nice and hot summer weather. I'm not sure about the other foods that they serve here, but this place is ultimately a chill place to hang out and have some really cheap wings on Wednesdays.
author: George L.

description: This place used to be great, now I'm disappointed every time I go in there. I don't know if the vibe is just different because of how much the Mission is now overrun by tech transplants, but it is no longer has the chill, local vibe that it used to. Good and drinks are still great though. Get the tots, for sure.
author: Dasher K.

description: My boyfriend and I went to an Ohio State watch party here. They were serving brunch and we ordered the bottomless mimosas and waking bacon grilled cheese. Now the mimosa quality seemed to change with every glass but they were always circling with a pitcher to refill if you wished. The sandwich was amazing and on sour dough!! I will be back here many times!! The staff is friendly the atmosphere is eclectic and fun. Definitely a great bar/restaurant in the mission.
author: Shelby L.

description:
A divey venue on the surface that has amazing specials, whether a super-cheap happy hour (4-7pm) on weekdays, $1 Taco Tuesdays, and 25-cent Wing Wednesdays. It can get super crowded in the evenings, particularly on one of these "deal" nights, yet somehow the servers manage to hold the fort down and deal with all the customers descending upon here.

The inside doesn't look terribly big at first glance, although there are tables leading down a corridor towards a glorious outdoor patio in the back than can fit lots of people, whether standing or seated. A solid neighborhood bet if you're looking for cheap drinks and food in a boisterous environment.
author: Vincent L.

description:
The outdoor patio area in this bar is kick ass! So much space and super unique with the levels! 

I came here with a group of 10 (you can reserve a table with 10) for brunch and Sunday vibes. Id def recommend coming early if you want a table outside or just plop down on the ledge. 

The food was very much eh. I had the chorizo eggs. They came out cold and just blah. The tots were tasty but were def frozen. The bloody Mary was pretty flavorful but not very strong  (despite the price) I tried a sip of the mimosa and it tasted like something I could make better and cheaper at home. 

I'd def recommend it as a cool hang out spot but wouldn't recommend the food.
author: Kaley K.

description: Wow! That Mac and cheese was some of the best I ever had!! The cheese was just right, the Mac part was pretty good to but holy $h!+!!! The truffle oil made it so good!! I swear I'll get fat but it'll be worth it just to have it over and over again!!
author: Samuel B.

description: Wing Wednesday! Affordable drinks! Delicious truffle fries and eclectic decor that reminds me of clockwork orange in a weird way. One of my favorite places to grab an after work drink and where I go after a particularly rough day with my coworkers. It does get crowded but if you're patient generally you can find a place to sit down. Good service, bartenders are always friendly. Definitely one to put into your rotation.
author: Amanda Y.

description:
DANGER: There was a piece of glass in my gin & tonic, and it made its way into my throat. Luckily I am preceptive and I coughed it up. It could have lacerated my throat. 

I told them about the glass; they apologized but offered me nothing. I could have died. 

We were having a really sexy conversation about BDSM, and it completely ruined the mood. We had to come home and write this review which cut into our sexy time. 

Get your tater tots elsewhere. Danger danger
author: Kit S.

description:
Who else has been super thrown off by the name of this place? I've heard it called so many names now (Teeth, Teeth SF, Dr. Teeth, etc.) but in the end, it's pretty clear that everyone is talking about this place on Mission with the tooth logo out front. 

I first came for brunch and because I was driving later, I missed out on the bottomless mimosas but it was definitely free-flowing and quite affordable! I split an okay omelette, but the TRUE BRUNCH STAR for me was the shared order of totchos (tater tots + nacho toppings, including guac!). So good!

I didn't think I'd be back for a while since this place is pretty far from me, but I ended up back here this past week on Wing Wednesday and WOW IT WAS CROWDED. I commend this place for keeping their wing prices (25 cents each!) low for so long! There's a posted rule of 2 drinks per person to get the deal, but with the crazy crowds this seems impossible to enforce. While wings come out pretty fast, I'd recommend sending someone in your group by 5pm to either order or grab seats unless you want to stand around for close to an hour. Also, watch out for the regular to high cost of everything else on the menu (pitchers of margaritas add up)! The natural wings and the thai chili ones were my favorite, but TBH I didn't try the others.

To finish this up, service seemed so-so whether it was fairly quiet (Sunday morning) vs packed (Wednesday evening). Our server dropped a wing as he set our tray down and was nice enough to get us two wings to replace it. I've definitely been to other places that just ignore dropped food--not cool. There's only two restrooms which can result in a SUPER long wait with hundreds of people drinking beer and eating wings. They card on Wednesdays, so don't forget your ID!
author: Christine L.

description:
My goodness I love this place in all its dirty sketchy glory. I've been here countless times and have had a great time always, though this may or may not be a side effect of the drinks I've had. 

The totchos are delicious. Crispy tater tots topped with everything under the sun. Cool sour cream, chunky guacamole, meat -- make sure you eat that stuff fast, or else it'll get soggy. If you're feeling especially like walking on the edge, try the ghost wings. They're made with ghost peppers, and whichever parts of your body come into contact with them will burn for at least the next 24 hours. They'll even give you a glass of milk to go with the wings, though it's one glass only, so drink it smartly. Would also recommend eating these wings with gloves because that sauce residue is invisible and deadly. Great for treating your enemies or just watching grown men cry. 

The drinks are fun. Ordering can be a struggle if it's busy, but just try your best to flag someone down.
author: Sophie W.

description:
I only ever find myself at teeth in wing Wednesday's! So this is a review just for that.

Wing Wednesday is smacking! What more can you ask for when it comes to $0.25 cent wings? There is a two drink minimum though, which may seem like a lot, but two drinks.. y'all can put it down, I believe in you. There's naked, buffalo, bbq, and mango habanero. Buffalo, naked, and mango habanero are all good! I don't really mess with bbq wings. The wings are juicy, crispy, and decently sized. Only draw back is don't order too much, because you can't take any home! We've also tried their tots and the totchos and the garlic crab ones are both good! Tots are crisp and the addons really give it flavor. Their drinks are okay, not super strong, not super watered down. 

Only drawback and it gets sooooooo crowded and loud here, so come early, like 5PM if you want to grab a seat to enjoy your wings.
author: Eva C.

description: Love this place, perfect for a fun night out, good old bar food and big enough to host a party (like I did for my bday) and get hammered  Sort of dark and old school, like a good ol' bar should be. Not too hipster for a change  The outside patio is great too to start the night (they close it at some point). Once they close it it's more like a dive bar. Great spot to have fun in the Mission.
author: Martino P.

description:
I've been here twice for Sunday brunch. Bottomless mimosas, tater tots loaded with goodies, what else can you ask for?

They top off your cup constantly, keeping you well boozed throughout your stay. The mimosas are not watered down like many brunch places, this is a bar after all.

I suggest getting the garlic crab tater tots if you like spicy and crunchy things. 

My boyfriend got the eggs benedict with a side of naked tots, still really good.

As a head's up, the hours on Yelp may be off, we got there at opening (10:30 AM) and the doors were locked. A walk around the neighborhood later, the doors were opened and customers were in by 11:00 AM.
author: Michelle C.

description:
First and foremost. Must try: garlic crab fries!

My girls and I came here for dinner around 4pm after a day of playing tourist and exploring Billy Goat Hill. We got to pick our own seating.

We ordered the garlic crab fries, the sliders (classic, pulled pork, and chicken), mozzarella sticks, and the wakin' bacon grilled cheese sandwich. The sliders were overcooked and dry. I wish we had been asked how we would like those done. Because I would have opted for medium rare. Furthermore, I wish I had requested more cheese and sauce that comes on the crab fries. Because I feel like they skimped a bit when it came to that. But overall that was probably my favorite item out of all the things we ordered.

We also ordered alcoholic beverages such as a Mule from the special drinks menu. We realized it was happy hour (3p-7p) but our waitress kindly told us that only well drinks were on the happy hour menu. Oh well, maybe next time.

Food here isn't incredible but it's not terrible. Typical bar food.
author: Jovi D.

description:
My giant loud mexican family was here on Sunday for Brunch. The staff was super accommodating and patient with our group. The back patio is super chill. We were there for a few hours and had the place to ourselves for the first half.  

The brunch menu was super enticing. I couldn't make up my mind. I settled on the Wake and Bake grilled cheese. Super cheesy which is a win, the egg was a little overcooked. Of course I had to get some tots on the side. 

I would for sure come back. Good drinks, good food, and friendly staff!
author: Olivia B.

description:
Ever since I told my sister about $.25 cent wings at Teeth, she's been dying to check it out. We finally got the chance today and neither of us were disappointed. Just a disclaimer, this review is based purely on food and Wednesday happy hour, I know nothing about the drinks here.

Rating Breakdown:
1.5/2 Stars for Taste --
When you come on a Wednesday, you are here for the wings. They have original (a dry rub), buffalo, BBQ, and chili habanero. The wings are decent, but not mindblowing. (For $.25 cents though, I am not complaining.) My favorite is the chili habanero, which tastes more like that Thai chili sauce you can buy in bulk at Costco. Not a huge fan of their BBQ, which tastes far too tomato heavy to me. 

My sister and I are fiend for fried potatoes, so we knew we had to order the Tot'chos (tater tot nachos). SO GOOD. The cheese wasn't the nasty theater chili cheese, but one that was thick, almost with a potato texture. Like chili cheese and bechamel sauce made sweet love and procreated. It was a perfect complement to the sour cream, salsa, and guacamole. A must try.

1/1 Stars for Value --
$.25 cent wings on Wednesday nights is the best deal in town. It was $11 for a large plate of tater tots (refer to the picture for scale). You can definitely share that plate with up to four people. The rule is that you have to get two drinks per person to get the Happy Hour wing price, but I think they usually let the "per person" part slide.

1/1 Stars for Customer Service --
I was a bit skeptical about the two drinks minimum rule for the HH price. I'm having surgery tomorrow so I'm not supposed to drink and my sister is practically a nun. The bartender let us know that non-alcoholic beverages count too! When I was here last time with a party of 6 or so friends, we kept on going back to order additional rounds of wings and they didn't make us buy more drinks each time...but that was probably because we bought like 3 pitchers the first time around. 

The line was crazy the last time I was here; I probably had to wait 15 minutes just to place my order. I don't know if it was the rain tonight, but there was virtually no line. The wings and tots were out within 10 minutes. Super fast service here!

Bonus star because whenever I have a Wednesday night free and a hankering for some finger-licking goodness, I will drag my ass down to Teeth. 40 wings per person? Sounds about right. Next time, I want to try the crab dip tater tots!

TL;DR: $.25 cent wings on Wednesday, two drink minimum. Try the tater tots.
author: Abby W.

description:
I would recommend Teeth for a weekend brunch. The food was enjoyable and well-priced. I ordered the veggie omelette and liked it. Good vibe, had a good playlist of music. They also had a shuffleboard bar game.

Only negative is that the service is alright. They have a lot of self-serve options. It could be cleaner as well
author: Stephanie R.

description: Didn't get what I ordered. Manager made me still pay for the food and took off my Sodas as a comp for the error of the employee. By the way, the soda was extremely flat. Super disappointed and never coming back here again.
author: Madie B.

description: Still a hipster hangout, still always packed, still bumping good music. The menu has been updated, but food quality is still the same. Most of the time, you'll get a monster-sized burger oozing with cheese and a huge side of tater tots and cheese. However, along with your gastronomic goodness, you'll also get a heavy side of hipsters and PBR. So, I guess it just depends on your tolerance for that kind of company. Literally saw a whole table of hipsters cheers-ing with 6 tall boys. Oh, SF. Wing Wednesday every Wednesday if you're into that.
author: Danny C.

description:
Great outdoor seating area on a warm SF day. Prices are a little expensive but it's standard of these 'hipsters' bars in the Mission. I love the egg sandwich and the tator tots. I do think the spicy crab tots are way better value for their price than the other tot options (mayhem, etc).

The inside bar area is crowded and stuffy but the outdoor area is a great place to hang out with friends and have a drink and some good food. The service is okay, not excellent, but fair for a food bar in the city. Note: the bathroom lines are horrible. They only have single stalls.
author: Cicely T.

description:
Trivia night on Mondays! We were here just to grab dinner and found out it was trivia night. I was reluctant to join at first as I've never participated in one before, but it's actually pretty fun and I knew a lot more answers than I thought I would. We didn't win, but was satisfied that we didn't place last as we only had 2 people and some teams had 6. They have a special every day and on Mondays it's a burger with a beer for $10. TBH, the burger was alright. It was little overcooked, lacked in seasoning and didn't have anything special added to it. It comes with fries or tater tots which is nice and you can upgrade it to totchoes (loaded tater tots) for a couple extra dollars. The taters tots were really good. I like it when it's crispy on the outside.

Overall, it's a little divey, the food is mediocre, but trivia night was fun.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
One of the best divey bars I've been to! Food is great, atmosphere was chill with unique decor and drinks are reasonably priced! 

Ever heard of totchos? Literally what it sounds like- tater tot styled nachos! Totally recommend. Glorious melty cheese, pico de gallo, olives, jalapeños, salsa, sour cream & guacamole topped on tater tots. But cheese and tater tots though..Everything I love in one! 

Wings here are bomb. Wednesday's are $0.25 wing's! I recommend the spicy buffalo sauce. Definitely should come early, grab a seat and a beer and enjoy your wings! On Thursday's, they have a special $9 deal of a large can of PBR & a shot of Jameson! 

Truffle fries were ok. Nothing too special about it. The fries were crunchy topped with cheese and truffle oil but not something I would order again. 

Service here isn't bad. Our server came by our table from time to time and asked if we needed anything which was great since service isn't always great at bars. The place is pretty roomy so you don't have to worry about it being too cramped. 

Great place to bring a group of friends to hang out! Will be coming back!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
I bought one $7 drink here, tipped $1, but was charged $10 on my credit card once I got home.

Totally doesn't break the bank, but how'd that happen?! Transparency in charges and prices should be a #1 for businesses. If you've come here super drunk, you've probably been overcharged, considering this was my 1st drink of a totally tame night. I remember, okay?!

None of the drink prices are listed, so I also found it funny that my guy friend was charged a different price for the exact same drink as we both ordered on separate occasions. I was charged more LOL. You go, Glen Co Co :)

Otherwise, I always seem to end up at this venue. It's not a dancing place, although I do enjoy the hip hop/top 40s music. The bar is always packed, though, and it's hard to get a table or drink.
author: Anmy V.

description:
Cute hipster vibe sorta bar in the Mission. A large group stopped by after getting brunch at a nearby restaurant and this place was large and not crowded (around 2/3PM on a Saturday), with lots of seating available. The weather was beautiful in SF that day, and this place had 2 large windows that were open. Getting drinks took a few min like it would at any bar. 
I got a Kentucky mule and it wasn't weak at all. Drinks are primarily served in mason jars. 
My experience may be different at night, but it was great for afternoon drinks. Casual feel, so feel free to come in your flip flops and t-shirts!
author: Sarika S.

description:
Ive had this place this place bookmarked for such a long time, and I'm glad I finally got to try this place out with my boyfriend. We ordered the totchos (basically what I came for), a grilled cheese sandwich with fried chicken inside (forgot what they named it), and two sliders! 

The sliders were meh, just pass on those.
The totchos were good! More than enough for two people
The grilled cheese sandwich was probably my fave out of everything, it was delicious!! I would come back for that. Overall dining experience was cool, the service wasn't bad, but this place does get crowded and can be hard to flag down a waiter which is why I'm giving it a 3. But it's a great place to grab a few drinks and eat some good bar food!
author: Alyssa C.

description: Great place to be at especially if you're with a group of friends. Service was on point, staff was very friendly. Looking forward to seeing Drakari there again! Really awesome guy and his customer service was amazing.
author: Warren M.

description:
Came here for Wing Wednesday and was very disappointed in the wings. Yes it's great that the wings are $0.25, but I didn't like any of the flavors and tried them all. The BBQ and Buffalo tasted the same. The natural were fine but nothing special. The Sweet Chili Haberno had good flavor but was too spicy for me. If it was just sweet  chili without the habenero, that would have been my favorite. I would give the wings 1/5.

Another annoying thing is that part of the wing deal requires a minimum of 2 drinks per person (can be alcoholic or non). So then you are required to spend money even if you were going for the cheap wings. However, the hefe weiss beer was very good

We also got the tachos which were the best part. They are just on the regular menu but they were delicious.

Overall: probably won't be coming back here, and definitely not for wings.
author: Jenna G.

description:
I don't get the hype of the dirty place. Food wasn't good and service was just blaaa. 
Drinks were basic too.
author: Lucy M.

description:
.25 cent wings

I've been here several times with with coworkers from my first job and Dr. Teeth has never disappointed us. Especially on those random hot San Francisco nights, Dr. Teeth is one of the few locations in the city that represents Pre-Tech SF. Before overpriced hipster artisanal mixology-based libations came about, there was a San Francisco affordable for people earning less than $80K a year. Dr Teeth stays true to that era - a place where a group of young city dwellers can have a good time without gawking at the final bill.

*The cute boy in this picture is not included in the happy hour
author: John L.

description:
I love this place, if you are looking for a bar that has a very mellow laid back feel and some top notch food, this is your place.

Love nachos? Try their Totchos! It's basically natchos with tatter totes instead of tortilla chips. The end result? A tasty, gooey and a bit crunchy matching taste we all love!

The atmosphere is pretty relaxed, there are 3 TV's in the bar so you would be able to see any basketball games going on. There is also a shuffle board table in the back which is always fun!

Service was perfect, even though when I went it was a Thursday afternoon it was a medium sized crowd. Our server got our drinks and food in a pretty short amount of time. 

Speaking of drinks, one thing that makes this place great is that they have weekly specials on drinks. On Thursday we got a shot of Jameson and a tall can of PBR for $9, which is pretty good when you pair that with their spicy buffalo chicken wings. Their chicken wings are really good especially if you get them with spicy buffalo sauce.

Overall, I would highly recommend this place if you want to find a place to watch the game with some beer, totchos, and chicken wings. I know I will be back real soon!
author: Jonathan B.

description: Came here on wing Wednesday and warriors game night! Really crowded for a place I was going to eat at, very bar like. I didn't even realize there was a patio until the very end of my visit! However, the 25 cent wings were all worth it! We were very excited and got too many wings and ordered (tot)chos  every thing was good but they didn't have a box for my left over items! I'll be back and I'll be sure to sit in the patio and order just enough!
author: Megan M.

description:
Come here got taco Tuesday 
$1 tacos and BOGO on the margarita!!!
The tacos are so goooood! One tortilla so it's not too heavy and could eat more ! Lol which my friends and I do !! 
Usually I get 2 fish tacos they are topped with cabbage and a spicy mayo sauce 
2 chicken tacos ; they are juicy and jo delicious!
2 veggie tacos ! By far the best veggie tacos topped with sour cream 
The tacos are so delicious and pairs well with the Margaritas 
Ask for salt on the rim...
Also the bar overall was a great social environment for drinks after work
author: Maira P.

description:
Came here on a Sunday night for some FRIED CHICKEN - my lady was looking EVERYWHERE for something cheap enough for me before I got home. 

Shout out to Karen for finding this place ;) and a big shout out to Teeth for providing affordable fried chicken! 

;)


FOOD (Fried Chicken Sandwich)
Fried chicken, that's all I wanted, but then their sweet potato fries and sweet potato tater-tots...Oh, My, Gawd. That was SO good ^_^

I got my plate, I was a happy man. Took a quick bite of the fries and my mouth exploded into an orgasmic frenzy.

My lady and I didn't finish everything, but I made sure we got a to-go box.

CUSTOMER SERVICE
Great! Thank you for being so prompt with your service. I always feel treated like a second-class citizen when going places for some reason, but no bad vibes from them.
author: Jonathan R.

description: Great place to go after work for drinks and food. I definitely recommend the wings!
author: Alicia M.

description: Bitchy ass wait staff and gross bar food. I working bathroom. Would pass on this place. Bar tender is mean!!!
author: Olivia P.

description: They burger was un cook and i ask for well done and it was also late idk why it has a good rating i had to put it back on the pan  very disappointed
author: Antoine T.

description: Bloody Mary Review - At teeth, your only problem will be choosing just one. The Classic Bloody features "absolute vodka, tomato juice, horseradish, olive, fresh lime, fresh lemon, salt, tabasco, worcestershire, guinness," the Bloody Beef is made with "absolute peppar vodka, house made classic bloody mix, a-1 sauce, crispy bacon strip" and the Bloody Maria comes with "corralejo tequila, house made classic bloody mix, fresh pico de gallo." Actually, you should just get all three. Why go? Bloody mary pitchers. | Price: $35 pitchers, $11 singles.
author: Shelley B.

description:
With some of the best wings in The City, Dr. Teeth rocks.

A dive bar with $0.25 wings on Wednesday? You bet. Come early because later in the evening the place is crowded with wing lovers.

Flavors include "au natural," Buffalo, Habañero, and BBQ. The Buffalo wings are good. Not Anchor Bar in Buffalo, NY quality, but a pretty good facsimile for the West Coast. BBQ are a bit on the sweet side, and habañero are not for the faint of heart. A good selection of beers on tap and in bottle/can.

With wings that easily rank in the top 5 in The City, Dr. Teeth is awesome.
author: CJ G.

description:
Service was subpar, but it was also packed for bottomless mimosas. 
The teeth burger.... I will take the suffering for those who haven't had it yet... DONT ORDER. Rather tasteless.. the burger literally comes with the bun, lettuce, tomatoes and the meat. I have to ask for onions and pickles to put in my burger and even that didn't do the justice... but this was probably because the server gave me extremely large cuts of purple onions and not slices pickles but long pickles....it was a little bothersome that I was using these to put in my burger yet it was oddly cut produce. 1/5 stars.. truly terrible Especially since you are playing $13 for a burger.

The true reason why this place gets 3/5 overall stars is predominately because the location is great to explore mission as well as their impressive outdoor seating - would be a fun place to host a party!

But their wing Wednesday's seems like all the jazz. Would probably come back just to try the 25cent wings
author: Frances K.

description:
I stumbled into this bar while waiting for my table across the street at Mission Chinese. The place was pretty cool. Definitely attracted a young, hipster crowd (so I was def the oldest, un-coolest person there). But the place had a fun neighborhood vibe to it.

The cocktail menu was surprisingly diverse. I wound up ordering the The Mayhem (Fernet Branca, Calvados, Templeton Rye, orange bitters, peychaud's bitters). It seemed like an interesting/potent medley of ingredients. The drink was actually just ok. Even though I like all the ingredients that went into my beverage, they just didn't all work together (at least for my palette). That being said, I did appreciate the effort/creativity that went into making of the drink. And for $11, I didn't feel like I really lost too much on this experiment. The cocktail still had a strong kick to it, so I could at least get a nice pre-dinner buzz going. 

But what I really enjoyed most about Dr. Teeth and the Electric Mayhem (beside its name) was the people watching. If I lived in the Mission, I would def make this my neighborhood watering hole. 

BTW, I heard through the grapevine that they do some great weekly specials, including: $1 tacos + 2-for-1 margaritas on Tuesdays, 25 cent wings on Wednesdays, and Bottomless Brunch on weekends.
author: Kevin B.

description:
I came here for a quick snack before heading to Bruno's. It is pretty cracking here at night, they have a good amount of tables and chairs. They great thing about this place is that they serve till 1:30AM! So late night munchies!

My boyfriend & I just got the Tatter Tots Nachos. It was HUGE portions and looked like a heart attack haha. It was covered with guac, sour cream, jalapeños and olives. Pretty much like nachos with the tots! It was decent, I think it could of had more flavor in my opinion. But if you are wasted, it would taste amazing. 

Will come back and check out their brunch!
author: Natalie L.

description:
Absolutely incredible brunch location! 

Plenty of seating indoors and outside too. Our party had 17 people in it and we had no problem immediately finding a long table despite it being busy inside! 

We also had no problem finding the bottomless mimosas at the bar. The bartenders and servers all had great attitudes even though they were SUPER busy and they made sure to let us know when the mimosa action was about to end. 

The food is not only amazing but the servings are HUGE awesome portions. Me and two other friends shared one order of the tater tots for our entire meal. And not just because we were wearing tiny tank top shirts on our way to an event that day!! 

The atmosphere is fun and inviting; there's even a shuffleboard table (and on this day some good looking foreigners who needed help understanding the game;). I could ask for nothing more in an establishment! 

Can't wait to go back!!!
author: Clyde V.

description: This place was fun! It's open seating and very busy so it can be a bummer trying to hawk tables. But once you're seated there are great deals every day of the week so it's worth it.
author: Brittany A.

description:
Tater tots, pizza or burrito??? I asked the hubby what he felt like eating. We were on our way to a class on Mezcal in the Mission and needed to eat before we start tasting some hard stuff! Didn't want to get lightheaded after just one sip! Lol

He chose Tots (yay!) and, I knew just the place for it--Teeth SF. Luckily it was only 3 blocks from the 16 St. Mission Bart station. 

It happened to be Tuesday which meant 2 for 1 Margaritas. A great deal for $8! We ordered that, the Crab Tater Tots, and Buffalo Chicken Wings. 

The Crab Tater Tots had a nice amount of crab meat and sriracha mayo sprinkled on top of the tots. Yum! Get this if you like crab and sriracha! Next time though I'm gonna get their Totchos. Nachos and Tots sound like a winning combination! 

We opted for 12 instead of 8 pieces of Buffalo Wings. 8 pieces would have been enough in hindsight since the wings were quite meaty. We tried to finish all the wings but alas we were unsuccessful. If you want a great deal, come here on Wing Wednesdays when wings are 25 cents each! Don't think you can find a deal as good as that anywhere else in this expensive city! 

We got there around 5 so the place wasn't must have had about 8 patrons. The place is large, so if you have a big group, it would be a perfect place to gather after work. They also have an outdoor space. 

Our server was very nice. She checked up on us a few times. We didn't want for anything. 

If you're in the Mission, try out Teeth SF and get some of those tots! You know you're in the right place when you see a picture of a tooth on a red awning!
author: Hazel C.

description:
Teeth is a great place to go to for nice bar bites and great drinks.

Teeth has a diverse crowd, depending in the day of the week. It can also get packed, especially on Wednesdays, because of the cheap and delicious wings.
author: Disaster P.

description:
This is only a review based on coming for Wednesday Happy Hours...

Cheap drinks and wings with a low key environment and an outside porch. Dr. Teeth is a staple Mission bar with people just looking to sit back and unwind after work. They have happy hour between 4-7pm with $4.50 well drinks and $1 off beers. While they don't carry any notable craft beers, you also aren't paying an arm and a leg for what they do have (ie. Guinness, Anchor Steam, Modelo, etc.)

There are a few tables but most seating space is communal, this goes for inside and outside. While most seating is bar height, there are a few "booth" like seats for lounging. With a dark red interior, it's a very lively and intimate environment, though gets stuffy when there are a lot of people - which is often. 

Wings are 25cents each and they have 4 different flavors: 1) natural, 2) buffalo, 3) sweet chili habanero, and 4) BBQ. You can order any amount, either from the bar and grab a number or from a waiter/waitress (only if you're seated inside). The line is slow at the bar as there's typically 1 bartender that is both taking orders and making drinks - not very efficient. To "qualify" for 25 cent wings each person has to get 2 drinks, though I don't know how the bartender really tracks that... 

The wings come out hot and piled on the same plate for each order. a few sticks of celery and blue cheese also come custom. The natural wings are a bit bland and tougher since they have no sauce. The BBQ are dripping in gooeyness and you can expect to need a lot of napkins. I like the sweet chili the best as they have a sweet honey taste and a slight spice, though nothing overwhelming as you might think with the habanero. They're not San Tung wings, but for 25 cents each, they're pretty damn good. 

Also try the tots. You can get them as a side (hug pile) or as totchos. Because when are tots ever bad??
author: Liza X.

description: Please please try the garlic crab fries if you ever get a chance. When you randomly crave crab fries and come along this place that serve GARLIC crab fries..... well let's just say it's a dream come true. Huge portion too, so plan on sharing with your friends! Another thing that I got from the menu was the tot-chos. Which are just as awesome! Friendly staff as well! They know their drinks so don't be shy to ask for recommendations! Definitely coming back for more when I'm in the city.
author: Maricris C.

description:
Teeth SF is a solid old cheap wings and beer hangout place. On Wednesdays, you can get wings for 25 cents each, grab a table as they are all first come first served (more seating outside in the back with TV), get some pitchers of beer (you might have to fight people to the bar since it gets crowded). 
They also have tater tots and other classic bar foods, which are also decent!
author: Grace P.

description:
- Atmosphere: 3.5 out of 5 for outdoor seating, indoor looks to be a 2.5 to 3 out of 5
- Service: 5 out of 5 for extremely fast service during peak hours
- Food: 3 out of 5
- Value: 5 out of 5 as our total came up to around 50 dollars with 50 wings, tater tots and 4 drinks

I came here for their Wednesday happy hour specials. At Teeth, Wednesday means Wings Wednesday. Their special is 25 cent wings with a minimum of two drinks (does not have to be alcoholic drinks)! 

I came to Teeth about a month ago around 5:30 PM and the place was packed. There was barely any room to move around the place and there was no open tables or seating (it is a place where you order at the bar and find your own seat). So after waiting about 30 mins or more, my group and I decided to leave and try again next time as it was somewhat hopeless for us to order and find a place to seat a party of 6+. 

A month later, I decided to go with my boyfriend and one of our friends (smaller party) and at an earlier time. We got to Teeth at 4:30 PM and basically split up. My boyfriend waited in line to order, which wasn't too bad as there was about 3-4 people in front of him. I went to the back to find a seat as we wanted outdoor seating as oppose to indoor seating. I was able to snatched up a bench table before a wave of people came in. When I walked to the back, there was about 3 tables opened and as soon as I grabbed my table, the other two tables were also taken. 

The outdoor seating is nice as it has picnic tables and fake grass to give it a park feels. They have a water station outside for those that need water to down more food and dilute the alcohol, you do not need to walk all the way inside. It could get pretty cold out there as it did when I was there but when the sun was occasionally out, it did warm up for a bit. The noise level is what you would expect at a bar, relatively loud but it is based on the crowd that are out there.

The service was amazing. Within a minute after my boyfriend gets to the table, I had asked him to go back and put in an order of tater tots and it took longer for him to come back from putting in that order than for the wings to arrive and he only took about 5 minutes to order the tater tots and walk back. About a minute or two after he came back from ordering, the tater tots arrived as well. I definitely give props to the fast service as the place was starting to get packed at that time. 

We got truffle tater tots and 50 wings (20 Buffalo, 20 Sweet Chili Habanero and 10 plain). The truffle tater tots were amazing. Being someone who love tater tots, one of my main criteria is that it must be crispy and it was. We were there for about an hour and a half and at the end, the tater tots were still crispy. The shredded truffles on top was amazing as it adds favor to the tater tots. The 50 wings shared with 3 people was definitely more than we all could eat so we ended up giving the remaining to our table neighbor. I am not a big fan of buffalo wings so I stayed clear of it. The sweet chili habanero tasted more like the Thai sweet chili wings that you would get at a regular Thai restaurant. The plain wings are hot and crispy. The wings overall was decent. They aren't the best in the city but they are amazing for the price. They taste like any other wings that I have gotten in the city so far (haven't gotten amazing out of this world wings yet, so please leave recommendations if you have any) but for the prize, I would definitely recommend it over other wings Wednesday locations.
author: Chenny O.

description:
Unlike most people, I actually really enjoy going to see the doctor. And after checking out Dr. Teeth, it's another place I wouldn't mind going to all the time!

Since we had dinner reservations at Foreign Cinema, which is close by, we decided to get drinks at Teeth SF real quick. The place is pretty roomy and had a fair amount of people for a Monday. They have trivia nights on Mondays at 8:30pm for those that are into that! And apparently, they have awesome happy hour deals for wings on Wednesdays.

The bartender Caitlyn was super cute and a joy to chat with! It definitely made our time at this bar fun. 

I'm a fan of the shot-and-beer-combos, so we just kept ordering A Slap in the Face ($11). Can't go wrong with tequila and Modelo! Cheers!
author: Christine S.

description: Wing Wednesday is great. Just make sure you keep an eye out for a table. Ask the party kindly when they're wrapping up if you can take the table after them. Tai was extremely helpful when she placed our order amidst all of the chaos. We had the buffalo and the habanero - SPICY we loved em. Cheeeers.
author: Elizabeth Q.

description:
3.5 stars

Grungy on the inside.

90's and 00's hiphop on the inside.

Confused? Yeah, so was I.

The scene is totally bizarre but, with Nelly playing and a shot of tequila, I enjoyed it.

Pop something..move something..shake ya tailfeather.
author: Nic Z.

description:
Friend and I came for Sunday brunch. We sat inside first before moving to the outdoor patio. It's pretty dark inside but fine. The sign said to order at the bar so we went up to ask about getting reseated. The bartender said there would be a server in the patio area too to take our orders so went out for fresh air to wait. It took a while so we ended up going back to the bar to place our orders. The service outside was slower and took a while to get food but we weren't in a huge rush.

Veggie Omelette with Artichokes - it was tasty and filling, but nothing to write home about. A mix of spinach, artichoke, cheddar, bell peppers for the filling. Came with a heaping portion of tater tots, satisfyingly greasy and crispy outside, soft on the inside.
Breakfast Burrito - Took a bite of my friend's. A generous portion sized like a small baby and would probably leave you with a food baby. Salsa verde was fresh, mildly spicy and bright. The inside was filled with pork, rice, potatoes and fajita vegetables. Kind of bland.

Bottom line is pretty reasonable prices, okay food, no line for brunch, pleasant outdoor seating.
author: Truc N.

description: A couple of the times were sitting in front of the window and the sun light was hitting us on the face. We proceeded by putting the shades down and the security came and told us that we couldn't do that since business is still opened. He also told us to put some shades on rudely. Not you for come back here for sure.
author: tina y.

description:
Wanted to grab a quick bite with a couple old friends & we all wanted to try this place - we came on a Friday night & found a table pretty fast. We saw that the special for the day was 25 cent wings w/ 2 beers minimum (each), so we decided to get Buffalo wings/totchos & I also got to try their IPA, which was pretty good. 

As for the wings... I definitely will NOT be getting buffalo flavor anymore - they were so spicy... I can usually eat pretty spicy things but my friend was literally sweating... on the other hand, the totchos were BOMB - must try!
author: Carrie L.

description:
I've only ever come here on Wednesday nights for their quarter wings with the purchase of 2 drinks. If you come during happy hour, drinks average around $3-5 so you can get a full meal for less than $12. They are pretty lenient on the 2 drinks per person rule, considering there are probably way too many people in their for them to actually take note and count, so if you don't want drinks, just have one person order all the wings. The wings themselves are decently sized and for a quarter, so I really can't complain. My personal favorite are the chili habanero ones. They aren't as spicy as they sound. All their other flavors are just ok. Also, something to note is that their flavored wings tend to come drenched in sauce, so, if you don't like them super saucy, order some plain wings and toss them in the extra sauce yourself. This place gets super crowded so be prepared to wrestle your way to a free table (if there even is one), and then wrestle your way to the bar to place your order. The wings aren't the best in town, but for 25 cents, you can count me in. 

Pros: 
- Cheap way to get a filling meal on a Wednesday night 
- Food comes pretty quick considering the number of wings they must have to churn out

Cons:
- Terrible area to have to find parking in 
- Really crowded inside with almost no room to move around 
- Although there are a lot of tables, you'll be hard pressed to find an open one during peak hours
- Flavored wings are drowned in sauce
author: Diana C.

description:
Good vibe.  As my friend called it, it's a dive bar.  Good food, good service, good friendly crowd.  I've only been here once, but so far I like the place.

Pretty big with pool tables.
author: Sarah L.

description:
Went for Brunch on Sunday.  

We got there at 10:20ish and it was easy to find a space to sit.  Would have been easier if it weren't raining and the back patio was a viable option. (The back patio is one of my favorite parts of this bar.  Darn. It did start to fill up quite a bit around 11:30 when we left.  I'm unclear on if they take reservations. I thought they didn't, but then there were a couple tables with reserved signs on them? 

For brunch, know that it is a bar, and therefore kinda dark inside. And the music is kinda loud. But hey, you should know this.

They do have bottomless mimosas, I didn't get them though, so I can't speak much to the quality - but the table next to us looked like they were having fun.  I got a classic bloody mary, which wasn't all that great - it was too peppery. 

I got the Chile Verde Burrito, which was quite good.  The verde sauce was excellent. Really my only criticism is that there could haves been more meat, but I mean, usually there could always be more meat, right? And it came with sour cream.  I hate it when you have to add sour cream to your burrito for $1.25.  

My friend's biscuits and gravy with eggs was also good. Biscuits were standard - which is to say totally fine. But the gravy was really quite good and that's the most important part.

Really quite reasonably priced as well. I'll come back some day and do the mimosas - hopefully when it's sunny and I can sit outside.

I think this place is still more of a winner as a night bar for chicken wings, sliders, and 2 for 1 margaritas on Tuesdays, but brunch was really pretty decent.
author: Sarah C.

description:
3 things are going to keep me coming back for more, ok maybe 4...
Late night orders for that oh so good but bad ( so good ) 
FRIED PICKLES - seriously, they could be the best I've had! They are super thin, really crispy and mm mm good!
Fantastic sliders. 
Delivery through Doordash.
author: Rachel L.

description:
A wonderful place to drink in the daytime, look at the only people drunker than you with disdain, and eat all of your friends' food.

Upon walking up to this fine establishment, I was smacked in the chest by a girl just before she attempted to impale herself on a parking meter. She and her friends were all laughing hysterically, so I just noted what kind of bar we were at, and headed inside.

The bar looks like a bar, but the multi-tiered backyard featuring picnic tables, cornhole, and sunshine makes it a winner. Hanging out with girls that didn't finish their crab totchos, sliders, fries, and more makes me a winner. 

Overall, I'd recommend Dr. Teeth and eating everyone's leftovers, although the latter might earn you the nickname, "Dumpster Pete." Probably only if your name is Pete, though.
author: Peter D.

description:
Love coming to Dr. Teeth's for Happy Hour because the food here is great, the drinks are cheap, and everyday is a deal! Personal advice, get here early if you plan on coming for Happy hour as it gets really crowded and busy. There's also limited seating in the back but that fills up too.

Typically I come in on Wednesdays because of their $0.25 wings. For classic buffalo wings, choose their buffalo sauce flavor. If you're feeling adventurous, I would recommend their sweet habanero. It's tangy flavor is comparable to Buffalo Wild Wings' Mango Habanero. If you're not into much saucy flavors, then the au natural is your safest best. I would stir away from the BBQ sauce simply because they drench their chicken in so much BBQ sauce that it becomes really soggy. Keep in mind that they have a 2 drink minimum for their wing orders, so order wisely. 

Moving along, if you need to nibble on something small while you sip on beer and talk with friends, I would recommend their Garlic Crab Fries. Ever since Coachella, I've been in search for Crab Fries and this by far is the closest one. It's not too heavy on the garlic so you don't have a pungent breath after every bite. I just wish they would be a little more generous with their crab and sriracha mayo. Their tots are also worth the try. I have tried their Nachos Tots but I wished I ordered just their regular one. The toppings would have been perfect with tortilla chips but not with tots. It just made the tots soggy and messy to eat. But when I got the chance to eat an untouched straggler, oh boy it sure was crispy.

Their sliders are also delicious. Priced at only $3 each, these sliders may be tiny but can get you real full. I tried their Classic and Pulled Pork, but my favorite would have to be the Fried Chicken. Just the crispy chicken paired with cole slaw and sriracha mayo is just amazing. 

And of course, the drinks here are cheap. I often get the Beer-garitas. Usually I'm accustomed to pairing Coronas with my Margaritas thanks to Chevy's Mexican Bulldog. But here at Dr. Teeth, they use Pacifico, which is a good alternative as it's not too heavy or make me full. Also please note that from 4-7pm, $4.50 for well drinks and $1 off of beers. Also their cocktails are quite strong. I've tried their margarita because I prefer tequila over any other liquor. After 3 glasses of those babies, you'll soon be forgetting whose round is it to buy next. 

Dr. Teeth's is the perfect Happy Hour Spot! But maybe next time I'll stop by on a weekend and experience their boozy brunch.
author: Denzell S.

description: First time I came here it was packed wall to wall of Ohio State fam I'm from Ohio best damn bar in the bay lol cheap brews for real can't beat it best fans in SF I haven't tried the food but I'll be back during college football season for the food Go Bucks!!!!!
author: Rolin S.

description:
.25c wings on Wednesdays! Can't get any better than that.

The only downside is that they are super busy. It's open seating, and the tables are usually a mess. There's one guy running around trying to deliver all the food to the tables. We pretty much had to clean the table from when the last group left.

Never the less. The wings have a two drink minimum. We ordered 20 wings and 2 beers. It was bomb and super cheap! Definitely coming back on Wednesdays again for the wings. We didn't have to wait too long for the wings to come out to us.

Other nights are less crowded. Wednesdays are the best.
author: Jessica S.

description:
We came in late on Saturday for the fabled chicken wings. The bar was at 85% capacity --  crowded but not unbearably so. The music was loud at club levels though, while each TV blared the latest in a Golden State vs whoever game. There were edison bulbs, sequined mannequins, and a shuffleboard table. It's somewhat as if a bro-y sportsbar didn't know if it wanted to go to a club or go to a twee instagram wedding.

Our server was unfailingly kind and while also failing to check up on us on a semi-regular basis.

We're regulars at challenge-level spicy wings establishments, but the death wings were beyond any possibility of culinary enjoyment. They mostly just hurt.

Anyway... they warned us a teeny bit, I guess.
author: Ken H.

description: Hate to be this person, but last night I went to Teeth and I must say, it will be my last. My friends and I were having a great time with drinks and enjoying the music until my boyfriend felt a rat tugging on his pants. We tried telling the bartender about it, but he seemed too swamped to care. The only person who took our concern into consideration was the security guard outside. PLEASE DO NOT EAT HERE! Clearly it is unsanitary and such a huge health hazard.
author: Lisa S.

description: This place is AMAZING!! Ariel was our server...and we couldn't have had a better one! We were here for a bachelorette weekend and I don't think that we could have chosen a better brunch spot. The food was amazing and I never found the bottom of my bottomless mimosa. I would recommend this spot to anyone...and I would highly recommend that you ask for Ariel as your server!!
author: Emilie G.

description:
Looking for a dirty dive in the Mission? Look no further. I'm going to brief as this spot has a million and a half reviews. First thing to note: order at the bar and they bring the food to you.

- Outdoor seating with cornhole. Day drinking at it's finest. Are all the tables dirty and sticky? Yes. Worth it.
- My veggie burger with tots was actually pretty good! Score! And at a $11 definitely a good value. Their menu falls to the more gluttonous bar food - think burgers, wings, tots, mac n' cheese, fries, etc... 
- Service was dece.
- Lots of great happy hour specials. Peep their website for more details.
