This seems to be a hot spot for those who like to party. On a Sunday afternoon there was a bit of shit show with a few different parties enjoying Sunday funday. In my younger years, you bet this would be my jam. At this stage of the game, it'll be a good meet up spot for those special occasions when I'm looking to let the hair down - animal style.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
If you're in the mood for tots and thots... boy, have I got THE place for you. 

Like so many others before me, I came here 85% due in part to the name (a bar named after the band from the Muppets? of course I'm in) and 15% due in part to the great reviews. It certainly was not due to the bar service or the other clientele which would best be described as murdery and over-served. 

In defense of the service, I used to bartend and I know that Sunday day-into-evening crowds are pretty much the worst and that murdery is sometimes the best mood you can eek out, but a little effort on their part to seem like they don't mind bartending would have certainly been appreciated. 

When we walked in there were 3 incredibly drunk girls trying to run into and/or jump over a parking meter and I'm pretty certain that one of them was bleeding from the mouth (probably from something to do with the parking meter jumping) and that was only confirmed when I saw that same girl struggling to hold herself up to look in the bathroom mirror while here two equally drunk friends formed an open door posse in the bathroom entryway to laugh and give some very poor life advice to their bleeding friend. That scene was about par for everyone inside of Dr Teeth, while the patio (where we chose to sit) was sunny, sticky, and full (to a comfortable level) with at least moderately respectable human beings who did not go out of their way to make it painful to be around. 

We initially ordered one of the cocktail pitchers to be split amongst 5 of us which was a pretty good deal and I think we each got a glass and half out of it and then most of us followed that up with a nice cold beer since the day was what would be considered a scorcher by San Francisco standards. 

For food, I went with the dungeness crab totchos, as one does. They were spicy, hearty, and a pretty decent steal considering the amount of crab lumped on there. 

Bottom line: If I'm ever in the mood for tots and thots, Dr. Teeth will be my #1 stop.
author: Candice G.

description: I give this a 3 star for the great price on tacos and wings. I love this place on Tuesday's and Wednesday's. I always get buffalo and habanero. The food always comes out quick. The bartenders could make their drinks a bit stronger. I have had a tortilla come out stale. But they quickly came to switch them out. Overall great place to get cheap food and drinks
author: Erick L.

description:
I came here on Wednesday for .25 wing night...and it also happened to be happy hour. I squeezed my way into a table (the gentlemen there were nice enough to let me intrude). After they left I watched as a few groups fought over who's table it was next...so this place gets crazy packed! 

Food: I ordered plain wings with ranch, a chicken slider, and a black bean slider (all of which were highly recommended by server). She was not lying....it was all really tasty!! 

Service: For as packed as this place was, my server handled it like a boss! I think her name was Felicia (according to receipt). She was on top of it, very helpful, and once she knew you'd treat her with respect, was very kind! I can tell she'd be able to handle it if some doucher got rowdy. Props to you, girl! 

Overall it was a satisfying experience. I will come back :)
author: Tina P.

description:
This place is disgusting. It's so filthy in there. And the bartender is a joke. He's working with his shirt open?? Okay? I know this is San Francisco but still. I asked him to wipe the table and he looked at me like I was asking too much. 

The mimosa is in a plastic cup (small) and no fruit. I asked him to change it to a single instead of bottomless because it did not look appetizing. He refused and gave me so much attitude about it. 

We asked to be cashed out but j guess he didn't believe us because he asked us 5 minutes later. Yes this is a whole in the ground. Only good thing is the music selection.
author: Maria Z.

description:
Cool spot on Mission. I don't know why I haven't come in here before but I had a good time meeting a friend here after work.

There were some specials that day - a Tuesday, maybe? - like $1 tacos (they were tiny but decent) and discounted margaritas.

We ended up getting some beers on tap and a couple of fish tacos. The tacos weren't much as I said and on the boring side but they were a $1 so can't complain too much.

The ambiance and service were spot on. I will be coming back for sure.
author: Art O.

description:
A group of us decided to go to Teeth SF last Wednesday, June 22nd for happy hour. I got there with a friend first around 6:15pm. At that time, we couldn't find a table, so we hung around in the back patio until half a table opened up about 25 mins later. We snagged it for our party of 5. The other half of the table opened up and we ended up having dinner and drinks.

Since it was Wing Wednesday ($0.25 wings all night), we of course ordered wings! There are some rules to observe, so make sure to read the signs: (1) 2 drink minimum per person, (2) No to-go boxes, and (3) Extra ranch or blue cheese (+$0.50). We started with a plate of 8 wings each: Au natural, Buffalo, Sweet chili habanero, Bbq. The wings came with I believe, a side of ranch. I didn't use it, so I'm not sure if it was blue cheese or ranch, but you can probably ask for either. My favorite flavor was the sweet chili habanero. It had a nice heat and I liked the contrast of flavors. The buffalo ones were okay. They weren't very hot. I'm not a huge fan of bbq sauce unless it's super spicy. It can be a little too sweet for me. So I thought the bbq ones were okay. I did get a side of death sauce so we could dip the au natural wings in it. My friends thought it was super spicy, but it was actually okay. There's definitely some heat in it, but nothing too unbearable.

We also got an order of Totchos ($11): melty cheese, pico de gallo, olives, jalapenos, salsa, sour cream & guacamole. Tater tots and nacho cheese are two of my favorite things in the world, so I adored this dish! So good! We also started with 3 Beer-garitas (or are they called Beeritas?) and a Diet coke. The total with the wings and death sauce ended up being a little over $50, so I'm not sure how much the Beer-garitas were. Probably around $10 each? A friend ended up getting another plate of wings and a second rounds of drinks. The beer-garitas were light, but fun to drink.

So much fun celebrating Wing Wednesdays. And you can't beat $0.25 per wing! Just make sure to get there early so you can snag a seat!
author: Elena N.

description:
They have specials in terms of their drinks every day, when I went in on a Thursday it was a shot of Jameson and a tall can of PBR for 9, which was great!

Their chicken wings are to die for with their buffalo wing sauce, but their famous for their Totchos are what makes this place amazing, it's basically tater totes instead of Tortilla chips in nachos, so good!

Service was great our server was very nice and brought out our drinks and food very quickly, they also have 3 TVs so we would also watch the basketball games.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
My favorite burger in the Bay Area. (http://bit.ly/1EL4WRd)

top bun
bbq pulled pork
burger patty
another bun
bacon bacon bacon
another patty
more bun
mac shells & cheese
more burger patty
bottom bun

aka The Dagwood $20. I returned on a brunch day to try to #diy my "dream burger" - Dagwood with jelly donuts replacing all the buns; didn't happen. #sigh Someday...

#idea TACO TUESDAY CHALLENGE

Each person eats a Dagwood & an order of Totchos, *then* the taco count starts. Loser pays for all the food.
author: Dan B.

description:
Random night in SF on a "Monday Funday" led us into this bar in the Mission where we met up with several friends who already had a game of Shuffleboard going.   It also happened to be trivia night where most tables were deep in thought thinking of the answers to the emcee's questions as they jotted down notes on their pads.  Fun, Fun..

We were ravenously hungry.  (Okay maybe not ravenous but I love being able to use that word to show off my vocabulary repertoire.  This smarty pants gets off on words.) 

This was definitely one of those times where we ordered way too much.  

*12 Buffalo Wings:  Good but not great.  With the bleu cheese dressing on the side, these were tasty but not as crunchy as I usually like. 

*Sweet Potato Tots: Yesssss, we have a winner.   I've never had sweet potato tots and these hit the spot.  Squeeze on some ketchup into a big puddle on your plate so that you can dip away.  These miniature fried morsels of goodness were just the thing to keep me munching away.

*6 Mozzarella sticks:  Can you imagine mozzarella sticks that look like miniature corn dogs?  They were that big.  So you can only see how disappointed I was when I took a bite into one of these and discovered how bland they tasted.  And how about that marinara folks?  Well, they didn't quite give us marinara sauce.  It was more of a salsa that didn't compliment the mozzarella sticks at all.   Don't mess with the tried and true-- I want regular marinara sauce!   

*2 Fried Chicken sliders:  Another winner here. Super tasty with the thin fried steak and coleslaw filling. 

If I'm ever in the mission again and feel like Sweet Potato tots, I'm coming here.
author: Lorie N.

description:
TWO WORDS: CRAB TOTS. 

I freaking love the crab tots. I also love their pulled pork sliders... but back to the tots. Flakey, perfectly fried little tots of happiness covered in delicious crab and garlic, showered in siracha mayo. Every bite is like falling in love. Now you may think that I'm exaggerating but I genuinely love these tots. I talk about them all the time and my friends probably think I eat them too often... the things we do for love.
author: Maria Francesca A.

description: Great Tuesday deal! Waitress greeted us at the door & highly recommend the pork tacos. Will absolutely be back.
author: Luke B.

description: The wings get me in the door, the service keeps me coming back!  My favorite waitress is a sweet little thing named Margaret.  She always makes my visits fun and hooks me up with what I need right away.  And she's just darn cute, too!  Thanks girl!
author: Jessica W.

description: Teeth is a solid neighborhood bar, with a great wings Wednesday deal. Drinks are reasonably priced. I am not much of a fan of coming here on a Friday or Saturday night, but rather for brunch on Sunday or for wings on Wednesday. It is a great place to come for friends, but is pretty small, so it can be a challenge funding seating. All that set aside, teeth is a fun place to come and hang
author: Ross S.

description:
Big difference between eating here and going out here:

1. Eating here is okay but the food is not bad coupled with some of their drinks. I usually get the appetizer platter and split it with a friend (chicken and fries are always a safe bet, the rest are all basic). 

2. Going out here is dead a lot on weekdays but on weekends it's one of the only bars without cover. The crowd is a mix of classy and ratchet. And the music is a hit or miss because sometimes they play the randomest shit but most of the time it's on point and worth a good time! If you hear 2 songs you hate, that's a hint to leave as soon as you can! 

For a bar is the mission, the prices are very affordable and the food is good before going out. I would suggest going out here than eating, but both offer a stellar experience!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
Cute bar with lots of seating, they have a shuffle board table which was fun, you just have to ask them for the equipment and leave your ID. 

Get the crab tots. Just do it.
author: Linz C.

description: I can only speak for their wednesday nights because that is the only time I ever go. WING WEDNESDAY 25 cent wings you can't pass that up. I used to go almost religiously but took a break from alcohol I have went back a few times since and my favorite flavored wings aren't the same. The chicken wing itself is but the sauce for the Sweet Chilli Habenero has gotten WAYYYYY spicier. I love spicy but this was too much so 4/5 now. Still an amazing deal.
author: Brandon H.

description: love taco tuesdays here. great great place amazing
author: Sasha G.

description:
Ok, I've been here a few times; Wednesdays for their wings, awesome, and random days for their tots, amazing.  

My friend and I came here to meet up her friend.  We walked in and he was no where in sight.  15 minutes later and still no response, wtf? Did her friend just ghost her?  Unbeknownst to us AND what makes this place even cooler is the back outdoor area!  And there they sat, a group of average looking firefighters having a good time enjoying their vodka tonics or whatever.  There's a whole section outside with lots of tables and chairs and benches, and a tv.  If you see a server walking around collecting dishes, don't wave her down to place an order, do it at the bar.

Regular Tots- good
Truffle Tots- OMFG GET IN MY MOUTH good. 

Nice area to chill, good service.  Will definitely come back.
author: Linda N.

description:
This is definitely the spot on Wednesdays! Decent $0.25 wings, and a bar. Last time I came here, I ordered 36 wings and they came to my table in 10 minutes! For how packed the place was, that felt extremely fast. 

The only downside of Teeth SF, you'll probably have to stand and eat your wings. But if you want avoid that issue, just get there early!

Will be back next Wednesday!
author: Barbara N.

description:
We came here to watch the NBA Finals Game 5 to cheer on the Warriors. We arrived an hour early and managed to snag a table in the corner with a great view of all 4 TVs. We got several pitchers of cocktails, dark & stormy, strawberry pisco punch, and the american mule. The pitches were all quite strong and great for large parties (4-5 ppl). 

I ordered the totchos and I thought they were decent, but the tater tots could have been crunchier and not so soggy. The amount of guacamole was disappointing for the price ($11). We ordered the sweet potato tots, which tastes like exactly what you would expect and certainly worth a try. We also ordered the crab dip and that was pretty good although there was way more dip than things to dip with.

The atmosphere was great and everyone was in high spirits since the Warriors were leading most of the game.
author: Edward W.

description: Good vibes, especially love Wing Wednesday. Just wish there was more seating!
author: Marie C.

description: 25 cent wings and fairly spicy. And beers. Good stuff!
author: Will D.

description: Saturday night and the place isn't really busy. The service was terrible. Our food came out late with cold fries. When the waitress brought it out she said she just had "Mac N Cheese." Our drinks taste watered down. After we finished eating we waited for what seemed hours for our check. Once we signed the receipt and left no tip (which is not mandatory) the waitress ran out and asked us if we "meant to leave no tip?" I looked at her puzzled and replied: yeah...no tip. I always tip even if they forget or mess up my order but tonight, tonight was a catastrophe. BAR RESCUE AND CHEF GORDAN RAMSAY NEED TEAM UP AND POUR THEIR LIFE AND SOUL INTO THIS PLACE! im just disappointed the nerve to ask us "Are we not tippers?"
author: Gerardo S.

description:
Great bar for Saturday afternoon shenanigans.
Awesome outdoor area and great drinks. 
Top notch bar food! Be sure to get the Scotch Eggs (runny, delicious, yolky eggs with a meaty exterior) and the tots!
author: Michelle L.

description:
Cool bar vibe.
Great name for a restaurant.
Great mix of people. Great service and staff.
We tried the jelly donut & fried chicken - moist, sweet, and delicious.
Grilled cheese was perfect along with rosemary potatoes and a fried egg.
Top it all off w/ bottomless mimosas. Perfection.
Check this mission street joint, worth it.
author: David H.

description:
This place sucks.  Our server was super nice but I heard her telling the table next to us the last three shots (two tequila and one "Bacardi bomb" which she described as totally gross but that she  gets them all the time) she had just taken and it was very apparent that she was wasted.  She took forever to return to our table, the few times that she did, I had to ask for a box 3 times.  

There was ABSOLUTELY no reason to get the "bottomless" mimosas that she pitched to us because we were only able to have 2 or 3 each (and they are served in those tiny plastic cups you get on airplanes) since every time they came back to refill, they would get to our table last and wouldn't have enough left in the pitcher to refill ours.  Then they would forget to come back.  

My boyfriend liked his Giants platter, but my food was all cold and not very good.  My over easy eggs on top of my breakfast totchos were over hard and all of the tater tots were mushy.  I think our food must have sat in the window waiting for our server to finish her shots for a good 10 minutes.  That or they just prepare cold food.  And their prices are laughably high.   

To top it off, our server lost my credit card.  When she realized, she drunkenly staggered off with a look on her face like she saw a ghost.  She came back about 20 minutes later and handed me the bill fold and said "funny, it was right where I left it!" I opened the fold and my credit card had a fat, sticky, muddy footprint on it.  Had our server been just buzzed instead of totally sloshed, she would have had the presence of mind to wipe it off.  Now I have to cancel my card and get a new one reissued because I don't know what's worse: the scummy residue of over-served, under-aged douchers all over it, or the possibility of stolen credit card information. 

It was a good day because I was with my baby, but there were a lot of other things I would have enjoyed doing with the 3 hours it took from start to finish.  

Cold, mediocre lunch, hammered server, lost credit card and a couple of rotgut mimosas was over $60. Will not return.
author: Emma H.

description: Awesome bartenders great food love the staff place can get crowed. I go for the wings  man bomb ass wings lol I'm a wing lover and wouldn't say this if it wasn't accurate my fav are the beer-Rita's
author: Eve G.

description:
Dr. Teeth is definitely a fun place. It's a bit divey, and has some ... let's just say.. unique decor. When you first walk in, you'll notice these truncated mannequin-type things sitting in little alcoves along the wall. They have some metallic accessories draped over their torsos and interesting headdresses connected to the neck, where the head should be. It was eye-catching my first time here. 

The indoor area tends to get pretty packed, but they also have a pretty large outdoor patio! No heat lamps, but it's good on a nice night. It's also not as loud outside, so it's easier to hang out in a group without having to shout at each other.

My friends and I like coming for the Wednesday happy hour (4 - 7pm) - 25 cent wings with a 2 drink minimum!!! Why would anyone not love this?! They have a few different flavors of wings to choose from: normal, BBQ, sweet chili habanero, and buffalo. The sweet chili habanero is definitely my favorite. It's a good balance of sweet with just a bit of spicy. I wouldn't recommend getting the normal wings though; they don't have any sauce on them so they're a bit dry and unflavorful. The chicken used for the wings is pretty good quality and have a decent amount of meat on them.

Tuesdays are $1 tacos and 2-for-1 margaritas! Still super fun with a group of friends, but I was not that satisfied with the tacos. They didn't have very much filling, so it was a little disappointing. The margaritas are good though!

One thing to note is that the drinks can vary a bit in strength between the different bartenders since they're trying to go really fast.
author: Tiffany P.

description: This is a good bar to watch sports if you're looking for loud af. I normally like more subdued venues, but there are select nights I'm down for a more happenin' vibe. I wish there were fewer hipsters, but this is the Mission. One guy looked straight Amish, as my friend pointed out. Lol. The food isn't omfg bomb. I actually wasn't too impressed with the tater tots, unlike some reviewers. The crab is a bit odd with the tots, and I would've liked more Sriracha. Love Sriracha. They burned the sliders. Ugh. Mac 'n cheese is okay. Drinks are also. I had the cucumber gimlet and the gin with strawberries. Solid options for me.
author: Paulina F.

description:
Meeting up with some friends over drinks a few weeks ago, we chose to head down to the mission and spend some time at Dr Teeth. It was the weekend so it had a small crowd but the atmosphere seemed comfortable and they had lots of TVs around playing the warriors game.

I put in an order for some fries, to which I added garlic crab, truffle oil and cheese. This sounded like a fantastic combination with a lot of potential. Unfortunately close to an hour later I still had not received my order. I have no idea what is so complicated about throwing together an order of fries but by the time it came out I had long since finished my drink and we were at the point where we were looking to head on to our next destination. This dish was average at best and certainly not worth that insane wait. 

Overall, this place disappointed me both in service and quality. "I've experienced better."
author: Mark O.

description: Love this spot! Great to watch games. The food is too damn good! Get the totchitos, they are nacho tater tots, and super good. Also their wings are to die for! I like the regular buffalo wings and the sweet and spice wings. The bar tenders are awesome too, along with the funky decorations.
author: Mollie H.

description:
------600TH REVIEW------

After having this bar in my bookmark for months now, I've decided to go with my friend especially since the 25 cent wings Wednesday enticed me. Yes, the deal is too good to be true. There's a catch: 2 drinks minimum per person.

Initially, we went in after the bouncer ID'd us and walked around - it was full. We waited for about 5 minutes and then decided to bounce. We walked around, but there weren't any other restaurants or bars that appealed to me, so we went back.

Luckily, after walking in, we spotted two open spots at the bar area and claimed our seats!

I ordered 15 wings (5 buffalo, 5 sweet chili, and 5 BBQ) and two Modelo. We waited about 10 minutes for our food, which wasn't a big deal. We were having fun with the bar atmosphere.

Overall, we had a great time, but I feel like there should be some sort of organization that should be implemented which is why I concluded this bar with a 3-star. Also, I wish they would brighten the place up a tad bit. It was way too dark. It's darker than Abercrombie & Fitch.
author: Aj C.

description:
Came here for wing Wednesday, left satisfied and stuffed. Happy hour lasts from 4-7 and there are daily specials. On Wednesday, they have wings for 25cents, with favors like bbq, sweet chili habanero, and buffalo. The wings come with celery and ranch too, which is pretty cool. 

Make sure to arrive early, as it gets pretty crowded (at least on Wednesday). It's also a pain in the ass to park around here after work but it's worth it. 16 wings for 4$?? Can't beat that. They have a 2 drink minimum requirement for the 25 cent wings, so the cheapest method is to order two happy hour beers. It's not too bad considering you'll want some ice cold beer to quench your thirst after spending 20 mins looking for parking.
author: Calvin K.

description:
Courtney is the best waitress we've had so far -- always checked on us and made sure we were happy. Love the tots and the grilled cheese is amazing.!The burrito leaves something to be desired -- too much eggs with not enough flavor. Mimosas are, of course, fabulous.

Our whole group thinks Courtney made the experience phenom! Thanks :)
author: Alyssa H.

description: Came here to watch the warriors game and shockingly got seats outside. Really crowded bar, but what can you expect during NBA finals. For being very busy, the servers and bartenders were on point and no one was waiting for very long.
author: Samantha E.

description:
Dr. Teeth and the Electric Mayhem. (Fun fact: it's a band from the Muppets) From the quirky name and its location in the Mission, you can solemnly swear that you are up to no good. Indeed, there's a drink named slap in the face, a burger called the dick pick, and cocktail pitchers titled community service. This divey bar with its dry humor and decor of torsos is made for mischief and shenanigans. 

The bar food features ingenious comfort food concoctions, the most famous of which is the TOTCHOS ($11). It's simple in concept but addicting in taste, combining tater tots with nachos toppings of melty cheese, pico de gallo, olives, jalapeno, salsa, pulled pork, sour cream, and guac. The tots get considerably soggy under the pile of toppings, so you do have to eat it ASAP.

There is a build-your own sampler in which you can choose 3 apps/tots for $16. It's a little confusing on the menu since it's right below the tots section, but we clarified that we can choose from any totos and appetizers (Also, they ended up charging us $22 because there's an extra cost for the totchos vs regular tots). We went for the totchos with SWEET POTATO TOTS and chicken, which I preferred over the traditional pulled pork one. I like to think it's healthier because the chicken is the cubed type like what you find in cobb salad, and it came with some spinach mixed into the toppings (vegetables in bar food? Unheard of!) The CHICKEN FINGERS were alright, decent but not particularly outstanding. Of note, it did taste different from the pre-made frozen ones with the heavy breading that you usually see. I enjoyed the REUBEN ROLLS, a clever fusion of spring rolls and the Reuben sandwich. Essentially, it was a fried Reuben... who can say no to that!

Service was great, especially since most casual bars in SF get away with no service at all. The server checked in on us quite often and also made sure that we had enough cups, napkins, plates and utensils for everyone as more joined our group. (Came with friends from dental school, who all of course got a huge kick out of "Dr. Teeth")

Teeth Bar is definitely a fun place, whether for scoring their 25-cent Wing Wednesday deals or indulging in divine totchos late into the night.
author: Edna C.

description:
Brunch review: I came here for brunch with 2 friends and had a great experience. We chose to eat at the outdoors patio, and service was surprisingly still attentive, yay! Bottomless mimosas=$15, and brunch dishes range from $8-$15 dollars. Not bad at all. My friend ordered a grilled cheese dish, my other friend and I ordered the chorizo scramble, and we all split the tator tots, which I definitely recommend! They're delicious, along with the mimosas. The food was pretty good, but not amazing. Overall, I had a good experience and would come back. 

On a side note, I came here during bar hours once, and had a great time as well.
author: Corinna T.

description: Came here on a Tuesday for happy hour - I know.. not the usual 25c Wednesday - their 2 for 1 margarita was a good deal but way too syrup-y. I'd prefer a $4 happy hour cocktail from Bissap Baobab instead (sorry Teeth). The $1 tacos were great though. Small but awesome to go with beer or something. I tried the chicken and fish, both had a bit of kick to them. Draft beers ran at $6.5 a pint, which was pricey and no discount for happy hour. The atmosphere was chill, not too crowded, pretty friendly. All in all, a pretty good time. I was probably high off of sugar after the hour.
author: Maggie G.

description:
My friends and I were wandering the Mission this morning, looking for a brunch venue that didn't have too long of a wait. After a couple of strikes, I turned to my trusted list of Yelp bookmarks and found Teeth SF. I don't remember when I bookmarked it, but I'm glad I did because this was a good find. 

From other reviews, Teeth looks like it's usually hopping but for whatever reason we were able to snag seats pretty easily around noon. Sunday brunch calls for bottomless mimosas and Teeth delivered. For $15, we got some of the strongest bottomless mimosas I ever had. Two mimosas in and I was definitely having a good Sunday. At one point, the waitress told us that since the establishment was responsible for our safety after we left the venue, she had to start pacing us to keep us from getting too drunk. Is that an actual law or were they just budgeting us? 

Anyways, on top of the mimosas we got a round of bbq wings to share and I ordered myself some crab cake benedicts. The benedict was good and the crab cake was all right, but the tots that came with them were fantastic. Tots- you da real MVP! 

I noticed an outdoor patio as well, but it was rainy outside so we stayed indoors with everybody else with the football game playing on the TV. Quiet cozy, mostly delicoius, and definitely boozy.
author: Philip W.

description:
Came here last weekend for bottomless mimosa brunch and was still feeling the consequences of my decision well past midnight............. so whatever else Teeth is, you can count on it for a good time. (If you don't mind maybe chilling next to the toilet for an hour or so down the road, but I'm pretty sure that was more my fault LOL.)

Food 2/5: Idk if I've just been spoiled by LA (where food tends to be cheaper on average,) but food here is not good for the price, which isn't that expensive strictly speaking (plenty of $10 dishes on the menu)... but still expensive for basically being a glorified McDonald's (I think their main selling point is tater tots which to be fair is good but then again how can you mess up tater tots for drunk people,) except McDonald's tastes better imo. Best thing I ate here were the crab tater tots.

Service 3/5: Waiters were friendly and I really appreciated how my glass was never empty or empty for long, but they were pretty slow in regards to other things like food (lol can you tell I care about my food.) Oh and also my waitress got 3/6 orders at our table wrong so idk how that happened.

Ambience 4/5: The inside reminded me of Cabo in LA (which people go to for Taco Tuesdays) and if you don't know what that is, just think dim red lighting and ratchet. We didn't get to go outside because apparently the patio was too crowded and I meant to check it out before leaving, but I kind of forgot due to having too many...

DRINKSSSSSSS 5/5: Honestly you know bottomless mimosas are always going to be made from cheap af champagne and yes my hangover sucked, but drinks were strong and yummy and ALWAYS COMING, which are all that you should require from bottomless mimosas. They're also only $16 (I think,) which is p good. 

Giving it a 3 for now, because it wouldn't be my first choice for boozy brunch in SF (not that I've been to any other ones in the city... but there's always something better right??!?), but I have a feeling with a couple more visits, I would maybeee be willing to bump it up to a 4. It's also super close to Bi-Rite if you want dessert (YUMMY) and Dolores Park, if you need to you know gather yourself...
author: Rebecca T.

description:
Taco Tuesday! $1 for fish, beef, chicken, or veggie tacos! And 2 for 1 margarita for $8. Really great vibe and night. Especially when you're with 8+ hiking buddies. Enjoy! 

Wings Wednesday are 25cent each! Don't drink and drive, you might spill your drink. 

-Black Tiger
author: Teason M.

description:
If it's a Wednesday night be sure to hit up Dr Teeth for their famous 25 cent wings! Located in The Mission, Dr Teeth is packed on Wednesday evenings both indoors and on their back patio. 

The Wednesday menu has a variety of flavors, both spicy and not. You can even get an order of tater tots to help wash down the pounds of wings you'll be consuming. 

It gets super busy on Wednesdays so be sure to get there early and grab a table. I recommend sitting on the back patio, it is really cute and there is lots of space.
author: Aletta B.

description:
Average prices for the area, chill vibe, and the bartenders were cool. 

Will come back now that I see I missed out on their tater tots.
author: Mandi W.

description:
Quick Review: A hipster hangout for Wing Wednesday.25 cent wings, need I say more. Great drinks, truffle tots and regular tots are also very good. Be prepared for a large crowd on this day though. 

FOOD: 
You can't go wrong with .25 cent wings! The buffalo flavor was super good and the habanero was tasty too, especially if you like spicy. I'm not a huge fan of truffle oil anyway so I could do without the truffle tots but the regular tots were good. They also have tachos (cheesy tots). My friends and I didn't order them but they looked good. 

SERVICE
It's a bar and it gets pretty crazy so don't expect one particular person waiting on you. However, it was pretty easy to flag someone down. I suggest going directly to the bar and ordering your drinks there, much faster. 

AMBIANCE
Once again it's a bar and it was pretty hard to hear unless you are sitting super close to who you are talking to or yelling. The music was more hipster chic than anything else.  The crowd seemed cool but I do miss the days when the mission was actually the mission and there was more diversity at places like these. Techies are taking over the city, but it's no surprise. 

I would say come here on Wednesdays.
author: Brittany S.

description:
If you're like me, you're most likely coming here on a Wednesday for their 25cent wing special. You're not? Ok, read another review because this is just for their wings night.

Here's the deal, when you buy 2 drinks per person, the price of wings drop to 25 cents each(minimum of 4 per flavor/per order). The cheapest way to do that is to purchase their sodas($3) or PBRs($4). I recommend the latter as they put ALOT of ice in their soda cups(no refills mind you).

As for the wings, there are 4 flavors. Here's my review on them:

Au Natural:
Basic fried chicken with no sauce, good to order at least 4 to dip in the sauce mixer which you will have later.

Buffalo:
Nothing special but it's a staple

BBQ:
For me, this was too sweet, but if you love BBQ flavor, this is for you

Habernero Sweet Chili:
The best one for me, sweet and spicy, the perfect match to a beer/soda.

Size of the wings:
The sizes seem to vary from: "This is the smallest wing I have ever seen in my life" to "These wings are pretty normal size"

And now for why they have a 3 star review. When you order 4 wings(the minimum) they'll give you 1 sauce(ranch or blue cheese) and some celery. When you order more than 4 wings, they'll still give you 1 sauce and some celery. You see where I'm going with this? Personally, I don't really dip my wings into more sauce if there's already sauce on them but my friend does. We ordered 24 wings to start and go 1 sauce. When we asked for more, the waitress told us it would be $0.50 more. Are you kidding me? I would rather just order 4 more wings and get another sauce and celery at that point. Later, we ordered another 24 wings and guess what? 1 sauce.

Of course giving this place a 3 star just for the sauce problem is quite evil, BUT WAIT THERE'S MORE!

For some reason, even when the place wasn't packed and they have 4 waiter/waitress/servers and 1-2 busboys, they can't seem to clean tables fast enough nor check on your table every now and then.

The best thing I would say about this place is how fast the food comes out, but when you're ready to order again, your waitress will be MIA.

TLDR: If you want cheap wings with 2 drinks minimum, this is the place for you, if you like to dip your flavored wings into more sauce, order in smaller quantities.
author: Da X.

description:
Came here for their infamous .25¢ wings Wednesday's! 

**Keep in mind it's required for the deal to purchase 2 drinks along with your wings!**

They have 3 choices of wings:

- Buffalo (8/10 it was a bit spicy but the kind that warms your stomach instead of burning your insides) 
- Sweet chili habanero (didn't appeal to me)
- BBQ (2/10 tasted too tomatoe-y for me, didn't taste like BBQ at all, at least not my preferred BBQ taste)

Arrived around 5:45 (party of 3) and surprisingly it wasn't incredibly packed, but we did wait a little, prox. 30min! Not bad considering the .25¢ deal occurring. Inside was too stuffy for me but the great thing about this place is the outdoor patio! There's a huge TV back there as well as a self-serve water station. The tables are picnic-styled with a few bar tables. And two upper levels. 
We shared a table with another party of 4 and we all sat comfortably! 

I wish I had ordered the tators but with an order of 30 wings it was more than enough to feed the 3 of us, even had a few left over. So along with the 2-drink rule, it totaled out to $20.09, excluding tip!
author: Irene Angela C.

description:
Hate hate hate leaving these, especially as a former waitress and bartender. Love this bar, unfortunately the service today sucked. Bottomless mimosas are not on the printed menu but you can order them. Apparently they end at 3... we had no idea.  Very often we waited for our "glasses" to be refilled. When we asked for a refill the "manager," Courtney, told us it was over and they had put the champagne away. I'm sorry you "put the champagne away?" 

Again, love the bar but fuck the lack of customer service. It's not cool to be a dick when people are paying.
author: Brittany C.

description: Great sweet habanero wings and a great deal on $0.25 wing Wednesdays. Models was $5, reasonably priced. Only concern is that the guy at the entrance who checks IDs accused us of stealing his beer (?) and we had to buy him another one.
author: J P.

description: This is another classic after work place go to. I personally recommend Tuesdays $1 Tacos & 2-for-1 Margaritas, Wednesday 25 cent Wings with purchase of two beverages and Sundays Bottomless Brunch 10am-3pm. It's always a vibrant atmosphere with really friendly staff no matter how busy it is. And trust it does get busy! Parking is decent to find you'll have to look but you'll find something. TVs are everywhere playing whatever game is going on. It is a dope place. It's not like the most amazing food you've ever tried but it's great vibes. I say go on those days that I mentioned. Go with the homies, meet up with a old friend, or a date night. You're welcome.
author: Rubin S.

description:
I went for Sunday Brunch.  I am a big fan of the bottomless mimosas! very good, not just OJ like at most places.   Bartender and staff was great!   Tots are amazing as one would expect.  The breakfast was good....the burger was a little disappointing but it was ok.
Overall a good experience! I will be back!
author: G R.

description:
This is the place to be on Wednesday nights! 25 cent wings with the purchase of 2 beers is a steal! It's only till 7pm though so get there FAST, this place gets packed.

We got 20 wings of the Sweet Chili Habanero (more sweet than it was spicy but so good) and 10 wings of the Buffalo (mediocre in comparison). I would skip the Buffalo flavor next time. 30 wings total out to be like $7.50, how awesome is that?! If you sit down with a waitress taking your order, they enforce the 2 drinks per person to make the Happy Hour wings count. Tip: you can get out of that by ordering at the bar. 

Our group also go the Tot'chos (tater tots topped with guac & salsa) which got soggy a bit fast. Besides the wings, I highly recommend coming here for the CRAB TOTS! Its pretty unique and is great bar food to munch on while a game is on.

I'll be sure to bring my teeth back next time.
author: Kathy L.

description:
Came here with several friends to indulge in a bottomless mimosa brunch--something I can no longer enjoy now that I live in Boston.

This place was a fantastic setting as their outdoor patio was beautiful on a warm and sunny October day.

For my meal, I had the chorizo omelet--which was actually very good and a decent size as well. 

As for the bottomless mimosa part of the brunch--this was not as wonderful as the rest of the experience. First off, they give you small cups--which I understand--but they don't just leave a pitcher on your table like many other places. Half the time, we had to walk into the bar to request refills and they would come out about 10-15 minutes later.

Overall, I really liked this place as far as the food and atmosphere were concerned, however I would not do the bottomless mimosas here again since I have had better experiences elsewhere.
author: Ryan R.

description:
Look, on the base surface, this bar is fine. I grabbed a spicy cucumber margarita hand crafted and it was delicious ($11). The bartender was cool, as was the waitress who came around. Kinda wish the prices were more happy hour friendly, but it's on par with the newly fancified neighborhood. 2 margies + tip set me back $30- yeesh

So what's the problem? Mission bros, bro. We got there at 4pm on a Friday and some dude bro was demanding loudly "WARRIORRSSS,, TURN ON THE WARRIORSSSS." I guess that's how he gets his way in life, just yelling out until someone shuts him up. Another group of bros sat next to us and it was "dude bro" this and "duuuuuude" that. Maybe I'll try hitting this place up when the dude bros are at work.
author: Alyssa J.

description: Rats all over the place. Huge ones and the staff doesn't care. Disgusting asf!!! Don't eat here!!
author: Natalie I.

description:
I went to Dr. Teeth with some friends on a Saturday night, and while I'm never the one to suggest finding a loud, crowded bar to hang out, I had a reasonably good time. The place was popping, with a lot of energy. The clientele seemed young and party-happy. I'm guessing this bar is a Tindr hot spot.

The bartenders were friendly and did quick work, considering. I think I had two drinks here, a Templeton and a High West rye on the rocks. Both good drinks, at standard pricing.

I guess Dr. Teeth is part of a larger space called Mayhem that maybe includes a restaurant? I didn't see anywhere anyone could conceivably sit and eat a meal, but maybe it's a big place. The area I was in was standing room only, and I spent a lot of time entranced by a pair of TVs screening a black and white montage of movie clips. It was pleasantly disorienting.

I don't know that I'd seek out Dr. Teeth again as I'm only getting older and lazier, but I had fun while I was here. I'd recommend it if you're looking for a happening time in San Francisco.
author: Steph C.

description:
WING WEDNESDAY UPDATE:

25 cents wings.  It's hard to believe anybody doing it anymore.  But they are.  My friends got here at 6pm and by some minor miracle, we found seating at the bar area at the community table.  Started with beer and only a dozen wings and a regularly priced order of the tatchos.  Although it does seem weird to order a $11 dish of tater tots covered in cheese, salsa, guac, and sour cream but after getting my dozen wings and eating a couple of them, the tatchos actually were a good palate cleanser.  Those wings...yeah...they were quite heavily sauced.  I don't know if it's butter, margarine, fat, something in their sauces made those chicken wings feel twice as heavy in my stomach. After eight wings, I had to call it quits...and per the rules of wing Wednesday, I had to get my second drink to fill my two drink minimum.

After 7pm, this place goes crazy.  I saw two servers most of the night handle a ton of customers all over the crowded dining room.  Despite the craziness, she was quite cordial and patient when we had questions or additional orders for drinks.  

Would I come back for Wing Wednesday again?  Sure...but with sauce on the side or no sauce at all.  It's still a great deal, the vibe in here was buzzy as the previous time I was here.  Thank you Dr. Teeth, Teeth SF, Mayhem, whatever you are calling yourself now.  It was a blast.
author: Ben H L.

description:
Totchos! Where have you been all my life?! Combining the two loves of my life, Dr. Teeth, you are a genius! 25 cent wing wednesdays are amazing. Thank you for knowing how to entice me to over-indulge! 

I know I'm late to the party, but yay for Dr. Teeth! =)
author: Marti L.

description:
To be honest looking into this place from the outside I wasn't expecting much. It's not until you go inside past the bar and out to the patio area you see the entirety of this place. It's SO CUTE! (Kinda hipsterish) 

I came here on a Sunday night, but even then there were good amount of people both inside and outside watching the baseball game hanging out (yes, there's a tv outside). There's park style benches outside with plenty of seating for groups with Christmas lights hanging. I didn't get a good look at the menu or order inside so I can't tell you their selection of drinks. But their food-- delicious! 

I'm not vegetarian but sometimes I crave the healthy stuff and then balance it out with a side of something better than fries TATER TOTS! Haha so my vegetarians, they have options for you! I got the pita sandwich with beets (lol I like how my autocorrect just changed that to beer) goat cheese and some other stuff, bottom line it's filling and good-- I eat a lot and I was only able to finish half. The tater tots you have the option of regular OR truffle, obviously truffle is better but only by a bit.
author: Jane K.

description:
If you're suffering from mild boredom, call your Yelp insurance provider and set up an appointment with Dr. Teeth.

Dr. Teeth has a duo MD in FUNniology and LAUGHodontics. He will take good care of ya.

Perhaps he'll prescribe the good old fashion Bottomless Mimosa. $15 and you'll see your mason jar filled again and again with that OJ champagne. Nothing's boring after 3 drinks.

Dr Teeth recommends you to take the mimosas along with a variety of brunch items such as their famous Jelly Donut Fried Chicken Sandwich ($10ish) or their Truffle Oil Mac&Cheese ($9ish). Never take prescriptions on an empty stomach.

Side effects include sudden spurts of rachet. You may experience crazy laughing, chest bumps with strangers, and groovy dance moves in the spacious office of Dr. Teeth. HOMIE supervision is advised.

Don't live with boredom. Call Dr. Teeth today.
author: Ringo M.

description:
I love Dr. Teeths! Totchos are so damn good you can keep stuffing them down even after you're full. The PBJ bacon burger is like no other and if you love PBJs you shouldn't miss out. The mac n cheese with crab is the best mac I've had! 

Came today for .25 cents Wing Wednesday. (One drink minimum) ordered the bud light with their freshly squeezed grapefruit juice and 18 wings all for less than $11!! That shit cray lol

Got here at around 5pm and there was only one open table left. After about 30 minutes the line to order wings was pretty long, so come early. I ordered the buffalo sauce, but definitely coming back to try their habanero wings.

Always great service. One of my favorite places in the Mission.
author: Christina O.

description:
This place sure can get crowded on 25¢ wings night (Wednesdays). Make sure you're good at estimating how much you can eat. They don't let you box any leftovers. We ended up having about 20 wings left. Clearly, we thought too highly of our gluttony!

You might have to fight or wait around for a table. 
You might have to wait a really long time for any staff to bus your table. 
You might have to share your table with other parties.
author: Yad L.

description:
I really like this bar!! Hipster to the max. 

The deets:
HH - Mon - Fri, 4-7pm. $3 beer, $4 cocktails
MON - Burger and beer for $10
TUES - Taco Tues! $1 taco, 2-for-1 margaritas all night!
WED - Wing Wednesday! 25cent wings all night with 2 drink minimum, get sweet Habanero and natural! The others are too saucey
THUR - fundraiser thursday
WEEKEND BRUNCH - Sat/Sun 10am-3pm $15 bottomless mimosas
SUN - buy any shot, get a free pony (yeah, I'm curious too)

More Pros:
- Outdoor patio is nice and spacious! Perfect for the spring and summer time :) They also have a TV outside where you can watch sports.  Though, you have to order drinks/food in the bar
- Located in the heart of Mission, right next door to Bruno's! If you get too drunk here, sober up dancing the night away there ;) 
- Tater Tots are delicious! We got the truffle tater tots, but I saw crab tater tots too that I was eyeing 
- White sangria $10 that I got was yummy 

Definitely coming back!!
author: Raquel Y.

description:
I've always wanted to try this place and low and behold... I've definitely been missing out.

This place surely lives up to its hype. Come on Wednesday nights for their 25¢ aka dirt cheap wings. Swear, these are not just any wings; these wings are crispy, juicy, flavorful, and full of meat. It's such a steal that you would think it's too good to be true. 

Just make sure that you come before the rush hour. We got there around 5:30pm and were lucky enough to wait in a short line and snag a nice spot on the ground in the patio.

We overheard some guys next to us saying that they bet the 3 of us would not be able to finish the 50 wings we ordered. Boy were they wrong! But boy were we going to explode haha!

Before we went, one of our friends highly recommended us getting the sauce on the side (because he said it would be way too heavy) but I'm so glad we didn't listen to him. They taste amazing with the sauce cooked with the wings!

As for the flavors, my favorite was definitely the sweet habanero! It's sweet with a tiny spicy kick to it. If you like eating somewhat spicier, buffalo is really good too! BBQ was delicious as well. The au natural was definitely not as flavorful as the other flavors but just dip it in the ranch sauce and they are bomb diggity.

Also, if you want the Wednesday wing deal, you must purchase 2 drinks per tab, but their drinks are super cheap too so it's not a problem at all! Before 7pm, their bottled beer are only $3!

You already know I will be back, no doubt about it!
author: Lincy H.

description:
I've always heard about coming here on Wednesday for their 25 cent wings, but i never got to try it until i broke up with my boyfriend and my life freed up!

Parking around the area is pretty forgiving, you're more than likely to find a spot close by around 6pm (and it's free!). It's crazy popular during their happy hour, so make sure to go a little bit earlier to stake out seats. When we arrived at 6pm, there were NO seats, so we had to be those weirdos standing uncomfortably close to a table that looked like they were about to be done. I have no shame in asking people if they're about to leave (hangry is real).

The tables are dirty, the servers are hipsters, and the crowd is pretty much the combination of the two - but for the wings, totally worth it.

We ordered 40 wings, 10 of each flavor and their crab tots as well. Note, that in order to get the wings for 25 cents, you have to order $4 worth of drinks or something like that. I can't remember which flavor i liked the best because they serve all 40 wings on the same plate, and all the flavors sort of meshed together. But I THINK i liked their sweet chilli the best and the buffalo flavor the least. 

Their crab tots are THE BEST. anyone who loves tots (or food for that matter) should definitely order these tots.
author: Andy H.

description:
I had this place bookmarked since forever and me and the bf have been trying to make time to go out to the mission for a while but never got the chance until this past week. 

We got super lucky with parking and parked half a block away. I'm not too fond of the area so I'm glad we got close parking. We came on a off day and time so it was pretty empty. Only had a few people at the bar and probably people in the back patio but we were the only ones seated at an actual table inside. 

It took a few minutes to get noticed but the server quickly came with menus and water and was really friendly. 

We ordered the burger and beer special for $10, tatchos, garlic crab tots and homemade corn dogs. The burger was really flavorful and we did the tatchos as the side which I really liked and wish I got a side of the crab one and a full order of the tatchos instead.. but there's always next time. The garlic crab ones were good, the crab wasn't fresh but it was still tasty. Wish I got fries instead because it was tots overload. I wasn't too fond of the corndogs because the batter was super sweet and the sausage was really juicy.. but the idea is cool.

Must come back to try the wings and grapefruit beer.
author: Tiff C.

description: Great name, inexpensive bites, tasty drinks, fun patio. That's Dr Teeth in a nutshell. I came in a few nights ago and sat out on the sun dappled back patio with a plate of sliders, pitcher of some kind of dreamy pisco & strawberry cocktail (later a cucumber mint gin gimlet - though a bit too sweet) and several friends. Oh, and some tater tots - a must! The vibe is fairly divey and super casual with counter service so there's no need to wait politely for your check when ya just want to head out.
author: Emily C.

description:
- jameson on tap 
- tater tots 
- outdoor seating area 

what else do you need?
author: Patricia L.

description:
Dirty dive atmosphere and very loud. Good for rowdy groups (not so much if you want deep conversation). Lots of televisions from multiple angles and sports-minded folks. Seating is seat-your-self so go ahead and stake a claim. Spot it near the corner of Mission and 19th with a tooth printed onto a maroon awning. 

Average food that probably tastes good doused with a drink.  A group of friends and I went to Teeth SF (aka Dr. Teeth) for a noon 'brunch'. Bottomless mimosas are available for $15. Brunch options are your greasy American favorites (tater tots, burgers, wings, omelettes) with Mexican influence (think dishes with guac, salsa, green chilis, and tapatio at the table). I ordered the totchos (tot nachos). The tots were your standard fried bunch but could have been crispier. All the cheese sauce, sour cream, guac, and salsa sort of overwhelmed the dish over time and made some of the tots soggy, leading to mushy mashed potato mess. The mimosas taste a bit watered down but they keep your glasses full (so I suppose drink more?). Bathrooms are near the back before the door to the patio (additional seating back there if weather permits).
author: Tammy T.

description:
This place was okay. Probably won't come back here. The food was way too greasy and kind of "cheap tasting." I should've guessed with the side of tater tots. The mimosas weren't worth it, in my opinion. The juice was watered down and it just didn't sit right. The service was great--glass was never empty. 

We got totchos and split the eggs and chicken donut sandwich. 

Btw the ladies bathroom has no lock or door handle. Rather, there's a hole where the handle should be. NOT OKAY.
author: Haana R.

description:
I used to love their hot wings back in 2013...

I just got back yesterday and order "buffalo wings" it was disappointed. Even the celery stick is old not crispy at all 

Also order tater tot the nachos style. It was fine. 

The waitresses seem busy flirting with customers ((good for her if she tried to find boyfriends I feel her... very strong feelings)) I have to work hard to grabbed her attention for plate and silverware  

She just not knowing how to do her job. Not really have common sense... When someone want to order food. Just go ahead and put order in and saying back in customer face that it more expensive... I pretty sure we all can read the menu.. 

I had so much fun there before in 2013 so I brought my boyfriend last night expected to have good time but it just came out frustrated
author: Fah Z.

description: Gotta say Tuesdays $1.00 tacos, beef, chicken, And FISH TACOS ARE BY FAR THE BEST. THEY WERE SO FUCKING GOOD FOR 1 dollar you cannot complain you should for sure come Eduard is a good bartender enjoy hidden gem but in my knowledge just order fish tacos.
author: Roberto B.

description: Taco tuesday is lit plus the service is great ! Will be there next week for Wing Wednesday !!
author: Tatiana M.

description: Great food here, nice setting, big outdoor patio. Only problem is craptastic service. Got my food and drinks ordered quickly, but seems the waitress forgot about me when I asked for the check. When I did get the check she seemed to forget to run my card. I waited out in the patio 15mins at least. Came back inside saw she was at the bar talking to some patron. I had to tell the bus girl to get the waitress to come run my card. She walks over with the obvious guilt on her face that she had forgotten about me and runs my card, no apology though. My recommendation is maybe get your food to go or dine here if you want your patience tested.
author: Thomas Crown O.

description:
Love this place. They have an incredible back patio that's three levels and has plenty of seating and TVs. Came here for a Giants game and the overall spirit of the bar was awesome.

There's a shuffleboard inside (as there should be at any ~true~ dive bar). Food menu is pretty great- however I ordered a chicken sandwich once and the chicken was raw... Honestly, I'm not even mad though. The sweet potato tater tots were too sweet for my taste (which is saying a lot), but still not bad at all! Plenty of tables inside, and the music is loud, but not too loud where you can't have a conversation. 

Friendly place, in the heart of the Mission and the perfect spot to come when the line for Techo de Lolinda is wrapped around the corner.
author: Steph D.

description:
Really swank bar in the mission. Great location right on mission. The inside is well decorated and the drinks were delicious and not too overpriced. They take cards here just an FYI.

The bartender was super friendly and it was empty (but I was also there on a sunday night the weekend after halloween) so I am sure that had something to do with it. They have a GREAT happy hour menu on a day to day basis (wing wednesdays)!

Highly recommend.
author: Bori B.

description:
Originally I did not want to try the Jelly Donut and Fried Chicken Sandwich. However my friend convinced me to just give it a try. When my meal came out the chicken looked and tasted amazing. The chicken wasn't dry and had a good amount of flavor to it. The plate was drenched in syrup and the donut had a jam spread with five pieces of fried chicken on top. The combination was delicious. I usually find these types of meals very rich and overpowering but this one was just right. The saltiness of the chicken complimented the sweetness of the donut and jam. 

My friend ordered the crab cakes Benedict which was very well made. Their pouched egg it perfect and oozed onto the crab cakes. They also added Holliday sauce on top and spinach at the bottom along with tater tots and some ranch. When I tried a bite of the meal the crab cakes were delicious but had a pretty salty seafood taste to it. Don't get me wrong I loved that kind of seafood flavor but I just found it a bit too salty for my liking. I think by eating the spinach along with it neutralizes the saltiness as well as a bite of a tater tot (I don't know why).  

Overall the meal was delicious and I would definitely love to come back! I just heard about their 25 cent chicken wings on Wednesday and by just eating their jelly donut and fried chicken sandwich I know that their wings will be just as good!
author: Kaitlyn K.

description: Awesome for brunch!  Best place in the city for bottomless mimosas and killer service from Courtney!
author: Steven S.

description:
I love love love the atmosphere of this place.

Came with the boyfriend for their .25 wings Wednesday deal. Place opens at 4 and already had all their table seats filled--we ended up sitting at a bar table. The server was attentive--didn't catch her name but she had lavender hair. Drinks were suuuuper strong. I'm a bit of a lightweight but usually I can handle two no problem, but haha...in any case, the drinks were also super yummy. Wings were a little too saucy for both our tastes, but for that price you can't complain. Also drunkenly ordered fries--they were so tasty. 

Definitely coming back when I get the chance and am in town again!
author: Beatrice F.

description: This place is in need of health care inspection and a staff with a higher value of cleanliness. Unfortunate, really, but fixable.
author: Claire S.

description:
I didn't dig this bar on the inside, but the outdoor patio space is really nice. Divey inside and lovely outside. The bar is so small, and it's really hard to get the bar tenders' attention. They won't even try to notice you if you don't make the attempt to catch their attention first. 

Interesting name. Nothing spectacular about this place. I'm giving it a 3 because of the patio. I stuck with vodka clubs the whole night, and they were so weak that even after three I didn't feel anything. At less than 110lbs and a renowned lightweight. You be the judge.

Wak.
author: Priti K.

description:
I checked this place out last night with a friend and I loved the vibes here. The outside patio was my favorite feature-- there's plenty of seating with nice string lights for a relaxed ambience. 

The crowd is a good mix of folks and the music is great as well. I would definitely bring a couple of my friends here to catch up with some beers
author: Ren S.

description:
What is there not to love about this place? (except maybe the fact that the bean bags for the cornhole on the back patio always seem to "disappear").

25-cent (actually good) Wing Wednesdays?

almost across the board $4 beers at all times (not just HHR)?

Awesome people who actually REMEMBER you? (thank you door guy and Amelia)

Or bartenders who give you INVALUABLE advice like "before trying to eat a 'death' wing, use the bathroom, and remember not to touch ANYTHING near your eyes.... or anything else for that matter"?

Or that they always have great college games, Warriors, Giants, Niners set ups and a shocking good flow around the bar?

Yeah, this is sort of a standard start, stop or end-of-night crash every time we head to the mission for good reason.
author: Mike V.

description:
I was very disappointed with the service I received. I wanted food and drinks. The waitress forgot to take my order and only served my friend instead. My friend grabbed her attention a few minutes later and I was able to order a Star Burger and drink combo of PBR and Jameson. The waitress took the order and had to come back a few minutes later for how the burger should be cooked. I was never asked what side I wanted with the burger. 

A few minutes later, another server came around and gave me ketchup, a napkin, and silverware. He plopped down the ketchup and it sprayed all over my shirt and pants. The server gave me a fist bump about the issue and didn't apologize for the mishap. 

I tipped out of pity, but the two servers were absolute garbage and a waste of time.
author: Trevor N.

description:
I had been wanting to go to this place because I had heard positive things about Wednesday's and their wings. I went on a Thursday and didn't get wings, so no comment on the wings. This Thursday was when the Warriors were playing a big game against OKC. During the playoffs last season Teeth SF had been a 'Playoff viewing' spot so I figured they would have volume on for one of the biggest games of the season. I was wrong. They wouldn't play the sound because they "don't normally do that". How does a bar in the City, with the best team in the NBA, playing a huge game, NOT PLAY THE SOUND!!?? Instead they played terrible music and served watered down Guinness Stouts. I was very upset and will probably never go back for that reason. Take some customer feedback and play the sound when the game is extremely relevant to your crowd. 

The tater tots were the only positive thing about this experience.
author: Luis L.

description:
I always enjoy going to Doctor Teeth's whether it's during Happy Hour, a Saturday night, or for their weekly specials...This place just does it for me!

Monday's are 2 for 1 Margarita Specials. I love to drink and mingle. And the best part, Wednesdays are .25cent wings, which is really a good deal. You can get like 12 for the price of 25 cents. You can't beat that. I've taken my mom, sister, and cousin here and they all love it!!

The ambiance is chattery, very hipster and packed, so make sure you get there at a decent time or else you'll be standing up- not so bad by the way. There is also a patio outdoors, which can be enjoyed until 10pm. Just come as you are and enjoy the fun!
author: Tammia H.

description:
The two times I've been here now have both been on game day Sundays, but for some reason it doesn't get close to packed here at all as other bars/gastropubs would in the city while the 49ers play. I'm convinced now after scoping the crowd both times that it's because most of the people here are SF implants which is more frequent in the Mission nowadays...or just aren't die hard 9er fans, which are both fine. But for those looking for that type of environment with people decked out in Niners gear, high fiving each other after each play, this is not where it's at.

Anyway, it's nice for a change up to still be able to grab a table in the middle of the game and get to the bar with no hassle. I've always sat in the outside back patio area where it's also dog friendly, the only downside is that the TV back there is a little small.

Both visits here were mainly to grab drinks after coming from eating somewhere else, so I've only had room to try the wings. I always get the sweet chili while my bf likes the buffalo wings, so we get the 12 pieces for $11. The weird thing about the service is that the waiters that serve the outdoor area in the back don't have access to adding items if you have a tab open in the bar. So I still had to get up and put my order in the bar and take a number with me, no biggie but I also don't see why the server can't add it into the already existing tab?

I'd love to come back for the 25 cent wing Wednesdays and actually come hungry enough to try other items on the menu. If not, this is still a chill bar to hang out at especially if you want to watch the game somewhere without the crowd.
author: Georgina G.

description:
I REALLY liked their food, but I can't understand why they don't get more wait staff on the weekends. The time you have to wait to only get water and a menu is ridiculous (easily 30 minutes). 

We came with a bunch of friends and sat outside on their back patio. Beautiful Sunday, lotsa hipsters around us, lots of weed being smoked, we had a blast. They have bottomless mimosas, that might have played into the blast part :-)
And really, the mimosa glasses were promptly refilled, but the rest of the service was more than lackluster. Like I said... took forever to even get the menus (which were dirty and sticky with maple syrup and god-knows-what), when the food finally arrived, the waitress didn't bring any silverware, so we sat in front of our plates of yummy food and couldn't eat it for at least five minutes. 

But speaking of the food: I was a happy camper, as soon as I was able to eat. I got the savory pancake with truffle tater tots, the mister got the roasted beet salad with walnuts, goat cheese and chicken. YUMMY! I could eat that pancake every day. 

Actually 3.5 stars. I know I can be a bit grumpy when I am hungry... I was really hungry (and had started on a couple of zips of mimosa) and sitting in front of my food without fork and knife...
author: Alexa W.

description: Very chill Mission bar with a nice selection of cocktails and eats.  The bartender with the ice blue eyes was hot and entertaining, the Blackberry Fix was the bomb, and the tater tots were divine.
author: shojua p.

description: Dr Teeth is a unique SF gem.  Can't leave without spending too much!  Great patio and love the tater tots!
author: Ray A.

description:
Dr. Teeth has one of the best happy hours in the entire Bay. In case you haven't been, here's the schedule:

Mon-Fri Happy Hour 4-7pm: $3 Bottled Beer, $4 Well Drinks
Monday: Burger & Beer Special $10 / Fernet Shots $5
Tuesday: $1 Tacos & 2-for-1 Margaritas
Wednesday: 25 cent Wings with purchase of two beverages
Thursday: Fundraiser Night!
Saturday & Sunday: Bottomless Brunch 10am-3pm
Sunday: Buy a Shot, Get a Pony

I'm usually here for taco night or wing night, and they're both good. You certainly what you pay for. I'd also recommend the tots, which are great when they're hot. Come early, or else you'll be stuck wedged in a corner surrounded by drunk strangers.
author: Christina S.

description: It was a now seasonably 85 degree fall day in the Bay Area and we couldn't  wait to sink our dr teeth into a spicy Wednesday night special. Upon entry, the crowd was going wild, but it was unclear if it was for game 2 of the World Series, or for the $0.25 wings. I would soon find out, it was the wings. Our bubbly pink haired server Ana explained in detail the plethora of wing options available to us with precision and expertise, and, despite her being a vegetarian, directed us in the direction of some delectable sweet chile habanero wings. Knowing our appetite wouldn't stop at wings, we also opted for the garlic crab totchos (yes, that is tater tot nachos for the nonbelievers) which were a fantastic choice. Drinks were unique and full of flavor as well, including a few of Ana's suggestions including the spicy cucumber margarita and something incredible with blueberries! We left with bellies full of at least 6 chickens (4 wings/chicken), faces smiling with teeth in need of a solid flossing-- but they way I see it, way to save more of the wonderous wing wonder for later!
author: Alisa W.

description:
While Wing Wednesdays remain the main draw to come here, we had a terrible experience last week trying to get served. Armed with the knowledge that we'd be vying with the other patrons intent on the possibility of the golden '73' materializing for the Warriors, we were still able to snag a table fairly early in the night. 

Our waitress pointedly ignored our attempts to get her attention, and when she finally deigned to grace us with her august presence, curtly announced - before spinning away -  "I have, like, no time for you guys. You would be better off ordering at the bar." 

Taken aback, we sent a representative to wait in line which was by that time filling up with the hungry after-work crowd, where it took another thirty minutes to actually put in an order. Ignored the rest of the night, it felt more than fair to give myself time to cool off before writing this update. Aaaaand.. nope - still unhappy about the experience.

25 cent wings is definitely the draw of Teeth, but be advised that you may have to deal with more than just the crowds.
author: James K.

description:
Okay let me preface this by saying i come here both for brunch and for a night out and it's awesome for both, but by far the best part about this place is the bottomless mimosas. 

If you go right at 10am, you skip the lines and the rush and can get a nice table up on the back patio outside. If it's nice out, I honestly can think of few better ways to spend a 5-hour period in the mission on a Saturday morning (just kidding but not really. My friends and I may or may not have opened and closed the bottomless mimosa portion of the day in the past...) and the service is pretty good too!

One word of warning: if you're here and doing the bottomless mimosas, you're not here to eat healthy. The donut sandwich is delicious, the scrambles are all really good, and the truffle tots are a must-do. I unfortunately made the mistake one time of ordering the yogurt and granola "platter" - just don't even pretend to be healthy when you're here. It was literally one centimeter of (let's be honest) Dannons vanilla yogurt with 6 slices of the same strawberry on top. SUPER not worth it, especially when the portion sizes for the slightly less healthy dishes are massive. (See photo for comparison)

Tl;dr: come here for mimosas and clogged arteries and a generally great time
author: Amanda L.

description: Nice bar, decent pricing, wings are good. It's gets really packed during game nights.
author: Nessy D.

description: Cool spot to chill after work.  Wing Weds was great.  I loved the buffalo.  They were delicious and cooked properly.  Sweet chile wings were too sweet for my taste but were good.  They also make a descent martini.  I will definitely go back soon.  It gets crowded but it was not crazy.  Servers seem to have a system.  Wings come out fast!
author: Pam P.

description:
Once you visit Wing Wednesdays for the first time here, your idea of the perfect Wednesday night will be changed... forever. It gets super packed once the $0.25 wings deal starts, so get here ASAP, or even chill here a little before to snag a table. The patio area in the back is nice and spacious... took me awhile to discover that it even existed. Otherwise, time to be a table vulture.

There are four types of wing flavors: Buffalo, BBQ, Habenero, and DEATH. My friend wanted to get six death wings but the waitresses warned him against it... good thing. Buffalo is my favorite, but my friend who likes BBQ wings says those are good too. The only thing is that all the flavors get thrown onto one platter, and I don't like my Buffalo wings touching the BBQ ones. Especially when we're sitting outside with minimal lighting, it's hard to tell which is which. 

To get the $0.25 wings deal, you have to purchase two drinks, which you were going to have anyways, right? In terms of drinks specials, Happy Hour is from 4pm to 7pm with $3 Bottled Beers and $4 Well Drinks. And now you know the optimal time to eat here. 

Towards the end of our night, we ordered the Totchos ($7) which were surprisingly good. As the name implies, they are nachos with cheese, jalapenos, salsa, pico de gallo, guacamole, and sour cream... but with tater tots instead of tortilla chips. What a great way to end a night of bonding with friends.
author: Stefanie C.

description: Came here for brunch Sunday and absolutely LOVED the food, the atmosphere and their delightfully strong Moscow Mules (which were so good that I'm totally willing to overlook the lack of copper mugs for them). Will happily be back for drinks and/or food again.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Uh... I'll probably come back and update this review sometime in the future, because by the time we showed up here, we were four cocktails and two or three shots in, so everything I say henceforth should be taken with a grain of salt.

But we ordered a pitcher of their yellow sangria (because we SO needed more alcohol), their wings, and their tots. Drunk me remembers their sangria being pretty tasty, the tots being delicious, and the wings being enjoyable, albeit a little on the too sweet side.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - I didn't venture into the main part of the bar, and I definitely wasn't paying much attention, so I can only comment on the front where we sat, which consisted of high bar seating near the window.

Bathroom - Didn't check them out.
author: Johnny W.

description: Came the other day for happy hour. Kim was our bartender. Very sweet girl, very attentive and professional. I came for the .25c wings on Wednesday of course. And loved it! Didn't care for the barbecue sauce, liked the sweet chili, but of course buffalo is my favorite I had a dozen!! Also had crab fries which I super enjoyed. Didn't care for the raspberry cocktail was too sour. I'll stick with beer and wings thank you! Lol right on Dr. Teeth's I'll be seeing you soon to go take advantage of the outdoor festivities in the back yard next time..
author: Cara D.

description:
Via Facebook, I made a comment about wanting to get Sunday Brunch. Amongst my friends, John Z. was the only one that seemed interested. Originally, we were going to go to District, but John's friend wanted to have brunch in the city at Local: Mission Eatery. I was all for it.

When we got near Local: Mission Eatery, we didn't realize that it was Sunday Streets so we decided on a different location. Dr. Teeth & The Electric Mayhem quickly popped into my mind because I had been wanting to try it out for quite some time. We get there and it's not super busy so we were able to sit down quickly. 

We ended up sitting on the patio. It did take awhile for the waitress to come back there, but she quickly took care of us when she did. There were a lot of options on the menu so it was very hard to narrow it down to one thing. I figured we had to start off with the Totchos (tater tots a la nachos) and I got myself the Jelly Donut Fried Chicken Sandwich. I couldn't pass something like that up. I don't remember what the name of the drink I ordered was called, but it was Bud Light and fresh grapefruit. Something I will be making at home. But for the record, not with Bud Light.

We got our food and dug right in. The sandwich was really good. It's definitely not something I would eat all the time, but the chicken was crisp and juicy. I do think the donut could've used a little more jelly, but that's just me. I had also ordered the home fries, which were really good and had a great abundance of garlic. 

As good as the home fries were and as full I was starting to get, I could not stop eating the Totchos. They were so addictive and so good, that I ended up abandoning the rest of my home fries. Must have more!

But overall, I really enjoyed it here and luckily they aren't too far from Bart. I will be back.
author: Vanessa S.

description: Our 2nd stop on your eat-a-thon, we definitely liked the ambience, food and drinks we ordered. They had our favorite Laphroaig as well as good cocktails, along with fried pickles, onion rings and tater tots. Services was very good, and so was the crowd.
author: Sid W.

description:
.25 wings!!

Awesome crab tater tots and flavorful wings. Attempted to try "death" but that was hot!! I moved my wing with my fork and I licked a bit and boy it was hot!!!

I enjoyed my company and the people around me..


 Get here early as the seats are limited.

Service is AWESOME!! I only saw one waitress working and she was on it!!
author: Jay B.

description: Awesome spot for PLUMP azz wings!! Good drinks, cool vibe & a nice patio out back.  Bar had a nice selection of tequila, and if u r into TOTS their's are perfect.  A great place for brunch and day drinking. Surprisingly affordable priced too.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
Happy Hour on Wednesday-.$25 cent wings as long as you get two drinks and no take out. 

Seriously one of the best food deals I have found for happy hour in SF. You get 5 sauce options (Sweet Chili Habanero, BBQ, Buffalo, Au Natural and Death Sauce). The wings were cooked fine, adequate seasoning but not going to rock your world. 

I will just say that the Death Sauce was the dumbest thing I have ever tried. After two bites, I could barely stomach the taste but that was just the beginning of my whirl wind of pain to come.
