I was a hot mess and wish I had never attempted such a stupid feat. I have a much greater respect for Adam Ritchman from Man Vs Food. 

All things consider the crowd was lively; seating can be tough so get there early or wait it out like we had to. 

Overall Thoughts

Can't really be too hard on .25 cent wings now can I?
author: Eddie W.

description:
Drinks were tasteful ! I had ordered the..... Blackberry something cocktail.. One of their specials from the menu. I can't recall the name cause I asked the bar tender for a recommendation and I heard part of what it was cause it was SUPERRRRR loud in there and it was super dark too ! Bar tender was nice :) 

THE TRUFFLE TATER TOTS ! Mmmmmmm !! I love tater tots !! Haha ! This place caught my attention JUST for that ;D 

If you don't mind SCREAMING while talking to ur friends or random strangers around you, then this place would be cool. They got a good amount of tables too. 

The guy that checks ID in front should really wear like some sort of security jacket or something. Or a name tag with the bars name or SOMETHING! 
When I walked up to the door, he was hanging out with a crowd outside . as I approached to the door, he stepped aside and asked for my ID. I was hesitant at first cause it was weird.. He looked like a regular guy hanging out with his crew or something.. 
So I asked questionable, "uhhhh... Do you work here ??" And he said yes.. So I Handed him my ID with a odd look..... ( this is my look: zero .. Underscore 3 times.. Lower case "o" . Freaking yelp won't let me use underscore! Lol )
author: Jenny N.

description: Went here for Sunday brunch. The nice part was that there was no wait, and the service was really fast. We ordered the breakfast totchos, which were pretty good, but they get soggy quickly.
author: Roya S.

description:
Vibe is fine. Cool casual joint with lots of food options and awesome art throughout the place.

Patio seating is only open until 10pm which is lame during warm summer nights.. Extend your hours! 

One other suggestion I have for this spot is louder music! Voices are louder than the music and not everyone wants to hear other people's convos.

Anyways I will be back! Good music too.
author: Colleen K.

description:
From my experience with Dr Teeth & the Electric Mayhem, it hovers somewhere between a 2 and a 3. My group and I were looking for somewhere to grab a bite to eat, found this place through Yelp and it looked amazing so we decided to give it a try. 

When we arrived the place was PACKED with highly intoxicated St. Patty's Day parade participants. The first thing I saw when I entered the restaurant was a man's bare ass as he was bent over butt-naked while his friends tried to hit his butt with a shuttlecock. Now, I understand it was St. Patty's Day and yes it's a day for all out debauchery for some but this towed the line between drunk idiots and wtf why is this happening. 

It didn't get much better from there, we were told it is self seating so we grabbed a table and waited...and waited...and waited. Finally, my boyfriend actively got up to seek out a waitress who said they were switching between brunch service and dinner service so it would be a few more minutes. Fine, understandable.

We finally got menus and placed our orders for the famous tachos and a few other appetizer dishes. 45 minutes went by and we could see the tables that had filled in after us were all getting their food before us. Our waitress finally came over with a blasé attitude to say our food would be out shortly. Finally the food arrived and wouldn't you know it, she forgot to put in the tachos. She asked if we still wanted them and we said yes so we ate our other appetizers while we waited for the tachos which came 15 minutes later. An entire hour spent waiting for the main item we wanted to try. 

I do have to say the food was pretty great, the menu made up of something out of a glutinous dream, it had every guilty pleasure you could ever want. The tachos ended up being out of this world amazing. The mac and cheese was also delicious, so creamy it should be illegal. The fried pickles were good but strange, they were sweet pickles which was not what I was expecting, but the chipotle aioli they were served with was quite tasty. Buffalo chicken wings were also good, classic but with an added kick.  

Drinks were also pretty great, I had a Mexicano Mule which is a Moscow Mule with agave and serrano peppers, evocative of a jalapeno margarita but even better. 

A really unique atmosphere and decent food & drinks, I just wish the service was up to par.
author: Caroline G.

description:
Went here to check out their .25cent wings on Wednesday. Came in, had a good crowd going and it was pretty easy to order. We ordered the totchos and each had 12 wings each and ordered one pint of beer each (which per their criteria it's a minimum of two drinks per order or so they say). Food was pretty good and the beer itself. 

Now to the annoying party, as I asked for the check from the waiter, she says that it's a minimum of TWO drinks per PERSON. I looked over the flyer that was in the stand (the flyer is double sided). On one side it says "two drink minimum per order" and on the other side it says " two drink minimum per person". I tell her that it says its per order and she argued back saying it's per person. I pointed out what was stated on the flyer and she said "IT'S FINE BUT NEXT TIME IT'S TWO DRINKS PER PERSON". At this point I'm thinking this establishment needs to get with it and stick with one story. If you're going to have a certain criteria it should be across the board that way people are not misled to false advertisement. Not only that, it's a liability issue if you get my drift. The manager(s) should look into that and fix it. Other than that, it's a cool spot. I'd probably swing by if in the area but I wouldn't go out of my way just to come all the way out there. Maybe the second time around my experience would be a bit more pleasant and I'll have a change of heart.
author: Angeline S.

description:
Now this was one place I was looking forward to checking out! Heard a lot of good things about this bar, from its delish Tat-chos to the great drinks!

Now I made the mistake of eating (I normally eat before I drink) before I made it Dr Teeth & The Electric Mayhem, just had drinks on my mind and thought oh better grab something to eat, so I full by the time I got there and I didn't get to try the famous Tot-Chos.

We got there about 15 mins to 5 on a Friday night, and we waited outside for the place to open, lets just say this is in a colorful neighborhood with interesting people around. But it still didn't stop me from wanting to check them out!

Doors opened and I got a good look around, this place looks like a lot of fun, bright fun colors, we were there for about an hour and that place filled up pretty fast.

I ordered 2 drinks, a blackberry fizz, it had fresh blackberry's & lemon muddled together, then vodka & st germain elderflowerliqueur and something else added, don't remember, but do remember how fresh it tasted, also got an Azul something or other, it had fresh blueberries & lemon muddled together, lots of tequila and other stuff mixed together. Omg that too was fresh and delish! Wish I had more time to try out some other drinks!   

Our bartender was Mac and he was the man, he handled everyone's drink orders in fast timely matter and made all the drinks with care.  Oh and found out they have Jameson on tap! This was a fun place, glad to have checked it out, next time in town, Ill have to stop by.  Just warning ya though, if you go looking for the muppets, you won't find them here.
author: Monica O.

description:
Props to whoever puked in the sink and urinal....and horrible drinks. Chicks are hot though.


Also, why the hell are there so many tall dudes here?
author: Jake A.

description: Came here the other night to watch the warriors game. Foods a little over priced but had great service from our waiter Tracy. He recommended ordering our drinks by the pitcher which ended up saving us a couple bucks and let us finish watching the game on the patio when he was clearing the other tables. We'll definitely be back for another game.
author: Aïdan S.

description:
Dr Teeth and the Electric Mayhem to the rescue!

Not only do they have amazing sausage corn dogs, Jameson on tap, and sweet and savory food concoctions...but their daily specials rock too!  

Took advantage of their $10 burger/beer combo on Mondays.  Had their peanut butter and jelly bacon burger with truffle fries.  The patty was a bit dry, but the overall taste of the burger was pretty darn good.  The grape jelly did it for me, and I didn't even bother with the lettuce and tomato.

Also took part in their 25 cent wing night on Wednesdays.  At that price, the buffalo wings tasted better than at most wing joints.  We also indulged on two humongous orders of their Truffled Parmesan tater tots.  Their sweet potato tots were also a force to be reckoned with. 

Among their tater selections, I'd have to say Tot-chos were my favorite...due to the massive messy pile of nacho toppings.  A true meal in itself.  And when it comes to their Slider menu, the Reuben sliders were money!  

Looking forward to their weekend brunch that includes their show dogs pancake wrapped maple sausage on a stick.  Also, the Jelly Donut and Fried Chicken Sandwich is now only offered on their new brunch menu.  

Honorable mentions go to the Mayhem cocktail, old school music selection, and their games out back. 

Best to come early.
author: Bobby L.

description:
This place is a great spot to come for a quick but and beverage after work. All of the tots are quite tasty! And the sliders are great. 
Sadly they changed their veggie burger patties. The old style was my favorite, I believe it was made from beets. I would come here at least once a week because it was so good, but now since they changed the patty to a black bean I come just once a month. Bring the old veggie burgers back please!
author: Mon B.

description: Good wings, good drinks, just no space to sit down.  So get here early and not during peak hours if you want to sit. But definitely jumping with people and conversation. But you can't beat 0.25 cents wings!
author: Alice T.

description:
My time here wasn't exactly the clearest since I was celebrating my belated birthday but I had a great time. We showed up with a drink into our night, so we decided to get one quick drink before our dinner reservations. We sat at the bar and our bartender Caitlin knew just what we wanted: "A Slap in the Face".

Before you call the police and report this place, one of their drink specials consists of a shot of tequila and a Modelo for $11. After one or two you won't even be able to feel a slap in the face. I tried to get one from Caitlin, but employees are not actually able to hit customers.

We downed our drinks, headed out to dinner at Foreign Cinema. We were still a little thirsty so we trekked a few blocks through the rain to see Caitlin and get another slap in the face. I couldn't feel my teeth, which is probably the true meaning behind the name of the bar.
author: David C.

description:
Sinful sweet&salty brunch food paired with drinks and good company. I highly recommend turning off your health conscience before dining here.

Our group of 6 started with Sunday brunch that blossomed into afternoon shenanigans. At 10:30 AM, it was fairly busy inside and out, so we were lucky to grab a table in the outside patio area. The patio has an upper level that, at the time, was occupied by a crazy fun birthday celebration full of bear costumes and alcohol.

Of course, our own table had its fair share of alcohol with BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS at $15 per person. The servers are incredibly prompt with mimosa refills, which created a state of gradual, enjoyable drunkenness...for my friends :)

When choosing my dish, the TOT-CHOS, tater tot nachos, were recommended, and I too pass on the recommendation. At $7.95, the combination of crispy tater tots, melted cheese (but not the tasty nasty cheese-from-a-can/jar), guacamole, sour cream, pico de gallo, black olives, and a generous portion of jalapeños (http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/vu9lAE9YVeLHpSpgD8Ncrg/l.jpg). As always, more guacamole and salsa would have been nice, but the jalapeños were a much appreciated kick to the dish. And if you ever need to choose between tater tots and fries, always go with the tater tots. Trust me.

Our awesome waitress gave great brunch-exclusive recommendations: the jelly donut & fried chicken sandwich and the showdogs, aka pancake-wrapped maple sausages on a stick. The JELLY DONUT & FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH is served with homefries or tater tots for $8.95 (http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/dJrUicJXlv5NCNCqznOeTg/l.jpg), and the name belies the contents: a jelly donut cut in half, invaded by a deep-fried chicken cutlet and a slice of Swiss cheese. I don't know if the donut is homemade, the chicken cutlet isn't anything special, but the combination of the sweet glaze and thick raspberry jelly with the salty crunch of the chicken patty is euphoric. Sweet&salty4lyf.

The sweet&salty theme continued with the SHOWDOGS, 4 pancake-wrapped maple sausages on sticks (http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/AeWp3mdM73z4kw8Fx7HVGA/l.jpg). I forget the price, but I'm going to take a stab at $7.95. In essence, they're a much yummier version of corn dogs. Loved the maple sausages, and the maple syrup dipping sauce perfectly complemented the crispy pancake batter. However, I'd def recommend the JD&FC sandwich first.

Bacon is an extra $3. Oh, and any side of tater tots come with a yummy, slightly watery ranch dipping sauce. A basket of original TATER TOTS (http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/lwx5Xkc8PGHgxfIXRld-Mw/l.jpg) will run you $5.95. Seriously, those tater tots are bombdotcom.

The inside dining area has a bar, pool table, and TVs all around. They have Jameson on tap (my friend said other locations have different whiskeys on tap), as well as Fernet, a SF staple (http://www.foodrepublic.com/2011/06/01/fernet-branca-real-san-francisco-treat). Random note: given the hustle and bustle of this place, there is always a line for the women's restroom (only one stall). Amusingly, there are also audacious ladies who not only use the men's room but also get angry at men who try to use the men's restroom. This place is fun no matter what you're doing.

BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS (and prompt refills) for $15. Fernet and Jameson on tap. $0.25 Wednesday wings. Must try TOT-CHOS for $7.95 and JELLY DONUT & FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH for $8.95, if only once in your life. And, as with any place in the Mission, come prepared for a wild good time :)
author: Adele F.

description:
(Sing to the tune of All About That Bass) I'm all about them wings, 'bout them wings, 25 cents each! 

Came here 3x so far--twice on 25-cent Wing Wednesdays and once on a Tuesday night. 

Wednesday nights do get very crowded as most people come in large groups and with hungry bellies. If you get here around 6-7pm with a group of people, be prepared to (1) Stand and wait for table, (2) Have part of your group sitting down and the other part standing until the party next to you is finished! Sounds bad...but when you're with friends and exchanging laughs, time definitely flies by! 

We usually get about 120-300 wings for our party, depending on how many of us there are. They have a few flavor options. I recommend the Spicy Chili or Mango Habanero! Yuuuuums. 

CAUTION: Dr. Teeth has their own "Death Sauce" made with Ghost Peppers (Scoville of a million!!!! Regular Tabasco sauce is around a Scoville of 4,000). Be VERY VERY careful with this if you do want to try it. Don't be ambitious and make your friends and yourself dump your wings in the Death Sauce....Yes, I was being ambitious and/or stupid (whichever one you want to call it, haha)...DON'T BE A HERO! Anyways, this was the first time I ever cried eating food before because it was so spicy. I was crying almost as hard as I do when I watch a really sad Korean Drama. T___T Oh, super spicy but still so delicious :)

They have a good amount of beers on tap and draft, wines, and speciality cocktails. For cocktails, I've tried their Fresh Strawberry Pisco Punch and Greyhound (w/ Fresh Squeezed Grapefruit). Both really tasty! The bartenders are also pretty flexible with the amount of alcohol they pour into the drinks--if you want more or less alcohol, they're really accommodating for you.
author: Rachel C.

description:
Great place for groups. I liked the they're patio area. 

I came on a Friday night. My friends and I had to wait for a long time to order drinks at the bar. I think I ordered the wrong drink. I got the tequila smash and it was tasteless to me. My friend got the beer-rita and that was terrible. My other friend enjoyed their drink with elderberry something. 

Ordered crab tater tots. I really liked the tots and sauce on it. You should pass on the fried chicken sandwich. I didn't like it.
author: Ange G.

description:
Can't beat the atmosphere here on a wing Wednesday when there's a game on. Fun place to be, the vibes always good. Oh and the totchoes...are amazing.

Everyone from the owner, to the bouncer,  to the bartenders are really really cool.
author: Katie B.

description:
I was unpleasantly surprised by this place. I mean, the pictures looked incredible, so my hopes were pretty high, but then were instantly let down. Everything on the menu is overpriced, but hey, it's San Francisco, what do you expect? So I proceeded to order a beer and a totchos (tater tot nachos). After 12 minutes the beer finally arrived in a jar that was probably half a pint (booooo). When the totchos finally arrived, I felt robbed. There was no cheese, the condiments tasted like they were from a frozen lunchables, and worst of all... soggy tater tots. Maybe they're other menu items are good, but I was unsatisfied. 

I will say however, the server was very attentive, especially for a pub. That was nice. 

Solid 2-Star
author: Jeff S.

description:
Just found my new Wednesday night spot. 25 cent wings all night and my bottled beer was less than $3. Whatttt? I am still shocked about the prices. The wings are big too. Not the wimpy ones you usually get at some other places... I got 12 and was absolutely stuffed. Loved the habanero sauce. Friend got a couple of ghost pepper ones and was dying. They're called Death and the bartender actually told him he shouldn't order 6 like he originally wanted. Solid advice. 

My friends and I also ordered a totchos (tator tot nachos) to share. That was okay, but perfect beer food for sure. 

They push out their wings fast too, which was great because I was starving. Lighting outside could be better. I could barely see anything once the sun went down. Another bummer is that they pile all the wings on one plate so all the flavors were mixed up. Cringe worthy when your mouth is ready for a bbq and you get a buffalo. 

Get here early or be prepared to stalk people for their tables.
author: Winnie T.

description:
Wasted Wednesdays have taken a whole new meaning. 

Between the drafts on tap (Guiness, Fernet and ... even Jameson!), 25 cent buffalo wings, Reuben sliders and truffled parmesan tater tots, why wouldn't you come to the Mission on Wednesdays?!?

I'm happy to find a good cocktail list at a hipster bar! The Mayhem cocktail is delish: bulleit rye, calvados and Fernet. It's a bargain at $10 especially with the generous serving. 

Yet another reason for you to come, the $7 dickle and a pickle. It's a shot of dickle whiskey and pickle juice, otherwise known to east coasters as a pickle back. Sounds nasty, but it goes down smooth! And you can have so much fun ordering it: 

Me: "excuse me Mr. Bartender, I want a dick-(ahem)-le and a pickle please!" 

* Wait, who's pickle do you want to tickle?!  *

Don't let the guy with bad B.O. turn you off, there's plenty of space in their outdoor patio!

Cheers to Wasted Wednesdays!
author: Janice C.

description:
Love this spot for brunch.  I'm a big fan of the bottomless mimosas and tater tots.

I had the pleasure of getting absolutely obliterated one Saturday morning drinking mimosas, and also proceeded to order the death wings.  My buddies said they would purchase me an XBox One if I managed to eat the plate of wings.  I did it!  But oh the cost.  These wings were literally the hottest things I've ever eaten.  My sanity, my taste buds, my bowels, my weekend.  All ruined!  But now I have an XBox One!  Hooray!

The Wing Day is supposed to be solid as well, though crowded.  Trivia is fun as well.
author: Chris S.

description: Most of my Bay Area life is in the East Bay and I don't often make it over the Bridge just for a meal. The other day, friends and I had a goodbye brunch at Teeth and it was on point. The beef Bloody Mary may sound weird, but it's delicious. The breakfast totchos are unlike any brunch dish I have had. Imagine a breakfast sando + nachos + tater tots. Very tasty!
author: Lawren B.

description:
Went last night with a group of friends on the day before the Groupon expires, which also happened to be trivia night.  30 sliders, 3 baskets of tots, 6 beers, and 1 pitcher of margaritas later (Total Bill if we didn't have Groupon:  $115ish not including tips.), we left happy campers, even though we weren't one of the winning trivia teams.  (BTW I blame the non-win on the fact that more than 1/2 the restaurant was there to redeem their groupons and not to play trivia, so it was a challenge hearing the questions and music.)  

We tried these sliders:  Classic Sliders, Reuben (corned beef and sauerkraut), Meatball Parmesan, and French Dip.  The Reubens were tasty, and the only one worth eating again for me personally.  The other sliders were simply dry and overcooked.

With the Groupon, we were only allowed to order the plain tots:  Original, Sweet Potato, and Truffle.  TRUFFLE TOTS!!!  I'd come back just to eat basket after basket of these incredibly delicious bite-sized, deep-friend crunchy bites of happiness.  I can't wait to come back to eat some of the specialty tots like Tot-chos and Buffalo Blue Tots!

As for service, our waitress and bus boy were very attentive given the huge crowds, but I think that's just bad planning for them to only schedule the 2 of them and a bartender for the night before a Groupon expires.

In sum, the sliders were really disappointing, but the truffle tots were amazing, and I'd be willing to come back and try Trivia when the people there actually want to play . . . so just 3 stars for now . . . maybe 4 stars if I fall in love with the specialty tots.
author: Christina L.

description: It's been a while since I've yelped, but after my recent visit to Teeth for brunch I couldn't resist. Pro-tip: avoid the $11 "totchos"--public school quality tots, watery fake cheese, mealy pico de gallo, and brown guacamole. Attaching a picture to this review so you can relate to our feeling of shock and disgust when our server dropped this off at our table. The place is super poorly lit, which apparently allows them to pass off this junk as edible...
author: Nicole L.

description:
Did I hear buffalo wings & tater tot nachos were the bomb here? and on Wednesday nights its 25 cents wings? Sounding unbelievable I had to pay a visit. When I first heard of Dr Teeth & the Electric Mayhem, my initial thoughts were the Muppet's?? LOL Ummmm that's really the name of the band that the Muppet's had during my childhood years. Moving forward, this hipster bar is located right next door to Cha Cha Cha's in the Mission. What does this shindig have to offer? A variety of snacks and nibblers but I only came here for drinks, buffalo wings and tater tot nachos!! 

Drinks: someone had a heavy hand, because my grey hound was strong!!
Buffalo wings-Spicy and delicious-yes I had to dip it with Ranch to cool off my tongue.
Tater Tots-Ding ding, loved the concepts and grubbed on it!!
Scene-Hipsters, and good looking folks also crowded!!!
Service-Friendly
author: Kathy V.

description:
It was SO packed when we went for Sunday brunch. Fun but crowded atmosphere. Went for a LivingSocial deal that included bottomless mimosas and brunch entrees. 

Jelly donut fried chicken sandwich: yummy but a little intense. The jelly donut is so sweet that it takes away from the fried chicken.

Yummy sweet potato tots!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Wing Wednesdays, oh how good you are to me.
Although I hate how crowded it can get, I always appreciated 25 cent wings in their Sweet Chili Habanero sauce. YUM.

On another occasion, I was able to try their crab tater tots (so worth it). Although their crab to tots ratio wasn't proportional. Too much tots. Their Reuben egg rolls are to DIE for. Wasn't a big fan of the onion rings (too big and too much batter). I still give this place 5 stars because the waitresses are super accommodating and its hard to find a bar with some darn good food.
author: Cathy N.

description:
Don't go here for brunch. I have never had a worse brunch experience... the waitresses were busy which is understandable on a Saturday morning, but incompetent and rude should never be a part of it. 
We had bottomless mimosas, mMmMmm yum, right? No, because they never got filled and they refused to leave a pitcher on the table. At one point, when ASKING for a refill (because it was never gonna happen on its own), the waitress' response was, "You know you can go inside and get refills." DAFUQ. Why would I go inside if you're my waitress and you're supposed to refill it? Am I being petty? Maybe... but there's MORE. We didn't get our food for at least an hour, except there was a plate missing. 
We tell the waitress, she's like, "oh what, hmm, oh let me see... oh yeah I remember your order." Um okay, dafuq you gonna do. "I'll put it in right now." No apology, no assurance that it'd be first up...nothing... and our mimosas were still empty. I mean, Jesus fricken Christ, it was a shit show... after waiting another 30 minutes, still no plate. Everyone else at the table was done with their meals and we were still waiting on the one plate that mysteriously vanished.
When we brought it up to the waitress, again no apologies, just a: "it's coming." Then... then... are you ready!? THEN, two of the same exact plates he ordered get sent to a nearby table... and he's still waiting for his plate. So, it doesn't look like his order got sent to the front... EVIDENCE!
So, to sum it all up. Don't fucking go here, maybe as a bar it's cool at night or whatever, but this place was fucking trash, service was trash, TRASH! 
*sigh*
author: Courtney B.

description:
Loveeee the back patio. Came here with a group of six and none of them had ever known there was a back patio to this place. It gets cold (obviously, we're in SF) at night but if you bring jackets and can tough it out, I'd count this as one of my more favorite outside patio locations. I appreciate that everyone respected the no smoking rule on the patio. It's extremely loud inside so personally, I'd rather be outside than inside.
Good dive bar food selection - we got sweet potato tots and wings. Bathrooms were kept clean and line moved quickly. If I were in the area again, I'd definitely say yes to coming back
author: Melissa T.

description: First stop in SF was Teeth! Bomb tater tot nachos and plenty of seating outside for our large group! Coming back for the sliders!
author: Maurisa D.

description: How the hell did this place get such good rating. I don't even know how they are still in business! Gross, gross, gross, the health department needs to be called and a detox company needs to come in and clean this shit hole! I understand the low lighting, they don't want you to know how gross they keep this place, i mean nothing is clean and my food taste as if the oil has never been changed and who makes a fried chicken sandwich  with chicken strips! Gross, I do not recommend coming here and I want my money and time back! Gross
author: Jeff S.

description:
$0.25 Wing Wednesday - no frills, just wings glazed 4 different ways. Order a dozen and share with friends over a few pints of beer in their backyard patio tables. Best cheap date ever, or a reason to catch up with friends for hump day. Come as you are - in sweats or in a suit, it doesn't matter as long as your down for wings!

Great for groups of all sizes and for people to trickle in and out of the group.
TIP: There are NO to-go boxes, so order only what you can eat!
author: Regina D.

description:
When I heard about Dr. Teeth and the Electric Mayhem, the Animal came out in me and I smiled bigger than Janice. My homegirl Mariela D recommended that we hit up the Happy Hour and that's just what we do very very well.... 

Of course I chose the most interest and weirdest combo for my first drink. Life is about trying new things, so I got the shot of whiskey with shot of pickle juice. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/y8mGQTwmFaSu3d7dAywOHA?select=sv5F-4-akpPl92vMLllElw#eol4n8PuuwVhWF4eRlgcWg Honestly, I didn't know what to think of the combo except after sipping on both, they tatsted similar. How? I dunno. 

So although I'm not a huge fan of wings, the .25 cent wings on Wednesday are damn good. I preferred the Asian Sweet and Spicy ones over the Regular. I am now a fan of these little snacky wings and know where to get them. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/y8mGQTwmFaSu3d7dAywOHA?select=sv5F-4-akpPl92vMLllElw#N0fNo7t-OAC4GMmJBDPvCA

We also ordered the Chicken Quesadilla. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/y8mGQTwmFaSu3d7dAywOHA?select=sv5F-4-akpPl92vMLllElw#qxjUgKYAk0NEnDwel6EsPA It was decent with a good amount of chicken and properly grilled and not soggy. 

The menu is filled with odd combinations for those who palates like to sky dive into different directions. Life is fun and sometimes your food should be too. There is lots more to enjoy here, so I am sure we will be back for more.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
I would give 4.5 stars for the food and atmosphere!

But unfortunately, this review is solely for the server, Aly or Lexi or something? The Caucasian girl. Came here on a Wednesday when it was 25 cent wings. It all started when we were waiting in line to order, I asked for a menu and she said yeah and never gave one, but that's fine cause I understand it was busy. She bumped into my friends and I multiple times, along with other customers as well. My friend said she also kicked him walking by but didn't look back or say sorry. Yes, I understand it is very busy and crowded but I work in a busy ass restaurant as well and I ALWAYS say excuse me. Manners. Fast forward: we sat down as soon as a table was available. We waited about 10 minutes for someone to come clean the previous party's food and drinks but no one came, so we kindly asked her and she gave us the DIRTIEST look. I felt bad, we tried to stack things to help, but I'm sorry we had to ask you do your job. We ate our food, but decided to order 16 more wings and 2 PBR's because the wings are only 25 cents with a minimum of two drinks. She told us "happy hour was over so PBR's are no longer $2, they are $2.88." That was fine with us! Nothing better than beers and wings. She comes back with the bill and says its "$14.71 without tip." First off, we were a party of 4, not 8+ so obviously gratuity/tip is not included, there's no need to be a smart ass about trying to imply tip. Secondly, 16 wings is $4, two beers is roughly $5.76, and two ranches are 50 cents each. 4+5.76+1 = less than $11. And I know for damn sure tax was not $3+. My friend asked her about it at the register and told her we decided to cancel our order. The vibes were bad and she wouldn't explain the extra charges but she went ahead and charged it anyway. Why? I don't know.. We waited to get my card back, and when we finally did, she said "I charged your card but deleted it, and you guys have to leave." WAIT, WTF? I assumed okay, it was busy and she wants people to be able to sit down and eat. But when we were leaving, she tells the security guard "they can't come back in." I don't think she saw standing me there at first when she said that so he asked why, then she saw me and said "oh nothing." What the f?? The security guard then asked us why we got kicked out. Idk, why? I wanna know too! You're telling me we got kicked out because we cancelled our order cause we didn't want to be overcharged and she didn't want to explain why?? I wouldn't trip over $3, she could gladly have it if it makes her mood better for other customers. But it's the fact that she had the WORST attitude with us the entire night. If you make a mistake and told us the wrong price for beers, EXPLAIN IT. We would have no problem paying more for it. But if you wanna try to hide the extra charges in hopes that we don't notice it, get caught and not explain why, and have a b*tchy attitude the whole night, then I suggest you find a different job before karma bites you in the ass.
author: Cassie T.

description:
After a miserable time at Hog & Rocks, We were still scraping our tongues of the old oyster scum, when we found our way to Mr. Teeth.

We initially thought we were coming for happy hour, but there are only specials Mon-Fri. After looking at the food menu and the drinks list, We were sold. Please we were desperate to get the oyster after taste out of our mouths.

House wine and beer come in mason jars. This already was a huge plus because I am a sucker for mason jars! The wine was not bad either!

We went a little crazy ordering food and we had 2 hours until our dinner reservations but oh well YOLO!! Plus I was sick all weekend and had to make up for lost time.

The sampler platter arrives and it looks good, but nothing amazing ($11.95) We also ordered the classic sliders (2 for $4) Yes people,  money matters!I bit into the somewhat plain looking sliders, and to my surprise, grilled buttery goodness accompanied the charred meat inside the bun. Delicious. Simple yet delicious.  Next, I bit into the corn dog on our sampler platter, and I about lost my marbles. I did not expect there to be a meaty bits of flavorful sausage underneath that cloud of sweet corn coating. The salty bursts of fat were also much appreciated. Another dip into the honey mustard sauce, and I lost myself again. Next onto the TOT-Chos. Tot-chos are tator tots drowned in all the toppings from a nacho. Those were also good, but a full serving would have had me on heart attack status. This was a perfect portion. The last sampler we had was the Mac and Cheese. We got the regular mac and cheese and it was delicious (the have a truffle version for $4 more).  Melty cheese in every bite, need I say more?

Yummy bites at a bar, decent priced drinks, 5 stars in my book! 

P.S. Decor is really funky inside. Come to chill with your friends, Probably not the best first date spot, but they do have a little outdoor patio which closes at 10pm. Also, place your drink/food orders at the bar.
author: Sharon N.

description: Tried out Dr Teeth for brunch as an alternative to The Sycamore (favorite brunch spot in the city). It was ok. Food wasn't bad, just didn't over-impress me. I got the biscuits and gravy with eggs. They were good, but nothing special. I also got the "beef" Bloody Mary. Again, good, but not on my list of top BMs I've had in SF. Atmosphere is very similar to a lot of spots in the mission. Sure, I would probably go back, but only if in the area.
author: Derrick S.

description: Such a fun place! Visited this place Sunday for a friends birthday brunch. Bottomless mimosas were great and the food was even better. Friendly staff and located in the Mission neighborhood. Definitely will be visiting again soon! :D
author: Shanti C.

description:
It's a painful thing for me to knock off a precious star from a place oh so dear to my heart, and likely my update won't sway the masses from dining at Dr Teeth, but I had such an odd experience on Wedensday that I had to make note.

My pal and I stopped in for drinks and wings on the famed Wing Wednesday, as was an old tradition back in our hay day, and snagged a spot at the bar. 

*Pro Tip: this is actually the worst possible place to sit as the night progresses*

I ordered far too many wings, thinking it was a good idea to get 10 of each, Nude and Buffalo, plus four Habenero. Since I was with a man, and men usually surprise me with how much they can inhale, I figured it was better to be safe than sorry. But we had been drinking shots and craft beers, and my mind was way bigger than our stomachs. 

I asked for the wings to be cooked extra crispy, and the bartender said that was a no-go. But why? I always order that way when I'm at a table and with no flack. Mass confusion / sadness, but moving right along, I also asked for a side of Death Sauce (yes, I've had it and I like it a lot, that's why I get it on the side, eat at your own risk, yada yada yada). Food comes out, all sauces on the side (??), no Death Sauce. Hmm. 

Keep in mind, the place is starting to pop off, and the sole bartender is getting crazy drink and food orders, so it's hard to flag him down to correct this mishap. Anyway, we eat, we drink, we are merry. Then we get super full, just like the restaurant, and decide it's time to dip out to Cha Cha Cha for some sangria. 

We asked for the bill and a box to take our remaining 12 or so wings (yea, we did very little damage, it's shameful) and the bartender said no to the box. Straight up. But we ordered two drinks each (actually more like 4 drinks each, but who's counting), and he said that if you could take them to go, everyone would do that, which is probably the lamest excuse I've heard. Dr Teeth offers their food for pick-up, but I guess that doesn't go for wings on Wednesday?

Anyway, we were dismayed and off-put by this, as it is just ridiculous for paying customers to not be able to take their leftovers with them, even on a special night. It's not like we wanted to-go cups for our beers, or something crazy. We were able to hand our wings off to some mutual friends who were staying, but that burn was no bueno.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Yes Yes Yes for Wings Wednesday!

Got here at 4:50 and was able to grab a booth for the 3 of us. We ordered 2 sprites to meet the minimum 2 drink order to unlock the 25 cent wings goodness. With 3 girls, we ordered 20 wings and the lobster garlic fries. Do not order the lobster garlic fries. It was so oily and greasy we ended up only finishing the top half since the bottom half is saturated in oil. If you want fries, opt for the poutine.

Do not get original. Buffalo FTW.
author: Lauren K.

description:
You disappoint me Dr. Teeth.

.25 wing Wednesdays sounds great, right? It's considerably less so when you have to wait an hour+ for wings. Plus, there's only about 8 tables/stools to choose from -- kind of hard to maneuver around. Waitstaff is swamped too (as expected), but they avoid eye-contact any chance they can get when on the floor -- I can see you!

So yeah, there's my rant. Dr. Teeth was a letdown.
author: Casey S.

description:
TATER TOTS!!!!!!!! That's what I think of when I think of this place. Their tots are amazing! AMAZING! So well seasoned and soooo damn addicting. You can't eat just a few. I finished my whole side order and stole some off my friends' plates. I just ordered eggs and bacon for the rest of my meal and it wasn't anything special. I'd have to say the tater tots were the star of the show. 

I'm sure if you order tater tot anything, it would be amazing. I'd come back for the bottomless mimosas and tater tots. 

I wish I could've sat outside for brunch. The inside was too dark and dingy for me. Don't get me wrong, it's a great sports bar and a fun place to drink beer, eat greasy food, and hang out with friends. It was a beautiful day and I wish there was table service outside for us to enjoy the sun.

Their bottomless mimosas were a great deal! So cheap for the city! And they totally don't mind if you bring your cup to the bar to get a fill up if they don't come by very much. Our server was swamped and hardly stopped by our table, so we just got mimosas ourselves. 

On a busy game day, there will be bathroom lines, so be prepared for that. There's only one women's stall and one for men. 

I'm looking forward to coming back for their tater tots and bottomless mimosas.
author: Kathy T.

description:
Time for Real Talk: Wing Wednesday is a rip off, especially for true alcoholics. You don't get your $0.25 wings without a two drink minimum -- per person, is my understanding. And you can't take any to-go. It's busy as f***, so good luck finding a place to sit. The silver lining is the wings are great and there are tons of flavors.

I shudder to make it more popular, but if you want a better deal, go to Hi Tops for $0.25 wings on Monday.

Brunch here would be five stars if they tried a little harder. The backyard is damn adorb and greasy food is bomb. The service, however, is forgetful *at best*. It wouldn't surprise me if they intentionally slacked on bottomless mimosa because they hate dealing with drunk patrons. And I get that, but darlings, it's your job, and we're paying a shitton to destroy our livers. So let us do it. This weekend I had to get up to get mimosas for my friends.

WTF is up with the new name "Teeth SF"?

I know I'm ragging on it, but I like this place and will return. I just wish they were worth it just a little bit more.
author: David S.

description:
Arrived on a Sunday around 12PM and was with a group of 8. No where to sit of course. Went outside and sat outside on the wet benches. Another group tried to lay dry wood on the wet benches so they could sit without getting wet and a very rude waitress or server whatever she was walked by quickly and said, "Could you guys NOT do that?"
2 stars because 1) rude waitress/server 2) had to order food inside at the bar, very inconvenient 3) horrible service 4) everyone that worked there had attitude.
author: Nicole F.

description:
For some reason every time I come here I find myself consumed by the fact that they have good taste in music. 

I don't know what logarithm they're using, but think it's a mix between spotify radio and personal preference. 


        

It makes me fall in love, honest to the Gaints. 

(why don't they have a "shocker" emoji to use in times like this...or do they?)
author: Mike G.

description:
Pricy, but good. The bar tenders and servers are pretty nice, and the food is unique. Lots of people congregate in the bar and it ends up getting cacophonous; we sat out back on the tiered deck. It was quieter back there than anywhere else in the mission (save a bookstore, perhaps). 
I got the sriracha mayo, garlic, and crab meat tater tots. Yeah, you read that right. They were insanely good, and enout to share with two or three others. 
The flickering lights out back and the crazy loud (and busy, thus slower service) interior are what knock a star off. Can't comment on the drinks, but they had more liquors that I'm used to seeing - not sure the tender could reach them all though...
author: Jacob S.

description:
I love, Love, LOVE this place!

Four friends and I decided to check this place out Wednesday night.  One of my friends had purchased a Groupon a month back but that plan was quickly scrapped once we decided to get the 25c chicken wings (their Wednesday special).

WHAT TO EAT:
*TOTS: Definitely give either the Tot-chos  or Tots ala Mayhem a try.  The tot-chos are nachos with tater tots topped off with sour cream, guacamole, olives, and jalapenos.  The tots ala mayhem was a bit more savory with tots topped off with caramelized onions and cheese. 
*CHICKEN WINGS: They come in a variety of different sauces: original (basic fried chicken), sweet chili, bbq, or death sauce (they use ghost peppers so expect to be asked to sign a waiver).
*MAC & CHEESE: Creamy and delicious and available with bacon (mixed in and it was delicious!), jalapeno, or truffle.
*CORNDOGS: Small corn dogs on a stick accompanied by both a honey mustard and cheese sauces.

WHAT TO EXPECT:
*Seat yourself meaning you will have to be a vulture
*Dark but loud atmosphere, but a great time
*Jameson on tap (always a plus!) for $7
*Credit cards accepted
*Parking can be difficult since you're in the Mission

SUNDAY-THURSDAY SPECIALS:
Sunday: Buy a shot, get a pony (I found out it's only a beer...shucks...)
Monday: Burger and beer $10
Tuesday: Trivia at 8pm
Wednesday: 25c chicken wings 
Thursday: $2 tacos and 2 for 1 margaritas

SERVICE:
I forgot our waitress' real name but her nickname was Sugar.  She was nice and kept the drinks coming.

No doubt we'll be back...
author: Nicole S.

description:
Came here for happy hour with a few friends and coworkers.  I wish they had happy hour prices for food, but the portions were big enough to share in which splitting the bill didn't cost an arm and a leg.

It was pretty dark inside, and the lights flicker, which I thought was a cute touch.  The waitress was very nice and attentive.  She made sure that my party had enough to drink and eat.

We ordered fried pickles, totchos, and chicken lettuce cups.  The fried pickles and totchos were huge, and oh so delicious!  The pickles came with a tangy sauce, and you can't go wrong with tater tots dressed like nachos.  The chicken lettuce cups were fresh and was a healthy option that balanced the fried stuff.

I got the Crispin Cider, which was light and, well, crisp!  I also tried a lemon drop shot that the waitress recommended.  It was good, and I recommend it as well.

I've heard good things about their brunch, so I hope to come back and try that.
author: Vira P.

description:
Review for Wednesdays:

TWENTY FIVE CENT WINGS!!! Came with 2 other guys and got 50 wings and a few drinks. We could probably have eaten more, but 50 seemed to satiate us. We only got the Habenero, Buffalo, and Plain wings, and we all agreed that the Habenero were the tastiest. However, I do recommend getting some of each type so you don't get sick of one or the other (except for death, but more on that later). 

Anyways, the indoor seating is pretty limited, but there's a lot of outdoor seating. If you get there before 6pm, you'll probably be able to get an outdoor table. The indoor tables were gone before 5:15 though. 

The wings come out lightning fast when we ordered. Probably in 5 minutes or less. We got a whole cup of blue cheese dressing with it and some celery sticks, but none of us liked celery, yuck.

The Buffalo wings were average, but the plain were pretty tasty and slightly sweet. The Habenero were sweet and spicy, but you just couldnt stop. They reminded me of a spicier version of asian chicken wings in that sweet and spicy sauce. Didn't have the chance to try the BBQ flavor

The death wings. Oh god the death wings. The girls who were sitting next to us offered us some of their death wings (they got like 4 and didn't eat any of them), so we manned up and tried one. Oh. My. God. The death wings brought us tears of "joy" when they graced our tongues, and we couldn't taste anything but hot for a few minutes after the unfortunate exposure. I didn't get a chance to ask how many scovilles the deathwing sauce was, but it was VERY hot. I'm very glad I didn't try it the first time they offered it to us before we ate our other wings.

The wings were average, but for .25 who can complain. The drinks are cheap. $3 PBRs, $4 other beer etc. This place looked great for large groups. I will definitely be coming back here, and maybe someone will even take another stab at the unholy death wing.
author: Courtney Q.

description:
25 CENT CHICKEN WINGS?! I'M THERE!

Make your way to Dr. Teeth on a Wednesday night for cheap chicken wings and alcohol! (Wings are only 25 cents if you buy an alcoholic drink.) It really doesn't get any better than this.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
We went on 25 cent Wednesday, and it was crowded as fuuuqqqqqq. We couldn't find a table and had to hover awkwardly around the bar and this group of friends that had a table so we could descend like vultures once they left.

To get the wings, it's a two drink minimum. And like, the wings are okay. I guess they're 25 cents, so they're not supposed to be phenomenal. But for the love of God do not get the barbecue flavor because it's all just smothered in really sweet, caked on barbecue sauce. It's not cooked into the wings. The honey habanero could use more habanero.

What to go for instead, then? The tater tots. They came out hot, fresh, crispy. I easily ate 30 in a minute. And if you're one for having the occasional celery stick with your wings, make sure to ration it out appropriately--if you order four wings at once, or 30, you'll get the same three celery sticks.
author: Rosy H.

description: God bless the bartender on this night for dealing with these day late and dollar short hipsters. They make this job blow.
author: PJ L.

description:
Not super fancy but it has an edgy feel to the decor. 

They have specials on wings every Wednesday during HH. Beer on tap. Sliders. Burgers. The usual.

Great place to hang out after work if you're around the neighborhood.
author: Julie L.

description:
So glad I came to this spot! I think it was a Monday night when it was $10 for a burger and a beer night which was well worth it.

Ordered:
Corn dogs
crab tater tots
Dr.teeth burger with side of mac and cheese

The burger was pretty good, a bit above average esp. with that mac and cheese. That mac and cheese doeee...BOMB!

next up, Corn dogs were hand dipped in that batter and they were probably the best corn dogs up to date. some soft fluffy corn outer and then the dog is not your average hot dog! The dipping sauces these come with are so good with the burger and tater tots too.

Crab tater tots with aioli ... the best for last! tots were so good. I cant eat this all day long. Now that i think of it ... i want some more.
author: Kenny L.

description:
This is a review of the brunch only. I came here last Sunday with the crew to try it out. We showed up around 11:45am. Parking in the area is tough. You might have to circle around a few times before finding something. After about five minutes, I found meter parking. Luckily meters are free in SF on Sunday's!

It was a pretty chill laid back vibe. I was surprised that we walked in around noon for brunch and there was still plenty of seating. When we got there it was pretty quiet, by the time we left, it was loud! 

Bottomless Mimosas: It ain't brunch without bottomless mimosas. They charge $14.50, which is not bad at all. The only downside is they serve them in little plastic cups. The mimosa was ok. Tasted like cheap champagne and cheap OJ. They get points for being generous with the champagne pour, however it's not my style. I like a good tasting  mimosa with my food. They are good on circling around and constantly filling up your plastic cup. My cup was never empty.Points for that.

Food: I ordered the Chorizo Scramble and the rest of my friends ordered the Wake and Bake Grilled Cheese. The food was, again, ok. I was expecting the chorizo scramble to pack a little more taste but it didn't. I'm not a picky person at all, but for some reason I wasn't messing with the potatoes in the scramble at all. The grilled cheese was good. They added some avocado to it. I immediately regretted ordering the chorizo scramble. But even then, the grilled cheese wasn't to die for.

Overall their brunch was alright. I probably won't be coming back here for brunch. With so many good brunch places in the city, this place just doesn't make my list.
author: Alexander L.

description: They got me at tots. Lots of different kinds of yummy tater tots. End of story.
author: Jenn N.

description:
FRENCH FRIES!? TOTS!? Ugh, MY WEAKNESS!!! This place takes my happiness essentials and makes them AWESOME! Oh and there's alcohol. Love this place. 

First of all, gotta love the lively atmosphere. It's loud, it's a bit dark, but even when it gets crowded (and yes, it can get really crowded), by some miracle I always manage to find a seat. Apparently there's an outdoor patio area I have yet to explore, so that's something to look forward to! 

The fried potatoes here are just ridiculously yummy and you have the choice between fries OR tots. You can't go wrong with either. You can totally taste the truffle-ness of their truffle fries/tots but much of their yummy points go to their garlic crab fries/tots with sriracha mayo! SO GOOD! 

I have to say though that the service here is kinda bad... and slow. If you're gonna order food and drinks, do it all at once. It's really hard to tell who works here and the people that do work here seem unwelcoming. I tried to order extra food in the middle of our meal and was pretty much told I couldn't because there's only one cook in the kitchen... on a super busy Saturday evening. Another time, we couldn't find a waitress so my friend tried ordering food from the bar and wasn't allowed to... even though I just did the same with no problems. Another other time, the chef forgot to add that sriracha mayo on my fries, and my heart sank. So many game-changers, it's a bit upsetting. 

They do have some daily specials and happy hours, but the prices are a bit on the high side for what it's worth. Still, what a great place to just sit down, eat french fries, drink alcohol and yell at your friends!
author: Krissy L.

description:
Two words: WANG WEDNESDAY!!!!!!! 

Also this place was previously known fully as Dr. Teeth and the Electric Mayhem (see: the Muppets). Happy hour on weekdays are like $4.50 well drinks, and they also have many other happy special deals on other days of the week, but I have to say this is the best one (I'm biased, since this is the only one I've been to, but hey it's popular for a reason). 

So here's the breakdown: 
25 cent wings with the purchase of two alcoholic drinks *per person*. If you guys don't want to stack up the tab with drinks, just send one person to the bar to order and only two drinks need to be ordered for the group (yay loophole).

Before I go any further: GET THERE EARLY IF YOU WANT A TABLE. Word to the wise, this place gets crowded and people become hawks looking for tables. And wings aren't really the type of food you eat standing up. And be very territorial with your seats. 

As for flavors: Sweet Chile Habanero, Buffalo, BBQ, and Au Natural (dry).
Sweet Chile Habanero is hands down my favorite. Don't let the word habanero scare you. The buffalo wings are actually much spicier. Wings are accompanied by a blue cheese dip and a few celery sticks. The buffalo packs a kick and it doesn't help that the thick delicious sauce gets every where, spreading the burn. Don't forget to ask for extra napkins...you will need them. The bbq flavor I'm not really a fan of. I'm not sure if it's too sweet or too tangy, but either way, I always jut get the buffalo and the sweet chile habanero. These three flavors come with an overload of sauce, so if you're into dry wings I guess you can get the Au Natural flavor which is just the fried wings without the sauce (boooooringggggg). 

Also one more word: TACHOS. 
that's right. Tater. Tot. Nachos. Just get them. And then proceed to have no regrets. Because tater tots and guac and cheese and pico de gallo and ugh now I want them.
author: Erika M.

description: We were here for Halloween weekend and there were no ventilation. It was definitely too hot. There is a water station but no cups. Things are pretty sticky. Saturday night had good hip hop music for the 20s-30s, it is fun for the throw back music.
author: may q.

description: Teeth is a great place to go when you're craving s chill vibe for happy hour, wings and tator tots. It's a great place to go when you're not trying to have happy hour at a super bougie place in the city. They have $1 wings on wednesday which is great and super fun, but more busy than another evening.
author: Chelsea S.

description:
Heard about this 25 cent wings Wednesday. Was pretty skeptical about it, but was I proven wrong. The wings aren't dinky as you think. They're pretty voluptuous! Check out my pics :)

The group of 8 I came with ordered 100 wings and devoured them like no other. I believe you have to order two beers before you unlock the 25c wings. 

Don't forget your ID too because they card. I believe you can get in without one if you head there early enough. It is all open seating first come first serve, so get there early!! 

To order your wings you have to go to the bar. I give this place a four star since the service was all over the place, and the place to order food is very small and clustered.

It's a very lively bar and would definitely come back in the near future. They also have a shuffle board and a bean bag tossing game to play while you wait. Enjoy!
author: Kenneth C.

description:
To be honest, I had heard so much hype about Teeth Sf that I was enormously excited to swing by for Taco Tuesday! The hype, however was not met. 

I'm not sure if it's because I'm from San Diego, but I wasn't super impressed with their tacos. Their meat was "okay" and a bit on the soggy side, while their fish taco felt a bit like ceviche shoved into a small tortilla. Overall, not the best first impression but I'm gonna hold off judgement until Wing Wednesday. Teeth SF let's try again!
author: Lucy C.

description:
Came here on a Wednesday night and the place was packed. Seat yourselves folks or else you will lose your chances of getting a table. The service was great aside from the fact that there were only 2 servers on the floor, KUDOS ladies! Great decor and fun atmosphere. $0.25 wing Wednesdays are so worth it because they are not anything close to wing stop/ hooter dainty wings. Minus 1 star for the nasty bathrooms. 


$0.25 wings: sweet chili habanero tastes just like it sounds, and if you are into sweet and spicy like I do then this flavor is the one for you!

Original wing: just your good old fashioned fried chicken wings, tasty for it being plain

Mac n cheese truffle: OMG I love truffle oil! This mac and cheese was ok it was kind of cold by the time it got to the table =(

Reuben egg rolls: the hubs loved this and i found it to be quite delicioius in eggroll form. 

Whiskey breeze: A sea breeze but w/ whiskey instead of vodka... it was OK

Cucumber cooler: refreshing and tasty

I'm going to try the jameson on tap next time hahaha
Aside for my gripe with the bathroom I do have to note that there are inconsiderate people in there. This guy asked my husband and I to move because his party was getting bigger and they wanted our table. Get this we were in the midst of eating our meal, WOW! Not your fault Dr. Teeth & Electric Mayhem it's hard to filter idiots from your establishment.
author: Mary Ann B.

description:
Great service - 5 stars.  Waitress was very attentive and very friendly.

As for everything else, the food was mehhh (typical bar food) and the drinks although surprisingly strong were just okay.  To be fair, it's really just because this place is in SF and there are so many great options, especially in the Mission.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
My only recommendation is to come here early! 4-5:30 is the best time to snag a table. Obviously since most people should still be at work.

The waitresses are pretty attentive, if you are able to grab a table, they take your orders. Wednesday .25 cent wings is always popular. I think they say there's a two drink minimum per person now. 

We've eaten..

Wings- the buffalo one, bbq, and plain. super saucy. 
sweet potato fries/tots- guys preferred the fries but anything sweet potato is quite yummy.
truffle tater tots- yum
I think we had some kind of nacho thing once too and that was good.

good solid bar food.

drinks, we've gotten the pitcher and the first time we got one it was strong, the last time we got it, pretty weak. decent cocktails too.

But great spot to catch up with friends! until it gets really loud and you can't really hear each other
author: Christine M.

description:
Great small place. I came on a Sunday night and it was busy. They have ski ball and ok music. Nothing special but a lot of heart and really good bar food. The design was cool with the maniquines,  but the bartenders are great. Bryan (maybe his name is Ryan) and the bald guy with the beard who said he was Mexican (sorry vague) anyhow... These 2 bar tenders are amazing. They make good drinks and are super cool and nice. Both had really intelligent conversations with my bartender friend about cocktails and hard liquor. I got the hickups and hey both tried to help by scaring me and having me
Do silly remedies. Eventually we cured my hiccups. They made our night extra fun and memorable and made our drinks just like we like them. I would definitely come back. These bartenders really make the place friendly and great! Yay. :)
author: Buffy S.

description:
Dive bar with eerie dentist flair. They have a rotating Happy Hour on the weekdays, with a daily special on beers and well drinks. Tuesday was 2 for 1 margaritas and $1 tacos. The margaritas are basic and the tacos were sub-par. 

But what was amazing were the CRAB GARLIC TOTS. Loads of crab in every bite smothered in sriracha aioli. Will definitely come back for that.
author: Minh N.

description:
Don't let the weird name fool you. Not as kitschy as I assumed, but a cool place nonetheless.

Came here for a Thursday evening night cap and parked ourselves outside on the back patio. It was a little cold but the drinks certainly helped on that front! This place would be rad-tacular (yes. word.) on a warmer night.

Their buffalo wings are pretty legit. Next time: wing night!
author: Carol M.

description: I came here for brunch and the prices were pretty decent for the quality of food. The bottomless mimosas weren't to die for, but they were decent. Can't complain when it's only $15. Other than that the waitress was super friendly and she was constantly checking up on us which we appreciated!
author: Marie L.

description: Great deal on Tuesdays for happy hour! 2 margaritas for $8 and $1 tacos they were delicious. Bartender was nice and the ambience is great. Definitely coming back for the margaritas.
author: Suzy R.

description:
My sister and her boyfriend were visiting SF and I was meeting them for dinner, so I decided to take them somewhere a little less touristy. This place had great reviews on Yelp, so we decided to give them a shot.

It was a Friday night and they were clearly understaffed. It was over 10 minutes before a server came to give us menus and another 10 minutes before she came back to take our orders. 

Dr. Teeth has a great selection of cocktails including 60 oz (!) pitchers of some of them. We ordered a round of drinks thinking that we'd probably try a few types of drinks over the course of the meal. However, they didn't bring out the drinks until after our food came out (30 min after we placed our orders). The server kept coming around to tell us that she would bring the drinks soon, but it took way too long for her to actually make it happen. I had the Old Cuban (which was a rum drink) which tasted mostly like the bitters in it and not much else.

So far, everything that I've mentioned has been negative; so why 3 stars? The food was awesome! I had the Strangelove burger (jack cheese, chipotle mayo, and bacon) cooked medium with tater tots as the side. The burger was juicy, flavorful, and cooked exactly to medium, and the chipotle mayo really complemented the cheese and beef. The tots were awesome too. I also tried some of the truffle fries and those were nice too (they didn't go too heavy with the truffle oil). 

The atmosphere of Dr. Teeth's is cool too. We really enjoyed sitting at the picnic tables they had in the outdoor seating area. 

Overall, I think that the food made up for the slow service and I'd be willing to go back on a less crowded day.
author: Ravi S.

description: Terrible bar to watch sports.  The owners don't have a clue.  One bartender with a packed bar?  No beer girl in the corner?   Allowing people who aren't drinking to stand at the bar and prevent anyone else to get drinks?
author: P T.

description:
Came here for a late happy hour after work with some friends, and it was well worth the price.

For $4.50, you can get a decent tasting well drink(I ordered cranberry & vodka) that doesn't taste like a college frathouse quickmix. Apps were all so delicious, highly recommend the garlic crab tots with sriracha mayo and bbq sauced wings. 


4/5 stars because despite how delicious the food is, my tolerance for cleanliness bothered me throughout my whole happy hour. The foam seats have holes in them, I sat on a seat with a hole so big I could have probably dropped my cell phone in it. Floor is covered in dust and the tables are sticky even after I saw them wipe it down.

If your tolerance for cleanliness is lower than mine, I think you'd be better off finding a bar elsewhere, but for me I'll take this any day over a fancy shmancy happy hour.
author: Zoe H.

description:
I get the blues in January. I try to fight it, but I'm just not my normal chipper self in January. I guess it's the cold weather, low bank account, absence of the pretty Christmas trees and the second chin I grew during the holidays. 

But there are glimmers of happiness for me throughout the dreaded month of January, and one of them is brunch at Dr. Teeth with good friends. (This does not help that second chin issue...)

I have been to Dr. Teeth for brunch more times than I can count, and can't think of a reason to complain. Well, yes I can. They should see me walk in the door and pour mimosa down my throat and shove tot-chos in my face before I can even get to a table. But other than that, Dr. Teeth is the perfect brunch spot, and one of my happy places. Sometimes people who are feeling down envision their "happy place" and picture a beach in Hawaii... yeah, mine is the patio at Dr. Teeth, where drunkards are tossing bean bags by me while playing corn hole, the sun is shining  down on me and I'm knocking back quite a few glasses or champagne and OJ with a buddy. Tot-chos are in front of me and then some kind of breakfasty concoction makes its way to my face and all is well. 

January is over now (thank God), but my relationship with Dr. Teeth isn't. 

Dr. Teeth, thank you for saving me money on therapy. You are my bottle of sunshine and happiness!
author: Liz M.

description:
Dr Teeth has to be one of the most uniquely named places I've been to. The outside canopy has a picture of a tooth on it, which initially led me to think it was a dentist, but boy was I wrong. Both outdoor and indoor seating are available. The inside is dark, dimly lit, loud, and full of more hovering people than there are outside. At least outside, I can breathe and hear what my friends are saying, as well as be able to see the food in front of me! I honestly like the outside seating more, despite the cold outdoor feeling. There are lots of TVs inside and one outside, which is a plus for any sports fan.

I seriously don't think you can get any better than 25 cent chicken wings (all night) and $3 PBRs (until 7 PM). We usually order about 90 wings and 1-2 orders of tots (don't judge), and for each person in our party of 5-6, it's only $7 bucks a person. The wings come in buffalo, original, barbecue, and sweet chili habanero (my fave). THE TOTS ARE TOT-ALLY AMAZING. Maybe it's because I'm just tots fan in general, but the different varieties of toppings (crab, taco toppings, etc.) you can get definitely bring them to the next level.

GET THERE EARLY!! Or at least designate an early bird to get a table! By 6 PM, the tables are taken and there are already a good amount of vultures hovering around. I must say, it takes a good amount of hovering, awkwardly asking people, and a combination of speed and extreme luck to grab a table. However, once you do, all your troubles melt away and you're free to indulge!
author: Caitlin C.

description:
I love Dr Teeth!! If someone suggests that we come here while in the Mission, I'm always down. Great back patio area for chilling, drinking, playing games, along with shuffle board in the main room. It's a great place to grab beers on a low key night yet you'll be surrounded by a ton of people thinking the same thing, Even then, its never overly crowded.

Come during wing nights, its ridiculous how cheap the wings are and they're pretty tasty too. There's a few types of sauces to choose from but you can't go wrong with buffalo. Other days have other deals but I think Wednesday night is still the best night to swing by. 

Cool bar.
author: Steven C.

description:
Came here after work with some coworkers on a Wednesday and this place was packed. It took us forever to find a table, but we eventually did outside in the patio. We got every flavor of the wings except the spiciest one, Mac and cheese, and tator tots. Everything was good, but the tator tots definitely hit the spot. I'm not sure how the crowd is usually, but I wouldn't recommend coming here when there's a game (the giants were playing when we went). Be prepared to push and shove as there's barely any room to stand in the line with the servers and customers constantly walking around you. Also have someone from your group stand in line to order everything while the others hunt for seats. 
I'll definitely would like to come back for their food, but since I'm not a fan of big crowds and lines, I'll try to find an alternative place.
author: Renee Y.

description: Went here to watch a niners gm! The Sunday brunch menu and the bottomless mimosas served n a small plastic cup stole the show. Overall the food is good the atmosphere is good. The TVs in the back r clutch too!
author: Marcus M.

description:
I love comfort food during the winter. This place offers up all my favorites: mac and cheese, tater tots, grilled cheese, mozzarella sticks AND they've got a decent breakfast menu. I mean we're covered up during this time of the year anyway with coats, jackets, sweaters, extra layers etc. Great timing, too since some of us might or might not have accumulated more of our own "insulation" over the holidays. So why not indulge a little before you start ramping up your diet come springtime? 

They don't accept phone orders though. Too bad because we'd be regulars here to pick up their tater tots. Actually that might actually be a good thing because I, for one have no self control and can finish the entire order of tater tots in one sitting by myself, no problem. 

I didn't get to try their their tater tot nachos but wow it sounds sinfully delightful.
author: Esther A.

description:
I was so excited to try the tat-chos. SO EXCITED. I ended up here during a particularly good date. You know the kind ... where you are really enjoying each other's company so neither of you are in a hurry to go home? Anyways, we were walking on Mission and found ourselves right underneath the sign for Dr. Teeth & The Electric Mayhem. Boom. 

We sat at the bar and enjoyed sitting near an attentive bartender. There were fried beets and tat-chos ordered along with some signature drinks. Everything was good. The Tatchos needed something else...meat perhaps?

I would say the only complaint I have is that there isn't enough of the Muppet theme carried through.
author: Tara H.

description:
BE AWARE OF CREDIT CARD GAMES this place plays.  I had a split bill between a few of us with my total being $34.00  We calculated this with the tip being included in everyone's portion.  I checked my cc and Dr. Teeth charged me $84.00
I called, no answer but vmail prompted me to email.  I emailed got an immediate response but it just asked for the general info.  I then got another immediate response pulling up a receipt for $84.00 with only..the content of "is this your receipt?"
I emailed them back 1. the date is wrong 2. the name is wrong....
I emailed them back..but it's been days no response.  I wanted to give them a chance to fix this before I call my cc to dispute..but it just shows they just pulled a receipt that just happened to be $84 and claimed it was mine...uhm...no.  What cheats..just check your cc or pay cash.  I no longer trust this place....

10/24/13update.post a few days later but immediately after this review I got a response..
eventually it's been taken care of...i have yet to actually receive my money but i did get confirmation that it's been processed.  so do have to update but still keep the experience up here and up one star.

.............
11/11/13 update.. I added one more star back because they eventually did fix the problem.  It took awhile.
author: Helen C.

description:
Teeth in SF is my current go to spot when I go to the city for brunch. I originally went there for the bottomless mimosas on a recommendation from a friend, which they aren't to disappoint.
The first time I ate there I had the eggs Benedict with  tots and that also didn't disappoint, frankly I don't remember our service from the first time because we were pretty hyped up off mimosas but from what i remember the food was awesome and it was nice that we managed to get a bench table in the back patio area, back patio is a sweet spot but it is first come first serve on Sundays. 
Alright now to what I do remember, again on a Sunday went in for mimosas but wasn't able to get a seating in the patio, which was fine so we got sat inside. Only a couple minutes went by before we were served drinks, the waitress was so good about filling us back up on the mimosas kept them coming the whole time we were there, my favorite part haha now the food was epic I had a grilled cheese stuffed with bacon and avocado with tots on the side. Crispy and melty on the inside.I've never enjoyed grilled cheese so much in my life. If you're considering coming to teeth for a brunch it is a spot you must check out, people you won't be disappointed!
author: Enrique M.

description:
Pros
- Cool decor
- Jameson on tap
- They take credit cards (including Discover)
- 70s/80s B-rated movies playing on the TV
- Shuffleboard table
- Deals during the week (like $0.25 wing Wednesdays)

Cons
- When crowded, it can be really tough to order a drink, especially since the bar space isn't all that big
- No Muppets

Overall
- A really great bar that I will keep going to
- I've noticed that most of the crowd tend to leave around 11pm on weekend nights
author: Dipesh G.

description: Loved this spot on a Wednesday night.. I found it by accident. Walked to use the bathroom and ended up staying 3 hours. Enjoying 25cent  habanero sweet chili wings... Cool spot
author: Chris C.

description:
Come here on Wednesdays for $.25 cent wings! You have to purchase two drinks... which you were going to anyways, right? Go during happy hour for $3 drinks and beer.

Tip: Send a friend off to grab seats while everyone else is still waiting (lines get super long, so go early!).  To avoid the "2 drinks per person," just combine everyone's order into 1 big order.

PS: Unless you're a bland and boring soul, don't get the original wings- You gotta try the sweet chili habanero. It's my FAV!
author: Cynthia L.

description:
Came here because I was hoping they would have the whole Muppet band here.

No Muppets. Just us lame humans.

Homemade corn dogs, crab garlic fries, curly garlic fries with truffle oil (oh yeah), meatball and classic slider, and grilled cheese sandwiches for my mates!

The food is just okay. It's like fast food, but more expensive.

The service on a weekday was surprisingly slow.

Mainly due to the packed crowd. Like they were giving out free tater tots or something.

I think this would be a great place if, like Dr. Teeth and his band, I was stoned or high on Muppet life.

But, since I'm not, I don't see the fanatic appeal of this place.
author: Jack R.

description: Tachos are the fear snackage get them, get all the tachos you can! Burger is good cooked right and super juicy. Friendly staff, trivia night weekly diverse clientele and fun decor. Check it out for food, drinks, and a good time.
author: Skylar T.

description:
I was amazed by the patio area here its soo huge. 
              The burgers are delicious too. I like the cups they serve the alcohol in and the fernet is really good. This  place gets pretty packed. Great place to a hold a group function too.  This place was pretty cool, this guy even gave me two hundred bucks on a dare to get this girls number
author: Luke S.

description:
Four stars for drinks -- they're really yummy! The atmosphere itself though isn't really my favorite, it's just such a shit show. It gets SO crowded and it's like black out city in there. Every time I've been there people have been beyond hammered. I mean it's a bar I get it, but it's just such a hot mess. I was here on Saturday evening around 7, while waiting in line for the bathroom we were informed we couldn't use it as the girl before us projectile vomited all over it, lovely. 

I do love the drinks and the food is good too but definitely need to get out of there on the early side before it becomes a total mess.
author: Lizzy U.

description:
Wing Wednesdays. Every review mentions it. Every hipster in the Mission knows it. It even has its own Facebook page. This is one event that lives up to the hype.

Come early and snag a table for your group as possible. Seating is very limited and you will see people vulturing around tables if a group looks like it's ready to leave. Otherwise, the crowd is fairly nice.

Drinks: $3 PBRs and $4-5 bottled beers before 7pm. A plaid-shirt hipster's paradise. The bottles beers aren't your crappy Buds and Miller Lites, but Anchor Steam, Lagunitas, Sierra Nevada, etc. Good quality for a great price.

Food: 
- WINGS. WINGS FOR DAYS. $0.25 for a delicious, juicy, hefty, sauce infused wing. Buffalo and BBQ are the best, and they come with your standard celery and ranch. I felt bad going all out on them in front of my vegetarian friends, but they were just that delicious.

- Tot-chos. A plate of tater tots smothered in cheese, salsa, olives, jalapenos, guacamole, and so much more. Fresh, delicious, and sure to disappear within a few minutes. Such a simple yet mindblowing creation.

- Dungeness crab mac & cheese. So much winning. On so many levels. A massive bowl of creamy, gooey, cheesy goodness with huge chunks of crab. They don't try to rip you off by throwing in a few pieces. They go all out here. This is what sealed the deal for me.

After a long day at work, this is the optimal place to release all of your worries and enjoy some of the best that the Mission has to offer.

For those who are curious about the name, Dr. Teeth & the Electric Mayhem is a rock band from The Muppets. I'm glad I can pig out on wings and down countless PBRs while enjoying the memories of my furry childhood friends.
author: Dmitriy S.

description:
This place is so "Mission".  The eccentric name comes from the name of a muppet rock band from the Muppets Show.  Enter the divy bar/restaurant and you see some headless mannequins adorned with rave like accessories or attire.  -interesting accents amongst the otherwise dark and austere interiors...  There seems to be a variety of characters in here too.  All good vibes, but yes, everybody's got character in here.

The cute bartender with the thick rimmed glasses served our growing party at the bar for the night.  She was friendly, attentive and had a fun personality.  We mostly drank here, but the corned beef eggrolls I ordered were interesting and delectable!  I'm inclined to stop through next time I'm chilling in the Mission.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
To Management,
