Get rid of your door guy, he is bad for business. Couple of buddies and I went to this establishment and as soon as we entered a black male with a beard and his hat backwards yells" HEY! I hate raising my voice". I thought this was funny because I can guarantee you this guy doesn't even have a guard card to be a bouncer. We left and went to cha cha cha instead. I understand he might be a little slow so please have a talk to him regarding customer service. Thanks.
author: P E.

description:
Good neighborhood bar to drop by. Patio is nice but closes early. Staff if ok. But drinks are way overpriced. $25 for two drinks that should be 12-15$. Not bad place for groups. 

People seem to order the deep fried mess. Wings on Wednesdays ? Otherwise grab food outside.
author: O M.

description:
I came here bright and early to watch the 49ers-Panthers playoff game. I was surrounded by 49er fans and it got crazy busy during the game. My friend and I split the tot-chos here. Yes, Tater tot nachos. Let your brain process that goodness. The tots were delicious! They were perfectly crispy on the outside and soft and warm on the inside. My only thing is the the nacho toppings made the tots soggy eventually, so I think I'd prefer just ordering regular tots next time. The service wasn't fast, but it was crowded for the game, so I totally understand.

The vibe in here is so 60s/70s and so funky. It'd probably be a great place to just come on a regular night of barhopping, too.
author: Patricia L.

description:
I HATE MISSION. i hate the traffic there and i hate how there is never any parking, but i would totally forget it all just to put those yummy tator-tots in my mouth! the way they are still crunchy even with the mountains of topping blanketing the whole mass, amazeballs. 
I also had the appetizer samplers! I choose the reuben eggrolls, mango habenero chicken strips, and the corn dogs! all of it was super delicious, but i definitely want to come back for 25cent wings tuesdays!
author: Christine L.

description:
Had this place in my bookmarks for a while, so I finally got a chance to try it when some friends told me to meet them here the Wednesday before Thanksgiving. Little did I know that it is $.25 wing Wednesdays at Dr. Teeth!! We got 60 wings, both regular and habanero, and it only came out to $15!!! Super awesomeness! Our waitress is the one that suggested that we get the habanero, which means that they crispy wings were covered in a sweet, spicy sauce. Holy crap, I can eat these for days! Great service, great wings, and a decent beer selection! As other Yelpers have said, they have Jamison on tap! 

I'm sure I'll be making my way back very soon!
author: Aaron Y.

description:
WING WEDNESDAYS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I've never been here other than on Wednesdays because IT'S 25 CENTS FOR A WING... TWENTY FIVE CENTS!!

Let me do the math for you:

100 wings = $25
80 wings = $20
60 wings = $15
...
only got $5 in your pocket? THAT'S 20 WINGS! (disclaimer)

Of course every marketing scheme has it's catch to it.
There is a 2 drink minimum per order. Now what "per order" means, I don't really know, it's up to the bartender there.
For reference, we bought 100 wings (of course) and we had to order 5 drinks.

The thing I don't like as much about this joint is that it is way too dark and way too loud in here. It feels as if it is a club-like scenario, not really digging that.

But still love this place. Gem in the mission.
author: Benjamin W.

description:
Jameson and Fernet ON TAP.

that's the shit I do like.
author: Susy C.

description:
Okay, so let me get this straight. Some brilliant mind out there was able to conceive the idea of making nachos but with tater tots.... and we still haven't found a cure for cancer? I don't understand this. 

Totchos are the real deal though. This place can get PACKED on the weekends and make it hard to maneuver through the crowds of people at the bar, but as long as I get my totchos then I am seriously at one with life. Seek enlightenment.
author: Jay R.

description:
Pro: Cheap fireball. 

Con: Single bathroom stall. 

No bueno combo.
author: Raji R.

description:
After hearing about the .25 cent wings on Wednesdays, I had to come check it out. This place does get full so come early. We ordered 10 of each wing (habanero, original, bbq and buffalo), the wings are larger than your usual wing chain spot. Like everyone else the habanero were the most memorable. Also, ordered the tot-chos and reuben rolls both were tasty.  

One tip, they don't let you take any wings home which is weird. All in all, its a fun spot to come after a long day of work and get your wing on! 

Will definitely be back to try the jelly fried chicken sandwhich and corn dogs.
author: James H.

description: This spot is really chill. The food is good. They have finger foods that will excite. The drinks were decent. I noticed there was a bar back that was working really hard, so I had him make me some drinks. He said his name was Tracy. I think Tracy could be the animal of this mayhem band. Give this guy the opportunity.
author: Daniel L.

description:
Came here for Wing Wednesday and left satisfied. I didn't know what the fuss was all about then I saw how cheap it was to order a big plate of wings to share amongst friends. We just ate the buffalo flavored wings. I'm a big fan of tater tots and had to get the "tatchos". Interesting concept and I actually thought there would be nacho chips in there. They had big screen TVs here that showed the 1st game of the World Series and then showed the Warriors game afterwards. I finished off all that food with a Jameson and Ginger.

The thing that turned me off were people who were asking if we were leaving the table soon. Nope. We reserved it for a reason and we aren't leaving until we feel like leaving. I also felt sorry for the shuffleboard here as it turned into a makeshift table for people as I saw plates and drinks on it.. The men's bathroom door doesn't close so it would be awkward if you had to go and it was a number 2. I could also barely hear conversations even though the music wasn't playing really loud nor were the TVs.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
25 CENTS for each chicken wing on Wednesday nights that starts at 5pm till closing and having it with beer is the perfect combo!  CHEERS TO HUMP DAY!

My crew and I ordered 1 0 0 wings!  
...Devoured it!  
Ordered beer!  
...Downed it!!

Bring a crowd and the atmosphere gets rowdy and ri-dunk-u-lous!!

They have FAB-U-LOUS HAPPY HOURS!!!  (I have to check out their Thursday nights for their 2 for 1 margarita drinks!)

Get your pack to go to this hipster bar for the happy hour specials and you will surely have a fun time!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
John Daly was delish

The Mule was refreshing

The Mayhem...maybe i wasn't ready for that.  probably not getting that again.
author: Tina A.

description: The tater tots and bottomless mimosas are worth the trip to this part of town. this place is a dive bar that is in a area that isn't the best ( lots of homeless people ) . However the food and drinks were def worth it ... Our waitress was on top of it when it came to refilling the mimosas and the food was really good!!! Overall I would def go back here for brunch and recommend it to friends to try out.
author: Rachana P.

description: Got out of Bart station started looking out for nice place to eat and drink with good music. Dr. Teeth caught my eye. I could not figure out the name of this place until I yelped. Nice place, friendly service, lot of young people and good food.
author: Dominic J.

description: Clutch joint. We were in the mood for wings and this place popped up in my yelp search and did not disappoint! Not only did they have stellar wings but they also serve some bomb sweet potato tots and have awesome beers on tap!!! The bartender, waitress, and busboys were all super friendly and actually spent the time to talk with us, make recommendations, answer questions and just be genuinely nice people!! A rare find; especially on a busy Saturday night. The spot was bumping and had a really cool, dark, fun vibe that was great for late night food and could have been fun for a night out with friends, too! Apparently they serve a top notch brunch with bottomless mimosas.. We may be back tomorrow!!!
author: Annie K.

description:
Jameson on tap? Wow. A free cell phone charger per table? Wow. 

We were there for a birthday and it just happened to be Taco Tuesday. I was really impressed by the quality of the bar food. The atmosphere and clientele is eclectic.. we planned on bar hopping, but honestly we could have stayed all night!
author: Nancy A.

description: No complaints here!! I've been here with a small group, medium sized group and most recently a large group, and the staff never fails to accommodate us. Just recently went for my friends birthday brunch this Saturday. We sat back on the patio and had a blast. Food is always bombbbb - they have a variety of tater tots, yum. And they always keep the bottomless mimosas flowing. Great place to grab brunch!
author: McKenzie D.

description:
Tots! Tots! Tots!

You heard me. It's all about the tots. What kind of place serves potato tots? A pretty awesome place, that's what. Ok, so I came here with a few friends after a day of wandering in the City (Pop-up lunch, North Beach festival, and bar hopping), so I was pretty tired by the end, and I couldn't be my usual glutinous self. I need to come back and try their drinks. However, I did have some of their very delicious food. 

I mostly consumed the "a la Mayhem" potato tots. Oh my, caramelized onions, Russian dressing, and cheese...this thing melted in my mouth like a little bit of heaven. This portion was huge!

I also ordered two sliders. These were very plain--just cheese, meat, and bun, but can you really complain for $4? There wasn't even dressing on it. I've definitely had better sliders elsewhere, so I wouldn't recommend them.  

Lastly, the space is pretty fantastic. Nice interior! No sticky floors (it was about 7pm, so maybe it was cleaner than usual). Nice location in the Mission, right next door to Cha Cha Cha and not too far off from the BART station. This is definitely the spot for the munchies and eccentricities in the low-key Mission!
author: Joanna S.

description:
Ugh. terrible. yesterday my friends threw a surprise party for me at dr teeth. It was amazing. everything except the service, the rudeness, the yelling and the power control exchange. 

I have been in the hospitality industry for 15+ years. All it takes is pulling someone aside to express your dislike in something we are doing. NOT SCREAMING AT THE TOP OF YOUR LUNGS MAKING A SCENE IN FRONT OF OTHER TABLES. dum dum. 

no owner of a bar is going to want their staff to be treating paying (like a couple hundred dollar bills check) customers in this fashion. It took me - and another friend - to kindly explain the situation and remedy it. 

Listen girl with the blue streak in your hair - I could hear it in your voice that you were high on adrenaline while screaming at us. And was scared. You should be - because you know deep down that's not the way to handle things.  Next time, take a moment, breath, and speak to someone in a courteous manner. Or you wouldn't have terrible yelp reviews written about you and your lack of tact, professionalism and seriously awful serving skills. 

on another note - the totchos were good.
author: Terri E.

description:
Where can you find the most fattening food that only your adolescent mind could have imagined or dreamed up? Where can you find the cutest hipster girls and bartenders that are actually super nice to non-hipsters?  Dr. Teeth!  

I love love love this place and frequent it often, from their fried pickles, sliders, and tat-chos (there's crack in the cheese) to their greyhounds, mason jars of Trumer, and bloody's!!!  Whenever I'm in the mood to eat myself into a coma and then drink myself into a stupor, this is where I do it!  It's also the best place to eat your feelings and relieve stress!  The music is great, the people are actually nice for the mission, the outdoor patio is fun, and the decor is eerie and cool!  Plus, when there isn't a sporting even on, they play obscure 80's movies on their tv like Warriors and Breakin'!  Check this place out!!!!
author: Brandy B.

description:
This place is such a rage! It's one of my favorite bars in the Mission and so conveniently located to everything! I've been here on a night out and had a blast. They had a shuffleboard and it can get to be quite the shitshow. 

I recently also went for brunch which was pretty good just had overall slow service. The back patio is so nice! You can play cornhole and kick it on the patio it's just the service got to be so slow!

A must-try is the Totchos it's super yummy and basically a starter that your group should share! I recommend a boozy brunch and on a good weather day so you can sit outside. I believe they do bottomless all the more fun!
author: Priya S.

description: Cool steampunk-seque bar in the Mission, right near Foreign Cinema, the Alamo Drafthouse and other central Mission St. Things. I'm a fan of the spicy margarita and they have good bloodies (grab a pitcher if you have time to kill) & beers on tap. Teeth also accepts credit cards which is always a plus!
author: Irina P.

description: This is the place for great Ohio State gatherings on Saturday morning and evening football games. The beer is great, the food is good.
author: Richard M.

description: Awesome outdoor patio in the back with lots of seating available. It's dark and a little dingy on the inside but the back patio is awesome. You have to order food at the bar as they wont come to you but that's ok. We got the totchos. Delicious! They were soaked in melted velveeta cheese. Super soft and gooey. Solid choice of beers. Cheap.
author: Melissa M.

description:
The tater tots here are amazing!!!!! I want to eat an entire bowl of them. They were covered in what I think was cheese and onions and mushrooms omnomnom. 

Drinks were standard and ambiance is pretty typical of a dive bar. A friend's burger was super rare though to the point where he could hardly eat it. Eek. 

Totally got this place with Doc's Clock or whatever that other doctor place is called near by but I am tard.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
I've gone to many places that were horrible, and my experience on 12/21/2014 at this place is definitely in the top 3.

Let me tell you why:

1.  We seat ourselves, wait close to 20 minutes for ANYONE to even notice us.  The place wasn't even that full, there were still tables available outside.   WHEN WE DID GET SOME ATTENTION, 20+ MINUTES AFTER, WE GET ONE MENU, WHICH WAS SOAKED IN SOME NASTY ASS ALCOHOL. STEP YOUR GAME UP.  

2.  We get a "new" waitress, and she tells us they have a new chef and everything on the "old menu" is gone until further notice.  ACTUALLY,  WHEN WE SPOKE WITH SOMEONE ELSE WHO WORKS THERE, THEY SAID EVERYTHING WOULD BE AVAILABLE AFTER 3PM, SO STOP LYING TO US JUST BECAUSE YOU DON'T KNOW JACK ABOUT ANYTHING, NOOB.  OH, AND HER ATTITUDE WAS DOWNRIGHT DISGUSTING.  

3.  This "new" waitress, doesn't tell us our orders come with tator tots, so we end up ordering two separate orders (thinking that our orders didn't come with them).  Guess what, OUR ORDERS DID COME WITH TATOR TOTS AND YOU JUST COST US TWO ADDITIONAL ORDERS, ridiculous.   How did you even get hired?  Hopefully, at best,  it was out of pity.

4.  After waiting literally over an hour for some tator tots, and a burger, they bring out my burger and didn't even tell me they didn't have the fries I ordered.  Guess what these idiots put as my side?  YUP, FREAKIN TATOR TOTS.  TOOK THESE IDIOTS OVER AND HOUR TO FIND OUT IF THEY HAD FRIES OR NOT....AWESOME.

Crappy service,  ridiculously long waits, grimy furniture, and dumb waitresses, what's to like?  I wasted my Sunday afternoon at this horrific place.  Needless to say, if you are looking for a good time, this place is NOT the one.  Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else...ANYWHERE ELSE.
author: M M.

description:
Note: Review solely based on the 25 cent chicken wings Wednesdays.
 What is there not to love about that???

The first time I came here, it was extremely crowded, babe and I were just lucky we found 2 seats! Not sure if the crowd was due to it being wednesday, or the fact that there was a warriors game, or even both. 

When I first heard about this deal, the image that came to my head was some dinky chicken wings. I thought about those chicken wings from grocery stores where you just pop into the microwave but boy was I wrong. They were pretty darn delicious and meaty for the price. Much meatier than wingstop chicken wings. 

We grabbed a combination of the regular style and the BBQ style. My favorite is regular but the BBQ isn't bad either. The BBQ was actually sweet so that was a surprise.

And their drinks come in mason jars, how cute lol

I definitely would love to come back on a Wednesday again, it's such a good deal to pass up :)
author: Harriet W.

description: Totchos are the best thing to ever happen in my life. The staff is wonderful! Everyone was super friendly and attentive. Also, the death burger was seriously spicy. You've been warned!
author: Denise G.

description: Me and my homies came here to watch the warriors game, Tracy was the coolest and nicest waiter I have had, he made us feel comfortable and was awesome with his services , will forsure come back
author: Shane S.

description:
Honestly the only thing I remember from this night at this place were their Midori Sour and lively atmosphere. 

I came here for my friend's 24th and needless to say I was a little bit on the tipsy side. Didn't get a chance to try much other than one drink but I'll definitely come back for their famous happy hour wings and tater tots!
author: Anna L.

description:
Came here on a Wednesday night for their 25 cent wing special after a long day of hiking. Between 3 people, we ordered 4 DOZEN chicken wings (regretted afterwards) and the truffle tots (since they ran out of fries) and we each got a beer. We ordered the bbq wings, sweet chili habanero wings, and the buffalo (original) wings. My favorite of the three were your good old buffalo wings, flavorful and had a nice kick to it. The bbq wings were my least favorite... the sauce was too sweet. The sweet chili habanero was alright, it didn't stand out as much as I thought it would and it wasn't spicy at all, in case you're wondering. The truffle tots was delicious! Tots in general are good, but throw some truffle on it, AMAZING! The wings/drumettes are huge, compared to other place. We made the mistake of ordering too much and ended up having about 8 pieces left. Since the pieces are so large, it's hard to get the center to be flavorful... so near the end of the meal, I just ate the outside since that's where all the flavor was. I probably wouldn't mind paying 25 cents for smaller pieces if they tasted better. I guess you get what you pay for? Overall, you will come out feeling full after this meal.

Place gets extremely packed because of the specials. Looking for a seat? it's like the Hunger Games in there! Be prepared to be asking all the tables if they're leaving or soon. Luckily, a couple was willing to share their table with us. If you have a table, you can order from there (which goes by a lot faster) but if you're still scouting for a table, line up with the rest of the people and you'll get a number to put on your table once you find one (this way takes longer). Service can be a bit better, but I guess if you're coming here, you already have low standards for service. My waitress accidently dropped a chicken wing on me when she was clearing the table. I don't blame her since she had her hands full and the place was packed. I just wish she came back to wipe the table... instead we had to resort to using napkins to clean our own table. Overall, good place to check out if you're in the mood for some cheap wings. Would I come back? Maybe, but at a less chaotic time... if there is one!
author: Johnson S.

description:
TL;DR: The menu is wild, the drinks flow freely, and the bar itself is cool. Neighborhood is sketch.

Came here for a livingsocial brunch deal, and man, totally worth it. The neighborhood is totally sketch.  We BARTed here, got off at 16th street/mission, and walked down to where the bar was. A word of caution, I probably wouldn't feel comfortable coming here at night without a group.  And I'm a big guy.  With a fair bit of fighting/training under my belt.  (only reason it gets 4 instead of 5 stars)

If you are feeling adventurous, consider bringing some 'rock to throw at all the crack heads and distract them.

Anyway, once you get there, its a great place.  Decent size bar and seating area in the front, and a nice outdoor patio in the back.  We kinda tooled around for a bit and played some shuffleboard while waiting for a table (place was PACKED when we got there).  Met a guy in a bear suit, had some laughs, and a bunch of Mimosa's (bottomless on weekends $15).

We get seated about 40 minutes after getting there, have a comfortable buzz going at this point, and am ready to eat.  Server was friendly and relatively fast, considering how busy they were. I ordered the jelly donut-fried chicken sandwich, because, why the hell not.  My lady had the eggs benedict. Both came with a choice of home fries or tater tots.  She chose the former while I the latter. 

Food was good!  Not mind blowing, but I certainly enjoyed it, and am curious to sample many of their other offerings.

After brunch we wandered out to the back patio to drink more and socialize.  Made a few more friends and just had a really good time in general.

Not sure when we'll be back, but we'll definitely check it out again!
author: Christopher G.

description:
The wings on Wednesday are ridiculously cheap. I love it so much. I don't love the crazy crowded areas and the fact that it takes like 20 minutes just to sit somewhere (unless you want to sit on the ground on the patio which we ended up doing anyway). Getting there early seems to be key. I will definitely go again with friends because their buffalo and bbq wings are so good and they're only 25 cents on Wednesdays. I think I'll try their tater tots too. All in all, worth the wait. They're actually really fast on turnaround with the wings.

Tip: don't get their death sauce unless you really want to die. That is not for the weak.
author: Ruobin W.

description:
I've been wanting to check this place out forever and I set out on a solo mission in The Mission to get my fix on some of their food and to check out the venue in detail, as I plan on having my birthday brunch here. I arrived into a cute little restaurant, dimly lit and bustling for a Sunday afternoon. Outside a sign said "Topless Bartenders, Bottomless Mimosas". To my disdain, no topless bartenders, but the mimosas were bottomless, indeed.

I sat and ordered their "Beefy Bloody", which comes with a strip of bacon in it and is made with Absolut Peppar, instead of regular Absolut (I asked for regular Absolut, since I'm not a fan of extra spicy Bloodys).

                           
Their Bloody Mary is AMAZING, and they use a small hint of Guiness in it, which really does something for the flavor in a major way. I will order all of my Bloodys with a splash of Guiness in it from now on. Thanks, Dr. Teeth for changing up my drinking game. I love when that happens.

Their brunch menu is out of this world, and third-world priced. Most of the dishes are decently priced and some plates are completely left field, like the Jelly Donut Sandwich, which is a fried chicken sandwich with a jelly donut for buns. I didn't try it, but next time I will, for sure. Sounds super adventurous.

I ordered the Tot'chos; a round of tater tots, piled high with all of your favorite nacho toppings. Cheese, sour cream, guacamole...the whole nine. The dish was absolutely amazing. Perfect hangover food, for sure.
author: Trav M.

description: Arrived about 6pm, parking is tough in the Mission as it is everywhere.  Walked about a block. It was packed, Wednesday is 25 cent Wings happy hr. 4 -7pm. Mostly Men, looking like they were fans of Duck Dynasty with beards and flannel shirts.  Found a spot at the bar, 2 drink  minimum for the .25 cent wings ( no take out).  I ordered 5 wings with my drink.  The wings were tasty and drinks ok. While i was ordering my 5 wings @ $1.25 some dude orders 50 wings? So i guess that is why it was mostly Men, the wings got them there. The bar person was not that attentive,had to keep flagging her .If there was music couldn't hear it. If you are in the Mission on a Wednesday low on cash, this is the place to be.  Other than that, don't think i will be back. Lots more bars in the City to check out.
author: Susie S.

description:
I don't think you can find a better deal in SF than Wing Wednesday's at Dr Teeth! If you're coming with a large group, I would recommend coming early to get a space or else you'll be waiting around, hunching over people trying to steal seats for a while. 

If you're only going in a group of 2-3, it's not too bad to find a random spot to squeeze yourself into. The wings are decently sized - I could kill about 10-11 wings, but I also eat more than the average person so keep that in mind. I like to get the original (bc its crispy), the sweet chili habanero and the BBQ. 

I don't get the hype over the taco tator tots...the cheese tastes like melted velveeta, guac was not fresh and I hate sour cream! I was very disappointed.

Also, if you want $3 PBRs, go before 7pm! $.25 wings are all night.
author: V L.

description:
25 cent wings on wednesday!!!

$4 beer
$3 ghost chili dip sauce
$3 to go box

we order 90 wings!!!

these wings are huge!!! you can't even compare these to wing stop.

wash it down with a few beer and your all good!
author: JessePanda C.

description:
If I lived in the Mission I would weigh 822 lbs, no shit. This place has a great menu of drinks and really tasty bar fare. 

Tater tots + crab + spicy aioli = SOLD 

Service was good for food and booze delivery. Our waitress was kind, prompt and knew the menu well. 

My husband had the sampler platter of fried pickles, habanero chicken strips and the buffalo blue tots. All were really delicious. They also had an extensive menu for burgers, tots, fries, grilled cheese, etc. 

We will definitely be back to this gem.
author: Autumn Y.

description:
Swung by this joint in the middle of the afternoon for a snack. Cool atmosphere with some interesting decor. They have an excellent selection of well-prepared bar food. We ordered the totchos and a sampler with grilled cheese, corn dogs, and chicken wings for the five of us to split.

The totchos were excellent; tater tots topped with an abundance of nacho toppings. The grilled cheese comes served with hot, delicious tomato soup that's perfect for dipping. Their take on corn dogs was well done; wild boar sausage battered and fried to perfection. We got the chicken wings with sweet chili habanero; these were pretty good but nothing too special. I'll be back.
author: Kevin N.

description:
Went on a Wednesday for $0.25 wings. Got in at about 630pm and the place was packed! theres a front restaurant seating as well as a backyard patio, pretty cool.. Backyard patio only had one TV if you're hear for sports.. We came to watch the warriors game, kind of. After lurking, we found a table where a group of 3 girls were almost done, finishing up their last 2 wings. Waited near by politely without bothering them.. Other people were rude and asked when they were going to leave.. We still stood nearby waiting. They paid for their meal and were just still sitting there talking even though they were done. I understand they want to enjoy their meal but sitting 20 mins after paying the bill is pretty RUDE, knowing that a bunch of people are waiting.. We were being polite by not bothering them during their dinner, but still.... 

OK. about Dr. Teeth.. Aside from the long wait for the seat, thing wings are just ALRIGHT. Not super great, some of the pieces were cold.. i'm pretty sure they just buy low grade chicken and precook a bunch ahead at time. However, because they are only $0.25 it kinda makes up for the low quality.. There are 4 flavors, sweet, original, bbq, and buffalo. The Tater Tots though!! SUPER good, even though it costs more than our 40 wings we ordered... American Mule (moscow mule) in a pitcher was pretty bad.. BEER goes with wings! our mistake.. 

Will I return? Probably not.. Wait just not worth it for me..
author: Ryan E.

description:
Wings and booze on Wednesdays !!! Wings are just 25¢ each!! Sweet chili h.... The best flavor there! Great selection of beers and alchy oh and the crab and garlic tater tots... Omg heavennnn

The only thing I don't like is the seating... It's always packed and I always have to spend so much time hunting for a table :/ I hear there's a long line to get in before it even opens on Wednesdays... GOOD LUCK!!
author: Kristina L.

description: Came here a few weekends ago with my loves on a Saturday night. Super packed, quick bartenders, but pretty small space. Either that, or there were just so many people there. Great place to enjoy the night out!
author: Bonita K.

description:
Went here early on a weeknight so there was parking nearby and it wasn't as crowded.  But as we were leaving, this place got crowded by the hipsters.  
We got seated and received service right away.  
My friend and I decided to share so we can try more dishes.  We shared the Mexican tatertots and peanut butter and jelly burger.  The tatertots were like nachos, it got soggy coz of all the sauces but it was good and filling.  Their peanut butter burger was actually really good.  I was actually looking for more peanut butter but it was a good balance.  The burger has a kick to it so if you don't like spicy, heads up.  But I think the kick gives it a good balance to the peanut butter jelly  taste.  I'd definitely come back for that.  We got beer also with HH price.  

It gets too crackin' and I can see it get busy so I'd definitely come back here early weeknight to try more of their dishes.
author: Claire J.

description:
Delicious, Delicious, Delicious. 

My only complaint is that it is a bit noisy, I may need to try for lunch to really enjoy the spot, my group had serious trouble hearing ourselves think!
author: Greg F.

description:
It started off great, the security was very sweet to my mother and I (I know, but my mom is cool haha)
But after that, things went severely downhill.

The "Wake and Bacon" was alright. Especially light on the cheese but I have a cheese addiction.
Tomato bisque, get the same from Panera.

The problem started when I finished my meal and wanted to order a drink.
Put in my order, waited ten minutes just to be told that the waitress couldn't bring my order to the table.

You brought food without water or even offering.
(By the way, we ordered alcoholic beverages)

What the fuck.

The people were beautiful and truly truly nice and aside from the one woman who took my order for food, the rest of the staff want to pay attention to every guy who comes in rather than the women. Like seriously, a group of girl next to me were waiting to order and we're ignored until their guy friends came in.
The Phuck? XP
author: M D.

description: Fun bar in the Mission. Went here with a coworker for an after-work drink and sat outside in the back patio to relax after a long day. The back part is sunny and has picnic tables, stadium stairs to hang out on, and a cornhole set up. Would definitely come back here.
author: Kaitlin M.

description:
25 CENTS WINGS ON WEDNESDAY. Just go, bro.

PROS:
-25 cents wings if you buy two drinks.
-But 2 beer is only $6...CHEAP.
-Great hipster vibes with a totally diverse crowd.
-Wait did I say 25 cent wings yet? So if you order 8...that's only $2. WHAT?!
-Great hangout place with your friends. Lively, drinks, wings - perfect for happy hour.

CONS:
-Line for bathroom can get long.
-Line for wings can also be very long, but the worst part is that there's not really space to line up. The waiters are zigzagging throughout the restaurant carrying wings and always always screaming, "Excuse me!" Design a better line system please!
-Can get very crowded.

TIPS:
-Just combine all your friends order into one so you can automatically get the 2 drinks, 25 cents deal instead of each person getting 2 drinks (unless you wild like that).
-While waiting in line, have another person scouting for seats outside! It is almost impossible to get seats so send a sacrifice to find them!
-DON'T get the original wings unless you a bland soul - always go for the saucey ones!
author: Ting Jung L.

description:
I almost don't want to write about this place because it's so damn awesome and it probably doesn't need more people, but I just can't keep it to myself! 

Short story:
Amazing three-level patio out back
Skeeball machine!
Bean Bag toss
$1 tacos on Tuesdays
Totchos (tator tot nachos!)
The end.

Long story:
We came in on a Tuesday randomly looking for a place that would take a big group of us. Thankfully we came early enough for happy hour and tons of table space. I was suspicious of the $1 tacos but they were really tasty and not sketchy at all (c'mon, you were thinking that too). It was getting really hot in there when someone from our group discovered there was a back patio. Lo and behold, there was a HUGE 3-level patio. Great layout, great for groups and a Skeeball machine. (Aside: I completely believe that Skeeball is the new Ping Pong).  Everything that night was awesome -- good service, good food, great atmosphere. 

A special shout out to the Tator Tot bar, specifically the Totchos. Tator tots smothered with all the goodness of nacho toppings? Yes, it's as good as it sounds. Whatever they use for that cheese sauce is almost criminal.
author: Colene C.

description: Great bar in the Mission District of San Francisco! My friends and I came here for happy hour, which was a pretty good deal for the city. We tried the appetizer sampler, which was decent, but if I was more hungry I would have definitely order the grilled cheese. I recommend this place!
author: Kitrina D.

description: Best breakfast burrito in the city!  Somebody show me a better one and I'll defer you to here.
author: Matt C.

description:
Confession: I love tater tots. And buffalo chicken fingers. And the occasional jalapeño popper. A very thoughtful date realized these proclivities and whisked me away to Dr Teeth & the Electric Mayhem so I could indulge.

And just when I thought things couldn't get better, I spied on the menu my favorite cocktail, a greyhound!

I could never make Dr Teeth & the Electric Mayhem a regular stop. But for once in a blue moon gluttony? Absolutely!
author: Miriam W.

description:
Came here for a date, after finding out the first bar we picked didn't serve food.  What a pleasant surprise! The ambiance is what makes this place special: low lights, weird sequined mannequins, couches, and a great music selection.  

The bartender Ryan was really cool and friendly, and you could tell he loved his job.  He gave my date a history lesson on her drink, and spent half the time getting down to the music selection. 

I got the Lone Star burger with totchos.  I honestly wasn't a huge fan of the tatchos, but it might just be personal preference (I really like plain tater tots).  The burger was amazing, and cooked to perfection.

Overall, it's a great date spot (if you can find seats), and a really good bar.
author: J B.

description:
Holy. Shit. 

This place was terrible. 

Went to this place hungover for brunch. Restaurant was an ice box; no heat whatsoever, and I froze my ass off. 

It's hard to enjoy food when you are just trying to survive sub zero temperatures. 

Ok but in all seriousness we checked the temperature on our phones and the restaurant was an icy 49 degrees. 

That's not ok for a food establishment. Turn the heat on you murderers.

I actually caught a cold from being here.

Much Hate,

Michael Stern
author: Michael S.

description:
There are 3 things you must know when you go here on a Wednesday (their 25 cent wing day):  

1. The only sauce flavor you really need to get is their SWEET HABANERO CHILI SAUCE for your wings, because the flavor is EXPLOSIVE in your mouth.  A little warning to the non-spicy food eaters--it won't burn, but it might still make you pant like a dog (just a little).  
2.  You need to order at least 2 beverages total (it can even be a non-alcoholic drink) in order to qualify for the 25 cent per wing discount. 
3.  If you cannot finish your wings, they WILL NOT give you a box to take them to go.  However, they will give you a small container for your side dishes that you paid full price for.  I mean, it's understandable...because you shouldn't ask for a to-go box at a buffet, BUTTTTTT....DAMN...I didn't want these tasty wings to go to waste!  So...a little FYI--be prepared to eat all of what you order.  

My eyes were bigger than my stomach this time around, but nonetheless....LESSON LEARNED!

Side note:  I'm impressed that the waiters/waitresses don't ever write your orders down and they bring the right order out to you every time.  And I wish they added more crab meat into their Crab & Garlic Tatter Tot dish.  WOMP...WOMP WOMP....
author: Wendy T.

description:
Dr. Teeth can go all Electric Mayhem in my belly any day of the week! I'm not exactly sure what that means, but my point is that I absolutely love Dr. Teeth.

For one thing, they have really great happy hour deals and a different special every day of the week. Not too shabby for Stephenie. Wing Wednesday is one of my personal faves, partly because it gets so wild in there. SFers sure do love 25 cent wings, I have found. They used to have trivia on Tuesday, which was absolutely fantastic, but they have sadly dispensed of it for some ungodly reason that I will not even try to fathom for I wish not to fill my soul with grief and sadness. But they have $1 tacos and 2-for-1 margaritas on Tuesdays instead, so that's a fair enough consolation prize, I suppose.

But more importantly, Dr. Teeth has some of the best bar food I've ever had the pleasure of shoving down my gullet. Totchos? Yes, please. Bacon Mac 'n Cheese? Yeah, I'm all over that. Burgers? Don't mind if I do. The point is that their food is bomb and it's pretty reasonably priced, in my humble opinion.

Also of note, there is a pretty cool patio area out back that is fairly large. It was a fantastic mini-getaway when we watched game 7 of the World Series (Mad Bum!! Woohoo!!!) in that jam-packed oven of a dining room. I should also point out that during that game, it was (understandably) crowded as a mofo in that place, yet our server was still awesome. She was bringing our party of about 15 drinks and food like a champ, despite having to shove her way through the thicket of the crowd. Kudos, lady whose name I cannot currently recall. Kudos, indeed.
author: Stephenie S.

description:
Excellent service!! Ask for Caitlin, she was friendly, attentive and knowledgeable about the menu! She made great suggestion! 

Sampler platter -$15.95
Mac and cheese with truffle cheese
Tot-chos
Side garlic crab fries

There specialty drink the Mayhem manhattan $10.00 is was perfect!!

Perfect for groups or a causal date.

We will definitely be coming back!!
author: Char K.

description: Great place in the Mission to hang out with friends for drinks or some small foods - the tots are particularly good. It's like a hybrid of tater tots and nachos. When the weather is nice-ish, the outdoor patio area is great. There's even a TV if you want to watch a big game or something. I've been here a few times and never disappointed :) It does get super busy on Thursdays/Fridays and weekends, so fair warning if you are looking for somewhere quieter or with more arm room.
author: Bianca C.

description:
So this is the bar with the funny name that I can never remember. Angelo F. used to mention their Wednesday 25 cent wing deal to me all the time. We finally stopped in with a couple of other friends and we enjoyed our time here.

They have cocktails with Saint Germain! They also have a full kitchen of food. We opted for the corn dogs with smelled like doughnuts but tasted like corn dogs. The food is totally greasy but it goes well with alcohol. Just eat it in moderation and you're good.

They also had an awesome DJ when we stopped in and it was fairly easy to get a table if you go early enough on a Saturday night. It was starting to get much more busy closer to 9pm.

I didn't go to the back patio because it was cold when we went but if it's a nice day, the back patio stays open until 10pm.

I noticed they also do trivia on Tuesday nights and they donate proceeds to your favourite charity on Thursday nights. Oh and I think they do margaritas on Monday?

The crowd is pretty mixed here. Prices were what you'd expect to pay in SF. Cocktails $10 and up, beer $5 and up. Theme nights are probably cheaper.

You bet I'll be back with friends in tow.
author: Amy J.

description: Fun crowd. Quick friendly service. Although beware their DEATH Wings! I always ask for spicy and never get it. So I figured this name was just a gimmick. It wasn't. My lips felt swollen, I sweated out of every pore, tiny needles pinged the inside of my mouth. The only way to eat them was quickly. That's the trick. The searing heat hits a plateau and doesn't subside even when you've stopped eating them. So push through. Ask for water 1st, the one reason this is a 4 star review. They gave me these death sticks with no water. Oh and do not rub your eyes while eating these. You think your mouth hurts you may possibly go blind. Ok have fun!
author: Attic F.

description:
Owned by the same owner as Bullitt? Sign me up please! Bullitt is by far my favorite bar in the city: food, music, vibe, etc. I'd surprisingly never been to Dr Teeth before and had been meaning to go for awhile to check it out, so glad that finally happened!

My girlfriends and I came here around 830 pm on a Friday night as we were waiting for our table at another nearby restaurant. We only came here for drinks, so I won't have a lot to comment foodwise, but basically: this place is amazing!

I loved the decor and funky art that was all over the place. It feels verrrryy hipster and 'Mission'. They have cool manikins everywhere that are dressed very interestingly - I took some photos you can see here.

We just got well drinks, but it's a great place to kill time, and I will say that the food at Bullitt is super yummy so I'm sure it's good here too. (Make sure to try the mac n cheese - nomz times 10). I also noticed they have Jameson on tap - so awesome. At Bullitt, it's Makers on Tap. 

This is a fun place to go and I can't wait to go back next time I'm having dinner in the Mission! :)
author: Priya G.

description:
Big O Wings for 25 cents on Wednesdays (with the purchase of two drinks)!

After hearing about this place from a friend, I thought I would get tiny wings because 25 cents for wings sounds too cheap to be true. When I sat down and found out that there is a two drink min. for 25 cents wings, I was sure I was being scammed. 

Wrong, wrong, wrong. 
The wings were huge (way bigger than BWW or Wingstop)
They're not strict with shared orders. By that I mean, grab a friend and get one drink each but order in the same tab. I even shared a tab with three people cause one girl didn't want a drink at all. The waitress was so cool about it.

Before 7pm, the bottled and canned beers are only $3! My entire order for 40 wings and two beers came out to be only $17! 

You must be 21+ to get in and there were no lines when I went, but from the other reviews, I guess there is usually a long line. There is also a super nice outdoor section in the back, so don't forget to check it out. 

I guess the only downside is that you CANNOT take home wings, but I saw two girls slip their wings into a ziplock bag inside their purse.. ratchet .. or genius?
author: Sabrina L.

description:
25 cents wing on Wednesdays was crackin at first. But then they changed it and made it where now everyone is REQUIRED to order 2 drinks. Probably wont come back after that.

The service is wack as fuck, they all give attitutdes. But I guess its understandable being that they work in a crowded environment with drunk people all around. But they need to be nice to the sober people.
author: Sonny S.

description:
The only thing more awesome than the name is the food - the happy hour specials are like, the best. There's a different one each day, and they are all comfort food, finger-lickin deliciousness.

On Wing Wednesdays you get 25 cent wings. TEH EFF?! You know what ELSE you can buy with 25 cents in San Francisco? THREE whole minutes on a parking meter! Woopdedooooo..... *rolls eyes*

Wouldn't you rather have a hot, delicious meaty chicken wing with your choice of sauce? 

YES. Yes you would. *Just smile and nod*

Another reason you should come here: 
The ingenious invention that is "Tachos" (tator tot nachos). And their chicken quesadillas. And their $10 burger and beer specials on Mondays. And, and, and, and....

And if that wasn't enough, my server doesn't laugh at me when I order the sugar free Redbull and Vodka instead of regular Red Bull. It's like ordering a super size meal with a diet Coke.  But she humors me.

So basically, you should come here if you haven't figured that out already. 
GO. NOW.
author: Mariela D.

description:
25 cent wings on Wednesdays. 

Yo0o0o0oo0o. 25 cent wings on Wednesdays!!!

That's a wrap in itself come on. 
Yes, there is in fact a two drink minimum to "unlock" the 25 cent wings special, but didn't you come for wings AND a beer anyways? 

Two beers for 6 bucks each, but you can also get 6 wings (which is the minimum) for $1.50 .... hmmm. 

I think we know who wins this deal. We do. 

And yes, the lines can be really, really long. Like waiting 20 minutes to order AFTER you get in, type of long, but it's lively and chatty enough in there for you not to get bored. 

It's loud, crowded and rowdy. All in a good way. 
There is an outside patio in the back that is pretty large. 

21+ to get in. 
Counter tables, sufficient bathrooms to get the job done, nice vibes, amazing wings. 
See you Wednesday.
author: Ben T.

description:
5 stars for the wings :))) on Wednesday but minus 3 For the service !
The Caucasian women with the blonde hair overcharged us for the wings on the Wednesday deal, like wtf ?! I don't understand how the deal all of a sudden changes prices... Umm... Okay? 
Then she starts giving us attitude for everything we ask for. You're a server, if you didn't want to give customers their needs then why choose this job? Then she tells us to leave because we didn't want to pay the price she gave us instead of the Wednesday deal ? At this point we were pissed. 
Mind you I've never written a yelp review until now. And I'm usually the nicest person you'll ever meet. 
Go for the wings/deal, just make sure you're not in her section and I wish I had gotten her name so you guys would know.
author: June K.

description:
An order of french toast for 9 bucks that only has 4 pieces, the equivalent of 2 slices of bread. The Jim Bean in the "Jim Beam" syrup didn't come through and probably would not have been worth the price even if it had. There are too many brunch places in a 2 block radius where the tables aren't sticky (blegh) and the food is heartier.

Blood Mary is killer! The food not so much.
author: Polly F.

description:
This is probably my favorite spot in the Mission now and it could easily be yours if you check it out on a Wednesday night. You can never go wrong with 25 cent wings. It's like getting free T-shirts--it never gets played out. The wings weren't puny either, so damn.

You must get the Tot-chos and try all the chicken flavors. If you're curious about the Death flavor but don't want 4 of them (you must order at least 4 per flavor), you can get the Death sauce on the side--beware though. As far as drinks, they got a decent amount of taps which include Fernet and Jameson--interesting. I like how they serve beer in mason jars.

Great atmosphere and service. As one might expect, it gets packed so come early and catch Happy Hour from 5:00PM-7:00PM. I like how there's a patio in the back. It would be nice if there were a bar and some TV's out there also.

This is where you need to be for hump day.
author: Marlon T.

description:
Went on Wednesday for the 25 cent wings with a group of friends. All the flavors were really good and the portion was enough to make everyone full! 
The service was slow but when the servers got to the table they were extremely attentive and sweet. 
The place is small for the amount of people that go and having self seating was a bit chaotic. 
Overall it was a great experience and I would go back again.
author: Nickie D.

description: Food was very delicious I had the chicken tenders and a hefty order of tatoo tots....Washed it down with not 1, not 2, but 3 Moscow Mules. Bartenders were some of the best mixologist on this San Francisco journey
author: Koby G.

description:
I came here after the San Francisco Street Food Festival on Saturday.  The three of us were there enjoying the ambiance.  We were given menus and ordered drinks; and held onto a menu to see if we wanted some food later.  The waitress then just took the menu for no reason so we didn't order any drinks.  When we left, we heard the prices of the shots and went somewhere else for cheaper drinks.

The place is really big, which is nice, there's a shuffleboard (?) table and the decor is wacky.
author: Wally W.

description:
Food: 4-4.5
Service: 4
Price: $10-$15 +tax/tip a person
Ambiance: nice small hangout place with table shuffleboard & tv screen. Though the dim lighting was a little bit too dim to see the person sitting across from me.

Been here once and definitely will go again. 

Margarita pitcher: I guarantee it gets the job done ;) 

Sampler: cheesy bites (side tomato soup), buffalo wings, & truffle Mac&cheese w/bacon.

Garlic tater tots w/crab: If you're a garlic lover, this is a MUST! Jampacked with intense flavors. 

****Definitely recommend***: garlic tater tots w/crab, truffle Mac&cheese w/bacon (you can really taste the truffle oil), margarita or any of the pitchers will probably serve you well. 

And the tomato soup is full of flavor, more than most I've tried. And I am a soup person.

4 instead of 5 because not everything was amazing. Though the ones mentioned above, WOAH, you've got to try.
author: Natasha K.

description: First time in SF so I was so excited to try Teeth and it was mediocre. I expected more. My wings came out cold and awful service. I don't recommend it.
author: Alemania L.

description: The concept is nice and so in the environment! The service is horrible, from the security to the bartender. They seemed as if they hated their job or they not being paid enough.
author: Alejandra L.

description: TOTCHOS! Came here before dinner and it was a nice place to chill. The patio in the back was super cute but it was too cold to sit outside. Came here for happy hour so all can/bottle beers were $4-6. Great place to chat, the music isn't too loud so it's a nice place to hear what people say. The waitress was really nice, kept checking up on us to see if we needed more drinks or food.
author: Polly L.

description:
I still to this day have no clue how this restaurant / bar earned its name.  But Dr. Teeth is probably one of my favorite places to get drinks or some greasy american fare. 

Their wings are large and meaty with a variety of sauces mix it up with, grilled cheese will put you in a nap coma but well worth the sleep, a bomb peppery bloody (a bit pricey at $11), good choices of drafts and cans, decent eggs benny, a gigantic heart clogging breakfast burrito, and the tots oh man TOTS in truffle oil.  My deep fried savory tooth is satisfied there. 

I cannot offer higher than 4 stars, the service is typically pretty slow (consider it euro hipster chic) and its the loudest place in the world on the weekend (clearly I'm just getting old).

Sit out back in the sun drenched patio which has a nice homey backyard appeal where you can watch the big game on a flat screen with your dog or bike.
author: Andrew T.

description:
THIS IS NOT A DENTIST'S OFFICE!

I really want to love this place but MAN do they have terrible service!  This place is more of a bar with food than a full service restaurant.

The inside is really unique and I love that it's a true hangout spot with shuffle board inside and skeeball outside.  The food was pretty decent too.  Nothing majorly exciting but I did love that they have tons of options for the tater tots like sweet potato tots, truffle oil and Parmesan tots and tot-chos.  I had the wake and bacon which was just cheese bacon and a fried egg.  Nothing too exciting.  The banana bread french toast was good but it was cold when it arrived.  Not sure if it was supposed to be that way but it would have tasted better hot.  It was also more of a bread pudding type dish so perhaps a name change might be in order.  It didn't taste to much like banana which was good because I hate the taste of bananas.

The bottomless mimosas were decent but were also super expensive.  They weren't fresh either.  $15 for pre-mixed mimosas served out of a pitcher.  $15 would have been reasonable if it was made fresh each time with fresh squeezed orange juice.  The orange juice tasted like Sunny-D.

Now to the service, which is really what brought the rating down.  We arrived and saw a sign to pick a table.  No one greeted us for at least 10-15 minutes.  Our waitress finally came over and took our order and other than bringing the food over and refilling our mimosas, we hardly saw her and we were never asked if we were ok or if there was anything else we needed.  We asked for boxes, which we never saw and had to ask another waitress to help us.  Sarah (I think her name is) was very nice and courteous, she just wasn't very attentive.  The table right next to us had their own waitress which seemed very attentive.  It's was strange that 2 tables right next to each other had different waitresses.

Overall, our experience was fun and I look forward to going back but now when I go, I will know that it's not a full service restaurant.
author: Victoria C.

description:
One of my favorite bars in the Mission; fun whether you go during the day or night.
Love the back patio on a sunny day, corn hole is hella fun to play if you go with a group of friends.
Later at night they do close off the patio to be respectful to neighbors.. understandable.
Inside there's dim lighting & the interior decor is pretty rad. They've also got one of my favorite bar games-shuffleboard! 
It gets pretty loud & crowded at night on weekends & wing wednesdays so go earlier if you wanna have a chill conversation with someone.
Drinks are pricey, but average for SF...worth it here though; bartenders are friendly, and they create some delicious cocktails. 
I definitely try to come here every chance I get.
Such a plus that they also serve food!! and if you do decide to give this place a chance, you only need ONE piece of advice: GET THE TOTCHOS (yes, tater tot nachos.) THEY LITERALLY CHANGED MY LIFE. Like you haven't lived until you've eaten a huge plate of this heavenly goodness...It's proof there's a god, trust me.

I tell everyone I love they must go here and order these, so...you're welcome. ;]
author: Sarita C.

description:
Interesting place, as expected being in the mission. Eclectic. 

Went on a Sunday AM, def a gathering spot for locals for sunday AM football; crowd got larger as the AM passed. 

Food was great - spinach & mushroom omelet and banana French toast w/ maple bacon. And the endless mimosas. Ok, so it was a bit early to be drinking 'endless' but whose complaining?!?

Def would find back if I'm in the area.
author: Judy N.

description: Came here for brunch on Sunday. The music is loud, service is slow, coffee is $4 for a half-cup without refills, and the food is overall mediocre. Wouldn't recommend
author: Jason S.

description:
Great place for happy hour!  From 5 pm to 10 pm, they have deals on deck.  I was able to get $3 beers and $4 well drinks as well as great food and an amazing environment.  I ordered an Anchor Steam Summer Lager and an Atom Splitter for a total of $6.  For food, they have all of the bar foods you want from tater tots (crispy and hot!) to grilled cheeses to wings!  Most of all, there's a ton of seating both inside with tables for larger groups as well as lots of space outside with the patio (and there's corn hole outside too!!!!!)

Overall, it's a GREAT choice if you are in the Mission.  The only downside is the lack of parking, but 'tis the life of living in San Francisco.  I plan on coming back for Wing night on Wednesday!!!
author: Robert T.

description:
Eh. How much you're going to enjoy this place depends on what you're looking for. I'm not a huge drinker anymore and I'm also not 22 anymore so for me it was a miss. Our group was reminded at least 9 times by the waitress that every person needed to abide by the 2 drink minimum to partake in wing Wednesday (25¢ wings). Some of us didn't even know if we were going to eat wings but that was irrelevant to the waitress. I understand her responsibility but why don't they change this to a minimum charge on the bill or prepaid tickets or something else so you don't constantly have to be harassed about this? 

I ordered an old fashion and for $11 it was pretty lame. Lacked any sort of love, not that I need love in my drink, maybe just a quick assurance that my cocktail is a cocktail and not a well soda drink. 

Regarding the wings: It's not a bad deal to come on wing Wednesday but I personally would not brave the insanity that ensues; your dedication to wings will determine this. For me it was way too crowded and way too hard to get the waitress's attention (although she did her best).

The haberno wings and Au natural wings were great. Buffalo was not my thing. The ghost pepper was great. Delicious and spicy with bragging rights upon completion.

So in summary, this place is fine. It just isn't regular joint for me considering the crowds and drink quality.
author: Katie A.

description: Awesome bar in tge Mission! This place is literally tater-tot heaven. You can get your tater tots topped with a variety of choices such as crab or nacho's-style. The tater tots are really filling and they give you plenty! Each tot is fried to perfection and goes well with any booze you choose. It's a little hard to flag down someone when you need something. But I would still come back! Drinks are solid.
author: Amy L.

description:
Generous servings of tots. Good drinks. Down to earth and friendly staff. Always funny shit on the TV. 

Please let me know when the next Adult Bingo Night is...


ALSO: If anyone finds a little red pouch in the women's bathroom, that's my mojo bag and I'd like it back. This is not a metaphor.
author: Bianca U.

description: Wing Wednesday! Yum, nice meaty and cheap. I will be back!!!
author: Carla F.

description: Get the wings, get the crab tots and never forget to tip this place is fun and friendly. I highly recommend!
author: Martin R.

description:
A place with Jameson and Fernet on tap! 

Was here for my little bro's 21st birthday, which just so happened to be Taco Tuesday so we gorged on dollar tacos and the greatest creation known to man, totchos. 

HH has two for one margaritas. Solid cocktail menu and you can keep the ginger beer flowing all night with their "mule" menu. They also have personal iPhone (5 and 6) chargers that you can request at the bar, which are absolute life-savers. 

I mean how can you not like a place named after Dr. Teeth and the Electric Mayhem Muppet band!
author: Clare B.

description:
Lots of bars have good bar food.  This place elevates bar food to a new level.  I can never again eat normal tator tots after experiencing the wondrous offerings of Dr. Teeth.  LOVE LOVE LOVE all the different tator tot creations -- Tachos, truffle tots, sweet potato tots, the ones with caramelized onions.  Holy crap, the tots are good!

Come here hungry.  

I took a star off for the bathroom situation.  It's a ridiculous wait for the bathroom, I think because there's just a one-roomer and it's SHARED with another establishment.  Come on.  We're all drinking lotsa beer here!
author: Karen r.

description:
Named after the Muppets band but nothing else Muppet related. I wish it was more Muppet than just the name. 

For that, I'm disappointed.
We were carded at the door and it had a douche-y air to it. The name is more fun than the place.
author: O M G.

description:
I'm visiting from New York and came here on a Sunday. Didn't get any food, but they had a bottomless mimosa option for $15 till 3PM. I was thrilled because I was having trouble finding anything that was open on a Sunday and also served bottomless mimosas period. 

Really liked the atmosphere, all the bartenders/bouncers were super friendly, and I didn't even have to ask for refills on my mimosas because there were people who came around to fill it up for you which is the greatest thing ever. 

Diverse crowd as well, but the music was a bit too popish for me. It was cute though, they played Britney Spears' first song ever and Carlos Santana... So I definitely understood the direction they were going. 

Had a great time and was drunk by 3 and then hungover by midnight. By the way, how can you not like this place? Coolest bar name ever.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
We know it's BAD for us yet we do it anyways...

Like eating a Double Bacon Cheeseburger at 3 AM in the morning; at the moment, the taste of the succulent beef patties along with melted oooeey goooey cheese and thick, crisp smoky bacon is SO sublime that every bite makes your eyes roll back to your head and forget that you're on a "diet". That is until reality hits the next morning and you realize that you inhaled your entire daily caloric intake in 5 minutes flat and consumed as much salt to bloat you to a Michelin blimp. *Bashes head on wall*  

If you're going to have this kind of regret, then stay far, far away from Dr. Teeth & The Electric Mayhem.

If tator tots and fried chicken alone weren't bad enough, Dr. Teeth has found a way to make bar food staples even more gastronomically artery-clogging. From tator tots smothered with an avalanche of melted cheese, guac, and sour cream to a fried chicken sandwiched between two jelly donuts, the food at Dr. Teeth will have you popping a Lipitor or two but it's totally worth it. Dr. Teeth is like the Broken Record (http://www.yelp.com/biz/broken-record-san-francisco#hrid:48ZPHYyTmHSHAM-gWQ_l7g) of The Hipster Mission. 

In celebration of Hump Day last week, we started our happy hour with the gut-busting Tat-Chos ($7.95): Deliciously crunchy tator tots topped with melted cheese, jalapeno, pico de gallo, creamy sour cream and buttery guacamole http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/y8mGQTwmFaSu3d7dAywOHA?select=CRIJQ8J_Y3PIkWcuXag7bA . With a tot in one hand, we enjoyed a tangy and meaty buffalo wing in the other. At just $.25 a piece on Wednesdays, it's a guilty pleasure that won't break the bank http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/y8mGQTwmFaSu3d7dAywOHA?select=D0HqHL3gKWdVEtdJN7JuXw. 

After just getting started, we continued our night of gluttony with the Housemade Corn Dogs ($7.95) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/y8mGQTwmFaSu3d7dAywOHA?select=sv5F-4-akpPl92vMLllElw. The Napoleon complex suffering corn dogs were disappointing in length and girth but did redeem itself with its nicely spiced sausage. Umm, that so did not sound right. :X Anywhoo....next came the Wake & Bacon Grilled Cheese Sandwich with Bacon, Cheddar Cheese & Fried Egg ($7.95) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/y8mGQTwmFaSu3d7dAywOHA?select=AJH_upFc-gltUalms4Rfgw. The crisp bacon against the oooey gooey cheese and the fried egg was sinfully good but with a dip in the tomato soup adding a bit of a garden fresh tang, it made it a tad bit less guilty. Needing to get maximum stuffage, I threw my order of the Croque L'oignon Grilled Cheese Sandwich with Gouda, Ham, Caramelized Onions ($7.95) on my friend's plate and he reluctantly inhaled it. But he inhaled it nonetheless, so I'll take it that it was good http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/y8mGQTwmFaSu3d7dAywOHA?select=WH_AHkSKwjq49KMMBfEHlg. I knew men were good for more than one thing. I'm kidding.  

Because every main needs accouterments, we shoveled down the fresh-out-the-fryer Basket of Skinny Fries perfectly seasoned to tickle the taste buds ($7.95) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/y8mGQTwmFaSu3d7dAywOHA?select=jDvEhUMigJiCwFU0HJlvkA with fork-fulls of the insanely rich Mac 'N Cheese with Bacon and Truffle ($8.95) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/y8mGQTwmFaSu3d7dAywOHA?select=ngkgA59sAv_bidN4klh2PA. The bubbly cheese crust led way to al-dente elbow noodles thickly coated with the most decadent béchamel sauce I've ever had. Just thinking about it, makes my muffin top pop a button off my shirt. 

Happy hour is never complete without drinks. So to wash down a week's worth of calories, the Cucumber Cooler ($10) was my poison of choice. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/y8mGQTwmFaSu3d7dAywOHA?select=vfxU7lnbRRR0LQKWFj5wLw. Three Cucumber Coolers later, I was lead to my worst enemy Mr. Tequila at Mosto up the block. We won't even start about how that lead to a night of debauchery.

REPENT.

REPENT.

REPENT.  

The next morning, I totally regretted it but I know I'll do it again and again, and again because it may be bad but it feels OH SO GOOD. 

OTHER NOTES:
*Friendly service
*HH Specials: $10 Burger & Beer Mondays, $.25 Chicken Wing Wednesdays, and $2 Tacos & 2 for 1 Margarita Thursdays
*Eclectic and eerie vibe with the chandelier headed naked mannequin being the center piece of the bar
*Hipster crowd
*Seating is hard to come by after 6 PM
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Got two slaps in the face - tequila shot & modelo for $22 ($11/each), then played a few games of shuffleboard.  

Shuffleboard was a little beat up but still had a great time, especially cause I came out victorious. To be honest, I probably would have docked this place a star or two if I had lost, but I didn't, so
Five Stars!!
author: George P.

description:
---Mayhem Indeed---

I came here with some friends for bottomless mimosas and a birthday celebration.

Great atmosphere. Friendly waiters/waitresses who vibed off our dancing/ratchetness. Delicious food (Y'all must get the Jelly Donut and Fried Chicken Sandwich). Spacious inside with a backdoor area too if you need fresh air. They even take reservations and split the check!

Beware:

-You have to be a little assertive with your mimosa. They won't go out of their way to fill it for you so you gotta be a go-getter!
author: Hammer T.

description:
THIS PLACE HIRES THE SHITTEST DOOR GUYS. 2 SEPRATE OCCASIONS, 2 SHIT HOLE DOOR DUDES.

1. Waiting outside for friends, the door guy has his homie just chillin w him outside, calling me hannah montana. Annoying. Then my friends arrive I put my phone in my front jacket pocket, as I walk in the door guys homie pick pockets me and I CATCH HIM. HE HANDS IT BACK BECAUSE HES BUSTED AS FUCK. I go ham on this dude, the hostess sees everything going on asks what happened and the door guy responds "my cousin would never do that this bitch is lying". I call the following day and they inform me that the hostess let them know and they let that guy go. Props to you hostess.

2. I show up with my small dog. Certified service animal. Dude goes "no dogs its too busy". I inform him he's a service dog. Says no. I ask if I carry him, or put him in my bag. Repeats no. Wtf.

I come here frequently because they are so dog friendly and despite the fact my dog is service, I try to not bring him places where I will have to defend the fact that he's a service dog.

One star for the sweet chili wings and bomb serving staff. Fuck these shithole door dudes they hired off the streets.
author: J A.

description:
I love this place!!! 

First off, they have the most amazing tater tots! You can get plain ones or the nacho tater tots...so good!!! The chicken sandwich, burger and breakfast sandwich are also very tasty! They have a bottomless mimosa brunch on Sundays, and the servers do a great job of coming around to make sure your glass is full. This place is fun to come to at any time of day which is hard to find in a bar. It's a great spot to catch a game on the weekends during brunch, and it's always packed at night for a more traditional bar feel. This is one of my go to spots when I have visitors in town!
author: Shannon P.

description:
I went today for wing Wednesday and everyone is right it gets super packed. I forgot it's all about being trendy now in SF 

I ordered 22 buffalo wings and 10 regular wings . 

Apparently ranch is an extra 50 cents ( really not a fan of that )

Order my 2 drinks. 

When I asked for the check, the waitress told me there is no to go order. I had 12 wings left. But I ate there so I would guess it's left overs not to go. I asked her to see how much for a single box. She came back 10 mins later and told me $3. Really $3 for $4 worth of wings . I should have just reduced the tip from the box cost. 

So :
4/5 on a great deal for 25 cent wings and cheap drinks
1/5 on service for charging $3 for a box
3/5 for customer looks
2/5 for parking . 

Great deal for food but doesn't taste that much better. Step up from buffalo wild wings .
author: Justin I.

description: My one experience at Teeth was checking out a shuffleboard set and giving them my driver's license as collateral, returning the shuffleboard set at the end of the night but forgetting to grab my driver's license (at least their drinks are strong...), and returning 3 days later to have a disinterested bartender do a cursory search and be unable to find my ID. Somehow, despite having what appeared to be a filing system, they'd lost it within the span of 3 days.
author: Sheridan G.

description:
This place gets a great review for simply having the strangest, coolest, most metal name for a bar, ever. Oh, that and it's a pretty cool bar.

Cheap drinks, tasty bar bites, cool atmosphere. The bathrooms are definitely not awesome but perhaps not worse than I expected from a place called Dr. Teeth & The Electric Mayhem. 

Very divey, dimly lit, and sort of hobo chic too. A perfect hang out for people in their 20s-30s. Looked like lots of regulars take up the bar stools and larger groups grab soft seating along the walls facing the bar. Not a bad place to get silly and have fun with friends.
author: Katy H.

description:
My review is for a Sunday afternoon so it possibly won't reflect the true character of this bar. But when I came in here, the crowd was WEIRD. And there was this awful sewage smell seeping out from the walls, mixed in with the somewhat delicious aroma of freshly fried tater tots. It was discomforting, to say the least.

They do have fun pitchers of cocktails for sharing, and creepy art on the walls (which I usually love). I'm willing to give Dr. Teeth another shot at night, but would probably avoid this place during the day for future occasions.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Great drinks, awesome "drunk" food. Bottomless brunch mimosas, decent bartenders. Try to hit this place up on an off night you'll have more fun. The bros tend to invade it around 3pm on weekends. Lots of tech but the drinks are decent enough to sufficiently ignore them. Also you gotta try their tater tot bar and wings. Don't be an ass and the bartenders will treat you well!

Bonus points of you know where the bar got its name. Googling is cheating and if you have to you're probably too young to remember!
author: Eden F.

description:
Yelp'ed a couple of places to watch a Niners game, and Dr. Teeth popped up.  We came here for brunch.  Overall impressions:

FOOD:  Awesome.  Had the Fresh Spinach and Mushroom Omelette and was thoroughly pleased.  Had the tator tots....omg.  Why aren't tator tots a more common option????

DRINK: Had the  Fresh Squeezed Greyhound and fell in lurve.  fresh grapefruit was awesome.  Had two of these.

AMBIANCE:  A great mix of divey but well-kept.  High ceilings and good decor keeps you from feeling too claustrophobic.  Not douchey in the least.   Enough tvs where you're not crowded around a single set.  

Would definitely come here to watch a game, or just hang out.
author: Ghizal A.

description:
5 stars! Here is my Thank You email to their Event Manager, Olivia:

Olivia,

I just wanted to let you know that every one of your staff members were AWESOME last night. I plan on writing a review for you guys on YELP and google reviews.

Caitlin was a rockstar and managed my whole party extremely well. It ended up being around 28 people in total circulating through the night, so we definitely kept her busy on top of the other customers.

I wanted to thank you so much again for your help. I will definitely consider this venue again if we have another fundraiser in the future :)

Please pass my appreciation along to your staff / management.
author: Brandon S.

description:
I bought a living social deal for brunch @ this place and boy oh boy what a great time I had! My gal pal and I arrived around 2pm (deal voucher listed brunch from 11-3pm) so we were a little worried that we wouldn't be able to use our Living Social voucher but it was no problem. We put our names on the waiting list and the hostess stated that they would honor the deal even if it was past 3pm as long as we provided our voucher and credit card to the bartender. We sipped Mimosas and enjoyed the young and trendy crowd, while checking out the unusual decor! We were lucky enough to snag 2 seats at the bar and enjoyed an AMAZING and knuckle popping brunch entree and continued our day drinking adventures. 

Our hottie lil bartender, Summer made the experience very enjoyable and answered any questions we had and took our order promptly and overall made our first time experience one to remember. Luckily we bought 2 vouchers so we will definitely be going back next weekend, only this time we will show up a lot earlier than 2pm.
author: Miss Nancy P.

description:
This place is ALWAYS packed! Came for Wing Wednesday and waited quite some time. I stupidly ordered 4 of the ghost wings not knowing what I was getting myself into. HORRIBLE IDEA. DON'T. EVER. ORDER. THESE! Regular buffalo hot wings are okay.

I also have a LivingSocial deal for brunch that I have yet to use. Came here at 1030am and still had an hour+ wait so I decided to save my coupon for another day, which they said they extend the expiration date!
author: Angela L.

description: The margaritas were strong. Cheap but ok wings a little too saucy in my opinion. Cool atmosphere.
author: Fernilla S.

description:
I met some coworkers here for a celebratory Happy Hour. By the time I arrived, they already secured a large table and were ordering drinks and apps.

They have 25 cent wings and you can even get some coated with a hot sauce made of ghost peppers! (NOTE: You do have to sign a waiver, though. Haha) I didn't eat any wings, but I tried a dab of the sauce and it is HOT! One of my coworkers was munching on them and he started sweating -- no joke! We also got some crab garlic fries which were pretty bomb.

I didn't get to see the bill, but I heard the beers were pretty pricey for the amount you get (they serve them in a Mason jar... Which just screams Hipster... But it's the Mission, so I kind of expected that. Haha).

It gets pretty crowded for the afterwork HH people, but it's a fun atmosphere. By the time we were ready to leave, there were people already standing around ready to pounce on our prime spot!

Will I be back? Possibly, it's a fun place with cool employees, good service, and tasty bar food!
author: Leana L.

description: Wing Wednesday. Packed, but worth it for the price you pay. Go and you won't be disappointed, thank me later
author: Jeff C.

description:
Tatchos? Wow, that's cool. Dundenous Crab Tatchos? Holy shit I'm sold.

I went here a month back on a date on a whim. The reviews looked solid, the four stars with 600+ reviews seemed promising, so her and I thought it'd be a good choice. The bar has been set high for me since checking out food at Bullit in Russian Hill, but this place delivered. The inside is kinda dive(e) but it's worth it. I also recommend the Reuben Egg Rolls.

Enjoy with friends!
author: Mathurin K.

description:
I've been to Mayhem nearly every week of the last month to either pick up a CSA box (Luke's Local--- look them up) or to indulge in Wednesday wing nights.  The latter being a terrible habit...as in terribly good.  

Wednesday nights:  $0.25 chicken wings and $4 well drinks- get there early if you want a table because the place gets packed.  The habanero wings are addicting, the fried pickles are delicious, and the 10 for $10 sliders are an awesome deal, with the Reuben being my favorite.  There's a tater tot bar, a grilled cheese bar, truffled mac and cheese with bacon.  Try everything with the addition of the ghost pepper if you're adventurous.  And if the thought of a cheesy, deep fried meal gives you heart palpitations, get the roasted beet salad with feta, strawberries, and candied walnuts.  

And I haven't even mentioned the oddly cool dental decor!  Or the shuffleboard.  Or the fact that the bar is named after the Muppets band.  Or the Fernet on tap.  

Yes, as you can tell, Mayhem is fast becoming my new favorite hangout...
author: Joanne G.

description:
So much fun!!!!

My friends and I came here for brunch/lunch. If it's a sunny day in SF, you should definitely consider doing some daydrinking here. You can go to the back and grab a table, but it's FFA so be prepared to fight for an open one. 

I think I got the Mission scramble that day, but to be honest, my five stars go to their tots. They make tots in different styles, but we shared the crab garlic and the totchos. Both were pretty fatty and heavy, but my favorite was the crab garlic. YUM! Chunks of crab, plus sauce, plus totssss? Happy camper! 

I also absolutely love that they have games. Outside, you can play cornhole. Maybe I think this place is a lot of fun because my friend and I won....but it's awesome to be able to drink with friends and be a little competitive cornholing!!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Wednesday night is wing Wednesday with 25 cent wings.  Come early!  It gets packed!

Love the bartenders/staff.  Good drinks.
author: Theron L.

description:
Between weekend brunch and Wing Wednesday, let's just say that I'm here more than I care to admit! 

Can't go wrong with bottomless mimosas & brunch on the back patio during football season. Food is kinda meh but it's a good overall atmosphere. 

Wing Wednesday is a bit of a shit-show. REALLY hard to find a seat, but the wings are killer so get there early!

 P.S. I do not recommend trying the "Death" wings unless you are some sort of next-level ghost chile eater from India. I'm so serious.
author: Casey M.

description:
This review is for brunch only. It was dissatisfying, mostly because the service was so terrible. 

We got here around 10:30 AM on a Saturday, and the inside was already packed, but the outside patio area still had seats, and it was quite nice.
