Seems like if you come any later, though, it's pretty difficult to find a seat. It's first come first serve, so the servers don't do much to help you find a table either.

You have to order at the bar because the servers are too busy to handle it. You get a number and they're supposed to deliver your food and drinks to the table, except they never delivered our drinks, so we had to go to the bar and get them ourselves. 

We ordered bottomless mimosas and mendotas (beer + grapefruit juice). They were okay, but they never really came around to refill our cups. I got one of the scrambles, and it didn't really taste like anything super amazing like I'd never tasted before. The tater tots were pretty good, but not good enough to negate the relatively meh experience otherwise.

Seems like it's a much more fun place as a bar - I'll probably come back to check it out at night.
author: Jamie C.

description: They told me I had an order of tots. Then they took them away from me bc they said I ordered something else and said the policy was to THROW THE FOOD AWAY!  Poor tots, it's either them or your happiness at Dr. Teeth. The policy is throwing food away in a drought, so terrible. :( Drink service on point, but overall no.
author: Suhail A.

description:
Jameson on TAP?!?!  Fuk yeh.

Aside from that, the place is nice, good spots inside and out. A couple of games outside, but it can get soooo packed in there... especially for any sort of sport game. Although, when i was there the crowd was more concerned with socializing then the game...How can you not pay attention to the GIANTS.
I'd have better food. but i've heard mixed thoughts about the wings.
they have good HH deals, so maybe that's why people like it..Check it out!
author: francis c.

description:
Another successful bar brought to you by the owners of Bullitt and Tonic.
Fun crowd, great drinks, no cover charge, no dancing area but you can still dance if the music is pumpin.lots of space for a big group
Will definitely come back here.
author: Claudine V.

description:
To be honest, I have a neutral impression of this place, other than it was lively, fun, and has possibly the best bar name that I've ever seen.  

Tip #1: Lots of outdoor seating (two terraced patios worth!) with big picnic tables and cute little lights.  Not very much space or seating inside though.

Tip #2: In the mission, with lots of yummy post-drinking food options around.

Overall: I was tempted to give this place a 5-star review purely based on it's name, but I settled for 4 instead.  Fun and good for groups!
author: Sarah W.

description:
The omelet was decent but nothing I couldn't make at home in 10 minutes.
The tatter tots were decent, but nothing I couldn't throw in the oven.
Overall, a pretty decent experience.
author: Isaac R.

description:
This was a great spot. Super crowded and hard to get a table for 7 but eventually were able to. Very dark and loud atmosphere. Pretty good music. Mixed crowd. Good vibes. Hard to have conversations with a big group unless you are yelling back and forth.

The beer selection is fabulous. Food was pretty good. Our table ordered grilled cheese, smothered tater tots, wings and fried pickles. The best thing was probably the grilled cheese and tomato soup. The wings were good, sauce was decent. The tater tots were pretty delicious as well. 

A great place for bar food and beers. It did take a bit to get our food, but it was pretty busy and well worth it I'd say.
author: Natasha S.

description: Worse customer service ever. Chicken seems to be microwaved. It was soggy. Also, the place was just dirty and sticky and gross. There was a wasted guy near guy, and he seems to be alcohol poisoned and wanted to throw up, but the employees didn't do anything.
author: Clifford A.

description: My friend wanted brunch. Honestly, I came for the tots. Walked in, went to the back outdoor seating area and found some picnic-style tables. The waitress came out after a few minutes with menus. We ordered the Chorizo Scramble and the Totchos. I also had the Blackberry Fix. The Blackberry Fix was delicious and the tots were so bomb. Not your fancy brunch, but good nonetheless, and I enjoyed every bit of it, even the crazy, loud crowds. Though, it did take quite some time for our check to come out and we were just taking up space waiting at that point.
author: Liliana P.

description: My son wanted wings. We showed up late and the kindest man still allowed us in for Dinner. It was a pretty hip bar scene with spectacular bar food. Wings were spicy and meaty. But the Stuffed Jalapeños were perfect!
author: Veronica W.

description: Why in the world as an OSU bar would you only have one person on the floor and one (extremely slow) bartender on for the OSU vs MSU game?!? It's taken over 15 mins to get a drink. Complete joke.
author: Christine J.

description:
This place is a lot of fun! The decor and the heap of board games makes you know that you're going to have a great drink/meal, along with the fact it's very loud. Try to get a close together table or one in the back by the TVs if you want a serious conversation, or are very determined in Trivial Pursuit games?

The food was good for the price though. We each got burgers (I got the veggie jalapeno one with a side of nacho tots, which was great, and I love the new trend of beet patties in the city!) but the fried pickles were more batter than pickle. Doubt I'd get those again, bout would love to chow down on nacho tots over a game of cards again!
author: Raven P.

description:
This may possibly be one of my new favorite spots.
Came here on a Sat, early evening.  The place was crowded but not uncomfortably so.  Within a few mins my party of 3 had a few chairs at a counter off to the side and were greeted by a really chill server who was patient with our indecisiveness and offered us tons of answers & suggestions (which was impressive considering how busy the place was).
Buffalo Tots - yes puhleeze.  Brilliant.  Sure, they got a bit soggy, but still - delicious.  Why have I never seen or heard of this before?!
Spicy Cucumber margarita - amazing. delicious.  I'll have another.  Thanks.

Need to make this spot a regular in my life.  :)
author: meg p.

description:
Definitely come here for their happy hour special. The deal ends at 7PM. You get a burger, side, and a beer for $10. $10!!!! You get a pretty good list of beer and burgers to choose from. There's only one burger on their happy hour menu that fulfills the $10 deal. If you choose the other burgers on the list then you would have to pay the difference. Not that much bang for your buck in my opinion, but still a pretty decent deal. Good food and good vibes, nothing to complain about. Their sweet potato tots were good, garlic fries were bomb, and next time I want to give their nachos a try. Burgers were delicious and I loved my cider. There's even a long table where you can play that game... the one where you slide something down and try to get it to land on a certain spot to get the most amount of points? Anybody know the name of it? My friends and I had a good time with that for a while.

At the end the waitress even took the liberty to separate the check for us. Sweet!
author: Helen O.

description:
FUCK. FUCK THOSE DEATH WINGS. Seriously. Fuck them.

My standards were at an all-time low after one bite into that wing. I drank an unclaimed pitcher of water from the next table over (not so bad), and I drank a glass of rotten milk (I ain't even mad). 

The tots are amazing. They are forever crispy, unlike those soggy little warts they offered to you back in your school lunch days. The bartenders are always pleasant, the crowd is like family, and there is a TV at the back patio. YES!
author: Tiffany W.

description:
A plethera of mayhem specially on Wednesday nights when the wings are cheap and booze floweth free! On Thursday nights they have Thacko Thursdays were they have buy one get one margaritas! ..... As long as you don't mind the "hipsters" that come runneth about the place, then you can call Dr. Teeth's your favorite muppet band bar! 

PS,, This spot takes home the "Hottest Bartenders in San Francisco award" you'll know what I mean before you can say "Wow! Jameson on TAP?!!"
author: Melanie D.

description: Patio closes too early. They got fresh squeezed IPA and the bar backs are super friendly. Sometimes smells like cheese-but in a good way.
author: Gracie W.

description:
Tots, tots, tots. Dr Teeth is a local favorite, and one that I've been meaning to check out for a while. The interior looks like a dive bar with a few tables in addition to a bar area with TVs. I came around dinner time on a Sunday, and the place was pretty empty. The ID checker and waitress were very patient and kind! They card at all hours of the day, even if you are not drinking.

- Totchos ($10.95): Tater tots + nacho toppings = Totchos! Two great American comfort foods rolled into one. These aren't just your bowling alley nacho toppings - pico de gallo and guacamole, anyone? Beware that they do come with a hearty helping of black olives (which were not on the menu and I'm not a fan of olives).

- Garlic Crab Tots ($12.95): Fresh dungeness crab, garlic, and chipotle aioli bring these tots to another level. The garlic comes in chunks, so the flavor can be quite strong. There's a good amount of crab meat on top too. Very satisfying.

- Strawberry Gin Fizz ($11): Just a standard, simple summer cocktail. Nothing too special, but quite pleasant.

I shared the two plates of tots with a friend and we couldn't finish either of them, so serving size is true to the price. I wouldn't say the actual potato portion of the tots were anything noteworthy, but the toppings make it worth a try!
author: Jessica F.

description:
This is one of my go-to places in the Mission! Best day to be here? Definitely Wing Wednesdays -- I swear, this place is the ultimate place to celebrate the end of hump day (especially if your work day realllllly sucked). Take advantage of their full bar or the open patio in the back while devouring 25¢ wings! I believe they now have a new rule as of a couple months ago (two drink minimum if you want to take advantage of their wing special) but it's no biggie. If you decide to come here, just be ready for a night of good food and alcohol in an exciting atmosphere!

As for the wings, I opt for the sweet chili habanero flavor every time. It has a little bit of a kick to it, but the sweetness of the sweet chili pairs very well. Don't forget to pair the wings with an order of totchos (crispy tator-tots topped with the goodies of nachos like guac, sour cream, salsa, and cheese). Wash it all down with your favorite beers or any alcohol of your choice and VOILA - you have yourself a good night. 

** PLEASE NOTE ** - when you're deciding what flavor of wings you should get for the night, the spicy atomic wings should not be on the top of your list unless you want to throw it up in the bathroom or sit in the corner in agony. It does, however, turn into a "How Ballsy Are You?" game where my friends and I occasionally test our limits as to how spicy we can actually eat. I'm not joking when I say that even a lick of the sauce can turn your night around. The worker that took my order even warned me that eating these ghost-pepper wings can be painful (and an additional thank you for warning me that you guys ran out of milk). If only I recorded my friends and I eating these. It would've been a great laugh seeing us all struggling, sweating, and tearing over just a small dab of the sauce. 

I've never made a trip here and didn't enjoy it. This place attracts a wide range of crowds and it's always been a pleasure to meet locals or visitors that are just passing by in San Francisco. 

Anddddd...here I am at the end of my review realizing that it's actually Wednesday today. Looks like I just might be going later tonight!
author: Regina C.

description:
I was looking for an easy spot to gather folks to celebrate a birthday and Mayhem was a great, easy choice. Plenty of space and open tables at 8pm and into the night on a Saturday, shuffleboard in the back, and friendly service. 

There's a very tempting menu but if you're on a health kick it might be best to down your juice fast portion for the night before you head over because otherwise you might not be able to resist options like the bacon and egg grilled cheese on huge fluffy toast, burgers, and totchos. That's right, I said totchos. Those are tater tot nachos, and they are amazingly delicious and artery-clogging. 

Our server was new and though she was really nice and helpful, she wasn't super on top of things in terms of the tab. Though she took our orders she disappeared when her shift ended and didn't tell us where the tab landed. Luckily another server was around to help us out and he was great. 

It was too bad that it was too cold that night to go out back and take advantage of cornhole, but I'm sure I'll be back to partake!
author: Christina P.

description:
I love spicy food. My instinctive reaction when someone warns me about an unassailably spicy hot sauce is to order some in a champagne goblet, add vodka, and take it as a shot; all the while looking straight in the eye of my challenger, laughing maniacally as a look of mute horror spreads across their face (this has only happened once in real life, the aftermath was impressively unpleasant...). 

Dr. Teeth makes Ghost Pepper "Death Sauce" (I'm sure you can guess where this is going). I ordered some on the side of my burger...and havoc ensued. While I enjoyed the smokey flavor and initial numbing burn when I tasted it raw, the infernoesque aftermath left me stoically blinking back tears and gulping down vast quantities of beer.  Adding it to my "Death" Burger (10.95) wasn't a much better choice, and although the ciabatta bun (what is this, 2001?!) soaked up much of the flavor, the spice remained, almost overwhelming the properly-cooked to medium rare, coarse grind of the meat. Applying some to my  "Fries a-la-mayhem" (which seemed to be a take-off of in-n-out's Animal Style Fries) was a much better option, with the fiery malestrom bringing out the sweetness in the caramelized onions, the earthiness of the potatoes, and cutting the salt of the cheese sauce. 

I did not give the bartender the pleasure of seeing me cry, but I most certainly did spend a few minutes in the bathroom, trying to scrub the capsacian out of my beard. 

Everything else was unremarkable, with decent happy hour pricing (4$ well cocktails, 3$ bottled beers), an above-average cocktail selection (I especially liked the "Mayhem", a Fernet infused Manhattan), and a poor selection of beer (four taps, none of them unusual or compelling). With only one bartender to handle a Friday night rush, service was on the slow side, but, in her defense she was certainly nice (and her job seemed to involve a lot of muddling, every bartender's nightmare). The crowd  trended toward the tech world and twenty-somethings stamped from the mold of the Marina district, none of whom I particularly felt any desire at that moment to mingle with. 

3.5 Stars: A good happy hour, a good burger, acceptable fries, and holy-shit-that's-hot Death Sauce. Probably not worth a special trip out from the Richmond District, but I would consider going back if I'm ever in the area.

Extras:

Accessible to every Mission corridor bus line, Bart, the 33-Stanyan and 22-Fillmore.

Be not afraid of the creepy mannequins on the wall...and why does every bar in this city have to use Edison-style bulbs for lighting?

Discounts available using Swipely.

Owned by the Tonic Group, whose specialty seems to be nostalgia (hence the name inspired by the Muppets).

Jameson and Fernet on tap!
author: Casey U.

description:
When my friends wanted to go here after our flag football game, I was skeptical.... Bar/Brunch in the Mission at noon on a Sunday... I was expecting to be waiting in line or the place over crowded.

But I was so wrong!  

This place was great.

Starting with the extremely friendly staff that remembered my drink order, was always friendly and smiling... A+

The food was legit! I got eggs bene and it was tasty, and the TOTs were to die for, my goodness.

Overall ambiance was great too.  Loved the outdoor seating with the TV to watch the game but they also had bag toss which was a nice touch.  Good seating, especially with the outside option!

Will definitely come back here.
author: Alex R.

description: Came here for $.25 wing Wednesday and was not impressed nor comfortable during my experience. The ordering system is terrible and disorganized I know that many people are coming but having your bartenders who are already bombarded with drink orders take food orders as well does not make sense to me. The wings are equivalent if not worse to dominoes or your typical 24 hour food joint. At least the beer choices were better than average, I would come back here for a normal night, possibly give it another chance but never again for wing Wednesday.
author: Josue V.

description: Drinks are fun and interesting. Bit pricey for what's in them however. The tater tots are sooo good though. I got the truffle tots.
author: Alice C.

description:
Who would say no to 25¢ wings? Their chikkkin wings are so tasty and they're not soggy compared to the Wingstop variety.  I probably inhaled 7,000 calories in less than half an hour.  Next time I wanna try their special tater tots.  Also, don't order the Habanero wings if you're a spice wuss.  The server was really fast at bringing me my soda refill and I think she's an angel for that because I was brave enough to try their habanero wings.

This place is fun! It's pretty loud so don't expect to have meaningful conversations and discussions while you're hanging out inside the bar. They have a back patio where you can gorge on chikkkin wings and they have a shuffle board.  The place can get crowded and it's difficult to find seating when they're packed. The bathroom is kinda smelly and dirty but I guess that's pretty standard for bars in the Mission district.

I'll definitely visit them again if I want to increase my cholesterol just to satisfy my chikkkin cravings.
author: Shirleyanne A.

description:
Trivia Night/Taco Tuesdays are the best!!! You get two for one margaritas so it's already an instant favorite. On top of that, trivia night so super fun with friendly competition and a rowdy crowd. The bartenders/servers are all wonderful. One of the bartenders is super hot and it's always nice to have eye candy. :)

More so, the food is really good. I love their tacos and tachos (tater tot nachos)!!! I've yet to try it (because I'm such a fan of the tachos), but they also serve tater tots in a variety of other ways.

Great place for food, friends, and fun!
author: Meygan N.

description:
Your typical Mission bar, but makes really good cocktails. Drinks are strong and not expensive, and they even have Jameson on tap.
They are popular for 25 cent chicken wings on wednesdays. It will fill up so get there early if you want seats. They have a pretty big outdoor patio area for warm days.
Must try their totchos next time!
author: Alfred L.

description:
I DIDN'T COME ON WING WEDNESDAY. but let me write a review on my visit on saturday!

TATOR TOTS - friggin amazing.. they add toppings on top of it to make it extra special. I was debating between the crab meat one and the a la mayhem one and decided to get the a la meyhem tator tots. To state it simply, it's like animal style tator tots (for those of you that have been to in n out)

Drinks - pretty good! a little on the pricey side, but pretty good selection of cocktails and beers

Outdoor patio - i think this was my favorite part because you can sit outside on tables or even on steps. TV outside as well so you can catch your fav team playing

Indoor- plenty of seating as well. The leather ishh seats are sort of old and cracked so I would suggest not wearing shorts like I did because it was painful as hell. Other than that, great place!
author: Carmen C.

description: Solomon was the best!!! He was always present when I needed a drink or water - always hustling ! #legit #hustling
author: Astro D A.

description:
First time attending this bar for 25 cent wing wednesday. The wings were not to shabby! The place was definitely packed and we were lucky to snatch a table (beginners luck?). Imagine eating all those wings and drinking beer and cocktails without a table? doesn't sound like fun. Drinks are a bit pricy but the atmosphere is nice and alive. The night ended with a bar fight, good time to leave the scene!

*Tip* 3 Moscow Mules were $33....we ordered a pitcher of Moscow Mules for $35 afterwards and it was about 8 drinks, so much more worth it.
author: Gunter L.

description:
Mayhem indeed! I really wanted to like this bar, but it was absolutely DISASTROUS. Still trying to decide if the deal is worth it: Thrillist SF (look it up, thank me later) is offering bottomless mimosas, entrees, and shots for $15 per person every weekend of January.

I tried to call to reserve a table, and they said they only do that for groups of 10+. The guy promised me that they were "very good" about getting people in and out. We showed up, and literally got shoved around for 20 minutes before someone told us that it would be an hour to get seating inside, but if we wanted to sit on the back patio, we could put our orders in at the bar. There was no list to sign up to wait for a table inside - one of my biggest pet peeves at restaurants.

The back patio is nice once you get past the weird area that looks like a scrapyard. There are only 3 long tables with benches, and then some cement steps you can sit on. I wish they'd taken the money and area they put into having a nice astro turf lawn and bean bag games and put it towards more seating.

The waitress never came to our table to take orders, check on us, or even get us waters. We were the table between the other two, so she was very obviously skipping over us. What the hell? The bar back was out there and more attentive and helpful than she was, so we ended up tipping him only. He seemed really frustrated and apologetic with everyone else's performance.

It took us an hour to get our food, and it was cold and incorrect. Everything tasted alright for a few bites, until we realized everything was way oversauced and felt queasy. 97% of the time I soldier through some pretty terrible dishes to the finish, but even I gave up. Our friends never even got their food. When they tried to ask for a refund because it's just damn ridiculous to wait 2 hours for food, the manager tried to charge them $15 each for a couple of sips of mimosas. Uh, you should be paying them credit for the horror you put them through - not that they would ever go back again though. I've never witnessed such a shitshow!

Sorry this is so long, but I'm trying to save you the trouble. Tips: Show up before 11:30 am, order with the guy who has a curly moustache at the bar (he was nice and gave us pitchers of mimosas that were 80% champagne, damn), make sure he knows you're sitting outside, don't hope for anything from the waitresses, flag down the ginger bar back, and bring entertainment to last the hour it'll take to get your food.
author: Cat N.

description: Good food. Good service. Nice casual environment.
author: Ben S.

description:
TOTCHOS
WING NIGHT
TACO TUESDAY

These guys can do no wrong in my book. Always a different crowd, and you're guaranteed to run into someone you know. There is no avoiding the deliciousness that is Dr Teeth.... And you can't beat the deals!

Tuesday nights tend to be my favorite... 2 for 1 margaritas, dollar tacos, and trivia!!!! However.... The menu is reasonably priced, so it's still very budget friendly even during off hours. 

Wednesday wing nights.... 25 cent wings. That's cheaper than a night at BWW!

Anyhoo..... Highly recommend. It does fill up quickly.... So get there before 7 to get primo seating.

P.s. There's also a patio for those warm SF eves, enough TVs to keep your sports-obsessed friends happy, and shuffle board...for everyone else.
author: Mar A.

description:
Some of you may remember my original review based on my experience on opening night. 

Since then I was talked into going back and I've been back a couple times on my own.

Even though the name and the decor still creates more questions than it answers, everything does look like it was thrown together, The staff is great,

I recently had an event there and Mark, the mustachioed owner, was a great host to 50-60 of us.

They feature food served with a sauce made from the hottest pepper in the world and the Ghost pepper wings here are the first thing I've ever had to stop eating.
author: Manny F.

description:
+ Truffle tater tots
+ Sweet potato fries (and not the wimpy thin kind!)
+ Outdoor patio
+ Really awesome service
author: Sherry L.

description:
The bartenders here are the worst. Super attitude, definitely high on coke and really ineffective.

We waited literally a half hour to get drinks  and there was nobody else at the bar.
author: Mara S.

description:
Gosh I don't even want to give this place four stars, but I have to.  I hate going to places like this, but Dr. Teeth just ... somehow forced me to like it.

Crowd was weird as shit.  I would have replaced it, and this place would have been a lot better. 

1. So much seating.  Awesome!
2. Bartenders were really friendly.  Made us girly-ass cocktails without judgment.
3. FOOD.  Their kitchen was open past midnight.  I ordered their fries.  SO GOOD.  Easily the best fries I've ever had at a non-fast food restaurant.  Comparable to McDonald's fries.  We weren't the only group eating fries there at 1:00 am.  So much easier than walking over to get Mexican food in the rain.
4. Bathrooms were clean.  This is kind of a big dealf or me.
5. SHUFFLEBOARD.  Yes!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
The wings deserve 5 stars, I'm not a wing type of gal but MAN OH MAN! so finger lickin good! I've been enjoying Wednesday nights with $0.25 cent wing night!! WORTH EVERY PENNY!

Overall staff is really friendly and is as fast and prompt as can be.

The problem is finding somewhere to sit and eat those delicious wings, it's a first come first serve so you basically have to stand beside a table to swoop in... It's a bar so I get it but wish it was more organized. I also haven't tried any other food on the menu but I'm sure it's great!!!
author: Silvia S.

description:
Hands down one of the TOP happy hour locations in this party of SF. Best time to go? Wednesdays from 5pm till closing, there are tator tots 25 cent chicken wings, jalapeno poppers and $1 PBRs (other beers go great with this combo, but the PBR price sticks out!). 

A couple weeks ago my group and i ordered two baskets of the tasty tots and 75 wings. Beer, tots, and wings were being tossed and downed left and right as we sat in their open patio in the back chowing down on our bounty and basking in a beautiful warm evening in the mission. 

Some would say that making Dr. Teeth & the Electric Mayhem a regular spot would be unhealthy, but that's most likely because they haven't gotten their hands on any of the tots or wings! 

*Pro tip- if you know you have a group coming that usually orders in batches, make one big order to cover group because I can guarantee that they get hundreds of orders through out the night and you don't want to be that guy who misses out because you ordered late! Trust me-i found out the hard way!
author: Jon K.

description: Charged me 20 bucks for a drink that wasnt even strong and then said they were too busy to clean off a table that was LITTERED with drinks and half eaten food. Told us to move the stuff to another table. You just acknowledged that it's a busy night, what tables do u see open?? +1 star for a pretty tasty long islands a friend got. Would not go again though.
author: Jessica S.

description: Solomon did an awesome job at bottomless brunch! He always made sure we had everything we needed and kept our mimosas full! Everyone should try this place out!
author: Whitney T.

description: Used to be a big fan, but with the menu revamp and name change not so much. Now the totchos, instead of having real cheese melted on top of them (which made them extra crispy and delicious in the heat) they are using a disgusting cheese sauce that was grainy and broken and only served to make the tots into a mushy inedible pile of sadness. My breakfast tots were supposed to come with 2 over easy eggs but instead had 2 cold over hard eggs. And then our server told us that water was self serve, but they were out of water. So she grudgingly refilled it for us. How nice. We won't be back.
author: Brenda K.

description: The sweet potato fries are delicious. Went with a group of 4 and it was a fun vibe, but the music was crazy loud and had to literally scream to hear each other. Even a tad quieter would have been better but great good, music, and vibe.
author: Katherine W.

description:
As many reviewers have noted, this is a great place to hang out on a warm day. The Moscow Mules are refreshing.

However, I will focus this review on the cornhole experience. First off, there isn't that much room to play. Standard cornhole rules allow for 30 feet between boards. The width of the patio also isn't ideal: if there are patrons sitting at the patio tables, one of the players may find their view partially obscured by a bush. Finally, the bags are in poor condition. One bag was leaking beans, causing a lovely stream to fly through the air upon each toss. I would recommend that this establishment invest in a new set. 

With that said, these concerns go away once you down a couple of drinks.
author: Huey K.

description:
We've not only been here once because of a groupon but it was such an awesome deal that we had to get a second groupon to come back! Everything on the menu looks delish! We had the sliders (original, french dip and reuben). YUMZ!

Get here early cuz there might be a wait!!! It's a bit difficult to talk when the music is loud, so be warned!

Service isn't the best, since there's only about two servers in the entire bar. It might take you a bit of work to flag down a waiter to order, so order everything you need.
author: Sharon G.

description:
Great food, decent beer selection. I especially love the 'totchos' and the crab fries. Wings are pretty decent, and I'm picky about buffalo wings.  I hear there is a cheap burger night, which I would like to try, but that brings me to my only negative, which I am sure isn't at all a negative to them....

It's almost always insanely busy, which is the reason I don't frequent more. If I could figure out off-times, I would go much more often
author: andy s.

description:
This place is so stupid. "Dr Teeth"? Stupid. Tater tots on the menu? Stupid. 4 parts alcohol to barely any mixer. Stupid. 80's Madonna blasting as I'm walking in? Urgh, stupid stupid stupid.

I can't wait to go back.
author: Caz R.

description:
I was here at 9:30 for their wings. It's more like a bar instead of a restaurant here. 
They have really spicy wings here. I didn't dear to try the super spicy wings but my friend who can happen pretty spicy he was crying and ran to the bathroom to throw up after eating those killer wings. 

Don't get the super spicy wings unless you are sure you can handle the heat!
author: Jasmine Y.

description:
This is now our go-to Tuesday hangout spot - Taco Tuesday / trivia night! 

Environment: It gets PACKED here on Tuesdays so try to have someone come early to save a table. There is an outside area, though, but you'd want to be inside by 8 PM to hear the trivia questions. There is also a shuffleboard I've never played, and a bathroom I've never used.

Food (Tuesdays): $1 tacos (steak, chicken, fish, or veggie) and BOGO Margaritas ($5 each). I haven't had the veggie tacos, but my favorite would be the fish. The steak tacos have too many onions, and the chicken tacos are too bland. The fish isn't beer battered or anything, but still good. I've also had the Easy Rider Burger (9.95), Onion Rings and the Tot-Chos (7.95). The burger was simple but good (on nice soft bread), Tot-Chos were good, but the onion rings were soggy and nasty - would not ever get again. On Taco Tuesdays though, you definitely get the best bang for your buck if you order tacos. I'm inclined to describe the margaritas as "decently strong," but keep in mind that I am a three-shot wonder and am positively STARVING when I get here (and the food takes a good 30 minutes to arrive). My friends all pound back multiple margaritas when they come here.

Trivia: Trivia starts at 8 PM, maximum 8 people per team, hosted by the sassy gay MC Casey. Always lots of fun, and people come up with some really creative team names. 4 rounds: 1) Current Events; 2) Mystery (changes weekly); 3) Music; 4) Random. 1st place team wins a $50 gift certificate, 2nd place team wins a bottle of hard alcohol (random), and 3rd place team wins a round of shots (8). One time they were a nice fruity concoction, another time it was Jameson. Though I'm sure you could ask for whatever because the bartender is really chill.

When you leave you'll want to walk in a group though, because the outside is kind of sketch at night (it's Mission St, duh).
author: Cynthia W.

description:
LOVE love the name first of all. I am a BIG Muppets fan so when I saw this I jumped on board. Their brunch Bacon Bloody's are bomb and addicting. I highly suggest ordering the sampler platter to share. You get to pick three items (we love the fried pickles, sweet potatoe fries and Tatchos). Their Tatchos are what call me in the night, cheesy, crispy and buttery taters. They also have a 25 cent Wednesday Wing night. How can you pass that up? 

The back patio has nice sunshine but be sure to get their before the crowds do (around 12:30pm or 5:00pm).
author: Bri R.

description: Awesome place for Wing Wednesdays -- 25c wings with a two-drink minimum (get the natural for some semi-spicy buffalo flavor, or the sweet chili habañero for something milder). The place gets pretty packed, so come early and snag a table. Inside can get extremely crowded, but there's a great lit backyard (no heaters unfortunately). When I came for brunch when it was relatively empty, but it probably livens up a bit later in the morning. Their brunch isn's as impressive as their wings. I had the Chile Verde Smothered Breakfast Burrito, which was large, but a little bland. The Grand Marnier French Toast with Orange Cream was pretty small in terms of portion size. We did get wings as well, which were the best part of the meal.
author: Lana H.

description: Teeth has amazing specials during the week including taco tuesday for $1 so cheap but could have more fillings inside the tacos. 25 cent wings on Wednesdays are worth it. They have 4 flavors to choose from with a minimum purchase of 2 drinks. The place has a good crowd, dimmed lighting and not too overcrowded on a Tuesday and Wednesday.
author: Marian P.

description:
Fun bar with an open air patio in the back. It does take some time getting a table, especially for boozy, bottom-less mimosas brunch.

Watch out for the wings in death sauce. This sauce is the spiciest thing I have ever encountered. I took a small bite of one wing and was instantly sweating, with tears running down my face. My buddies tried eating more than one and were in pain for well over an hour. Seriously, these things are not a joke.
author: Vitaliy D.

description: This place is pretty cool. Has a great atmosphere. Came here with my chicka on a Friday night. She's been there before and acts like its the the it spot so I was dying to go. Many food items on the menu for a bar. We ordered the totchos, I ordered a plate of chicken wings with the sweet chili sauce, and my girlfriend ordered the grilled cheese with tomato soup.  I really like the place, but the food wasn't as good as it possibly could have been. I coulda swore the Tomato soup was tomato paste from a can. Overall Relaxing, good amount of space, friendly staff (even security), great drinks.  Great place to hang out grab drinks,  enjoy your time, and even grab a snack. But not a dinner place. I would recommend it!
author: Farhad H.

description:
I've been in search for a Wing Wednesday place in the city and this is definitely a spot to hit up! 

$0.25 wings ! How could you beat that?! My friends and I tried Original, Buffalo, Sweet Chili Habanero and BBQ, our favorites were the Original, Buffalo & Habanero ones. When a place makes good plain original wings, they're definitely doing something right! You could even order all the wings original and get the sauces on the side so you can try all the sauces! 

We also order their Truffle Tator Tots! I may be bias because I love tator tots, BUT they were SO GOOD!!! They came out hot, crispy & so fresh ! OMG TO DIE FOR. Also it came out in a basket so you get a good amount for what you're paying for! 

The food came out pretty quick for the amount of people that were packed inside & out on the patio! Um you can also order pitchers of Moscow Mule & sangria for $32. (except our's had hella ice which = diluted after a while). Definitely would recommend this place but it does get SUPER CROWDED on Wednesdays! We came around 5:45/6 and couldn't find tables inside but we found tables outside in the patio. It got really packed after we found a table outside so come early! Or eat your wings standing up! 

Good Wings, Good Tator Tots, Excellent Price, Super Crowded! Definitely coming back here to eat more wings & try more of their menu!
author: Taylor C.

description: This place is literally tater-tot heaven. You can get your tater tots topped with a variety of choices such as crab or nacho's-style. The tater tots are really filling and they give you plenty! Each tot is fried to perfection and goes well with any booze you choose. The only downside of this establishment is how crazy rowdy it gets. But then again, it IS a bar and it IS in the Mission. It's a little hard to flag down someone when you need something. But I would still come back! Drinks are solid.
author: Laura T.

description: The food is SO GOOD. Brunch here was amazing and worth every penny. Waitress was great, always making sure our cup was full (bottomless mimosas) and the place was super nice too.
author: Nicole M.

description: Came here for brunch with friends to booster up for the santa con bar crawl. I got the jelly donut chicken sandwich and lets just say my sweet tooth is still thanking me. I tried some of the tater tots, sweet potato tots, and tachoes which is like a spin off nachos bit with tater tots. It was all really good.
author: Ana O.

description:
Had brunch there this past Sunday, must say it wasn't a good experience. Poor service and mediocre foods. I would stay away from the "pig in a blankets," they were under cooked and the sausage inside seemed a tad raw/undercooked.

However my main gripe was the service. It's wasn't busy that day at all and it took ages to get our food and all three entrées came trickling out, plus with no silverware which arrived 5 min after the food. Than my side of bacon I had ordered was mega over done and was just dry, crunchy, and salty.  

Best thing I had received was the tots. The home fries on the other hand were meh.

Don't think I'd return again. Too many other solid joints in the area.
author: David C.

description: I came in to dr teeth for one reason: the death burger. Since I've moved to the Bay Area I've been craving spice, and was not having much luck. I heard about the death burger and knew it was a must try. I find the death sauce to be very balanced. It has a very nice and delicious ghost pepper flavor, and a subtle heat to follow. It was never overwhelming, if anything it could have been a bit hotter. But overall it balanced perfectly with the burger, which was cooked very nicely, and left with a very nice after burn that lingered nicely, without too much lip burn. I highly recommend the death burger for anyone as an every day spicy delicacy.
author: David I.

description:
I'd heard a lot about this place before coming here so I suggested this little spot in the mission for bottomless mimosas and brunch one Sunday morning. Needless to say I had really high expectations before arriving. 

The place is not that noticeable from the outside but I kind of like that. We walked in and seating was nowhere to be found. There's an entire back patio area that is very cute and complete with corn hole and all. This area was totally packed. 

Protip: arrive early for optimal patio bench seating next to cornhole. 

We found some spots inside next to a tv. The boys I was with were glad because they could watch the game on. I was just ready to be drunk at this point. 

We ordered bottomless and a bloody Maria (Bloody Mary with tequila rather than vodka). The bloody was amazing. Mimosas were generously all champagne and barely orange juice which is great. I wish they would have left us the pitcher on the table but instead the waitress kept coming to refill our empty glasses. 

I ordered the beet salad and didn't like it that much. I ate almost all of my friend's tatortotchos though. Sooo yum. Highly recommend them. 

We left the place pretty wasted. So overall mission accomplished. I'm already making plans to come back just to score prime seating later in the summer.
author: Vidya K.

description:
16th/mission bart station is the most dreaded place for a girl walking by herself in heels. Creepy people everywhere. But, trust me, dr teeths is worth all the unwanted stares, hollers, and snickers. JUST TRUST ME!! Or you can just take a handy dandy lyft/cab/uber, OR you can just suck it up, be an adult and walk like a normal person. Anyway...

This place is like a fun playground with all the goodies that our little hearts desire. Mac n cheese, taterrr tots, taanachos, grilled cheese, but with TRUFFLE OIL. I felt like a very happy drunk child indeed. I got a sampler of 3 choices (thanks btw for having that on your menu for the indecisive people like me). I got their truffle tots, mac n cheese with bacon and jalepenos (so good!) and fried pickles. I wish you guys made fried pickle chips instead so they wouldn't be so mushy. :( BUT all is forgiven because of the mac cheese and tots AND our wonderful waiter BRITTANY! what a sweetheart! She was patient and attentive and she's a seller! Watch out, she'll know the perfect time to persuade everyone to order a "last round" of jameson shots with pickle backs. AKA 3-4 rounds after...fun!
author: Lisa F.

description:
I came here to watch a Buckeye game with my boyfriend and we both had a great time. We both got a bit tipsy thanks to the bottomless mimosas but managed to sober up a little (just a little) with the help of their delicious truffle tatter tots, chocolate/blueberry pancakes and lobster omelette...yum! 

The bartender was super nice and probably filled up my water at least 10 times without me even asking him too. He even caught us trying to take a selfie and offered to take our pic for us...and that is during a Big Ten game people!! Great service! 

I also loved the eclectic decor and the music was good too. 

We will come back to watch future games :)
author: Esther C.

description: I probably shouldn't have ordered so much food. But I did. Tried pretty much everything Yelp had to recommend. And everything was to die for. The crab tater tots, Reuben egg rolls, the Tot-chos, chicken wings, and mac and cheese were all so goooood! The ambiance was a little too dark for my liking. But I get it, it's a bar. But I could barely see or hear my friend who was sitting across from me. Oh well, we were stuffing our faces with all the good food anyway. Great place to stop by when in the Mission.
author: Dara S.

description: Although the lines can sometimes get long I just buy drinks and (25 cent) wings in bulk and let the good times roll.
author: Chris T.

description:
Tried out this place tonight with my boyfriend and I must say I'm pretty impressed. The place was slowly getting busy and the waitress told us we could sit whenever we would like. The tables are pretty big and the seats are very comfortable. The place is a good open space with a back patio. 

The food there is AMAZING!! We got the tater tot nachos (idk how to spell it), mac n cheese, wings, and grilled cheese sandwich. Boy, they were all really good! I couldn't complain. The service was good as well. The lady kept checking up on us which I liked to see if everything was okay. 

All in all, this place is a must go to on a weekend! Food and drinks are good!
author: Lisa K.

description:
I really REALLY didn't want to like this place.  It has a silly name, and it's in hipster central.  Given my acute allergy to skinny jeans and "ironic" mustaches I just didn't see it working for me.  However, I ended up here with my girlfriend randomly on Sunday night, and was glad we did.  

The space still needs some work (feels weird for lack of a better descriptor), but it was pretty empty so we nearly had the place to ourselves.  The food menu has everything you could possibly want after a long night of drinking, and everything we ordered was fantastic.  The "totchoes" are gloriously hedonistic, and the fried chicken sandwich I had was perfect.  One thing about that sandwich though. They let you choose which sauce to have on the sandwich, the hottest of which is their "Death Sauce", which is a ghost pepper based paste.  Being the capsaicin junkie that I am (it's genetic for Texans like myself) I had to give it a try, and I'm glad I did.  GREAT heat, but with a great flavor as well.  Just know that your stomach will still be burning when you wake up the next morning.

Their cocktail menu was also creative (the Mayhem was great), while the staff there were all really nice and provided great service.  In short, this place is definitely worth braving the mission (and it's hipsters) for, especially if you're a pepperhead like myself.
author: Joshua W.

description: Kim!! Worse Maneger, slams a drink at us that we did not order and make us paid for us!! Really what type of service is that!!
author: Juan-Carlos C.

description:
Weird, divey, chill spot in the Mission.

Came here on a rando Monday night just to check it out/grab a quick bite and drink. Saw the good yelp reviews and peeped some of the pictures of the tater tots, so we decided to give Dr. Teeth a try! Was not disappointed!

Tots a la mayhem - We snagged a plate of these ballin' tater tots with caramelized onions and cheese! So addicting! I would definitely go back just for these.

Mac & Cheese (+Truffle, +Bacon, +$2) - Wicked! Really, with cheese, truffle, and bacon, you can't go wrong. Purely amazing.

Obviously you wouldn't want to come here if you're on the latest diet fad or juice cleanse, but for those of you who don't really care about the grossly high caloric intake likely to occur, then Dr. Teeth is your spot! Oh, and for those who aren't eating, they have strong drinks that will get you buzzin real quick!

Pro Tip: This place is a little grungy and attracts an eclectic crowd. They were also playing a super strange movie while we were there, pretty graphic. So if you're not into that or if that's not your scene, then you probs shouldn't come here.

Worth a visit if you're in the area and want some quick unhealthy eats or quick unhealthy alcoholic drinks!
author: Jason T.

description:
I usually take the food to go since my friends preferred to eat before drinking. I hella hate eating comfort food before drinking because I try to avoid taking a shit at any dive bars in the Mission esp. some bathrooms don't have a lock in the toilet stall or it's just plain piss-flooded dirty. I also can't get drunk fast enough on a full stomach.
  
I really don't care about the drinks but the food was amazing. The garlic tots were hella tasty and rich in the strong garlic flavor. The bison burger was hella juicy too. The mac-n-cheese with truffle and dungeness crab was bomb too. Dr. Teeth is my favorite late night munchies spot to hit up after the bars.
author: Richard C.

description:
I love me some Dr. Teeth! This bar is always abuzz with shenanigans. A little divey with a lot of character, this is one of my Mission staples. 

I love stopping in for Wing Wednesdays, although it gets very crowded--get there early if you can. It's worth it, because the wings are a quarter each and also BOMB. And they have a back patio! There is nothing better than relaxing on patio with a drink in one hand and wing sauce all over your face on a sunny late afternoon in the Mission. 

Dr. Teeth is a catalytic, choose-your-own-adventure type of bar. AND it's across the street from Taqueria Cancun for your late-night taco snackage, which is extremely important to me, and probably to you too. 

How could you NOT want to go?
author: Meredith C.

description:
11-August, Sunday
I was definitely intrigued by the Chicken Sandwich in between a jelly filled donut with tater tots, even in the back of my mind I knew it was probably going to result in a horror story for my digestive tract. In fact, my gut instinct was right which I should of went with instead of punishing it.

I washed this garbage down with a foul tasting classic bloody Mary that was more artificial mixer than merry.

It is impossible to hear anything in this space,
The service is painfully slow even though it was not that busy once we had arrived,
And the kitschy decorum did not even make the slightest sense, whimsical steam-punk? Not even.

Initially I tried not to be too harsh by judging this place solely off of the name (but perhaps I should have!)
It seems like this place is working for a lot of people though (judging by the reviews), but it is definitely a world outside of my taste level..
author: Ty T.

description: Came here for the wing madness on Wednesday night. The wings are amazing here... your mouth will be watering!!
author: Kylie M.

description:
I looked danger in the eye at Dr. Teeth and the Electric Mayhem, and I blinked first. I was too much of a chicken to try their peanut butter, jelly and bacon burger. Why? I can't say. I love peanut butter, I love jelly, I'm a human being so I must LOVE bacon, but yet...my palette said no...

"You are not yet ready."

Four days later I was ready and it's one of the best damn burgers in the city. Between the fried pickles, the tater tot bar, the flowing drinks and fun crowd, this is one of my favorite places in the Mission.

Two pieces of feedback for the owners...

1) Get a hostess. The hardest part about visiting your restaurant is that it's always full and there's no rhyme or reason to getting your seat. So there's always a competition between you and the three other parties all looking to be served who are hovering over the eating customers and all waiting to pounce on the next open table. It's pretty frustrating, especially when you've been waiting the longest, but someone else was in closer proximity to the table when it opened. Even a sign-up sheet would fix this problem, and improve the experience for everyone.

2) If you're going to have a trivia night, get a better microphone/sound system. Half your patrons aren't playing and they're all yakking, and the host has the world's quietest microphone, so everyone's annoyed on trivia night. A better microphone would make this event a lot more viable.
author: Kevin B.

description:
This is my new favorite place to brunch. The atmosphere was very inviting and the people were nice. My friends and I congregated her last sunday and it was an experience to remember. Our bartender was friendly and attentive. She was nice enough to cater to my friends and I especially cause were pretty dickish when we are together. She kinda reminded me of a sexier Donna from That 70's Show. The drinks kept coming before I had time to think to myself "Hey, I can see the bottom of my mimosa glass". 

The decor seems t be fitting with the new gentrified mission. The music was excellent, everything from Bobby Brown to Hall and Oates. After reaching a satisfying level of inebriation I toured the facilities and I was pleasantly surprised to find a multi-leveled back yard patio area. The people out back were enjoying the sun and enjoying their smokes while a small television had the sports game showing. It kinda felt like how I imagine highschool would of been with the degenerate smokers at the bottom level and the preppy varsity jocks and cheerleaders playing cornhole  at the very top of the pyramid. 

The food I had was excellent. I had the crab tater tots (tater tots covered with REAL crab) and the Crab omelette (again with real crab). They were very generous with the amount of crab given. It tasted divine and I didn't share with my friends because I'm a horrible human being. My friend came by with some egg tarts from a neighboring shop and the bar was cool enough not to prevent him from eating it. 

The patrons seemed like cool folks. I was able to chat with them for a few minutes and not feel like they were being assholes or felt that they wanted me to leave them alone. Which says a lot because I talk to myself and sometimes and wish I could leave myself alone.

I plan on loving this place like one would with a woman they cant really approach because she meets more than every expectation you have set for a woman. Coming by every once in awhile because she makes an excellent companion to hang out with and my friends like her. She kinda looks homely from the outside but when you get to see what is inside her do you realize you have something special. Plus she has crabs and is generous with it.
author: Robert gene R.

description:
Good place for $5 watered down well drinks. $3 bottle or can beers from 3-7pm. Monday Burger and a drink for $10 and the burgers are good. Tuesday is taco Tuesday $2 and Wednesday is wing Wednesday for $0.25. I forget what Thursday is. 

My only problem is that it's very dark inside and the 3 times I've come here the tables have been sticky, once we came in at 4pm when they opened and the table were dirty from the night before. They have a BIG variety of bar food it's really good, fried and greasy good. My suggestion is come early (4pm) to get a seat and enjoy your happy hour otherwise the hipsters will be hawkin you waiting for you to leave staring at you. Look out if you go later than 6pm people get sloppy drunk. Also parking does not exist if you come late. And remember it's the Mission. You natives know what I'm talking about.
author: Roxanne O.

description: I think I ate here? I definitey know I drank here....yes, I did eat here. I got the wings. They were awesome. I did not know that they sold pitcher-sized drinks (to share of course). That is amazing, and was amazing the night (or nights?) that I went (have been?). Great atmosphere, not too hipster-y from what I can remember. Fun place (and cool name)
author: David S.

description: It's decent.  Thought the wings were fine. Probably a fun weekend evening bar with a bunch of friends.  Has that vibe. Still searching for the best chicken wings/bar in SF and East Bay.
author: Amy Y.

description:
Culinary contradictions.

Not often you'll find me preferring pancake wrapped pork sausage over a homemade veggie burger. This is one such case. Excellent former. Just OK latter.

Likely influenced by the use of bursting at the seams flavor of Showdogs sausage. It's so good. Pancake shell was brilliant. Four to a $7 order. Split 'em.

Veggie burger was also brilliant. At least the color purple. Otherwise a bit bland. Perhaps overshadowed by the sour cream, cheese and guacamole covered tater tots.

Tot-Chos are a really thing. And too good for my own good. One bite turned into five.

Drip coffee is hyped but failed to see the draw for $4.

Back patio is great for early afternoon brunch relaxing. Prepare to share the space with people playing highly competitive drinking games. It is a bar after all.

Which is probably when they'll earn their fourth star. Food was good but also $20/person with minimal table service. Have to order at the bar. And get your coffee refills.

On the upside that made it easier to avoid Tot-Cho refills. There might have been another round.
author: Jason B.

description:
Went for happy hour. They don't put the beer into glass cups for you; they leave them in the aluminum cans.

The selection was good, the location was good (one of my first times in the Mission), and the shuffle board was fun.

I had a bit of tater tots with crab meat on them. Not bad for junk food.
author: M W.

description:
I've come during happy hour and during the nighttime prowl. It's a cool place to be at although on one of the random Thursday nights, it was pretty empty. At least we got ourselves a table and we were actually able to talk to each other :)

For food, get some garlic tatertots! We ordered the one with crab on them but the tatertots are what won me over! I didn't need the crab on there. It comes out super hot and crispy. Mmmmm. 

As for drinks, you can order pitchers of Moscow mule or sangria. We did both between 5 people during happy hour. 

They also have a lot of specialty cocktails. I recommend the blackberry fizz!
author: Connie Y.

description:
I love Dr. Teeth! 
The staff is always really friendly, the drinks are delicious and they have food! 
I've been here on different days and times of the week and I am always able to find a place for me and my friends.

The only few downsides are:
-the drinks are a little pricy (although delicious, especially the tequila smash)
-the michelada is not at all authentic and kind of confusing
author: Jessica S.

description: It is Tuesday Trivia night but no trivia. Friendly staff, really loud and hard to hear conversations at the same table. The $1 tacos are nice and the veggie one is a happy surprise really good with beets and greens. Will come again, it seems like there is something going on  here most nights of the week.
author: Jacqueline S.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night, bravely ignoring the Yelp mobile app's warning that this place was popular with 20-somethings. Indeed, it was a little too popular with 20-somethings; it was packed to the gills and uncomfortably loud, at least for my posse of 30- and 29-year-olds. There was nowhere to stand, let alone sit, and I can't really conceive of what ordering food and eating it could possibly be like. It reminded me of this hard-partying co-ed frat house from college.

Also: the back patio, which is spacious and nice, closes at like 10. 

There is in fact shuffleboard, but there's only one. There was also that beanbag toss game, the appeal of which I don't understand, on the patio. And yeah, there was only one bathroom, which is like, a public health and safety fail to me.

I can imagine that it's more pleasant when it's less loud and crowded such that it's possible to have a conversation with your companions and maybe discern if there's a menu of food and beverages available. When I went, it was too much of a shitshow. I mean, we managed to get some beers (PBRs and Sierra Nevadas, I think?) and a mediocre Moscow Mule that came not in a copper cup.

On my way out, I was headbutted by a drunk person on my SHIN. I don't even know how that could be possible.
author: Sylvia C.

description:
The manmosa or whatever it was that I got here was delicious! Beer and fresh squeezed OJ - sign me up!

Their food was pretty good too - crab and spicy sauce on tater tots YUM!

It was pretty crowded at 6:30 on a Friday (no surprise) but we were lucky and found some seats. They have a cool patio out back too. 

Sadly, no signs of the Muppets and pals here.
author: Aneilia M.

description:
I can't attest to how good the food was since we didn't have any, but the group next to us looked like they had a good spread.

The drinks were great though! The bartender did an awesome job with our Obey Jose's. I think the best part was the shuffleboard. That was the main reason our group came here after Cha3. Will definitely come back for the good service and shuffleboard fun!
author: Liz G.

description:
Went for the brunch last Saturday with a friend.

1/2 a star for the doorman who, upon entering the establishment was incredibly rude to me about the wait and made that the first point to make alongside if I had the livingsocial deal, it was being honored for the rest of the year, not just up until the 22nd of April.  Okay, thanks!  Well, I'll wait, thank you.  Didn't ask for my name, just put down 2.  I went back to him (big sigh and roll of eyes) to give him my NAME.

1/2 a star for the fact that I was drugged by someone while I was there (a total of 2 hours and a bit) as my friend who was with me noticed a complete change in character and I dropped off the radar in a matter of seconds, needed to be taken to the taxi and I spent the rest of the evening in and out of consciousness, following all the patterns of being drugged (not going into details). 

No, this was not a matter of drinking too much because we had about a total of 5 4 oz. mimosas each.  My friend, pretty cool.  Me, off the radar, unresponsive, blacked out, vomiting, etc.  

Don't recommend this place.   I'm scarred and who knows who else as well...

I just happened to be SO lucky as to have someone with me to save me when I needed the help before it was too late!
author: Maddy B.

description:
The title is a bit off-putting at first glance; who loves going to the dentist??  And even after the sketch walk all the way from the 16th Street BART down Mission - once you walk inside, you know you found the right place.

One of only a few places in the Bay Area to actually have a shuffleboard, hordes of loud-mouthed men congregate around the long table spilled with sand after a hard day's work, hooting and hollering in their fancy shirts and ties as they try their hand each at shoving the little marker down the fairway.  What?  Oh, I'm not really a fan of the game, can you tell?  I prefer my games with a little violence and a lot of questing thrown in.

Aside from the shuffleboard and the crazy hipsters and yuppies it attracts, the bar itself is a nice one - wooden accents, mood lighting (which I love), and a place that serves fairly decent grub to go with your poison of the day.  The music's not too bad either, depending on who the bartender is that day that has control of the holy iPod of Antioch.  (what?  you didn't get my joke?  you suck)

I may find myself there again in the near future, with another possible after party at Casanova or Thieves.  Come join me and my crew.
author: Lorrayne L.

description:
This is a review for their Wednesday wings special! I have known about this place for a long time but have not had the chance to stop by because I live in San Jose. Fortunately, my current rotation is at SFGH which is a few blocks from here. It was packed when we got there at 7pm but luckily it was only my friend and me. We found a spot on the fake grass outside and semi-picnic'd it. 

We ordered some wings and they came out really fast! I was expecting a long wait since there were so many people and it must have been hard to find us but nope, wings came out fast and hot and delicious. We ordered the Mango Habanero and the dry wings and the sauce had a great, spicy but sweet flavor. My friend said she ordered Death before and it was so spicy, she was only able to handle one bite. She is able to eat spicy food so just a warning... beware if you aren't able to take the heat! There are also $4 Jameson shots and $3 PBR's so it's one of the best HH's I have been to!
author: Elizabeth V.

description:
Good bar food, drinks, beer selection... and close to work.  Awesome.  I have gone to this place consistently for about a year and I have had a great time every time. You can go on slower days and enjoy your drink and food without trying to find a spot to drink and eat.  Wednesday and $0.25 wing days... it is a VERY busy day to go, so bring your patience or make sure you get some friend to arrive early to save a spot for you and your friends as well as place an order.  Once the order is paced, food come out pretty fast. 

Another very awesome thing about this business is that they support local nonprofit organizations.  YOU GUYS ROCK!
author: Amelia M.

description: Went here last night and had a blast! LOVE the wings. totchos, mac & cheese and the drinks were DELISH! Great vibe.. someone for everyone!
author: Miriam B.

description:
ONE WORD: TOTCHOS. 

Nothing pairs better with their house cocktails, maybe a side of Death Sauce and 25 cent wings on Wednesday nights. (If you're feeling smart, or like a smart-ass, come on Tuesday nights for trivia.)
author: Auburn S.

description:
I did not expect this place to be as good as it was during my visit. In a city where most meals are over priced, Dr. Teeth provides a ton of food without breaking the bank account. Here's what I ordered:

Banana Bread French Toast
- Dense, delicious, and perfect for the sweet tooth. I was only able to eat half of it b/c it was so filling.

Fried Chicken Eggs Benedict
- Hollandaise sauce smothered over a perfectly poached egg on top of a piece of flavorful fried chicken on top of a slice of Canadian bacon on top of an English muffin. Enough said.

Coffee
- No joke, I've found my new favorite cup of coffee in the city. At $4 it's pricey for a regular cup, but boy is it tasty. No acidity, just full on roasted goodness.

If you're around the area, check it out. You might just find a new brunch spot.
author: Alfonzo J.

description:
¡$0.25 WING WEDNESDAYS! 
I'm a sucker for wings.. and even worse when it comes to cheap wings - so I had to try dr.teeth once I was in sf again. The results are as follows:

Go early.. or late? I'm not exactly sure when the deal starts, but there seems to be a crowd at all hours of the night - but fear not, the wait is worthwhile. This is a casual kind of dining experience - you seat yourselves.. Correction, you fight for the seats with a bunch of hungry wing-scavengers when a table leaves. It doesn't get bloody, but if you're shy.. you'll never get a table. 

The wings : we ordered 80 wings
I was in a group of 7 - so the amount was sufficient, we also had an assortment of tots and other fried bits. The wings - we ordered with three kinds of sauces: buffalo, BBQ, and habanero chili - I loved all three. The buffalo had a kick to it, the habanero was more of a sweet and salty assortment, the BBQ was good old fashioned barbecue. 

I liked the seating in the outside patio better than the indoor seating - there are games on the upper decks for you to pass time with. 

Really good experience- even with the wait and all. Great for small groups, wing lovers and wholesome people altogether. DEFINITELY coming back again.
author: Anna C.

description:
A very eclectic bar in the Mission district, but definitely a cool spot. We went for happy hour and sat at the bar for a few drinks. There was a decent beer selection along with some other specialty drinks. I had a Franzikaner and then an Arnold Palmer that was very good. We also ordered some sweet potato fries which were cooked to perfection and served with some bangin' sauce. I'm not sure what the sauce was exactly, but it reminded me of duck sauce, with a sweet and tangy flavor.

They also have a shuffleboard table, which I thought was pretty unique. I liked it. Check it out.
author: Maryclaire H.

description: Great place in mission. Crazy concept but it works food was great, the apps where fantastic. Drinks were good and the wait staff amazing never missing a beat in service. Always coming to check up on you I mean just on point with the craziness that was occurring when we were there.
author: Elfego S.

description:
25 cent wings on Wednesdays with purchase of beer? Such a good deal. They give you some legit wings too. The habanero wings are my favorite since they have a slight sweetness to them. Buffalo is a close second, but I don't care much for the BBQ. Don't underestimate the wings, 5-6 can fill me up easily. My group of four shared a plate of 30 wings (3 guys + 1 girl) - we all left satisfied! 

Come early because this place gets packed.
author: Michelle L.

description: Good wings and atmosphere. Who needs more? Okay so it's in a kinda scary part of town. That just makes it more of an adventure. We ordered the habanero and buffalo style and both were excellent. Totchos (tater tot nachos), well, I get it, especially if one has the munchies. Wings were served with blue cheese (yay) and cooked perfectly. They place has a good vibe, all sorts of people enjoying their day, which is what its all about. Beer was cheap, service was great. Great happy hour choice.
author: Gee L.

description:
Parking is tough in the area, but it always is.  The place has friendly bartenders and well made drinks.  They have a menu of cocktails and a subset of them you can order in pitchers for sharing which is actually quite nice.  There's a smaller beer selection if you prefer to go that way, but it works out fine.

Something I don't see very often is their Dickle and Pickle (whiskey w/ a pickle juice chaser...yea don't hate till you try it).

There's a patio area that can be nice if the weather is good and a shuffle board as well as a number of TVs showing sports.  Overall it's a pretty chill place to hang out and have a few drinks with friends.  My friends mentioned that later on in the evenings it gets packed like sardines in a can packed.  We went earlier in the evening and it seemed just right.  Oh yea did I mention they have Jameson on tap?  Yup, on tap.  Pretty cool.
author: David K.

description:
I don't really understand what's going on with this place, but I really want to play shuffle board here eventually.

Had some drinks and a meh veggie burger, which is probably my fault for ordering the veggie burger. It was super crowded on a Thursday night but the bartenders helped us snag a table after a while so we could eat sitting down. The bartenders were super friendly and helpful.
author: Tasha D.

description:
First off, the "shot" you get with the LS brunch voucher (Fernet) is probably the worst thing I have ever put in my body...It tastes like Jager mixed with peppermint and stale coffee. Don't drink it, secondly They waitress we had, had the audacity to ask for more of a tip. I had already tipped 12% on the original receipt BEFORE the deal was applied ($69.00). I have NEVER been asked for more of a tip. It's not so much that she gave us bad service, our food came on time, but it just wasn't a 15% tip day for her, mainly because she was nowhere to be found when we wanted to leave.

A note to be wary of with this place, I don't know if it is always like this but, be prepared for a loud atmosphere. If you are expecting a Sunday brunch where you can sit and talk with friends don't come here. This place is almost like continuing the party from the night previously as there is screaming, shouting and all-in-all a lot of noise pollution.

I wouldn't say that this place is "bad" it has good food, and okay service, but that shot in the beginning ruined my entire meal. and so did the waitress who asked for more money.
author: Shawn S.

description:
This place was very underwhelming. Not only did it have little to with the Muppets but the food is lack luster and artery hardening. If I am going to have a heart attack from my food, I want it to be worth it for my taste buds. 

The drinks themselves were also kind of boring and the staff took their sweet time serving my friends and I. 

All in all, I rate this place a "meh."
author: Andrew K.

description:
4 words: 25 cent wing Wednesdays.

Great place for happy hour, good drink specials, the food is good for the most part, and the back patio is great to hang out in on a nice sunny day.

The bar staff is always friendly and accommodating when splitting checks.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Delicious, packed, loud, it's a combination of a lot of different elements and lots of types of people. Work's most of the time, but not always. 

FOOD:

Pretty delicious, the wings are awesome on Wednesdays for 25 cents, and everything I've had for brunch has been super solid. 

ENVIRONMENT:

This is probably the main reason I'm taking points off. It can be a cool crowd, and you definitely are going to have a better time if you come early with a big group of friends. The only problem with that, is everyone comes early with THEIR big group of friends. Additionally, the bouncer doesn't seem to stop people from coming in until they're jammed to the door. It definitely can feel like BART during rush hour, and does more often than not. Brings an eclectic crowd,

SERVICE:

Can be pretty slow at times, more so when it's packed as stated above. The bartenders are pretty solid though.
author: Patrick T.

description:
This place was pretty cool! First thing that stood out were the pitchers of mixed cocktails. Second, the tator tot bar (we got the tatchos!), the truffle tots were also delish!

We came here on a Thursday and sat outside since it was a really nice SF day! The waitress was friendly and came back frequently to check on us during the beginning though she was definitely harder to find as the place got more packed.

My fave pitchers of cocktails were the John Daly and Moscow Mule. 

I keep seeing all these mentions of jameson on tap which i must have totally missed when I went but guess that's just another reason to go back!
author: Nadia L.

description:
One of the only places in the mission where the bartenders and doorman are friendly.

Loved the atmosphere, good beer selection and and the prices were friendly to the young hipster pocketbook.

Also, they accept credit cards, which appears rare for the mission bar scene.

A definite stop.
author: Jennifer S. C.

description:
Grapefruit vodka jam...cocktail-- holy smokes!  They make a good kamikaze too!  They've got beer and whiskey, on tap!!! 

Service = friendly.  

Prices = moderate 

Overall I'd be back.   Funky name and all. (Muppets band reference)

We had their sliders and tots... Good tots.  :)
author: Fannie S.

description:
Dr. Teeth is our group's go-to place for Tuesday Trivia.  The trivia host is hilarious and it's always a fun evening.

Food and drinks are reasonably priced.  Order the tachos.

If you enjoy finishing your night with a little hookah, visit Arabia Nights just a few doors down.
author: Brian M.

description: Extremely delicious wings!!!! Love it, can get any better that this. Although the brunch on Sunday totally let me down. I went with 5 friends which had to wait about 40mins to place the order. All of them except me had the mimosas and to be honest it was very low budget. Using plastic cups and taking forever to refill, plus every time the waitress came by with a pitcher to refill it looked more orange than the last time, meaning that they were putting more OJ on the mimosas. I ordered the Basic Egg Benedict with home fried and frankly it was exactly that, BASIC. It was the last plate at the table and 2 of my friends had already finished when my food came. It didn't had the home fried but tater tots and the plating of everyone in the table was vague, no passion dedicated at all. In conclusion this wings are by far the best I've tried in SF but for the brunch, I can keep on going without trying it again. Keep up the good work WINGS people.
author: Francisco Javier B.

description:
Happy Hour (.25 wings) on Wednesday is the shit.
The servers are the shit.
The bartenders are the shit.
The backyard patio is the shit.
Plus, the food is NOT shit. In fact, I heard brunch is awesome.

On another note, I'm glad my dad doesn't read my reviews. *CHEESE*
author: Diane N.

description:
Me: "YAH I THINK I'LL HAVE A DOZEN DEATH WINGS FOR ME AND MY FRIENDS" 

bartender: have you had them here before...?

Me (clearly inebriated): "NOBUTIAMSPICY AND YOU ARE WHAT YOU EAT AMIRITE?"

bartender: (look of disapproval) nobody eats more than a couple, ever. (followed by more looks of disapproval)


She was right. Nobody eats more than a couple. 1 wing is more than enough to make you hate your decision, and stomping mad, while you're at it. Hold on for dear life to your shitty PBR, you're going to drink the whole thing, and wish it was milk. Painful exit the next morning is sure to follow.

Truffle tater tots are totally awesome though.
author: Ben T.

description:
As an avid Yelper, I'm not sure how much I trust this app after my experience here. A group of 4 of us came here for Sunday brunch. Most places around the time and day we went would be busy, so we were expecting that. We found a seat and our orders were taken relatively quickly. The outdoor patio in the back is great and we were lucky to have found a table out there. We ended up waiting two hours for our food. We were so damn hungry that we had very low standards at this point.  So I ordered the burrito that was supposed to come with chili/meat. A basic ass burrito would have satisfied me. What did I get? A tortila with eggs and tater tots. After telling our server that I didn't order this weak excuse for a burrito, she told me that they ran out of the other ingredients. Isn't that something you tell a customer before you make the food? Or at least when you hand it to them? Two of us ordered the burrito so 1/2 of us didn't eat bcus we were not about to pay $11 for tortilla with egg and potatoes when Taqueria Cancun was down the street. They also managed to mess up the remainder of the meals they didn't already totally mess up. 
Needless to say, this place is great if you like wasting your time and money.

And while I'm still confused about why this place has such great reviews, I'm guessing it's because everyone who wrote a review was drunk so their standards were probably even lower than mine.
author: Paulina T.

description:
Any bar named after a Muppet band automatically gets 4 stars. Having Jameson on tap, another 3 stars. An eclectic menu of comfort food/gourmet appetizers- including  wild boar corn dogs,  sweet potato tator tots, and eggroll reuben- another 4 stars. 

OK- that's 11. This is a Spinal Tap rating! Animal would approve.
author: Lisa R.

description:
I love, love, love this place on Tues nights for their Taco Tuesday dollar tacos and half price margaritas, and Wed nights for their 25c chicken wings. This place has been packed every night I've been there, so I'm glad it's finally warm enough to sit outside in the back.

I've had their chicken, fish, and veggie tacos and they are all winners but the fish tacos really take the cake. The margaritas used to be better with the old bartender - he would make fancy stuff with cucumber or strawberries, but last time I went the bartender only made standard but mediocre ritas which were not very strong. 

The wings are delicious. We usually get 20-30 or so for 2 people of the chili habanero, buffalo and bbq wings. They don't allow you to take any extra ones home with you, so if you order way too many the way I usually do, bring a little container with you to take the leftovers - they are great reheated in the oven or toaster oven. 

DO NOT under any circumstances order the death wings unless you like being in intense pain - I love spicy food but honestly they should not even be on the menu; they are not fit to eat. After eating one, I thought my head was going to explode and I couldn't speak for nearly 10 minutes. Nothing could cool me down, it was too intense! Then on the way home my stomach got totally messed up and I suffered for 2-3 days. Bad news. Stick with the non-lethal wings!
