Another thing I love about this place is their tater tot bar! I've had the tots with cheese, caramelized onions and russian dressing, and it was so good I decided to recreate it for Superbowl Sunday this year. Excellent combo of flavors. The only other thing I've had from their regular menu is the jalapeno poppers, and they were just ok. My quest for the perfect popper continues...

All in all, this is a decent weeknight happy hour spot and I'll keep coming back. I like the food and  the crowd.
author: Jen R.

description:
Super fun and awesome food. I mean, how can you say no to TOTCHOS!? Yes. Tator tots with guac, cheese, and just greasy heaven. They surprised me with their spaghetti and meatballs. Who gets pasta at a bar!? Me. And it was shockingly delicious and al dente :)

They have an outdoor patio which is always awesome on a sunny day!
author: Michelle K.

description: Sweet potato tater tots !!! Tots are my favorite thing about this place. So yummy and always fresh. I came here last Friday and I feel like the burgers have changed a bit. The first time I came here I got the Dr teeth burger and it was delicious. I have also tried the lone star which is really great. Friday, I had the pulled pork sandwich and it wasn't up to par. Still, I think this is a great spot to enjoy a beer and a meal with your friends. Definitely a spot for younger crowds. If you don't mind the noise level and the crowd, good place to try out ! Also, the happy hour deals !
author: Hae Rim H.

description: Awesome place to grab a drink and chill
author: Sam N.

description:
Wow! 

We had great service and awesome food and drinks. Stopped by around 9pm on a Wednesday and got a table right away. The drink menu had lots of yummy options. I opted for the Blackberry Fix and was very happy. Lots of crushed blackberries! 

The menu had so many options that the four of us couldn't choose so we went "tapas" style and ordered a bunch of goodies. 

Bacon and fried egg grilled cheese sandwich w/ tomato soup--- amazing. If you like breakfast sandwiches you will love this.

Reuben egg rolls. Holy crap these were amazing and I don't even like reubens. GET THESE!

Tot-chos. Yummy. Tater tots with sour cream, cheese, onions, olives and jalapenos. Yes.

Tots mayhem style. Woah. Tater tots covered in grilled onions and Russian dressing. Probably our favorite thing all night. Sounds simple but it's smacks! 

Meatball parmesan slider and Reuben sliders. Very good.

Corn dogs made with sausage and three types of mustard dipping sauces. Hells yeah! 

Our waitress was excellent and talked to us about butter and cheese. Prices were great. All four of us ate all of these goodies plus drinks and tip for $100! We will definitely be back! 

We love mayhem!
author: Audrey Jean T.

description:
This restaurant makes me want to throw up. It's like, you take all the trendy people in San Francisco and throw them into this restaurant where they can gossip about who drank the most PBR the night before. Plaid, plaid, plaid.

Besides the overwhelming hipster vibe, the food is very decent. My boyfriend and I wanted to try the spiciest sauce they had and we disliked it. It wasn't even tasty spicy; it tasted like pure chemicals. The rest of the food was VERY sub par and the service was even worse. If you're going to be serving buffalo wings and spicy food to your customers, I don't think it's unreasonable to fill water glasses on the regular. The mixed drinks were pretty good and the bar was large but it still took longer than necessary for a drink. 

I don't think I'll be back.
author: Tommy C.

description: As someone who's worked in the service industry, I can say, even for a dive bar this fu**ing sucks. I used to come here all the time and after the staff changed over it's been a shit show. This place used to be my go to spot, but it's severely deteriorated in the past few months.
author: Evan P.

description:
Awesome bar!  Nice staff, good cheap drinks, cool atmosphere and the patio in the back was pretty chill. 
Food was good too ;)
author: Ashley G.

description:
My friends and I went to Mayhem on a Saturday afternoon for brunch. Our party of 5 would have to wait 45 minutes... No big deal. I didn't expect to be seated right away. Time goes by and 2 people in our party decide to venture off and go eat elsewhere. So we change our party to 3. This is where the FUN begins!

The girl asks us if we mind sitting out back where it might be cold. We stupidly accept the offer because we are starving! So we get taken to the back and lo and behold a table with two WOBBLY AS FUCK chairs and three chairs just standing around waiting to be broken. She asks ME to grab one and I get one that looks like it was picked up at a yard sale. I'm thinking - where the eff am I? Am I getting paid for this? This is NOT my job. I'm hungry so I think "Whatever, I'll sit here." and just grab the damn chair. 

Server is nice and we get the bottomless mimosas and all. Are they good? Hell no. Nasty and watered down. For the food I got the Mission Scramble and my friends got the sliders and some other plate I don't remember. My food was not great,  and the eggs tasted undercooked. Best part of my meal? The tater tots (thankfully!)

Anyways, the reasons I'm giving this place a two is not only because the table/seating area was shitty, the food was nothing special, and the mimosas were watered down, but also because of the HORRIBLE experience it was to sit out back. 

We were sitting there attempting to enjoy a meal when we begin to notice BLACK STUFF in our drinks. Where could it be coming from? OH! The motherFUCKING people right up next to us SMOKING like there's no tomorrow! Management allows this sort of thing? I understand the smoking part, but hello, common sense people. You have paying customers who do NOT smoke just trying to get through a meal WITHOUT eating/drinking cigarette ash! So I even ask my server and the guy refilling drinks for new drinks - COMPLETELY IGNORED ME. My server looked at me like I asked her to perform brain surgery. Instead of bringing me a new cup of water or mimosa, she brought us the bill. Fuggin' joke.

I seriously do not understand the appeal of this place and the 5-star reviews. 

Never coming back here again. And congrats to those who like nasty mimosas, bland food, and sit out back eating/drinking cigarette ash! CONGRATS for liking crappy places and having low standards.
author: Arnold B.

description: A cool place with weird stuff on the wall. They have a full bar, food and beers on tap. If you're looking for a hipster bar,  a dive bar, a sports bar, or just a good shuffleboard table,  this place fits the bill. A fun place for anyone!
author: Joe S.

description: $2 PBR tall boys and 25 cent wings on Wednesdays are a great value. The bar was super busy even before 6 o'clock on Wednesday. You'll definitely want to come earlier to grab seats. The only downside is there are only have two single occupancy restrooms.
author: Susana T.

description:
25 cent wings on Wednesday is a great reason to come to Dr. Teeth. If you come make sure you reserve a table because you can, which doesn't make sense to me at all. I got there before 5:30 ordered drinks, wings, tot-chos, mac n cheese, and then proceeded to find a place to sit. 

The place was packed inside with one large table reserved. Found a spot outside and bummed it at a table that was reserved for 6. Ate the food and kept looking out for the person that was going to come and claim the table. What I noticed was everyone walking outside was trying to stake out a table that was leaving. It sucks not to have a place to sit and eat. 

Guy came at 5:55 and asked if we were going to be there any longer and I said we were finishing up, just trying to get some boxes.

Apparently they don't give boxes out on a Wednesday. Makes sense since people can order a ton of wings for a quarter and leave, but I didn't have any wings. I'm trying to pack these tots to go! I ended up tossing half the tots and the mac n cheese. What a waste... I wanted to try it all. 

So in short, come on a Wednesday, reserve a table, and bring lots of friends.
author: Larry H.

description: Great deals on drinks, good bar food, and an outdoor patio. What more could a lady ask for?
author: Katey W.

description:
Came here on a Monday night. It was "full" without being overflowing but despite the 49ers game being on I got a couple of seats. The wait staff are incredibly friendly and nice, and gave me excellent service. We had a couple of sandwiches with their house tater tots and while the regular ones were fine I thought the sweet potato ones were tastier. The beer is served in jelly jars.

Overall a solid place, with a very white Mission crowd. Would go back.
author: Jordan C.

description:
This is a review of the bar only. 

We stopped in for a quick drink while wandering around the mission. It was about 5/5:30pm on a Saturday and the place was pretty empty. We sat at the bar and ordered a beer (which they serve in mason jars, how cute!). The bartender was very friendly and chatted with us for a little bit. 

They don't have a lot of beers on tap, but the bar had a great liquor selection so maybe cocktails are more their thing.

I'd happily come back
author: Rachel E.

description:
Ok, my boyfriend and I went here for the Living Social brunch. The deal was $25 for two brunch entrees, two shots of fernet, two bottomless mimosas. 

First, the wait was FOREVER. That happens at popular places, but the host seemed totally out of his depth. He was simultaneously flustered and overwhelmed, yet he spent most of his time in the back of the restaurant chatting with patrons. He sat people out of order occasionally too. Not a great start to the morning. 

They were generous with the mimosas, which were strong even if they didn't taste great. The real disappointment was the eggs benedict. The egg was rubbery and the english muffin was cold. THEY DIDNT EVEN TOAST THE ENGLISH MUFFIN. How is that possible?? In an eggs benedict? It was game over from there, Dr. Teeth's couldn't recover. They ended the meal by bringing us the Fernet, which made no sense either. I was already tipsy on 3 or 4 mimosas, why would they bring a shot at the end? 

There was one saving grace: The Tater Tots. Mmmm MM they know how to make those. Just writing about them makes me want some sweet fried potato in my belly. 


1 star for service, entree, and fairly douchey crowd. 

2 star for strong drinks and crispy tater tots. Might come back for a game night sometime, but definitely not brunch.
author: Claire G.

description: Still 5 stars. Tried the tater tots topped with garlic and crab. Holy crap so good. Took awhile to come out but it was worth the wait. We were there on a Wednesday so she notified me wings were 25 cents each. Nice up selling! Ill take 8. Love this place. Drank a load of IPAs.
author: Marty J.

description:
Came here on a Wednesday and it was super crowded !!!

Tried 3 flavors and they were super CHEAP ! 25 cents each. 

Best Flavor Sweet chili wings !! Personally, i would not bother ordering other flavors.
- BBQ was meh....
- buffalo Wild wing was meh....

Ordered a light beer in a Mason Jar with a piece of orange ( forgot what it was called  :(   )     pretty good 

Pretty good here, would definitely come back
author: Swifty L.

description:
I can not believe how much I looooove greasy bar food from Dr. Teeth & the Electric Mayhem!

Been here a couple of times, once when it was completely dead inside. It's really weird and a little scary honestly because it's dark, people look at you funny and you have no idea who is working here and who isn't.
Another night, when it was ridiculously, crazy packed. I got super lucky, friends were holding a seat for me or else I would've been standing FOREVER.

Now, I have no idea who can resist the bar food here because all want to do is eat and drink. Mac and cheese, hell yeah, add the bacon and truffle! If I could live on a diet of bacon and truffle/truffle oil, I would have no regrets. Tastes hella good!
Also got the reuben egg rolls, how are these so freaking good? It's like a little mulatto (I mean this in the nicest way possible to my mixed ethnic peeps.) that just knew everything it ever wanted to be in life. Good!
I thought the tater tots were good but meh, they're tater tots, it's not some form of crazy experimental modern food form. Just some deep fried potatoes.
Wash all of it down with multiple cold and refreshing drinks. Eat again!

With all this said, I would definitely come back for:
1) Death Wings- I don't want to be bleeding on the inside but one must wonder just how spicy.
2) Brunch.
3) Mo mac n cheese!

Enjoy!
author: Winè C.

description:
As far as bars go, Dr. Teeth & The Electric Mayhem is just as good as any other. Whenever I pass by, they're usually stuffed to the gills. This being the weekend after Thanksgiving and early in the evening, it was noticeably quieter. 

My friends and I managed to snag the table near the front, which has a couch and several bar stools, and a nice view of the sidewalk and all of the passersby. Admittedly, I'm not much of a drinker anymore, but I decided to indulge and imbibe in an adult beverage.

I ordered a Blackberry Fix (or is it Fizz?). It was $10 (a bit steep), but it was tasty. It consisted of Skyy vodka, crushed blackberries, lemon juice, and a big blackberry for a garnish. There's another ingredient, perhaps elderflower?, to give it some sweetness.

For all of my fellow foodies, Dr. Teeth seems to have an extensive menu of bar food taken up a notch. They have appetizers, sandwiches, salads, tater tots (!) ... the list continues. On this particular evening, I was stuffed with Thai food, so I will have to try their cuisine at a later date.

Someone told me that there's an outdoor patio, but I'm a wuss when it comes to the brisk SF nights. I much prefer to sip my cocktail in the warmth of the interior.

Apparently, this place hosts SF Vegan Drinks but (as usual), I totally missed the boat. They'll be on hiatus until January. Unfortunate, but I'm sure I will cope, somehow.

If nothing else, I will just be counting down the months until I can indulge in vegan treats and rub elbows with like-minded veg-heads.
author: Brandi W.

description:
Real food. No bs, straightforward fatty goodness, all to be washed done with selections from the more than impressive cocktail menu.

And if that wasn't good enough, there's the death burger. 6,000,000 scoville units of ghost pepper fuelled madness. I won't lie, I cried, but it was delicious and I'll be back to try the death wings.
author: Michael A.

description: I have gone here before many times and have had great experiences I recently went and had a negative experience. I waited 20 mins for the female bartender with short black hair and tats on her arms to serve me i had my money out too. She served the girl next to me gave me eye contact and continued to ignore me and help other new people that were walking in. The only difference that I could see with the people she served and me was that they were not asian. I would have left, but I was with friends. Left a negative vibe for me and sad to think people can be so lame.
author: Willow P.

description: Doc didn't have to pull my teeth to get me to eat here! One look at the darkly disturbed interior deco & I felt hungry, thirstin' and at home. Our Nurse Amelia (5+stars) made wonderful recommendations regarding drinks & eats. She was like Novacain on a toothache! Great call on the Tatchos Amel! 4 outta 5 dentist recommend Tatchos for gingivitis:)
author: Maury K.

description:
This review is strictly for their weekend brunch.  Due to the Living Social deal, I decided to try this place out.  The bottomless mimosas was definitely appealing.  I came in a little after the place opened for the morning and there were a few guests already seated.  With that in mind, I was surprised at how slow everything was from placing our order to finally getting our food down to paying.  Granted by the time we got out of there the place was packed, I at least expected to get our food faster.

Now for the food.  My boyfriend ordered the Mission Scramble and I got the Mushroom and Spinach Omelet.  But out of curiosity we decided to start off with an order of "tot-chos" (nachos style tots).  The tot-chos were decent but after the cheese got cold, it wasn't so appetizing anymore.  My boyfriend's Mission Scramble was good but nothing special and my omelet was awful.  I don't remember the cheese they used but the texture and taste was so bad that I couldn't even pick around it.  Thank goodness for the Living Social deal because I would've been extremely upset if I had to pay full price for the meal.  At least the mimosas were good... they're not stingy with the champagne.
author: Frances J.

description:
I met up with some friends after being at weapons ass reduction workout in SOMA -something to checkout if you're looking for something to do.

Since it was Wednesday, we went with the 25 cent wings. How can you go wrong with 30 wings to share and a couple beers? This is a great place if your looking for something low key with TVs to catch the sport games. 

Be prepared to come early or wait around for a table to open up.
author: Kristina S.

description:
Super delicious sweet potatertots!  And the fried pickles were none too shabby!  Also, they have corn hole on the back patio (love that game, hit me up if you want to get womped).

All around, an excellent dive type of bar with delightful snacks and games.
author: Jasmine F.

description:
I am sure I wrote a review of my experience here. Has it been removed? Very weird.

Like many others, I dined at Dr Teeth in early April with a Living Social deal.  I'd heard mostly positive things about the restaurant/bar in the past and was excited to give it a try.  When we arrived, they were already very busy, and we were informed that there would be an hour wait.  They offered to start us on the bottomless mimosas, so no problem, we agreed to wait.

As time went on, we realized the host at the door was doing little to manage the seating of the waiting parties.  The waitresses did not seem to be updating him when their tables were leaving; people were seated out of turn.  There are large picnic tables outdoors that appeared to be self-seated, but we were told we couldn't sit there.   We were a party of 2 and it took almost 2.5 hours to be seated!  They ended up using a large table to seat 4-5 parties of 2 after hours of waiting. My impression is that they didn't want to "waste" the other tables on a small party.  The entire time, the host refused to give any estimates for the wait (even once it became clear his original estimation of an hour was way off base).  In fact, he seemed to be spending a lot of time talking to a friend rather than paying attention to the situation inside the bar.  I am sure they were in violation of fire code / capacity restrictions at many points in the day.

Meanwhile during this wait, we saw people eating standing up near the bar, holding their plates, because they did not want to wait any longer;  people with plates sitting on the ground outside by the picnic tables, because they didn't want to wait any longer.   Dr Teeth was generous with the bottomless mimosas, which made for long restroom lines.   While we were waiting, one of the patrons also stumbled outside and puked by the restaurant entrance.  Who knew brunch could be this classy?

Despite all these issues, if the food would have been good, I would have considered going back again.  The bottomless mimosas were disgusting.  The 'juice' tasted more like 'fruit drink', I'm guessing watered down concentrate.  My order of eggs Benedict and tater tots was incredibly average.  The eggs were a bit overcooked (and not served very warm).  As for the tater tots, I guess I was expecting not to get the same sort of frozen tater tots I could warm up at home... maybe my expectations were wrong.  (Let's be real for a moment:  frozen tater tots taste better when eaten on my own sofa).  

The only positive points of the day were that the looooooong wait gave me lots of time to catch up with my friend, and that the waitress for our table was cheerful and fantastic, despite what I'm sure was a very stressful day.  In fact she was the only decent person working that day.
author: Heidi M.

description:
Overall, a bar with a great vibe to enjoy a casual beer and (some) fried things!

FOOD:

Sweet potato tater tots - A major disappointment for a place with a friggen tater tot bar. The tater tots were crispy but undercooked, which is one of the few ways to mess up fried food. I liked the sauce (thai sweet chili-ish?) though.

Truffle fries - SO DELICIOUS. I'm not normally a fan of truffle oil, ever since Gordan Ramsay revealed the truth on Masterchef (look it up!), but the fries were cooked perfectly, covered in parmesan cheese that kept me munching through the artificial flavor of "truffles".

Nachos Grandissimo with chicken - I was food-creeping on other tables and eyed the giant plate of nachos next to me. Obviously, it had to happen. The reality, however, was fairly disappointing. Nobody likes cold cheese and stale chips!! Stop it.

OTHER THINGS:

They had my go-to Black Butte Porter for $4 which I was completely OK with. Jameson on tap is hilarious.

The bar itself feels grungy but cool and was filled with the typical Mission crowd. The bathroom was pretty dirty, but whatever, it was a Sunday after bottomless mimosas.

I'll be back...probably? Not for the food but for the dranks.
author: Caroline W.

description: Love this place for sunny day drinking. Great  patio in the back with a good amount of seating. Great drink menu. I recommend the Kentucky Mule (yummy bourbon and ginger beer drink served in a mason jar). The bloody was pretty good too, a little spicy for my taste.
author: Brandi D.

description:
I like the food here, but the service is appalling. First of all, it is completely unclear as to what the ordering system is. Do you order at the bar, do you carry your own food and drinks? What are the waitresses for? After sitting for over 10 minutes waiting for service, I decided to inquire with the bartender. He was nice, but then the 'waitress' seemed upset I said anything about the lack of service. 

Two 'waitresses' then came over to the table where I was with my friends and had the nerve to tell me that 'they were sorry the service was so poor, but I had to understand that they were just really grumpy because they were out until 4:30 in the morning'. Ummmmm, okay?! Really?? 

Anyway, like I said the food was good, but I'm not sure I would go back. It was disappointing to say the least.
author: Heather N.

description:
Fun place for people watching. Very different crowd and lots of seats and room to move around.

The specialty drinks are a bit pricey, but tasty. I like to tater tots. Will be back for Wing Wednesdays! Okay, probably the tater tots again!

If there were cheaper specialty drinks, I would be there more often.

I really like coming here.
author: Jen T.

description:
Came here on a Friday night - felt Marina in the front, Mission in the back. Favorite part - Beer in Mason Jars.

Highs: Shuffleboard
             Beer served in Mason Jars
             Relatively service at bar
             Space to move around in the back
Cons: Marina-esque people in the front
            The only IPA they had was Deschutes? Gross. Lets get some Speakeasy or       
                anything else up in here. 

It wont be my first place to go back to, but I wont avoid it like I do Beauty Bar.

Might have to try it for brunch and update my review.
author: Maggie F.

description:
So it was one of those days in San Francisco where the temperature outside was 85 degrees. Its a rarity so some friends and I decided to go somewhere to enjoy a tasty pitcher of something ice cold while being outdoors.  We got to Dr Teeth and to our surprise Wednesday was 25 cent wing day. That's crazy. The wings were good and bigger than expected.  We got there right about 5 oclock. was just starting to get busy.  Our waitress Courtney was nice and gave us suggestions on the menu. Even warned us that the "death" wings were not for the faint of heart. Sure enough we didn't listen and for the first time ever I ordered a milk at a bar.    As the sun set the crowd grew .Courtney was incredible. Running around inside at the bar, outside to the tables, never once waivering.  Smiling and keeping a positive attitude throughout.  

Four hours later and a few jamesons deep it was time to leave.  I had been to Dr Teeths twice before and had a great time but this time definitely the service stood out.  In the mission there is a lot of great places to grab a drink and get some good food.  Sometimes its the little things that get you to go back.  My friends and I will be back soon.  Thank you Courtney for the great service and keep it up.
author: eric t.

description:
Two words: WING WEDNESDAYS.

Hipsters, cheap beers, tasty tater tots, and delicious/flavorful wings makes this place a perfect place for Wing Wednesdays! Twenty-five cent wings! SO GOOD. This awesome place is located right on Mission, and thus super close to both the 16th St. and 24th St. Bart stations in addition to Valencia St. for all of you who need more ways of fulfilling your hipster-isque ways post-wings. The atmosphere here is awesome especially the outdoor patio in the back! The place is loud and everyone's super friendly, making it a great place to catch up with friends over cheap eats after a few days of work-related blues. 

The tater tots and wings are a definite must! There's plenty of flavors to choose from: the chili habanero wings were my favorite flavor! The drinks during happy hour are also fantastic - $3 PBRs until 7 PM and the bottled beers are reasonably priced at about $4 or $5 - including Lagunitas and Anchor Steam. 

I have yet to come here on a night other than Wednesday, but I know there are some other daily specials here too. Just gotta find out and see if they're as awesome as Wednesdays...!
author: Cheston W.

description: Buzy place. They have this .25 wing promotion which looked very tasty. The drink menu is better than decent. Bartender girls are on it, tater tots are very good, they have 3 or so different types. The only thing that I did not like, was the chicken sandwich. I dunno, it had no flavor I guess. I would certainly go back here again.
author: Jorge P. G.

description: Taco Tuesday is great, be sure to try the veggie tacos. The fish is ok but nothing special & the margs are very sweet!
author: Rebecca C.

description: OMG, $1 Taco Tuesday, buy one get one free Margaritas. .25 cent wing Wednesdays washed down with a beerskee. Ahhhhh, I LOVE this place. It has a awesome look to it. The food here is extraordinary. The cook really did think outside the box when he designed the menu. This is such a wonderful surprise. Dr. Teeth makes Ghost Pepper "Death Sauce" you have to sign a waiver in order to eat. YOU know this girl loves her some spicy food but was too chicken to try :X. Shout out to whoever thought of the tater tot nachos!!!!! My gym partner thanks you in advance for making me feel guilty for eating this amazing delight. It was like heaven in my mouth and I will  be back soon to enjoy Wing Wednesday! A++++
author: Jess C.

description:
Trailer Park Trash Food = Trailer Park Trash Asshole. Came here for HH with some friends and I was appalled. 

Okay, so you serve tater tots and corn dogs, I was thinking: "FUCK YES!" I wanted to get a good idea of their food so I ordered the sampler. Mac and cheese, corn dogs and curly fries. 

-_- 

....I cant. The plating looked careless -- like a pile of brown and yellow mush. First thing, I dig into the mac and cheese...I mean, bowl of goo. How do you mess up noodles and cheddar? The ratio of noodles to cheese was off completely. Every spoonful was just cheese (and one noodle if I was lucky) I had to use my knife to cut the excess cheese off before I could put the spoon in my mouth..
FAIL.

Corn dogs...wow. Thought it couldn't get worse than the mac and cheese but I was wrong. Anchor steam beer batter yet the batter was charred....take a bite only to discover a flavored sausage....yuck. 
FAIL.

Alas, curly fries. hahahahahaha naw, these were rock hard. A plate of curly crisps. No one believed me til i held one in my hand and they watched it shatter like glass all over the floor and in my margarita. Zero potato in the curly fries...I don't understand! :( 
FAIL.

Only two stars because of their 2 for 1 margaritas all night. They're strong and double-fisting makes you look like a bad ass.
author: Lydia L.

description:
Wednesday: .25 chicken wings all night! A few coworkers and I made it down to the mission for Dr. Teeth.  They do not open until 5pm and the place gets packed fast. Not many large tables, but I heard they have tables in the back that people can reserve?! 

Arrived at 5 and got a good table.  Started with 24 chicken wings , buffalo and the japenero wings.  Both were spicy, but delicious. $6 worth of chicken wings and 5 of us were pretty full already.  We also ordered, fried pickles and the mexican - sweet potato tater tots. Eh original! Just stick with beer and chicken wings. 

A few coworkers and I had some bloody 2 the next day, so BEWARE of eating the ghost pepper sauce. I only dipped it in too. 

Will be back and recommend!
author: Chanel L.

description: Delicious totchos (tater tot nachos! genius!) and macaroni and cheese made me an instant fan of this place. My friend and I came during happy hour on a weeknight and it wasn't too busy. Drinks were a little watery and I had a hard time hearing what our server was saying but other than that it was an altogether good experience. I will definitely return for the food!
author: Morgan B.

description:
Me and my friends came here on a Wed early evening. It was CROWDED! To my surprise, it was literally jam-packed to a point that it was pretty hard to move from one spot to another. It was shocking to me since I never expect this many people would be out for happy hours on a work day. Well, I guess we were just like them? 

So they have this 25-cent chicken wing/leg special that you have to order with a minimal of two drinks. I had two bud light since I didn't feel like drinking, plus 10 pieces of chicken, with two sauce choices, half and half, and it only cost 11 dollars! What a steal, isn't it? 

The crowd there seems nice and they have a nice patio/deck in the back. It's perfect for those who'd want to enjoy their food with a taste of nice weather the city has the offer. 

My only complaint was that it was way crowded. But hey, good food, good crowd, and good price. I guess everyone will come over for that. 

I'd recommend against driving over there if at all possible. Parking was terrible and it took 20 dollars for me to park next doors, which was a bummer. So by all means, if you can take public transportation over, you definitely should consider that option!
author: Victor K.

description: What a piece of crap are you can bring your dog but you can't bring anyone under 21 for brunch even though person has eaten there before this place needs to get their shit together don't waste your time here
author: Terrence M.

description:
A Sunday wasted. Wasted in more than one way.

I should have known better as the day went from beautiful stroll past Dolores Park to pee drenched streets of Mission. The fact that I had to present my ID before even getting in the door could have been strike two. Yelp's description of ambience: "Hipster." Yeah, I should have known better. 

I had purchased the Living Social deal after looking on Yelp. "Well this place seems to have decent reviews" so it seemed safe. We arrived around 11 am and the place only had a few open spaces (plenty of outside seating). We chose a spot near the front window. When the waitress finally came by she noticed I had the deal and got us started right away. We were sitting near an older couple, the man was eating wings that were not sitting right with my nose. We chose one of their omelets and the jelly donut chicken sandwich. The omelet was bland. It needed salt, more ingredients, or better cheese... did it even have cheese? Clearly it wasn't memorable. The eggs seemed slightly overcooked and dry for my liking. The jelly donut chicken sandwich was interesting but maybe only because it actually had flavor. The food was nothing to write home about. The deal also included mimosas and a shot of liquor (I don't think a shot of anything should be served with brunch). So we finished up, paid, and left.

As we made our way home, I was under the impression that I was just sick from the booze. Wrong. It went from bad to worse. Random upchuck in the park :( followed by even more embarrassment as we attempted to get back to our neighborhood via the Bart- so, so sorry Bart station but I'm sure you've seen worse from homeless people. I don't even remember half the day, waking up in my apartment with my coat and jeans in the wash because I threw up on them. For the next 16 hours I was either passed out in bed or hugging the toilet from food poisoning (because no one continues to puke like that even after their stomach is empty). I'm lucky I recovered before my boyfriend took me to the ER to have my stomach pumped.

Needless to say, after that traumatizing experience I will not be coming back to this establishment.
author: Miffy Y.

description: Cute spot in the Mission & I'm glad that I finally got to check this place out. I went here on Wings Wednesday (I didn't know about Wings Wednesday until I got here) & luckily I got here early since it gets packed quick. You can't go wrong with 25 cent wings & great cocktails. They have an outside patio & your food is brought to you. You need to order everything at the bar, but they're pretty quick. Again...if you're headed over here, especially on Wednesday, come early! Parking in the Mission sucks, but that's not their fault - you may have to drive around a few times to get a spot.
author: Michelle F.

description:
So, I initially walked into Dr. Teeth with high expectations. My roommate had tales of wing-eating contests, cheap drinks, and other sorts of awesomeness. I walked in and thought, "oh, this is a pretty cool little dive bar"... Continued to the back, past the bathrooms and BOOM back patio. This is a rarity and a treat. I could use some vitamin D, as well as the obligatory cigarette bumming after a couple of drinks.
 
That was during the NFL Playoffs, and I have since returned a few times. They have different daily specials that are pretty great. Taco Tuesday, Wing Wednesday, etc. Do it.
author: Sean D.

description: Bottomless Mimosa!! They were awesome didnt have to wait long for refills. Dive bar with good vibes. We had the totchos which were just ok. Not impressed. Maybe next time I'll come back for their 25cent wings.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Skip the weekend brunch. No joke. My girlfriend and I had the livingsocial deal and value wise, it was golden: bottomless mimosas, two shots of fernet and two brunch entrees for a lot less than the $75 we could've paid was a steal. After an hour wait on the last day to redeem the deal, mimosas were crap and served in plastic cups. Crappy champagne with a dash of OJ. I don't need my mimosas served straight up.

Breakfast was an avocado scramble for her and "maple glazed bacon" sliders for me. Everything sounded truly amazing and the menu reflects the mayhem in the bar's name. It was too good to be true. Quality was no better than Denny's, down to the generic tater tots that tasted the same as they did in your high school cafeteria. The dishes were realized entirely too literally -- my sliders had little bits of cheap, flavorless bacon inside of a hard, dry scramble plopped inside generic mini burger buns with a dollop of nothing special chipotle aoli. 

I'd go back at night for beers or whiskey, but nothing else.
author: Dan U.

description: This was our first stop when our plane landed in San Francisco. Had read how awesome the place was and talked the bf into going (25 cent wings and Jameson on tap sealed the deal). When we first walked in, I was a bit skeptical. Not many places to sit and the crowd was about a decade younger than me. Decided to sit in the back and we ordered some beers and wings. HOLY CRAP-- these wings were soooo freakin good. The guy who took our order (owner maybe?) said to be careful ordering them too hot and we heeded that warning. I've never had wings this size, this tasty, and they were piping hot! I figured we would only be there for an hour or two but it became quite a night to remember! The bar over poured (NO complaints here :-D) and we were glad we found a Lyft vehicle to drive us to our hotel! I can't wait to go back. A flight to San Francisco is well worth the $ just to stop in here again!
author: Christine A.

description: I was kind of disappointed with the atmosphere here. There was water on the floor and it was pretty dirty. The music wasn't  that great and at midnight there was only a handful of people there.
author: Tyler S.

description:
Lots y lots of fried goodness here so not for the faint of heart ;)

Do -- tochos, fried pickles, any of the hamburgers, and the grilled cheese!

Don't -- fried beets and the mayhem drink :(

Super fun atmosphere, great location, definitely makes for a good night!
author: Maya-Luisa G.

description: Dr. Teeth is one of my absolute favorite local bars. It caters to everyone, and I mean EVERYONE. It is the one outpost for Marina folks who are "just slummin' it guys, like OMG;" they have cornhole in the back. It's the Saturday bottomless mimosa spot (used to cost $12, now $15... They suck at eggs benny, so get the amazing Cobb Salad, tachos, or burgers). They love the dive bar crowd.... Ummmm... Jameson on tap and PBR&shot specials... Need I say more? And during the week, they have un-fucking-paralleled 25¢ wings on Wednesdays (get the buffalo or jalapeño honey wings... Not the ghost pepper, unless you want an 'unforgettable experience...' Three times... Once in and twice out). Kim and Josh are the best. Tip them well, or fuck off... Because, just leave. It's a good place. 5stars.
author: Michael C.

description: If I could give 0 stars I would. Terrible service, door guy was sitting on a bench with headphones on and screamed at us when we walked past him. Server sucked, didn't come to the table for 15 minutes. We ordered an appetizer and the sever brought 1 fork, there were 4 of us. We Didn't have more forks for 10 minutes, then we were still missing one. 3 of the 4 things we ordered were wrong.  We sent the grilled cheese back because it had bacon on it, the server returned the sandwich same as before with the bacon just peeled off. Asked to speak with a manager and they sent over a server pretending to be the boss.  The mediocre food isn't worth visiting this place.
author: J B.

description:
I love this place for trivia because they are so fun about the whole thing. There are prizes galore: once at the half way point, and again at the end, and also one for the best team name: bring your A-game for the name game, y'all. The DJ delivers the questions in a funny, no-BS sort of a way, and the whole thing is done in less than 2 hours. Definitely a refreshing break from some other trivia nights that drag on for ever and ever.

Anyway all that is besides the main point, which is obviously TOTCHOS. I feel like it doesn't really require an explanation but here it goes: replace the chips in nachos with TATER TOTS. SWEET POTATO ONES AT THAT. Bam! Done.

They also have a shuffleboard table, but I've never actually gotten to play it yet :/
author: jon y.

description:
Patio was awesome. Service was great. Fun was had.

The old fashioneds here are killers!
author: Paulo K.

description: Worst experience ever. Food was ok, and it was served Luke warm and our server, Jilane, messed up everyone's order. She was literally the worst server I have ever had in my life and I have never written a bad review on a restaurant ever but I just feel like I had to it was so bad. She forgot everything I asked for and was rude about it. Would never go there again.
author: Zachary A.

description:
I've only been here on weds because of the .25 wings. That being said - this place is awesome. 

Heavy on the hipsters and heavy on the bar food (thats a good thing). This place gets really busy after 6 so get there by 5 and you should be fine. The bar food is really good. Traditional selections but with a taste. 

 I recommend the wings cause even if they taste like crap they are still only 0.25 each - they are sold only in 8's so 8 wings for $2 (awesome). The wings has a savory sweet sauce to it. Similar to the ones used in asian fusion restaurants - the quality of the wings, i would say is about the same quality as wing stop. That may be a good or bad thing depending if you like their wings or not. 

Mac and cheese are also a delight. You can get a sampler platter and i recommend the tots and mac and cheese - heart attack heavy!
author: Ryan R.

description: Is this the worst bar in SF? Probably not. Still a terrible place and I would advice you to go somewhere else if you want to have an enjoyable experience. Apparently "customer care" is not a concept that Teeth folks are familiar with, isn't it ironic since they decided to open a bar?
author: Luke C.

description:
Overrated.  

Super-crowded and understaffed for Sunday brunch.  It took them about 1/2 hour to take our order, then another 1/2 hr-45 mins to get food.  I'm pretty sure they forgot about it back there because by the time we go it, it was kind of cold.  Coffee was not awesome, and Mimosas tasted cheap.

This is one of those classic Mission hang-outs which is way too cool for school.
author: Chloe B.

description: Four years ago the food was only average for an extremely inflated price. Cut to present day and things have only gotten worse. Good luck finding competent wait staff or bartenders.
author: Henry T.

description: Terrible terrible service, way over rated. Also, I'm pretty sure its a health code violation to leave a pile of dog poop in your outdoor space, and its obvious no one cared to clean it up - that shouldn't have to be pointed out to you. Skip this place, there are way better places on the area!
author: Kimberly R.

description:
It was a great deal with the voucher. however the seating arrangement is HIGHLY unorganized. A friend and I waited about 1 1/2 hours for a table of two when we arrived at 11:30. There is bar in the front area along with some seating. The host in the front will not know when to send in the next table until the server comes and tells him. I did NOT see a server let him know a table was available. There is also seating in the back patio area and I asked the server if this is first come first serve, she said no. As I stood by the host i saw maybe 2 servers come up and tell him that there was available seating. 

I was tempted to try the fried chicken with jelly thing but they sold out!! 

System is very disorganized. I know some people who were already drinking the unlimited mismosas who's name is after me on the list. If it wasn't for the voucher i bought, i would have no come back.
author: Anita W.

description:
Tator Tots + Nachos = Tat-chos

I'm so addicted to these... hold the sour cream and add carne asada

This is like the best invention ever.
author: Thömas F.

description: I like this bar - it has fun bartenders, cheap drinks, and a nice game area in the backyard. The only thing I was bummed out about is that they close the backyard early in the evenings (but I totally understand that it is to be courteous to their neighbors). I asked the bartender to make me his best refreshing cocktail, and he definitely made me what I asked for -- some cucumber drink (either my hearing was impaired or it was way too loud for me to figure out the name of the drink). I also got to order one of my favorite drinks, the Dark and Stormy - Ginger Beer and Rum... there aren't too many bars that carry ginger beer, so kudos to Dr. Teeth for that one.
author: Elaine N.

description:
The food was 4 stars (would have been 5 if it didn't take an hour to get it). My breakfast sandwich was great and the tater tot nachos were so good.

Our server was friendly and as fast as she could be given that they are way understaffed.

But they offer brunch reservations. You can only email about them. My email was returned in a timely manner and we had a couple back and forths, but no one ever confirmed anything. When I showed up on a Sunday, we had to wait 2 hours to sit down and when it was our turn, the front door guy just told us to grab the next open table we saw... not sure what the point of the list at the door was.

Dr Teeth has certainly been discovered, but they don't seem to handle the crowd very well. I think they need to work out some kinks to handle their popularity, otherwise people are going to get sick of waiting 1/2 hour to get a drink at the bar, 2 hours for a table and 1+ hours for their food.
author: cindy p.

description:
We kinda' had a good time here, the comfort food thing is good once I guess. The hipsters that were around seemed to be into the whole thing more than i was.
I'm not sure if I would come back though.
author: Lizzy M.

description: Great place to come and get the night started with a great selection of affordable drinks.  They have a nice outdoor section which was leveled and created a great environment to drink and socialize with your friends.  I would definitely come back and to try the food here.
author: Richard L.

description: My friend and I went to Dr. Teeth to use a Groupon I bought for tater tots, sliders, and beer. They have bar food down. They have "bars" for tater tots, mac & cheese, and burgers. Other foods, like french fries, have almost as many options. In fact, they offer five kinds of sliders. We tried four. My favorite was the rueben. Somehow, corned beef, sauerkraut, and 1000 island dressing are even better in miniture. It made me want to try the full-sized version sometime soon. The frenchh dip, which had a really wonderful au jus, was a close second. Tatertot-wise, we opted to try the buffalo bleu ones. With buffalo sauce and melted Point Reyes bleu cheese, they are savory and delicious. The portion size is huge, too. After working our way through a mountain of potatoey goodness, eating five sliders seemed daunting. My friend made it through, but I only managed four. Of course, having a taco in addition to the tots didn't help. It was taco tuesday (only $1 each!) and 2 for 1 margarita night as well. We couldn't resist. The tacos aren't bad either. The one sip I had of my friend's was STRONG. Together on a regular basis, they might be dangerous. I heard the veggie taco is the thing. Next time, it's on the docket. Tuesday was also trivia night. We stayed for a few rounds and it was fun enough for me to want to try it sometime. The bottom line is, Dr. Teeth isn't remotely close to anything for me, but now that I've experienced it, I know I will be back. Groupon or not.
author: Nicole M.

description:
wednesday wing nights - 0.25 cents/wing . fantastic deal. the wings are meaty (not like the teeny tiny ones you see at a lot of places), and the flavors are tasty. If you're up for trying SPICY without killing yourself - order your wings with a SIDE of the deathsauce. you can dip as you please.

and i heart the tots. sweet potato and regular. with nachos or mayhem style.

outside patio is awesome (except in the rain). they shut it down at some time probably for noise levels in the neighborhood.

The music can get pretty loud on a fri/sat night. 

its best to divide and conquer to swoop in on people leaving tables.
author: Christina C.

description:
Get drunk and full for $6!? Can't say I've done that before!

I come for the $0.25 wings and happy hour and it has yet to disappoint. The place is very hipsterish but hey! it's the mission! The atmosphere is very laid back and the outdoor seating is definitely a plus. They have specials every weeknight such as trivia and karaoke I think but you should come for the wings. The Habanero Chili Wings are good buy my favorite are the Buffalo. DO NOT TRY THE GHOST CHILLI. That thing will burn your mouth off.

 They have Fernet and Jameson on tap which is awesome. The prices are reasonable and the location is great. Bart drops you off a couple of blocks away.  The staff is friendly especially Vanessa. It's a great place to check out the game or any event as they have T.V's everywhere and the crowd doesn't get too loud. 

All in all, this is a great place to come any day of the week and I recommend it.
author: Javier G.

description:
We went here for the Sunday Brunch Living Social promotion and I wasn't too impressed. 

We arrived just before opening at 10:00 AM and there were a few other groups of people, but far from crowded. The service was surprisingly slow for this type of environment. The time from seating to ordering exceeded twenty minutes.

My order of the Mission Scramble was decent, but lacking quality for the price. The meal was simply bland. The food lacks anything special. I ordered tater-tots on the side. The tots are also okay, but super salty. I will say that the bottomless mimosas were pretty good. The servers are really good at ensuring that those cups never reach bottom- I appreciate that. Our mimosas were served in proper campaign glasses, but I noticed a lot of other customers had plastic cups.

Our living social deal was supposedly a $45 value, but the cashier bumped it up to $65. They also (somehow) bumped up the price of the food to $70 (two meals, two bottomless mimosas, two shots). In the end it nets out, except for they increased the tip since gratuities are calculated on the total bill before applying promotions. I didn't realize this until later in the day.

All-in-all, at this price level, for brunch I can do better.
author: Nathan E.

description:
I actually really liked this place!

Being in hipster central, I wasn't sure I'd like it because it's not really my "scene".

I quickly got over that, and discovered they make a mean greyhound with fresh squeezed grapefruit juice! 

My friends had already ordered the tot-choes. They were actually pretty good! Even with the ghost sauce. I have an unnatural love for tator tots though. 

We ordered dinner as well - I had a reuben with sweet potato fries. The fries were thickly cut and probably some of the best sweet potato fries I've ever had. I really liked the homemade ketchup they served with them too.
author: Sara P.

description: Would you believe a group of us Dental office Ladies came here? It was Wednesday night .25c wings. Really good.  We tried all the flavors.  All for $5. We also had drinks. Thats where the prices get you. Waitress was sweet and ready to refill our drinks. It was crowded and not a nice bar but definitely a place for watching the game and hanging with your peeps. ... we even saw  couples on dates :)
author: Ka'Neki M.

description:
I just want to start off saying that my friends are obsessed with bars that have food and an outside area. Zeitgeist can go fuck itself and El Rio is so damn far I might as well just go back to Mountain View afterwards to my parent's house so my mom can rub my back in the morning as I cry into the toilet asking myself what I'm doing with my life.

Okay, back on point. I like this bar. Like, really fucking like this bar. Like it enough that even though I woke up at the ungodly hour of 6am and can't fall back asleep I'm still sitting here writing a good review instead of watching Law and Order SVU.

Anyways, I was lured by my friends during their happy hour on Wednesday for their 25 cents wings.

Which were amazing. And I'm really picky about my wings. All of the flavorings were delicious, although I lean more towards the BBQ side. And unlike most places, they are generous with their bbq sauce. I could have actually drowned myself in it if I tried. By the end of the night, my friends and i collectively were responsible for eating about 50 chickens. 

I was too drunk to catch the names of the other foods my friends ordered but they had some tater tots with cheese, olives, and other nacho-y shit on them that were bomb. Then my friend had a grilled cheese with egg in it or something which absolutely blew my mind. Had a side of tomato soup too. Someone else got their Mac n Cheese but I'm not even going to review that because not even I can fuck up Mac n Cheese. My bf tried once on accident; he put too much water in the pot and essentially made Mac n Cheese soup. It was still delicious 

I don't like mixed drinks generally so I can't comment on that because I didn't bother ordering one. I just got a tall can of PBR. The beer was nice and cold; nicely refrigerated. 

Nothing important in this paragraph, but can people literally not describe something in SF anymore without using the word hipster? It may have completely eluded me in my drunken stupor but I did not notice anything hipster-y about this bar except that there were maybe a couple hipsters but it's not like they're contagious. They're like Mono, just don't share drinks with them and you'll be okay.

TL;DR this bar is awesome and I will probably be returning every wednesday for their 25c wings, tater tots, and happy hour tall cans. They will be directly responsible for my worsening alcoholism and exponentially increasing ass size and will be hearing from my lawyers.
author: Kory A.

description:
If I had to eat only one dish for the rest of my life, it would be the tot-chos from Dr. Teeth.

I first came to this place for a friend's birthday party a couple years ago and I love stopping by. You can only speak in raised voices, but it's usually because you're there for a game. The wait staff can occasionally be slow at bussing tables, but that's because the place is usually PACKED. The service I have received has always been tip-top.

Tasty food, good drinks, the ability to ignore hipsters even when they're sitting at the next table - I love this place.
author: Charles L.

description: I love this bar. I've come here twice, once for bottomless mimosas and once for happy hour. During bottomless mimosas, the only downside is that they pour the mimosas for you so when it gets busy it sometimes takes longer to get served more mimosas. I'm too used to places that give you the bottle of champagne and OJ to mix yourself hahah. Happy hour is great because its $3 beers and $4 well drinks before 7 pm. TOTS & MOZZERELLA STICKS DOE. those were the two best decisions of my life. I ordered the mozzerella sticks and I mean come on, how much better can you get? Its mozerella sticks! Difficult to mess that up so it was a solid appetizer. It also came with marinara sauce. The tater tots though...Oh. My. God. They were topped with this creamy sauce and I think it had crab on it too. They were so freaking delicious. I could eat those every day all day for the rest of my days and be ok with that. Definitely try the tots if you have the chance. The sauce and crab toppings made the tots just out of this world. Also they have shuffleboard here. Its fun playing while buzzed. Hahaha. Also the waitresses are super nice and really chill! Would definitely come here again.
author: Amy T.

description:
Dr Teeth knows you want clever and reasonably priced things to eat and drink. That's why their menu is so awesome.

They have weekly specials. Taco Tuesdays have dollar street tacos and 2-for-1 margaritas. We all know what Wednesday is, best of luck even getting in the door for those deliciously cheap 25¢ wings.

Don't let your waiter take your menu away. It's the type you want to just continue to order off of as you drink and chat more.

Absolutely order their spicy cucumber margarita. It's *THEE* perfect thing to drink on a hot day.
author: K M.

description:
You just can't beat $0.25 cent wings on Wednesdays.  

It's fuckin' packed, but anywhere in the country serving wings for that cheap is probably packed too.  

Aside from that, this place is a pretty solid bar, with a nice patio in the back.  Mixed drinks I've gotten have been solid pours at good prices, and you can also quench your thirst for PBR here as well.  They've got Cornhole and Skee-Ball so you can fully get down hipster-style.  

It gets 5 stars because our server girl was beautiful.  Is that inappropriate and a totally irrelevant reason to give an extra star?  Maybe.
author: Louie M.

description:
So good. I came here for a Saturday brunch with 3 other friends. 2 of us had gotten a Livingsocial deal for bottomless mimosas, an entree, and a shot of fernet.

We showed up a bit after 10am, and our friend who had shown up earlier was already seated at a table in the back. At this point it wasn't very crowded and service was very fast. We moved to a high table next to the bar.

I got the Jelly Doughnut Chicken Sandwich along with tater tots. They weren't able to give me pancakes as a side anymore, unfortunately. The sandwich was amazing! The sweet taste of jelly donut along with the savory juiciness of the fried chicken just blew my mind completely. The tater tots were also really, really good, although I wish we had ketchup. It came with a ranch dip as well as habernero Tabasco and Cholula, which I was also pretty happy with.

My friends got the Mission scramble as well as some other kind of omelet. The eggs dishes were HUGE, and I'm pretty sure nobody was able to finish.

I was way too many mimosas in and very happy at the end of it all.

Service got a bit slow later, as the bar got really packed around 12:30, which was understandable, although annoying.
author: Michael W.

description:
It's on the dirty mission...so already I like it. Cool patio outside, can smoke outside and drink if that's how you like to indulge. Shuffle board inside. Hot server making up concoctions. The food is really awesome, you may want to hit a gym the next two weeks after eating here (the worst foods taste the best right?) Wing Wednesdays are the bomb. Mango habenero, BBQ and the regular wings are awesome. Huge tasty wings at a quarter a piece... Oh ya and Jame-O on tap and tall boys of PBR. Only thing I hate about this place is it gets crowded an if your trying to eat, you could be doing so standing up. Otherwise I dig Dr. Tooth's.

Recommend!
author: Tom L.

description:
Hot Damn this place is awesome on WING WEDNESDAYS! You just can't beat 25 cent wings! 

This place has an awesome backyard patio, with a little mini-field where people toss bean bags, and plenty of seating.  They serve their tap beer here in glass jars instead of glasses (which is frikken sweet).  You can't beat the price, and the vibe here is really chill and laid back.  This is my new favorite place to go on wednesdays in the city!
author: Austin R.

description:
attn gentlemen, hot bartenders work here.

Barberella playing in the background, servers walking around carrying dranks bumping into folks and giving them nasty looks when folks run into them (Uhh this is a bar not a 5 star classy establishment where those looks are kinda sorta slightly allowed). The joint itself is nothing different inside, but they do bar food the way it should be done. 

That being said, was cool (enough.) I hear they have 25cent wings on  Wednesdays. I went on a Friday and boy was it packed. The bathroom line was out the hooh hah. I'd like to take a moment and say, "San Francisco, I love you." SF crowds are just the best... but let's make it clear that that's not Dr. Teeth's doing.
author: Rosa L.

description: I spent the last 15 mins expecting a server to give me a menu. But no this dumb @&?!$ couldn't even make eye contact with the other half of the room. Horrible "service"
author: Erica B.

description: Awesome bar. You have to circle through a bit to find a seat because it does get crowded. Went on taco Tuesday which was a grear deal. Two for one margaritas, and dollar (small) street tacos. It was loud and fun and funky on a Tuesday night. The wait staff was busy but very helpful when they were available.
author: Emily G.

description:
What's NOT to love about this place?

*.25 cent wings on Wednesdays
*yummy tator tots
*PBR
*Jameson's on tap

The wings are delicious...I personally like the Sweet Habanero Chili wings.  They also have the Death Ghost Chili wings too.  If someone party fouls, feed the loser one of those. lol

Anyways, love the atmosphere, the food and the ppl that work there.  It def made me a repeat diner there.
author: Toma W.

description: Despite the sketchy neighborhood, DR. TEETH & THE ELECTRIC MAYHEM has some of the best "bar food" I have had in the city. We came for "Taco Tuesday" and had so much more: Deep-fried Pickles, Rueben Sliders, Buffalo Bleu Tater Tots, Tot-Chos (Nachos with Tater Tots instead of chips), Beef & Chicken Tacos. All the food was fresh, the portions were hefty, the prices reasonable, the service was fast and friendly and we left with full bellies and an urge to return and try numerous other things on their menu (Burgers, Salads, Mac & Cheese etc.). We will be back for sure!
author: G C.

description:
FOOD:
1.) Big buck hunter Burger = w grilled mushrooms.. oooh this was good

2.) Sampler plate get to try three items we chose:
A.) Mac n cheese!! w truffle! 
B.) Reuben egg rolls!!! = This was... nothing I would order again.
C.) Garlic crab fries = O man this is the winner. So surprisingly good! And even as leftovers the next day... STILL SO GOOD!!! Must try if you ever come here! :D

I will come back for the grilled cheese


SERVICE:
Order at the bar and then they'll bring it out to your table number :)


ATMOSPHERE:
Taller high tables with high bar seats, I like how the seats are comfy plushy with backrests and footrests! Bar atmosphere, but hip and enjoyable.
author: Angela L.

description:
FIrst off, the name. Huge Muppets fan.. points immediately before entry. There is such a great atmosphere in this place. I adore the decor, the clean bar, and of course good company. If you don't order the sweet potato tater tots, Kermit might be crushed. Oh and they have shuffleboard if you didn't get enough frosting on your cupcake. If you love the Mission, Dr. Teeth is a must on any day or night.

PS: They have a "death sauce". You must sign a waiver before so much as tasting a drop. Epic.
author: Mara M.

description: The few times I've been here it's been pretty busy. It's a nice loud bar with TVs going. It can be difficult to get the waitress' attention but it's a busy bar so what do you expect? Overall I really liked the food and the vibe of the place.
author: Rose D.

description:
Stepped out front to get some air (so hot in there with the crowd) and overhear the bouncer say he's not letting any more in because the Fire Marshall had come by.
I asked if he could let us know when we could go back as we were already in. He was very rude and told me that only I could go in, and only to grab our things, pay the bill and leave. Fine, he's a bouncer; he thinks it's in his job description to be a jerk, I get it. 
The real problem was the managers response to the situation. "Well we are trying to get people to leave." Including those who have 10 friends and half of their food and drink still inside apparently. 
Yes, they have yummy wings that are a bargain on Wednesdays, but their beer is overpriced to compensate, they don't keep track of their Maximum Occupancy numbers at all, and the manager could use a lesson in customer service from his waitresses.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Service as such is absent. 
We set at the bar that had 8 seat total. The place looked busy, hh hour time. The bartender asked us if we are part of the party, which we were not, so she suggested us to order with the server, which is still ok. Before even giving us a menu, this girl asked if we know what we want... Excuse me for not being familiar, this is my first and last time in here..
Food was ok, nothing amazing, booze tastes the same everywhere...
I was waiting for my friend to be done with his hair cut at near by place, and he settled the bill before he left. We had to waive to our waitress, that passes us several times, not even looking our direction.. At some point I went to the bathroom... Guess what, all my food that I was still nibbling on my beer and my shot were cleared off by the time I returned, my jacket was still on my chair. I was gone for 3 minutes!!! 
When I tried to say that to the bartender, she put her eyes down and pretended that I do not exist, or she can't hear me!!! WTF??? 
 Maybe a great spot to get drunk, do not come here for anything else.
author: Sofia K.

description:
$0.25 wings on Wednesday is the best! It gets really crowded... originally we had 8 guys to one small table but luckily we took over the next table when they left, to the death stares of other people who were trying to dive on the seats!

Drinks were good, I ordered a Hef but have never drank one SO sour before... but he was nice enough to switch me out for an IPA after I asked.

Also, try some tachos and/or tater tots. All delicious
author: Wilson T.

description:
Wednesday night happy hour is definitely worth coming to!  25 cent wing night, $3 bottled and canned beer.  Top it off with their Tate-Tot selections and you can't go wrong.

We had a party of 4 and was able to get a center table next to the bar and kitchen, and in between all three flat screens (especially good spot during bball season).  We ordered up 20 wings to start (half sweet habanero chili sauce and natural with a side of "death sauce" - made from ghost chilis).  We also had the Tot-Chos (tater tots with guacamole, melted cheese, jalapeños), and the Garlic Crab Tater Tots (topped with garlic aioli, and crab).  Sweet habanero was super tasty with a little kick balanced with the right amount of glazed sweetness.  The natural wings with a smidgen of death sauce was explosive.  The heat from the death sauce just builds in your mouth and is not for the squeamish.  Both tater tot dishes were good (how can you dislike tater tots).  Tot-Chos won me over with the right amount of crispness with melted cheese and a little heat from jalapeños.  Will try their sliders next time around.

They even had Jameson on tap...  Which we had to partake along with Lagunitas IPA, and hefeweizen also on tap.  They also had 21st Amendment in cans, and not to mention the crowd pleaser around the entire place seemed to be tall cans of PBR.

Service was fast and friendly.  Atmosphere got more crowded and noisy as the night moved on, but it was to be expected.

I recommend this place for a group of friends that want some good pub food and drinks on the cheap.  It's located in the Mission, so parking can be difficult unless you're willing to walk a little.  Other happy hour nights included a burger and beer deal on Monday nights...
author: Lawrence L.

description:
Really good vibe and crowd.  Came on a night when the Giants and The Niners were playing.  Let's say the crowd was VERY enthusiastic and prideful.  I love the atmosphere and can tell there were a lot of usual clients.  That's a great sign

It's 2am so instead of writing a long paragraph going into extensive detail I am going to describe what we ordered using four words or less.  Excuse my laziness
mac and cheese + bacon - disappointing
sweet potato fries with cheese -  yumm! big portion
truffle parm tots - they got this right!!
drinks - YES! strong! delicious!
service - decent for the crowd

I want to come back for their wing nights!
author: Tammy N.

description:
Came here for the $0.25 wing Wednesdays!!! OH, and also root on my Giants for Game 1 of the World Series!

It was definitely packed here on a Wednesday night - but I can't say for certain if it was for the wings or if it was because the Giants game was on, probably a mixture of both.

Cool tidbit about this place is that aside from being indoors at this bar, they have a huge outdoor bar area in the back where you can just chill outside. They had TVs out there too showing the game as well. Double-win.

The wings were pretty awesome - for $0.25 per wing, you get the idea in your head that the wings may not be the biggest or meatiest, however when our order of wings came out, the quality was like I was paying full price for them. Definitely appreciate that! Our waitress was really good taking our orders and being prompt about refilling our drinks - did I mention the Hefeweizen they serve is served in mason jars!? I love that.

We also ordered a bunch of sweet potato tots which were soooo good - not drenched in oil like most are and the sweetness of them complemented the spicy wings.

Importnat note: order all your wings at one time - the kitchen probably gets so many orders they're usually pretty backed up and it takes forever to get your order. But, it really is worth it..just not worth it more than once though.
author: Julia K.

description:
I'm glad i tried this place, I've been wanting to for ages. Really unpretentious, just like most places in the mission, which i like. Their tator tot things were really good, but really bad for you- you know, fried, greasy etc, but good..:)
Nice.
author: C A.

description: Shuffleboard, decent beer, good cocktails, tater tot and grilled cheese bars, good edm music and a back patio. Thumbs up.
author: Zara S.

description:
Went here on a rainy Wednesday night with a friend for her birthday. It wasn't too busy when we got there around 10:30pm, but it filled up within an hour. The owner, I believe his name was Mark, was tending bar, and he was AMAZING. Super nice, killer mustache, and when he wasn't making drinks he would come over and chat. Him being from New Hampshire, he noticed my Maine ID and struck up a conversation. I think he took a liking to my friend and I since he gave us free shots and was making our drinks pretty strong (pretty much all whiskey with a splash of soda). Mark is awesome, and I would definitely go back if I'm ever in the SF area again.
They also have shuffleboard! And the ladies room was fairly clean, which we enjoyed.
author: Janna H.

description:
I had the perfect, ideal restaurant/bar experience at this place. 

There are huge TVs located on what seemed like all four corners of this place so I could watch the game from wherever. The pitcher of "Strawberry Cisco Punch" comfortably quenched our whole party(five people)'s thirst. The mac and cheese with bacon in it was delicious-ly cheesy which is what I wanted from it. It had shuffleboard and a back patio area to lounge in if you felt like being outside on a sunny day. This is definitely the place to go chill with your friends on a lazy, Sunday afternoon.
author: Kerry S.

description: Beer, wings &fast service. Kinda sucks that there aren't any servers to wait and serve you but food makes up for it!
author: Monica G.

description:
Dr. Teeth is the mullet of Mission bars. The business in the front is comprised of strong cocktails and funky, gold-painted decor. Peruse a menu that ranges from strong and straight-forward to colorful drinks muddled and shaken to order. Grab a few baskets of truffle tater tots to share with your friends, and challenge worthy opponents to a game of shuffleboard. Then, make your way to the party in the back: an outdoor patio complete with Skee-Ball, picnic tables, mounted TVs (go Giants!), and -- on a mounted platform that adds on-top-of-the-world confidence to your liquid courage -- a bocce ball sand court.

One of my favorite hangouts. Before the patio closes at 10 p.m., the hipster clientele mingles freely with start-up folks and parents enjoying a beer and a game with their kids in tow. Get there early to secure a spot at the shuffleboard table; the sign-up sheet fills up fast, as does the line for food orders.
author: Kristina T.

description:
I love this bar....

One of my regular spots when I just want to grab a drink.... or several.

I hit up this spot almost every month...meet random folks... some of the bartenders know us... Its just overall a chill environment. The food is also awesome.. from burgers to tater tots.

Sometimes, you will encounter 2 cute little dogs running around. Be sure not to step on them.. and dont feed them any food!
author: Cel A.

description:
I'm happy to have found this place and their $10 burger and beer deal that they have on Mondays. For that price you would think that something would be lacking, but nope! The burger was ample and juicy, their selection of beers was good, and they have a bunch of sides to choose from. I got the sweet potato fries, and they were bomb. Our server was extremely friendly and attentive. 

The place is a little strangely decorated, but provides some interesting things to look at. It's large and has a lot of seating. 

It looks like they have some sort of deal nearly every weekday, and I've heard their Wing Wednesdays are pretty awesome. I'll be back.
author: Alana G.

description: The living social/groupon/etc deals were in evidence on a pretty packed Saturday morning, but we still managed to snag some space out back. I was impressed with the caliber & friendliness of the waitstaff. I thought the drinks were quite nice, with a good selection as well. The food was a step down in my opinion, but still fun and interesting.
author: Lisa K.

description: Best wings ever. Wednesday $.25 a wing with a $3 beer=  great backyard with cool people.
author: Michael H.

description: I have always loved the food at Dr. Teeth and never had an issue with the service but, the last two times I've gone I have waited more than 45min for my food. I ordered a glass of water and had to end up getting up and getting it myself. The food is yummy but I wish the service was just as good.
author: Jessica C.

description: I LOVE LOVE LOVE Dr. Teeth!! The Raspberry Fix is one of the best drinks I've had in my entire life and the Moscow Mules are awesome too. Truffle oil fans will rejoice at their mac n cheese and and tots! Their burgers are out of this world. Staff is super fun, professional and friendly! I can't recommend Dr. Teeth highly enough!!
author: Maya S.

description:
The bartender was a ponytailed gent who ignored my girlfriend and i (you live in san francisco, you better get used to the lesbians). after four people were served ahead of us that arrived after us, finally i was annoyed.  I agressively ordered our drinks. Not my sweetest self, but I wanted to like this bar. I LOVE the muppets.  There is not a god damn thing muppetish about this bar. It's loud and full of straight dudes and and those annoying gaggles of girls from the office in bad shoes. 

So, the drinks were really good.  

The guy that made them was NOT the guy that took our order, so no idea what his function is actually (ponytail dude, what are you doing back there?!!), but we ordered truffle fries at the same time as our drinks.  About 10 mins after our drinks were served (and sucked down because we like booze) no fries have arrived. So, I sweetly inquire, "hey man! where are those fries?!" to which he responds "oh, i forgot." No sorry, no i'll put them in now, not a thing. We said, run the card, we're leaving. 

Maybe the worst service ever and not only will we never go there again, we've already told everyone we know about the horrible service.  

The worst thing, is that i actually really liked the decor, but give me a muppet for chrissake!
author: Holly H.

description:
This is our new watering hole, and you can typically find me here after Monday Night Dodgeball getting my drink on. Great bar food, good selection of beer, and a nice clean dive atmosphere. This place has not disappointed me yet.

$10 burger and beer? Awweeesommeee.

What REALLY sets this place apart from the rest of the bars out there...JAMESON ON TAP. WAT??? And if you know me I love Jameson. All win! 

So if your ever in the mood to go chill, play some shuffleboard,  and eat some artery-clogging bar food. I highly suggest Dr. Teeth.
author: Joon Y.

description:
Nowhere can really beat $0.25 wings right?! There are 3 flavors: original, buffalo, and sweet habanero. I don't really recommend the original because it tastes pretty bland. The sweet habanero wasn't much to my liking either - it really just wasn't spicy enough. The buffalo was definitely my favorite.

But here's the deal: we ordered buffalo and sweet habanero and they brought us out original instead of buffalo. I forgive them because it's busy as hell in there and it probably gets hectic trying to remember all the orders. But instead of bringing us out buffalo wings, they just gave us the buffalo sauce to dip the original wings into. That to me was kind of crap. Granted, the buffalo sauce was by far the best tasting to me.

We also got the tator tots (original) which went oh so well with the wings! Highly recommended.

Also awesome here? Jameson on tap! My first experience with Jameson and what better way to have it than on tap? Well, so I got wasted and full at the same time. Always cool.

Women's bathroom does form a line eventually which is annoying, but for some reason women have to pee more and take 3 times as long as men do in bathrooms. & there's no sneaking into the men's bathroom because theirs has no lock & multiple men go in there at once. I think it's a mission thing.

All in all, a great hipster experience. It does get crowded after 6 pm so the earlier you get there the better chance you'll get a seat. I will be returning for wings Wednesday!
author: Junel S.

description:
You have to come here on a Wednesday night. Why? Because they have chicken wings for $0.25 all night or until they sell out. You are probably thinking, ok sure, chicken wings are cheap here BUT another incentive for you to visit this establishment is that they have Jamison on TAP. How many places in SF has Jamison on TAP? Not many lol.

So on to the real review. I came here around 8pm thinking its going to be packed and we won't get a table but low and behold, we were lucky to get seating in the middle of the bar. There were 4 of us so we decided to start out with 50 wings, of course assuming that they were small wings that are over-fried with little meat on it.

To our surprise, the wings were larger than most places I've been to including (hooters) so we were beside ourselves due to the price. We ordered a mix of buffalo wings, bbq wings, and 4 wings of the extremely spicy with Ghost Chili.

On top of the wings, we also order TATOR Tots!!! Man, it was nostalgic eating these tator tots. We ordered the A la Mayhem tator tots as well as the Truffle tator tots.

On a side note, I've been to cha cha cha next door plenty of times but never noticed the bar that is literallly next door.

Food Highlight: Of course the wings for $0.25 each on Wednesday but don't forget to order the A la Mayhem tator tots and the Jamison on Tap!!!

Eat on, fellow foodies!
author: Rich L.

description: My new favorite go to bar.  Before 7pm it's relaxed and easy to get in, but you'll get some crowds later and on the weekends if you want something more high energy.  I've spent quite a few nights here eating tater tots already and am developing a taste for their on-tap fernet.  There's also a shuffleboard and back patio.  The place is just fun, casual, and has a decent pub menu.
author: Aaron W.

description:
Came here for brunch with my good pal a little bit ago. I think the place is a straight up bar at night and only serves food during the weekend days.. not sure though.
