But anyway, who doesn't love bottomless mimosas?! They do serve it in a plastic cup though, which is less than classy but at least, sanitary! *Bonus points from the germiphobe*

I had the eggs benedict and it was awesome. Also LOVED that they served it with tater tots instead of hash. This girl loves her tater tots!
author: L M.

description: Fun bar with shuffle board and tons of booth space inside and a nice sized patio with big picnic benches, tv's and corn hole outside. Tasty beverages with 4$ well drink happy hour even on Friday. Also the food is pretty awesome, gotta love beer and tots.
author: Arielle K.

description:
Okay, elk meat is gamey. I get it - I'm no schlub. I enjoy a nice gamey piece of meat now and again (though after eating lamb in New Zealand, all non-kiwi lamb can take a hike). But when something is overpoweringly gamey, that just screams "not that fresh" to me. And that's exactly what went through my brain upon biting into an elk burger at Dr Teeth.

Not that I didn't know that I was taking a risk, with a menu featuring ghost pepper-infused hot sauce, a burger with peanut butter on it, and "reuben" egg rolls, but needless to say: don't order it. 

Otherwise, the service has always been top-notch, and Tuesday trivia can be fun. Ultimately, this place just isn't my scene. If you're the next Adam Richman, scope the menu. If not, steer clear.

Also, there are no muppets here. Womp womp.
author: Christina S.

description: The wait staff is really nice and the drink with the bud light and grapefruit is legit BUT I find their food to be really expensive and not delicious.
author: Molly S.

description: Hmmmmm...Well, the bartenders are fine and the doorman too - Definitely does not feel like SF in that place, more like Walnut Creek or something ...strange very strange. The name is absolutely awesome. Never had the food. I'd like to stop by Sunday-Wednesday, with the hope that it will be much much better?
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Truffle tots for sure. 

We ordered a lot of food here:

Cobb salad: good lettuce. came with grilled chicken that was tasty, but it was the same as the chicken in the mendo. 
Fried chicken sandwich: pretty good. I don't remember much about it though. 
Mendo sandwich: Good components, but it needed some tang. I suppose that's what the dipping sauce is for, but I'm not so hot on mayo-based sauces.
Truffle Tots: Very good! Not what you make at home. So crispy and perfect.

Really great service. We came on a Friday evening before it was crowded, but there was still a fair amount of people dining and drinking. The waitress was really attentive and checked in on us very often. There were people going around to refill water and to take care of any requests. Overall, it was a good dining experience, but it was a bit loud and it just seemed a bit like glorified bar food.
author: Victoria J.

description:
So I went here 2x because a lovely yelper told me too. First time we'll just ignore as I like thinking on happy moments. I'll simply write about all the happiness I experienced here on the second. 

I will say this straight up. Only reason it is not 5 stars is because I didn't eat any of the food but I did salivate as I watched happiness in the form of tater tots smothered in a variety of toppings get served to other people. 

4 stars goes to our waitress that was working a double and I literally wanted to wait around and get her drunk because she effing rocked. When we first arrived (carnival weekend btw) it was pretty empty and there was this Adidas model shoot thing going on so not alot of people were drinking. By the time we stumbled out it was packed, but she still was managing to pretty much run the floor by herself. So owners cute brunette with long straight hair and awesome figure (i know you said your name but PBR had its way with me) deserves an effing raise!

4 star goes to the adorable bartender. The stache made my day. Also alot of bartenders when confronted with a drink they haven't heard of will be dicks about making it. I am obsessed with cactus coolers, but nor cal seems lacking in them so I routinely have to explain this at bars. (citrus vodka floater of peach schnapps dropped into red bull with NO orange juice!) He was just like okies tell me whats in it and bam drinks made and in my tummy. I also am a huge bloody mary fan and I think I would actually mission here hung over for one it was that good.

4stars go to the awesome back patio. I had some not so great tan lines from sitting out there.

4 stars to an actually maintained shuffleboard! so many times places have shuffleboard but theres no sand on it so the games :(

4 stars for their drink specials. Me coworker and man all go pretty wasted over a decent 5 hours for around 70 bucks. (roughly 5 an hour for a good time)

Bathrooms were a bit icky but hey its a bar not a lounge so i can't hate. Over all I am sooooooooo glad i gave it a chance cause we had a super fun time, the drinks were strong, our waitress was bomb, and the crowd turned super fun. Can't wait for July to start drinking again and do the bottomless mimosas.

So thank again friend for suggesting!
author: Meg N.

description: The burgers were great! Perfectly cooked with a good abundance of melted Brie. I had the side of Totcho's and it's a huge helping of glorious tater tots with nacho fixins. The drinks were well balanced with the Bloody Mary's knocking it out of the park. Service was not really great that's why the 4 stars.
author: Victor G.

description:
I was ridiculously excited when I heard that an Electric Mayhem themed bar was coming to the Mission.  I mean, OMFG, it's the fucking Electric Mayhem, can you picture that?

In the end, the bar doesn't incorporates almost any Muppet theme into the decor.  For the very in the know, there's a single peacock symbol on the wall along with the very prominent Dr. Teeth sign out front.  Otherwise it appears to have left over decorations from an S&M club.  Odd.

So I came for the decor (which isn't there) but stayed for the burgers and beer.  It's got surprisingly good bar food!  Burgers are moist real beef patties on a nice bun, veggie burgers are good according to the wife.  The philistines who eat the tachos (tater-tot nachos) seems to love them.   The one thing I haven't heard love for is the fried pickles.  Which is fine by me cause I hate pickles.

Oh, and beer.  They have that too.  The taps aren't anything too special, typical SF favorites.  But your drinks come in old jelly jars which is always fun.

It can be crowded sometimes but wade through the crowd to the back where there's often still plenty of space.  And if that fails, sit down at somebodyelse's table and act weird till you scare them off.  It worked well this past Friday.
author: Ivan L.

description:
One word for you, yelpers: Totchos. 
For those of you who have yet to experience this, it's a plate of piping hot tater tots covered in all of your favorite nacho fixings. In other words, probably the greatest food fusion invention since the Sushiritto.

If totchos don't sound like your thing (because you're a hollow shell and you've lost the ability to experience joy), Dr Teeth also offers some tasty wings for only 25 cents on Wednesdays, a good selection of beer and cocktails, and an awesome back patio. 

If you need a break from Zeitgeist, and the idea of  spending a chill sunday playing some drunken skee-ball while eating a plate of totchos sounds appealing to you, then this is the spot.
author: H M.

description: Tuesday Trivia was pretty fun (especially after winning a bottle of booze on the final round).  Wouldn't mind another night of Whiskey breeze, Parmesan meatball sliders, and yummy sweet potato tots. yum yum
author: Stephanie T.

description: I cannot get enough of their 25 cent wings every Wednesday. It's such a deal and I thought they were going to McDonaldesque when I got them but they were actually pretty good. They have the usual flavors of bbq and buffalo ranch but then they also have sweet habenero and death. I have only had the bbq and personally they are better than the wings that my family makes and that saying a lot. My friends also got a pitcher of American Mule and it was pretty strong but that was alright with me. Will definitely be back!
author: Desiree C.

description:
1) Great idea = tater tots bar. I especially LOVE the sweet potato tots, highlighted by sweet, smokey barbecue dip.
2) Mac & Cheese = not too greasy, and delicious with bacon & jalapeno, or just plain truffle.
3) Love the homemade corndogs with homemade sausage, and pretty much everything else on the menu. down home style with quality ingredients.
3) trivia night, anyone? very funny, very fun. that casey is a charmer.
4) pretty good cocktails. definitely more of a grab-a-beer type of a place, and more a pub than a lounge, but still respectable, and tasty
5) Service is a little on the shitty side. Like, it's average speed, but it's not very attentive.
6) for this type of establishment I did expect crispier, more tasty and less syrupy wings. 

Over all = good atmosphere, suitable for a little upscalish pub food, a fun place to hang out and drink good beer, cocktails, and play some shuffleboard.
author: Y K.

description:
Peanut butter jelly burger! Seriously. Seriously. Also, quick & friendly service, big menu full of fried goodness, and they take credit. Seriously.

Only downside: there was some sort of frat boy convergence the night I was there. And a bunch of people in wigs. Not sure if this is the routine crowd but I'd take my chances again.
author: Dana O.

description:
This review is for Wednesdays only. 

What brought me here was the 25 cent wings and they keep me coming back every Wednesday. All the wings are good but the most tender are the BBQ and buffalo, the habanero with sweet chili has the best flavor to me but is the toughest. 
The customer service is really great, well at least our last server was. She keep coming back to the table to make sure we were cool and if we need anything. I guess it just depends on how busy they are.
author: Louis C.

description: Tried this for the first time last week.  Wednesday nights are chicken wings night and the place gets hugely packed with people!  You need to arrive shortly after opening otherwise you won't get preferred seating.  They offer I think 6 types of chicken wings.  As a fan of all things spicy, I tried their "Death Wings" and they live up to the hype.  I had one and that was enough.  They basically use hot sauce that is used for large soups.  The others are all basic and standard, but the flavor is good.  There's a large hidden patio in the back, so follow the hallway back.  The patio is cute, but could use some updates to make it more consumer friendly.  On the top tier where we ate, it was pretty dark.  The mgmt should also remove the bean bag game on Wednesday as there's simply not enough room to be playing that game.
author: Shaun W.

description:
While I like the idea of this place, just like anything in the mission it get swallowed up by the hipster plague. The drinks are great, the food is so-so and the service is something left to be desired.

We waited to nab a seat which is completely fine because it's first come first serve for seating. While there tends to be land grabbing for "people coming later" I tend to think that's bullshit. If your friends aren't here on time, they get to stand like the 2/3rds of the rest of us. 

The food isn't bad. I love the 10 sliders for $10 bucks deal! I havent yet experienced the taco Thurs or wing Wed phenomenon. 

I'll be back, just maybe right before happy hour starts or a weekend day to get a decent experience.
author: Chazz d.

description:
TOTS!!!

Did that get your attention? LOL.  Dr Teeth and the Electric Mayhem is awesome.  So my buddies and I are off to another Yelp! mission and check out this joint in the mission and I'm like...where are we going?

So as we get to the place and I start to wonder what am I getting myself into?  The place is decked out in, I don't even know how to describe it, like half mannequins that are see through with lights, kind of like, I don't even know, you have to see for yourself. 

But anyway we order the Tater tots sampler, the lamb burger and some other burger, I don't even remember, but the TOTS!!! I was focused on the tots lol.

This review is totally on the Tots sorry.

*Tatchos- is like nachos, but with tater tots instead of the chips, so like tater tots with salsa and gucamole and sour cream, OMG, effin awesome.

*Sweet Potato Tots - were delish.

*Truffle tots - tater tots cooked in truffle oil. score! I think every tater tot should only be fried with truffle oil, it's like the law.

There you have it fellow Yelpers! Tater tots everyway possible.

Dr Teeth and the Electric Mayhem, you're definitely good in my book.
author: Edrian D.

description:
PACKED on a Friday night. Venue got a good amount of chairs & tables. Very dark in the back of the venue. They serve their beers in cool little glass jars. The service at the bar seemed quite fast. This place also serves food! 

Chill place to come with your friends and have a drink and a snack, but having a conversation will prove to be difficult as it is quite loud.
author: R H.

description: Saturday night: good beer selections...pretty good mixed drinks.   Music was upbeat and pleasent. only bad thing for me: it is waaaaaay too dark. Didn't try the food but judging by the smell I would guess it is pretty good.
author: Gloria R.

description:
Bad ASS. Grass-fed burger for the price of grain-fed. I got two huge patties for nine or ten dollars, which comes with tater tots, and when I asked for rare, they brought it f$$$ing rare. A cooked veneer over raw meat like I sometimes buy from Bi-Rite or Prather and just eat tartar. Most places, even a Locavore or a Mission Beach, will give you medium when you ask for rare.

With bacon and sweet potato tots and tax it came in under $14. I'll tell you something: you won't do that at Super Duper. Not with two enormous goddamn patties.

The owner Mark is worth going in for by himself. He's got that burning gleam of the relentless entrepreneur and is funny as hell. Plus his moustache--and I'm not a stache guy, really--is wicked. I'm not a hipster bitch, I just wear the shades.

The layout is cleverly wide open and the place's name is a Muppets reference. Devious.

The sweet potato tater tots are tater tots, not fries or frites. That implies many things, accurately.

A bar/restaurant on Mission street, not Valencia, that doesn't serve greasy torture meat. This place is paleo as HELL, boy.
author: Matt L.

description:
Its a very eclectic place.  A little dark and dingy, but don't like that scare you away, the food is actually pretty good.

We got a living social coupon for brunch with endless mimosas, and 2 shots of fernet (that stuff is wicked!)  The mimosas are serviced in plastic drink cups, which we thought was strange, but they kept coming to fill out cups, so no complaints here.

I ordered the (jelly donut fried chicken sandwich) and truffle tater tots.  It was YUMMO!   I place is not in the best neighborhood, but I'd go back again just for the sandwich and the tots.

It is a great little find.
author: Jacki C.

description:
When you come to Mayhem, it feels like you are at Tonic, but in the mission. It has almost the same layout, but more funky and vibrant. These guys really know what they are doing with all these popular bars such as Bullitt, Tonic, and Rebel. They each have something original about them and that's what makes them so popular. Message to other yelpers, stop hating on the name, I like it. Though I do agree, there should be at least some muppets memorabilia. 

You will have a good time here, it's chill...they play 90's music...have a shuffleboard...it's usually crowded...a good place to start off the night. Not as hipsterish as elbo room, but it's getting there. I celebrated a friend's birthday here and a bit sad they didn't have the scorpion bowls, but they do have awesome drinks like the mayhem cocktail. The food is very comforting, try the sliders, wings, and tatchos, all solid. Every time I come here the damn hot dogs and crepe stands right outside smell amazing and are hard to pass on. 

I'll definitely be back and would love to see more upbeat music. This place has a lot of specials throughout the week you should check out. Can't wait for the next bar to open in the Marina!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
25 Cent Wing Wednesday
Pro: Juicy 25 cent wings.
Con: No seating and no parking.

I finally put my foot down and told the boyfriend that we were going to eat at Dr Teeth & the Electric Mayhem no matter what because he has been on a wing kick ever since we ate at Buffalo Wild Wings that just opened up in the Serramonte Mall (can you believe he has the nerve to say that the wings at BWW are delicious when they are dry and not evenly coated with sauce?). 

But here at Dr. Teeth & the Electric Mayhem, every single wing is coated with whichever sauce you choose and every single wing is cooked perfect, they are juicy and tender.   

It was extremely crowded and I'm not sure if it was due to it being 25 cent wing Wednesday or because of the Warriors game or both but it was hard to find a seat. I finally ventured out into the back and found the patio because I noticed a lot of people coming out of nowhere. The boyfriend was not happy that 1) he couldn't find parking for 30 minutes and 2) it was too crowded, so then he told me that we will not be eating in the Mission for awhile not because of those two reasons. Well, even if I won't be there for awhile, I think that you should definitely come try their wings, even if it's just once!
author: Mona L.

description:
Based on all the 1 star reviews (I always read the bad reviews first, as they're usually more helpful) I was all prepared to hate this place.  Bad service, hipsters, expensive drinks, crowded, etc. and our experience was just the OPPOSITE.

We showed up on a FRIDAY at 6pm, right in the middle of most bars slam time, and the place was only slightly crowded.  Granted there were a dozen+ people outside because it was so nice out, but inside, it was just us, another 2 tables and a few guys at the bar.

We had a group of 15 people who straggled in over the course of a 2 hour period, and we had our own personal waitress, even after all the tables in the bar were filled with other customers.

We were a nightmare--ordering food and drinks EVERY time she came back to the table (8+times) and asking for separate checks, paying for drinks in cash but food on a tab, that sort of thing.  We also had a Groupon, but we got ZERO attitude and amazing, doting service.  We literally never waited to order food or drinks, and everything came out quickly,  was correct and on the right tab.  Maybe they got a new waitress?  Ours  was a young, leggy blond.

I was happy to see the dude with the curled mustache at the bar because so many people had spoken highly of him on here, and his service was no disappointment.  
When I went up to order drinks, he acknowledged me right away, even though the 5 people at the bar were clearly regulars and he was chatting with them.  He's one of the few bartenders in the city who can work AND talk at the same time.  Shocking, I know.

The guy ahead of me ordered like 15 drinks, and even apologized for taking so long (though it was only like 2 min) and because everyone around (staff and patrons) was all smiley and inclusive, I would have waited 15 min for a drink!  It's amazing how few people know that a genuine smile/eye contact and an *I'll be right with you* can get you FAR with customers.

We also ordered 7+ plates of food and although most everything on their menu is a gut bomb, it was still mighty tasty!  

Did I mention $4 for 24oz of PBR?  YES!  Not super cheap, but also not self-important-expensive like the bars that charge $3 or 4 for a regular can!

Oh, and for those who complain about there being no Muppet theme--go outside, they're all out there waiting to say HI!
author: D C.

description:
Ok, this place is super "Hipster" but......I still like it. I have yet to order anything here I didn't like. Highly recommend the Mac and Cheese and the truffle tater tots. 

If you love spicy and you're brave, go for the ghost burger. However, if you're thinking about ordering it to see how spicy it is. It's spicy.....TRUST! Ghost chilies are not a joke. I put a tiny drop on a tot and I almost died. I had to be a baby and ask for a glass of milk I was in pain.

If you go for brunch, sit on the back patio, it's a nice area to relax (beware of people lighting up back there though). The bottomless mimosas were a little pricy for a small glass, however they live up to their word and kept them coming.
author: Candace L.

description:
So I went here in February 2012 due to a stellar recommendation from my friend's hair dresser. We were in the mission and figured why not make a night of it. The hairdresser really recommended the Tot-chos. It sounded delicious.

We get to Dr. Teeth's and sit down promptly. Our waitress took ten minutes to come great us. We put in our order for our drinks and the Tot-chos. Our drinks came within five minutes (and were awesome). Forty five minutes later our tots come after having to remind the waitress. She had forgotten to put in the order. We asked for our check when we recieved the tots and again, had to repeatedly ask her for it. 15 minutes later we got it. 

About 20 minutes after leaving my friend and I started to feel really sick. The tot-chos were not a good idea. I'm going back to try their 25 cent wings and to give the place another shot. But we will see...
author: Cassie W.

description:
This place is the jaaaaaam.

Tatchos (tater-tot nachos for those not in the know), death wings (sign the waiver), and random Sunday night dance parties. How could you not? The place has a less than divey feel which is both comfortable and "missiony" (did I really just say that). But fuck, the buffalo fried chicken sandwich is the shiiiiit. Did I mention the staff were really attractive? Big ol' tele's to watch the game on. And uh, yeah Fernet and Jameson on tap. Bada bing bada boom kiiiid. 

The only buzz-kill is a limited happy hour... It could be worse.
author: Daniel C.

description: Short and simple. I've been here a few times. Burgers are awesome. Tater tots... Overrated. Sausage corn dogs are amazing, and the reuben egg rolls kick ass. Skip the tots, and get the corn dogs and egg rolls. And Courtney the waitress was nice and rad. Cheers and enjoy this place. And they play great music. Adios.
author: Charlie Ramone D.

description:
Julia? Julie? Juliet? The young woman with a cute bob-ish haircut handled my large group very well. A gaggle of girls celebrating a birthday can be a bit intimidating, but she knew how to entertain and take care of business.

Um, the chocolate cake shot was pretty amazing. Try it. Trust me.
author: Farah S.

description:
If I could describe the decor I'd say it reminds me of a... 70s/early 80s gay dentist's office. And yet it doesn't feel cheap or cheesy. They did a good job balancing the flare by making it a little divey and gritty in no small part to the pretty awesome light fixtures.

This place can get packed, so if you can handle the crowds or you can drop in early, the Mayhem is a strong drink you can get that will put some hair on your chest.  

Wish I hadn't eaten 2 dinners before coming here, otherwise I would have loved to have tried their food.  But oh, I'll be back.
author: L K.

description:
Went after work with my boyfriend.  The drink was really great, I got a mojito.   The ambiance was also awesome!! We sat out in the Patio, it was sunny and a lot of fun.  
The only bad part was our order of Jalapeño poppers.  They were really WAAAY too breaded and tasted pretty bad.  We barely ate two of them and left the rest.   

I would go again, but for the drinks.  Not sure what their other food is like, but a bit hesitant to try.
author: Tanisha G.

description:
I've been coming here for several years now (not regularly but occasionally) and I have to say the place seems to have gone down hill a bit as far as food quality and service.  I was there with a group of 8 on Saturday afternoon and, granted it was a bit busy (not packed), but our server was rarely to be found.  She was certainly pleasant enough when she was around, but we had to go looking for her 4-5 times and each time she acted like there was nothing unusual about us having to go find her.  

Our first round of drinks took no less than 15 minutes to make it to our table (literal buzz kill!), and I don't think she ever even came back to ask if we wanted more.  We ordered tot-chos and the blue cheese tots, both with chicken, and compared to what I remember them being in the past, they were very unspectacular and not even hot.  We also ordered 10 sliders (we ordered 5 classic and 5 meatball but we received 10 classic) and, though they tasted fine, left no lasting impression.  

As a result of this visit, I will be dropping Dr. Teeth off my list of places I frequent when trolling the Mission.  Goodbye for now Dr. Teeth.  I hope if I do happen in sometime again in the future these issues will have been fixed.  The prices may be right, but it's only a deal if you're getting something good!
author: J D.

description:
I go here a lot. Not as much as others since it definitely seems like there is a 'regular' crowd but never feel like there's an unwelcoming hierarchy.

It's a great place to bring visitors to for a unique, trendy, upbeat friday night at a bar.

They have bar food, good beers, djs sometimes, a back patio (where my boyfriend had a company BBQ randomly and it unexpectedly looks up a hill at people's backyards making it actually feel cool and cozy. There are also TVs, weird cool mannequin sculptures, various kinds of people, and fun (not top 40s) music.

The recommendations seem to get around easily because I ran into a friend from Hawaii who was visiting in town completely by accident after she was referred by another tourist. Ironically it does not strike you as a tourist spot, which is nice.

Always a good time!
author: Jessica V.

description:
As soon as I read about this place opening up I knew I had to check it out. 

Their food sounded fantastic (reuben egg rolls, and I don't even like reuben sandwiches!), 

They have Jameson and Fernet on tap! 

They have shuffleboard! (although the table is a little warped, from what my friends observed).

...and a Muppet name to boot! - although that's about as far as the reference goes.

I tried their 'make-your-own' sampler plate, with mac & cheese, jalapeño poppers, and chicken strips. It was a rather tough choice since everything sounded amazing, but I decided to stick with the classics.

The mac & cheese was great and so were the  jalapeño poppers. But I probably wouldn't order the chicken strips again....they weren't very meaty and a little dry.

My friends shared the sliders between 2 people and they said it was plenty. The plate of tots from the "tater tot bar" was enough to share as well.

On a different occasion I tried their Blackberry fizz, which was delicious but goes for a steep $12. But it is a full glass' worth... not your typical cocktail-size.... complete with blackberry bits. I would order it every time if it wasn't in the double digit price range...

I also had their mini corn dogs, made with sausage instead of hot dogs. Pretty good, although by the end of it I could've gone for just an old school dog.

I've heard they started doing a bottomless brunch, and I will definitely be back for that! I'm a sucker for mimosas. Not to mention there is apparently a benedict bar. 

They have also started doing Taco Thursdays with $2 tacos and 2-for-1 margaritas, which sounds very promising.

After writing this review...I don't know why I don't go here every week with these options!
author: Katie S.

description: First time at Dr. teeth...heard about it from friends. I was told about the .25 wings on Wednesday and how packed it can get so we showed up around 4:30. Beelined for the patio seating then ordered at the bar. There were five in our party, first two orders were delivered promptly and piping hot...and I noticed those around us were having their food delivered promptly then suddenly the food service stopped. 30min later (according to my receipt) and still my friend and I didn't receive our food. My friend got her food first and told me her wings were cold...I got my food 3min later (tater tots and 10 wings) to the touch food was warm...once I bit into it...COLD. She was coo with eating it but I wasn't. I had my plate of food along with the receipt and told the lady by the register my problem....she said she couldn't help me because I ordered at the bar so I had to wait for a bartender to assist me. I stood near the bartender for 5min and I was helped but it was as if I was a nuisance. I explained how I waited 30min for my wings and was served cold food and I no longer wanted 10wings because I had drank my two beers as I waited and instead wanted 5 wings. He changed my order and gave me back a buck but it was as if I was such a pain. Maybe if the food runners were a bit more attentive and didn't allow my food to just sit there....we wouldn't have a problem. I feel the wings were a good size and very tasty along with my tots...however you must ask for extra napkins and plates otherwise you're screwed and must fend for yourself. We asked the waitress for napkins twice and she came near us without napkins both times while my friends fingers were a mess. More people need to be hired for the Wednesday wing demand because the servers are very inattentive.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
This was a fun place in the mission! Lots of random things on display everywhere (which I guess explains the electric mayhem in the name) but not tacky. seemed to have a pretty hipster crowd.

We only went for drinks, all of which were really good and very strong. The bourbon breeze is a good choice if you're a whiskey fan. All of their specialty cocktails use top shelf liquor and are only $10 (which is a nice change from NYC prices!)
author: Punam P.

description:
We came here over the weekend with about 14 people--10 of whom straggled in at random times.  And no reservation.  

Not only was this NOT a problem, but there were huge tables out back that fit everyone, and at least 5 really cute dogs just hanging around enjoying the sun.

Good bloody marys, awesome service, tasty breakfast.
What.  A treat.
author: Jennie C.

description: Cool place great food and good customer service. I will come return for more of the delicious and eclectic items on the menu.I love the diversity of the employees and customers. And the food is pretty darn good. Next time I will try the jelly doughnut chicken sandwich. Mmmm
author: Melissa B.

description: Been here 3 times now and still don't understand why people give this place good reviews. The staff was very unfriendly and unhelpful and RUDE the place was very overcrowded and The food was pretty disgusting I ordered fried mozzarella sticks and it came out as what I would call a fried puffy breadstick with a thin layer of hard cheese inside.
author: Michele H.

description: Totchos and Bacon wrapped tater tots are heaven! Especially while sitting at a kick ass top notch bar like Teeth! The carnitas on the Totchos was very flavorful and tender! Highly recommended.
author: Jaswin K.

description:
Holy crap! This place is terrible. 

Granted, this was probably during one of their busiest times (New Year's Day) and they simultaneously had a Thrillist special going on. But if they were going to do a special intended for a drunken New Year's crowd, shouldn't they have prepped for it? They were extremely ill-equipped for the crowd.

We waited almost 20 minutes before getting a single look from one of the wait staff, who told us we needed to order at the bar. After getting thrown back and forth between the wait staff and the bar, we finally made our order.

We had joined our group of friends who made it to the bar a bit earlier than us. We met them in the back patio, which was a nice, quaint location to have a nice New Year's brunch. Unbeknownst to us, we would have to wait a solid 1 hour before the first part of our group received their food and then another 1 hour before the rest of us got sick of waiting. At best, the food our friends got was cold and unappetizing.

The only redeeming portion of their meals was probably the tater tots, but even then, we weren't able to experience those tots on our own. Having waited a solid 2 hours for our food, we went to talk to the wait staff who were no longer coming to the back patio and they said that our food was 6 more orders back. Are you kidding me?!

We decided to leave and asked for our Thrillist refund so that we could either use at another time (or in our case sell it to someone else). That seemed to work smoothly, but then the damn manager had the gall to tell us that we had to pay for the bottomless mimosas that were a part of the meal. Really? Yeah, and it was $15 per person, the same cost as the damn Thrillist deal. GTFO.

So we argued with the manager a bit more, stating that we had little of none of the mimosa to drink. He tried making excuses about how many people were there, but really, that's not our problem. I'm a reasonable person when I go to restaurants because I've worked in the service industry, but this was a completely negative experience that I hope no one ever has to experience during their time out.
author: George D.

description: This place is pretty great. It gets busy within a couple hours for sure. I got the Blackberry Fix drink, a burger, and my friends and I shared truffle tater tots and sweet potato fries. The Blackberry Fix is a delicious drink. You can definitely taste the liquor, but it's not too alcoholic tasting for those who might as well just be taking a shot. I also had a sip of the Whiskey Breeze and that was also pretty good. Not as heavy on the alcohol as the Blackberry Fix, but good and I'm not even a huge fan of whiskey to be honest. The truffle tater tots were gooood. Not as truffle tasting as I expected, like truffle fries from Unami Burger, but still good. Sweet potato fries, a choice you can't go wrong with. Burger was delicious and it even came with this sweet chilli sauce that was great for dipping. Service is good and our waitress was really nice. Definitely would go back as I want to try to tacos or wings one day. :)
author: Julie L.

description:
I arrived in SF a month ago and this is the 2nd dive bar I discovered. This is GREAT. Chicken wings are at $0.25 each and blue cheese sauce is delicious. There is a backyard with pretty lights. 
But, there is much noise and it is hard to hear each other talking. 
Anyway, great place to chill at night!
author: Vicky A.

description: This place is nice and roomy with plenty of space for big groups and they have food! and wait for it.... WING WEDNESDAYS! Great spot in the mission!
author: Brittini S.

description:
I think the name speaks for itself.....Amazing....Headless mannequins, old random movies on display, and....JAMESON ON TAP! Amazeballs!

Hipster or not, pretty friendly bar. Bartenders are cool and fast which is a plus, and they sell those tiny Pacificos, which at first I only thought Corona did those. Haven't tried the food here yet, but the fact that they have a kitchen is pretty clutch for a bar in the city.

They also have shuffleboard for you folks that love playing drunken games....The only con about this bar is that it can get really packed on the weekends. But I mean, if you're just in the mood to let loose and have a good time, this place is awesome!
author: Nicky N.

description:
Great cocktails, great deals. I love the combination of classy drinks and cheep eats, especially as said eats are offered in miniature. The sliders were A-Ok, but my favorite snacks were actually the tots a la mayhem (i.e. covered in dressing and cheese...hard to go wrong with that!).

Avoid: the veggie burger. Its purple. Weird.

Try: tots a la mayhem. tater tots "animal style." Yes!

The atmosphere is comfortable and flexible. Came here for the first time for going away drinks night at the end of my last job. It's great place for groups, with the flexibility for people to drop in and drop out over the course of an evening. Stopped by again on the afternoon of the great San Francisco Santa Con for an afternoon pick-me-up and had another positive experience.
author: Lindsay M.

description: I was actually pretty disappointed. I went and got a burger with a fried egg on top. The fried egg was overcooked - the yolk was completely cooked. Totally destroys the point of having the egg on the burger. Not to mention the burger itself was cooked well beyond the medium rare I requested. The meat was dry and flavorless. What a bummer.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Cool name for a bar although I can't remember it when people ask. 

25 cent wings on Wednesday + happy hour drink specials makes this place a winner. Everyone that worked there was super awesome as well, so 5 stars for Dr Teeth!
author: Greg M.

description:
Brunch 10:30am Saturday. You can never go wrong with bottomless mimosas.  Although our waitress was kind of slow because she was taking care of the whole patio area, the "busboys" did a really good job at making sure our mimosa glasses were never empty.  Get the jelly donut fried chicken sandwich! It was amazing! Our living social deal came with 2 shots that were taking forever to come out so we just left after taking care of the bill... Unfortunately we got a ticket for an expired meter for waiting so long =[

Came here once at night too. Cool vibe but super crowded so we left. I wouldn't recommend it for big crowds but I'm sure if you're lucky enough to get a table then it'd be fun!

Overall cool place. I'd go again.
author: Angelica T.

description:
This place has a great continue-the-party-through Sunday ambiance.  I think it would be particularly fun on a three-day weekend.  The place is funky, hipstery, and super loud.  We had just all-you can drink mimosas, which were pretty low grade, but, there are lots of other drinks.  In this place, you're paying for the atmosphere.  

That being said, I don't know how this place gets 4 star averages given its food.  I ordered a spinach and feta omelet, which was delicious, but came with a massive 1/2 plate of bland tater-tots and a fruit cup of mealy banana and a few slivers of strawberry.  They were out of some of their more famous sides, including the bacon.

My boyfriend ordered scrambled eggs, toast, tater tots, and sausage.  Everything was so bland and grey, it was basically tasteless.  The tater totes aren't tossed in any spices or anything.  They come with a dill-mayo dressing that could be good, but which was so watered down with milk, it wasn't.  The sausage was terrible.  

The service here is good.  Staff are really nice and, as I said, the vibe is fun.  However, given that you're likely to have a long weekend brunch wait, as we did, I think you can have a better overall experience elsewhere.
author: Jenny B.

description:
Sometimes the service can be a little slow, and there are only 4 beers on tap. Those are my only complaints.

Totchos are to die for, sweet potato tots are also great, and the salads are darn good and HUGE. Sliders were a little uninteresting, but that's after I stuffed myself with tots and immediately regretted not putting Tums in my purse.

We love coming here for trivia on Tuesday nights. Starts at 8, goes till about 10. The emcee is a funny guy and encourages banter/heckling. They give shots to the team with the best name. Third place gets a round of shots, second place gets a bottle of alcohol to take home, and first place gets a $50 gift certificate. My team won this week, so we'll be back next Tuesday to defend our title and use our $50!
author: Kate S.

description: I came here on a Wednesday night for happy hour. They had 50 cents wings which was awesome. I had the spicy sweet Habanero wings which tasted a little spicy-mild but enough spice for me. It was similar to Asian chicken wings because of the sweet and spicy chili. I'll probably come back with my friends to drink and get chicken wings for a cheap price. The other food that other people looked really delicious and the shuffle board is probably a good game to play when wasted :D
author: Jason L.

description: Great Saturday brunch spot. Went there on a Saturday from brunch and the ambiance was fun. Not super packed like some other popular brunch spots and the back patio is awesome in the sun. Plus the shuffleboard table and bottomless mimosas till 3PM are a plus!
author: Brian K.

description: Loud and crowded.   Beer selection on tap sub par.
author: Michael E.

description:
**Food Only**

It was a late night and I was getting hungry after some rounds of drinks but the place we were at closed their kitchen already.  We went here on a whim hoping they still served food and they did.  We shared a tomato soup and grilled cheese sandwich that was served with salad and some tator tot nacho fries...LOVE

Both were so incredibly yummy...could be I was starving but in all honesty we devoured the whole thing and the nacho tator tots were pretty filling.  

It's a bit loud here which I didn't care for.  It was super dark too. Had to use our cell phones to make sure we weren't sitting in a complete mess.
author: Kim D.

description: Came here on a Wednesday and this place was packed! Good thing my friends had an area where they were seated before I got there. The decorations are very interesting with decorated mannequins and lights that reflect into mirrors. Also, this place is super hipster hah. We came here on a Wednesday only because the wings are $0.25! They were pretty good and juicy too! Alcohol is also cheaper on Wednesdays. But because we came here on a super hot day, it was way too humid and stuffy in there so we didn't stay to long. I definitely would like to come back for their wings again someday.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I was here last Thursday night for a Happy Hour Fundraiser party a friend was putting on for the Alzheimer's Association.  This bar will host these events any Thursday night for charities and donate 10% of all proceeds for the night back to the charity of their choice?  AWESOME - and not something you see all the time!

Pretty solid ambience - the staff was really friendly and on top of things.  I tried the Reuben Egg Rolls and had the signature cocktail The Mayhem - both were awesome.  The back patio looked really cool: huge deck, along with an astro turf area for games and stuff (they had cornhole boards set up!).

Definitely coming back for brunch on the patio and going to check out the other bars they have in the city.
author: Kyle O.

description:
This place is a good place to go to if you're looking for yummy bar food and a great patio. Expect a crowd on the patio on a beautiful sunny San Francisco day. Expect an even bigger crowd on 25 cent wing Wednesdays. 

I especially enjoy the cheap PBRs, the macaroni and cheese and tater tots mayhem. The drinks are always strong as well. 

I'm looking forward to going to this place for brunch one of these days.
author: Saralee L.

description:
$0.25 cent wings!!Wednesdays!

I came here under a co-workers recommendation and it was PACKED on a wednesday. this place is best for groups that are 6 or less..because of the lack of space. 

I came in and I had no idea what was going on...where do i order food, was there a menu...I just saw a line and follow what everyone else did...ordered my wings/beer and got a number..

I then went outside in the patio and waited for the wings. they came out relatively fast.  Good cheap wings...cheap alcohol...win win!
author: Brendan L.

description: Yeah, you know, I came for the wings and the beer. It's not a problem ordering, getting a seat is probably the toughest part of your night (or afternoon). $.25 wings, so getting 20 is $5 and getting 50 is $12.50 which is suuuppppeeerrr cheap. Wings are good if you're buzzed enough otherwise it doesn't taste all that great. Back patio is so nice but the whole time I was wondering if the neighboring tenants hate this bar.
author: Ryan L.

description: Awesome.  Good drinks, good vibe, GREAT DJ.  And they've got a shuffleboard.  Love it!
author: Kristen S.

description:
The backyard cornhole court has been decimated. The last time I was there someone must have stolen or shredded the bags. It's also really cold out there! And the crowd is all early - mid 20-somethings! 

Full disclosure, I'm old.

I guess I'm over this spot. Sorry.
author: Mark S.

description:
This place deserves two seperate reviews; one as a bar, and one as a restuarant. I recently had been here to try out the brunch after only having been here as a bar patron previously. 

Brunch - This place was packed from living social/groupon deals, there was a wait but that was expected. The servers were overloaded with people which I knew wasn't their fault, but my food came out wrong twice and the portion size was beyond ridiculous (small) for price. The server made up for the mistakes and even bought me a drink, I left her a great tip and let her know I understood it wasn't her fault; however I would skip brunch here again if the food didn't change. 

Bar - This is a nice place to stop for drinks before last call, it gets crowded a lot on the weekends but not so much that it's difficult to stand.
author: Cody H.

description: Burgers were delicious and tots were awesome! The service was alright and it took while to get our food. I would come here if you're down to hang out for a while. However, once the outdoor patio closes, things get pretty tight inside. Then it's time to move on to the next bar.
author: Brian M.

description:
Hands down the worst bar I've been to in the Mission. You may as well call this place Dr. Roofies and the Electric GHB. Horrible loud 90s dance music, next to no light (and you're supposed to eat in here?!) flat soda and bad decor. It's their first week so hopefully they'll step up their game (put your hours on the door!) but the only thing this place has going for them is the servers are very nice. If you are a bro who wears backwards white baseball hats every day, then this is the place for you. 

I'm calling foul on having a bar named for the Muppets without anything Muppet about it at all.
author: Beth D.

description:
My friends decided to drag me there on a Wednesday. My first impression is that this place is a little over crowded, but we were patient and finally secure a table. There wings are a bargain on Wednesdays, that may be the reason for the crowd? 

Overall I enjoyed the appeditizers on the menu, really go well with drinks. What i loved about the menu is that they have food for those who just want to chill and some food items that are on the extreme for those looking for excitement. My friend challenged me to try the "Death Wings" (made with ghost chilli) with him. He ended up not being able to talk for most of the night, haha. 

I'd definitely recomment this place for those who are looking for hang out in a group, If you are looking for a quiet place, you might want to look elsewhere.
author: Alan L.

description: Sunday Football bday celebrations are fitting for this hipster mission joint.  Did I just say football and hipster in the same sentence?!?!? Brilliant. Jelly donut fried chicken sandwich with tots...where your stretchy pants. Drinks are subpar...but shots are yummy. Order the "captain yatch" = mint, simple syrup, lemon soda and gin
author: Michelle H.

description:
This place does a really great job!  I came for the Wednesday night wings a long time ago and have been going back for any night or weekend since.  The staff is incredibly friendly and you gotta love the back patio area too which a lot of first timers here miss.  There food is excellent from the regular menu, I must say.  Brunch is fine, but not the best ever.  Order what everyone else says: the wings, the tot-chos, the burgers.

Show up early!  You want to get a seat and this place gets packed all the time by 6:30.
author: Jon B.

description: The food is not impressive what-so-ever. I've had better specialty cocktails. However, I do like the set-up of this place. The bar is huge and centered directly in the middle making it the center of attention. There are plenty of seats at the bar but if you wanted a table for either you and your partner or even a larger party, there are multiple sized tables surrounding the bar. They play a variety of music. From what I've seen the bartenders have the ultimate say and DJ what music is being played. The bartenders can get very distracted with certain guests (most likely friends and/or regulars) and have the tendency to forget that other patrons are at the bar. I had to ask my bartender for multiple things and flag him down to get some service. Not very attentive.
author: Ashley Y.

description:
Great brunch spot for groups!

Went here with the girl with a living social coupon. Food was brunchtastic. When we went it was pretty crowded, so be prepared. 

I had the eggs benedict and it was on point. Have to mention the tatchos (tater nachos), bomb dot com. GET THE TATCHOS.

They have a pretty cool outside area and offer a bunch of different pitcher options, so looks like a great place for groups. Gets kind of chilly out there, just fyi.

Just a side note, the coupon came with a free shot of some mint tasting jager wannabe liquor? Disgusting. Just all kinds of awful. Whoever actually likes this stuff, WHAT IS WRONG WITH YOU?
author: Ryan R.

description:
Decent And your typical Mission Dive Bar. Somewhat of a mixed crowd. Outside patio is great, staff and service okay. TV screens perfect to watch local sporting events. 
I do recommend for drinks and what's mentioned above. 
*** I would not advise eating there but who am I to judge. Just an opinion only. Depending on your eating habits, if you want typical bar food then this is for you. Tastes like freezer food that goes in a microwave or onto a grill to defrost/cook and their bathroom isn't ideal if you need to take care of business. 
Just go for the drinks and people I say.
author: Edward B.

description:
I really want to give this place five stars.  The drinks are affordable, the service kewl and nice.  The food awesome, great portions, and about the same price as cooking at home.  

I wish that this could be my local neighborhood go to.  However, at nights they turn off all the lights, it gets dark and douchey...cue electronic music...the antithesis of what Dr. Teeth and the Electric Mayhem (the Muppet band) would actually want to hang out in.  

Please steer away from the Marina tools and cater towards your neighborhood!  

Love,

Your Neighbor
author: Lyz L.

description: We ordered Mac and cheese, the tatter tot nachos and 25 wings half chili habanero and half bbq. The chili habanero wasn't really spicy. It was sweet but had a nice tang to it. The wings were crispy and they weren't soaked in sauce. I like how the Mac and cheese had difference cheeses on it so every bite was different.
author: Emily L.

description:
Start with 2 stars for being a clean bar

+1 for having a shuffleboard in the back

-1 for the place being named "Doctor Teeth and the Electric Mayhem" with the logo and everything but completely lacking any Muppet theme or even any honorific drinks.
author: Lee S.

description:
What happened to Bissap Baobob before I still do not know, but Mayhem was kind enough to honor them by having a Bissap Baobob cocktail or hamburger on the menu (I cant remember which one after X amount of cocktails last night). 
The crowd was mixed, hipsters meets Russian Hill meets miscellaneous. I dont know what was going on with the decor (what is that weird NBC logo looking thing on the wall?) but I do like they had 5 TVs all playing the giants game. (Go Giants!), though I wouldnt go as far to call it a sports bar. 
They pour a GENEROUS cocktail and the food portions are HUGE and decently priced. Staff was super friendly, overall a nice edition to the mission, it will be interesting to see how things fair out over the next few months.
author: Jordan V.

description: This place has an awesome happy hour. 25 cent wings! I liked the original and sweet chili the best. The buffalo and bbq wings were good, but too saucy so they were a bit overwhelming. The truffle tator tots were good too, but I was too full to try anything else. I'd like to try their totchos and other bar food in the future.
author: Becky C.

description:
I see a lot of people on yelp complaining about this place, and honestly I don't see what the fuss is all about.  I had drinks and dinner at the bar last night and enjoyed pretty much everything.  The bartenders were just fine and were genuinely interested to hear how the lamb burger that I ordered turned out (it was really really good).  There are some lounge booth areas, a central communal table, and regular tables towards the back, in addition to the bar up front. 

If you're complaining about the hipster decor and ambiance, well you shouldn't be in the mission.  for me, I'll be adding this place to my mission establishment rotation.
author: Scott K.

description:
Starting To Hate This Place Maybe Returning AGAIN....Cause NO TOGO Boxes But Wings And Tots Are Good....

Wings Are Amazing....

Like The Service A lot Plus Jameson On Tap "Hella Yea"....
author: Tee S.

description:
2 for 1 margaritas on thursday night!!! And not just your average margaritas, they're STRONG and delicious. And on mondays, apparently they have a burger and a beer for $10. legit. 

They have really good drinks on your average day too. I've had a couple that I've really enjoyed. I've never had the food so I can't speak for that, but other people I've been with have had it and enjoyed it. 

It tends to be relatively crowded on the weekends and on thursday night so it can be hard to find a table but if you stick around long enough you're sure to get one. The place has really cool decorations and they usually play a random old movie from the '80s or sth. And they have shuffleboard if you're into that. 

I'm a fan! :)
author: Caitlin B.

description:
Good bar type food. Sandwiches, fries, tots, all with a twist. 

Burgers are not that great. I ordered medium and it was well done. Dry and hard to swallow. 

Fried chicken sandwich is good.
author: Erica L.

description: This place is laid out just like a spot I used to frequent in Portland, OR called Sweet Hereafter and has a similar vibe. Dark, lots of standing tables, sometimes hard to get a drink at prime time but it's always crowded in a good way. It's becoming a regular Mission outing starting point.
author: Madeline S.

description: Wing Wednesday protip: Show up during the first or last two hours.
author: Inigo M.

description: Never tried any food, been here a couple times out with friends the drinks are reasonable and stiff. Fun vibe inside and I love the back patio area. A little too cramped to dance but the music and the vibe is real cool. Great experience every time I've been here.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Only been here 2-3 times as is out of my neighborhood. 

The beer was cold and the food was tasty, but the reason I'm taking the time to write this review is the staff at Dr. Teeth.

On every visit, I've been mightily impressed by the the affable nature of both the bar and wait staff, and the great service I've received.  

Super chill and friendly, yet very efficient, with nothing in the way of attitude.  

All this while the place was ridiculously busy.
author: Mark J.

description: Delicious burgers and great daily specials, from the $10 burger and beer Mondays, $1 taco Tuesdays and, of course, the 25 cent chicken wing Wednesdays.  Don't let the eccentric name fool you -- the food and beer are pretty standard fare, but tasty nonetheless.
author: Vin J.

description: I don't understand the name but whatever, this place is just hipster-chic enough, with its wacky decor and games in the back corner. I also tried the donkey punch.. and looked up the name on urban dictionary.. did not appreciate. Can't account for what the place is like during the daytime, but it's freaking packed at night. I liked the jolly bouncer.. and my gay bartender. Free parking on the street behind the bar!
author: Vivian H.

description:
Was here with friends who used their Brunch special on the LivingSocial promotion while I paid full price. The place has mixed crowd and it is hard to have conversation with friends since the atmosphere is loud.  The service was slow since my coffee was forgotten until I annoyingly reminded the waitress  and the food could be better. I ordered the 2 egg special and tater tots at $9.00 and it was not epic. Tater tots might be from the grocery frozen food section, thawed, and baked. My peeve was to be charged $15 for bottomless mimosa that is strong yet served in plastic cups. Shouldn't I feel special with a real champagne glass if I pay $15?  Circa charges $10!  Also the LivingSocial deal was not a deal after all since you left spending more than you anticipated for tax, tip, etc. 

Anyways I think there are many other spots in the city that have brunch that is just as tasty and worth what you spent.
author: Patricia P.

description: Came here on a Saturday night and was lucky enough to find a spot to sit for 5 people. Fun little dive bar with good bar/junk food! We had the sliders and the tater tots, both yummy (and fattening!). Service was pretty decent considering how busy it was. Overall, nothing too outstanding about it, but I'd go back and recommend if you're just looking for a decent drink and good bar food!
author: Ashley W.

description: There are some very good looking people who work here, let me just start off with that. They're also fast on their feet, which is always good in a bar setting. I went here for a Warriors championship game, which was probably a mistake on my part. However, I would probably come back here because the patio is gorgeous and people aren't allowed to smoke out there, which is great for non-smokers like me. That night they had two-for-one margaritas and dollar tacos. It can get crowded af, but I'm pretty sure I just picked a night that every bar in the city would be busy though. I would definitely go back.
author: k h.

description:
Hmm.. just OK.  Went on Saturday night to check this place out.

Good:
-friendly service
-above-average bar food (truffle oil tater tots)

Bad:
-atmosphere is kinda blah (huge cavernous space, sparse decorations)
-who plays ESPN in the Mission?
-definitely a Marina and bridge-and-tunnel crowd after 10pm (maybe they came from Bruno's or Medjool?)

The Mission has better places.. but if I were around the Mayhem on a quiet Tuesday night, I might check it out again.
author: Toby C.

description:
Got 10 sliders- 2 of each kind.
   -Meatball Marinara was all meatball, no       marinara but the flavor was pretty good.
   -BLT was solid
   -Veggie Burger: please pass on this. The pattie was more like a weird paste.
   -Reuben takes the cake, delicious.
   -Classic burger was just that, but props for a tiny handmade pattie instead of a tiny frozen one

Definitely get the tot-chos! So good, but how can you go wrong with tater tot nachos? 

For brunch, go for the jelly doughnut fried chicken sandwich, I promise you won't be disappointed. It sounds really weird, but the combination of flavors somehow works. Try it with hot sauce. 

The service here is über slow, so be prepared for that. That being said though, the wait staff is actually really nice. An they play great music.
author: Brian V.

description:
If you think this is "Mission style" you don't live in the Mission.  And you probably think TGIF is the coolest place at the mall.  Seriously.  This frat party doesn't even belong in the Marina, let alone the Mission.  If you're into big screen TVs, and overweight  drunks with mini skirts, you should head immediately to TGIF.  (You could go here, but I'm hoping you'll take the hint and stay out of our neighborhood)  

Was actually forced here recently by the well meaning sister in law buying an online brunch "deal."   After suffering an hour wait, with the mentally handicapped "door man" giving our place in line to his friends, we were finally rewarded with...  TGIF on the corner of 19th and Mission.  

If the waitresses only had more Flair on their uniforms, instead of having to constantly apologize for the entire mess, it might be worth it just to gawk at all the pathetic people trying to make the scene.  (Uh, they don't, and it's not.) 

If you wanna participate in the further destruction of  the Mission, definitely stop in for some "wings," screaming douche bags, and cheap vomit shots.   If you have any interest in saving what is left of the Mission, hold up your crucifix as you walk by.
author: dan s.

description:
New experience!

I've never been to any restaurant like this one before. It's really dark inside and the atmosphere is just really fun. I went on a Wednesday and I think it was Trivia night so all the guests could choose to play trivia or what not with the bartender/host and I think if you win you get to go to the bar and take free shots! ( Who doesn't like free shots?) This is definitely a place to go to with a bunch of friends and have a little chill and fun night out. 

Food here is pretty amazing too. If you like spicy stuff I would highly recommend the death sauce. It's really spicy but it's really delicious too!!! I couldn't handle more than 3 bites of it though so just be careful when you smear it all over your burger hehe.. 
Other than that, I love how this place has fried pickles.. I am a big fan of fried pickles and usually I only eat them at home cause I don't know anywhere else that provides it but this place is my new found pickle heaven. ^.^ 

anyways, since I like this place THAT much. I am bring some friends over there for dinner tonight. Cant wait to experience it all over again! (:
author: Allie S.

description:
I've only been here once, so I haven't had a TON of the food, but I can offer my opinion.  First off, we were so very disappointed by the fact that there's nothing whatsoever related to "Dr. Teeth & Electric Mayhem" (of the Muppets) on the walls.  The walls are pretty bare, and there's soooo much potential to pimp that place out with some sort of muppet-related anything.  But, there's nothing.  We were quite let down by that aspect.  We just figured it was copyright infringement or something which is why there's nothing, but, then don't have that name, right?

The food and menu, on the other hand, we totally love.  Now, it was only my wife and I, so, not knowing how big the portions were, we got an order of buffalo tots as an appetizer.  It was a mountain of tots!  It was awesome.  We couldn't finish them.  They were doused with buffalo sauce and had blue cheese interspersed throughout.  As well as a side of blue cheese.  They were slightly soggy from the sauce, but the flavor was great and some of the ones with not as much sauce still had that nice crunchy outside.  They weren't TOO spicy hot, either, which is good for some people.  Would definitely order them again.

We also got the egg, bacon and cheese sandwich with a side of mac 'n cheese.  The sandwich rocked.  I would definitely get it again.  The mac 'n cheese was good too.  You could taste the sharpness of the cheese.  And possibly a hint of truffle oil.  We dug those as well.  The menu was great with tons of things we we wanted to try, but of course couldn't  try it all - burgers, wings, fries, sliders, etc.  The combinations of ingredients in the burgers and sandwiches sounded  awesome, so we can't wait to go back and try some more food.
author: dave g.

description:
I ventured in here on their second day being open. The were still getting things together and didn't have their full beer selection available. $5.50 for a draft is on the higher end, but maybe by $.50. They also had $3 16oz budweisers which i was indulging in. The decor was interesting, lots of lights, mirrors and strangely decorated mannequin things. A few TVs to catch the Giants games on. Mellow tunes on a Thursday eventing. 

There were even a couple patrons with their own muppets. For whatever that's worth. Who doesn't like a muppet?
author: Doug H.

description:
No no no no no. All the food was pretty inedible in my opinion. 

I guess this place must be a place to go for drinks and that's about it.
author: Alison M.

description:
Didn't love this place the first time I came in, but I think it's growing on me. Why, you ask? Let me tell you.

1) Skeeball
2) Crispy chicken tenders
3) Back patio with 2 levels
4) Corn hole on astroturf
5) Not crowded on one of the hottest days in June.
6) Plastic is a-ok.

Happy.
author: Karena Q.

description:
This bar has no fecking clue what it is or wants to be.

It's named for a muppet band.

Then they've a selection of top-shelf gins and vodkas and bourbons, and a fairly extensive (but kind of boring) cocktail list-- all fairly typical "this is our spin on the {fill in the blank where we dug something out of the standards section of Mr Boston's}.

Then a fairly shitty selection of beer.

(I hear that the food is good)

Then you look around at the decôr:

If you wandered round the East Village ca 1998, took about a dozen yuphip bars, squeezed them together, then gathered the bits that fell off the end and put them all up in one bar, you'd get this place. High(?)lights include:
- Industrial pipes ending in baloon-y lightbulbs
- Panes of coloured perspex randomly attached to said pipes
- white-painted male torsos with mirrors glued to them making you feel like it wants to be a gay bar, but kinda wants to stay in the closet
- Glossy black paint
- 3 large screen TVs showing sport. 
- Beer served in mason jars (how very)

I dunno, but it didn't tie in at all for me.

On the up side, the bartender was really nice, I hear the food's rather good, and I hear the owner is there making a serious go of it and super friendly. 

Then there's the whole "Dr Teeth & the Electric Mayhem" thing. This is a muppet band-named bar in a bar the muppet band wouldn't be caught dead (or, I suppose, without an arm up their arse) in. 

Maybe adderall will help? Or maybe that's the problem.
author: Glen M.

description:
It was my 3rd or 4th waiver challenge when I went head-to-head with the Death Burger and the Death Burger won, so be warned, it is nothing to mess with. A day later, my stomach is still on fire. That said, it was good. Cooked perfectly. They brought by a couple glasses of milk to help. And I still lost... 

Otherwise, lots of creativity on the menu for people who aren't there for the Death Burger. It's not your average bar food. Tot-choes = awesome. Sweet potato tots, love em. Mac 'n cheese with truffle oil, hit the spot. I'll be back soon to check out more of their menu.
author: Forza M.

description:
I haven't had the food here, but been a few times for drinks.

The place is a nice typical American bar; might even seem a bit high scale considering the neighborhood.

My favorite thing about this place is the patio/garden.  
Really nice set-up, with some fun lawn games set-up.

Prices are a bit on the high side, but PBR seems to be the drink of choice and priced accordingly.
author: Ayall S.

description:
Well, I'm a fan. I dole out my stars based on how well an establishment meets my expectations, and Dr. Teeth was better than expected.

I went here on a Thursday with boy because we wanted to eat the ghost pepper wings. Well, I sure did. I've been telling him for months that I love spicy food, and he would sass me with his half-Mexican birth certificate and tell me that there is no way a white, Jewish princess from Connecticut can handle "real" spice. So, when I heard of Dr. Teeth, I knew I was finally going to get my chance to prove how much I can handle.

When we got there, we had some Pilsners from the tap. Light beer before wings. Boy was nervous. But Mark, the sweet bartender with the burning man mustache, said the wings were fine - spicy, but tasty. That was enough for me. But then the OTHER bartender (Mack?) was all, "You guys are insaaaaane!!!" And then the dude sitting next to me at the bar was all, "I've never seen anyone do this." And then boy was freaking out and wouldn't order because he said he didn't think I could do it and didn't want me to get sick. And then they all (not Mark) started quizzing me about how much spice I can handle: "Do you eat Thai spice?" "Can you eat raw chilis?" "Have you ever had habaneros?" And, finally, boy went to the bathroom and I just ordered the dang wings.

And, of course, I was fine. Actually handled the spicy wings a little bit better than boy. Ha. I told him that me and my bro used to sit around the kitchen table with one tablespoon and our stepfather's hot sauce collection playing truth or dare. We decided the wings are a 12-minute spice - after 12 minutes, the heat dissipates. The nice thing is that the pepper takes a minute to kick in, so you can taste the food as well as the spice. We each ate three wings and the Mark took the last 2 back to make them spicier. But they tasted the same to me, although my tongue was prepared. 

Boy and I decided that, if 10 is the spiciest thing we would eat for pleasure, then these are a 7. Mark mentioned having them be made more spicy in the future, and I kind of agree with him. If they are going to make you sign a waiver (which they do), that stuff should be insanely hot. I would be down for trying them as an 8.5 or 9. But, all-in-all, great staff, good food, fine beer, great experience. And, if I ever need the upper hand in a conversation, I know where the venue for that should be: over a plate of ghost pepper wings, because I am a ringer.
author: Melanie D.

description: Very considerate staff. It was busy when I went and they missed an order but gave us a round on the house. Food is also incredible. If you don't get the tatchos, you're missing out.
author: Leah C.

description: The food was, at best, just okay.  Their famed spicy burger sauce was disgusting.  It was like a chemical burn with no taste.  Not interesting at all.  Their wings were absolutely disappointing.  The service was abysmal.  The atmosphere was 100% hipster pretentiousness.  I'm never going back.
author: Scott E.

description: 25 cent wing wednesdays are awesome, but unfortunately it took over an hour for us to get our food because the order got messed up. The patio out back is pretty sweet as well.
author: Eliza D.

description: update: my old pal Stu works there and so does Raf (as i found out this past sunday for brunch). instant five stars. :)
author: Ryan L.

description: The only reason I take one star off is because of how insanely crowded this place gets on Wednesday nights -- otherwise, it is easily 5 stars.  This is a favorite hangout spot for my crew on hump day.  The patio outdoors is spacious, and they always have the Giants (or whatever local team is playing) game inside on the TV.  Every week on Wednesday, this joint offers $.25 wings and $3 24 oz. PBRs for most of the night.  Needless to say, it is easy to have a good time on the cheap.  If you aren't feeling wings, they also have pretty sweet appetizers.  "Tatchos" are tater tots smothered in melted cheese, jalapenos, salsa, pico de gallo, guacamole, and sour cream.  Delicious.  Staff is super friendly.  Check this place out if you are ever in the Mission -- conveniently located next to the BART station on Mission/16th.
author: Jordan J.

description: Love this place! Great drinks + bartender. Quick, great space, good mix of people, and not to mention great food! The back patio is spot on! Chill out have a beer at this place! I definitely recommend it!
author: J M.

description:
This review is specifically for brunch today, April 7th, 2013.  I had purchased the Living Social deal for two entrees, two bottomless mimosas, and two shots of fernet for $25.  And yet, I would give zero stars if I could.

We arrived as a group of four.  Once we were seated the waitress took our orders, served us our drinks, and then we honestly never saw her again.

Two of us had ordered sides of tater tots, and two had ordered sides of home fries.  And yet, they mixed up the order and brought three sides of tater tots and one side of home fries which they REFUSED to replace.  Why?

Because they RAN OUT OF HOME FRIES.  They literally ran out of potatoes??? What kind of restaurant runs out of food??

Once the food was set in front of us, they forgot to give us silverware.  We had to wait for TWENTY MINUTES and ask THREE TIMES in order to get the silverware necessary to eat.  So, by the time we finally could eat our food was lukewarm.

If that wasn't bad enough, after two glasses of mimosas a busboy ran over to inform us that there was no more champagne.  No other option.  No other replacement.  If you wanted other alcohol you had to pay ON TOP of the bottomless mimosas you were already charged for.

BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS = TWO DRINKS.

We asked for the check soon after and it literally took an ENTIRE HOUR to pay.  One of the four of us had paid to park, so we were honestly on a time crunch.  We kept flagging people down begging for someone to get our waitress, and finally someone took pity on us and grabbed the bill to settle it.

After not seeing her for almost three hours, the waitress came back to say goodbye to us.  Too little too late!  I have honestly never had such horrible service.
author: Courtney G.

description:
Awesome!  Its like a Chuck E Cheeze for adults.  Awesome drinks, delicious food, and fun games!  The table shuffleboard is lots of fun and takes some real skill and practice.  The have Corn Hole out back now too.

Huge fan of the tater tots, especially Mayhem Style which is pretty much like Animal Style.  Their grilled sandwiches are good too. Surprisingly, they are toasty without being too greasy/buttery.

My Fernet on tap came with a free beer.  Well, it was an 8 ounce Pacifico which sort of qualifies.
author: Troy S.

description:
I have come to Dr. Teeth and the Electric Mayhem for brunch in the past, and they're food is pretty good, particularly their Sweet Potato tater tots. Other foods I've tried are their macaroni and cheese with jalapenos (not the biggest fan, their mac and cheese is a bit too goopy as opposed to solid and baked, as I personally like it), and their eggs benedict (they did overpoach my egg on one visit). But beyond being a bit too picky, their food on the whole is good.

Go for the tater tots and the niche experience, but otherwise, Mission Street has other delicious gems. 

Note this review takes into account mostly their brunch/breakfast food style foods and mealtime.
author: Mark T.

description: Good ambience and strong drinks but don't be surprised when you get the bill. We were lured in by the novelty of Dr Teeth but long wait times and over priced cocktails took from the experience.
author: Sam S.

description:
Went here on game day.... I wasn't impressed The doorman is rude and overzealous (I'm in my 40ies with the salt and pepper thing) he was hyper vigilant on id; fine but do you have to be such an A%% in the process?

the drinks were overpriced and the interior looks like it was designed by the Folsom marching band.... I found It pretentious and uncomfortable..  

I doubt I'd go back.
author: Him S.

description:
I am not sure why there Tuesday night Trivia has not made its way into the lore of Yelp reviews yet, but it certainly deserves some attention.  I believe it starts around 8:30.  Some quick research by yours truly tracked down the host to be one local comedian, Casey Ley.  His questions are hard.  His off-hand remarks are hilarious and he appropriate yells insults at people who call out answers.  I'd only recommend that he repeat all the questions at the end of each round and say #5 instead of next question.

As for Dr. Teeth, it's essentially a less crowded Bullit.  So if you like tater tots, then that is a good thing.  I wasn't super impressed with their regular fries, nor was the fried chicken sandwich on the other side of the plate super wonderful.  Yet, they have a good selection of beers to wash away the mediocrity of their food.  So come for Trivia and drinks or just drinks some other night.  Eat elsewhere.  Unless you just want tater tots.  Then gorge away.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
This may be our new favorite spot.
The bartenders are all friendly and on top of it.
The drinks are great.
They have Jameson AND Fernet on tap.
and I love the cushy barstools!

Trying the menu (quite extensive with a grilled cheese bar even!) next visit!

The decor is fun.

yay!  new Mission spot!
author: sUper j.

description: All about those chicken wings! Best deal around, delicious food, cold drinks, cool surroundings although it's usually pretty busy. I would definitely go again next time I'm in SF.
author: Mike C.

description:
Great hipster-y mission bar.  Five stars for having a kitchen at the bar (allows for the ability to satisfy your drunken muchies and continue drinking all at the same time :).

Unlike some of the other people, I think the service has been generally pretty good (I've been three times and each time had prompt service).  Had tot-chos, not all that amazing.  The concept is wonderful but just didn't quite do it for me.

Sliders were great.  25c wings . . . best part happy hour special on wednesdays in the mission :).  I think they could use better drinks specials but definitely wont complain and definitely will continue to take advantage of 25c wings.  I've tried the sweet chilli habanero twice, a bit too spicy for my taste.

I frankly don't care about the Jameson on tap but the hipsters tell me that this is an amazing feature.  Since I don't drink that stuff, doesn't really matter to me.  Also, I don't really do sports, so would be nice to have something on the tv besides boring sports matches.

One thing to know, it can get really hectic and busy in there so if you can arrive early, you should.
author: Banana S.

description:
Two words: GHOST. PEPPER.

If you're a fan of man vs. food on the food network, you know all too well that the ghost pepper can reduce a grown man to a red, sweaty ball of unhappiness.  The ghost pepper (AKA - Bhut Jolokia chili pepper) is arguably the hottest pepper in the world .... and they serve it here ... with tater tots. Awesome.   

I made the mistake of trying to impress/ challenge my boyfriend to a tasting. I LOVE spicy food, but after eating this pepper with jalapeno poppers (the peppers come in dipping sauce form), most of my taste buds had been burnt off and I had esophageal burn for the next 4 hours.  I did not expect the spiciness to linger until 2AM. You've been warned.

If you're not into self-inflicted pain, this place is still lots of fun.  The staff is really friendly and the bar is clean.  The drinks are strong and pretty cheap.  The food is fun (sliders and tater tot nachos). They also have shuffle board and televisions.
author: Lara O.

description: Came here for Sunday brunch while visiting my college roommates. They raved about the place and I was pretty excited. We sat on the patio, which I think was our mistake. We got there at 11:30 and they had already run out of champagne for mimosas, which should have been our first clue.
