The waitress essentially forgot we were there the entire time and it took us over an hour to get our food, and about 45 minutes for drinks. When it finally did get there, we didn't have any silverware and had to go hunt for it. The food itself was actually delicious, which gave the third star. We split the burger and banana bread French toast, and they were both awesome. The bacon Bloody Mary was pretty delicious too. I think the experience would have been much better if not for the service...
author: Lauren R.

description: Great atmosphere and location to bar hop and mingle. The staff is super friendly and knowledgeable about mixology!
author: Sami B.

description:
I have only a few things to say...
I came here today and ordered a spicy spicy bloody from the bartender who happened to be Natalie and let me tell you it was one of the best bloodys I 've had in a long time. I recommend it next time you come into Dr.Teeth.
author: Javier G.

description: This is for Wednesday wing nights!  Super crowded. But I can't complain for the price of the wings you get. Delicious, flavorful, and not puny! Definitely coming back!!
author: Nancy G.

description: Fun and funky inside. Loud, but that is the nature. Some good beers. We ordered the hummus, which was under-salted and watery with a very bland pesto. The red bell pepper served as one of the accompaniments had seen better days, and it took 20 minutes to be served humus!
author: Daniel S.

description: Dr. Teeth & the Electric Mayham for their bottomless mimosas brunch which definitely did not disappoint! The traditional brunch fare was kicked up a notch by unexpected touches. For instance, my omelet was made with curry chicken sausage instead of regular generic chicken sausage. My only regret was that I did not notice the fried chicken on a glazed jelly donut on the menu. My only consolation was that I did order the tater tots which were divine!
author: Ayele A.

description:
Super eclectic little bar that plays some good tunes (hip hop), and although some of their drinks are a tad bit too sweet, their Bloody Mary's and menu make up for it.  You have to try the variety of tot-chose they offer.  I celebrate nachos, carne asada fries and Irish nachos, but this is a step up!.  OMG.

Bonus:  They have a super cute outdoor area and being that it's located in the Mish, you can actually take advantage of that area on many a day.
author: Jennifer H.

description: The tots, the service, the ambience, bar tenders and the drinks are top notch. The decor is zany, but consistent. Plenty of patio space too! Love the teeth.
author: Joel V.

description:
I never yelp because I think it's lame, but after eating here for the second time, and receiving a generous amount of tater tots (friend previously received only 3 onion rings with burger), and having the very nice bartender remember AND apologize for previous lack of onion rings and offer to buy us some was simply good business. 

Said friend felt vindicated, we split the gouda western burger (delicious!!! I just wish I had remembered to ask for jalapenos), the corndog appetizer (you can always win me over with mini corndogs), mac n cheese (soooooooo good, cheesy and the ultimate comfort food), and the reuben eggrolls (so-so, but creative and I'm a sucker for kraut). We left full and happy. I waddled the block and a half home feeling full and comforted.  I like my new neighborhood bar.
author: Lady D.

description: Not bad...I cant say I'm very happy with myself for eatin that garbage....but there is a time and place to eat fried garbage.
author: Mario W.

description:
I came with a big group of friends for brunch on my birthday last Sunday & redeemed a bunch of those Thrillist deals (bottomless mimosas + entree + shot of fernet) in the process.  We were all very excited to try out "Bullitt in the Mission" and despite high expectations Dr Teeth did not disappoint.

The food = basically Bullitt food aka greasetastic hangover food.  The eggs were good, but the bacon could've been cooked a little crispier, especially since I asked for extra crispy!, but overall the food was solid.  I enjoyed introducing my British friends to the glory of the tater tot, which evidently has not made it across the pond (what a shame).  

Even though we had about 20 people in our party they did a good job bringing out all our food pretty quickly and keeping our drinks flowing pretty well all morning.  I eventually booted in Dolores Park a couple hours later, so I guess you could say the bottomless mimosas were up to task.  

Bonus points for:
- spaciousness
- interesting decor, although I think they could incorporate the Muppet (and/or actual teeth...there is a weird dental poster in the back, which strangely I can see succeeding) theme even more
- shuffleboard table
- vending machine stocked with such gems as 5 hour energy, condoms, cigarettes, etc.
author: Molly B.

description:
I am loving Dr Teeth! This place is awesome based on the fact that they have some awesome tator tots. Love the tots!

Recently came by for brunch because of the Thrillist coupon deal thing that they had. I had the corned beef hash, which was delicious. With a side of tots, bottomless mimosas, friends, and free shots? It was a good day! 

The service is also something worth talking about. Our waitress was so nice and chatty with us. There was a minute where we did see the bottom of our glasses with no mimosas, but it was probably because she was the only waitress in there and it started to get busy. Maybe that's something they need to work on. But she stayed calm and cool, and she also saw we needed more mimosas so she was quick to just refill our glasses and leave a pitcher on the table. 

Still hoping to come back here to try out the rest of the menu as well... like that jelly donut fried chicken sandwich, which sounds like all kinds of delicious. My previous visit to this place was at night, and it was crackin! It turns into a club and plays some awesome music. They also played some awesome music during brunch... you switch from The Grouch to Adina Howard, you win fans. 

Love the vibe of that place. I love it!!!
author: Caroline L.

description:
I came here with a few friends for Taco Tuesday. 

Food/Drinks:
-Dr. Teeth has Taco Tuesday with $1 veggie, steak, fish, and chicken tacos and 2 for 1 margaritas (2 for $8). 
-The veggie tacos were decent, what you would expect for $1.  They came with sweet potato fries, beets, lettuce, salsa, and guacamole. 
-We also ordered a plate of Tatchos which were also just okay. Tatchos = tater tots topped with cheese, sour cream, olives, guacamole, and jalapenos. 

Other:
-Good Service. 
-I've heard that this place gets packed on Tuesday nights but we were able to get a table for 4 after waiting about 10 minutes. 
-The music was also a little loud so it was a little hard to talk to others. 

Overall, a decent experience but not sure if I would come back.
author: Geetanjali J.

description: First time for 25 cent wing Wednesdays. The only thing that sucked was the seating. It's one of those things where if you don't come early enough you have to start stalking guests who are almost done with their food. It's super crowded and loud and any parking on Mission sucks, but that goes to show how many people think it's worth it to come in anyway. And it is worth it. But at least the bar keeps you occupied during the wait. I can't wait to come back and try something different!
author: Jenn F.

description: I had an unbelievable Groupon deal from them and was glad I bought it.  I trekked out to the Mission to check it out and was quite happy with my tater tots, sliders, and beer.  This is the ultimate Happy Hour spot in the Mission.  Great vibe inside, friendly staff, good crowd.
author: Angelique B.

description:
As we walked along Mission Street on our way to Mayhem, Kaitlin asked "Where are we?!" to which I responded, "Out of my comfort zone."

I was certainly not expecting my night to bring me to Mayhem.  The clientele were an interesting group, and I can state with certainty that I have never seen a larger group of men in plaid shirts than I did here last night, outside of a University of Puget Sound event (their mascot is the Logger- plaid shirts everywhere).

Upon returning home and looking up this bar on Yelp I discovered that it was the alleged Muppet bar that had just opened.  Maybe I didn't venture far enough into the bar, but I saw no Muppet memorabilia anywhere.  I did appreciate the tooth x-ray above the bar in homage to Dr. Teeth, but was confused by the headless mannequins with strategic coverings made of gold disks.

Perhaps I will venture back here after it has been open for longer and is less of a scene, but overall I was unimpressed.
author: Nora S.

description:
Reuben Eggrolls: AWESOME.

Burgers are really good.  

This place is great but if you don't order judiciously you may end up consuming 5k calories and feeling sick after your meal.  Burgers come with tater tots and then you can get extra stuff on those tots like cheese/nacho fixings etc--delicious but total gut bomb.  

Decor is a little weird, but interesting.  Good place to grab a weekend lunch.
author: Mike I.

description: Do not like. Do not like the crowd. Do not like! And look at my other reviews I'm not just some bitchy yelper who loves downing places. DO NOT LIKE. And PS , if your power is out, maybe close down for the evening. That was some BOO
author: Lauren V.

description: I left SO angry - this was hands down the WORST service I've experienced in a loooong time. We had to wait about 15 minutes for anyone to even acknowledge we were there, and every step of the process took an absolutely absurd amount of time. I even had to wait over 20 minutes for our waitress to just take the credit card. The food was totally mediocre, reminiscent of the stuff I used to get at the cafeteria in middle school. The tomato soup was clearly Campbells (or worse) and served cold. The sandwich was tasteless, the "totchos" were good at first bite (since after waiting for 2 hours I was crazy hangry) but also became tasteless 3 bites in. I'm so sad I wasted my time and money here.
author: Johanna D.

description:
Mayhem? More like Meh-hem (bad-doom-ching!)

We wandered in looking for a drink and a late dinner. I was dazzled by the menu with its Grilled Cheese Bar and Tater Tots Bar--yum! Not to mention the cheap prices for some seriously sturdy food. The scene was a little much, but I was feeling optimistic about the place overall...until our food came. 

My friend and I split the original grilled cheese with tomato soup and the beet and avocado sandwich with sweet potato tots. The grilled cheese was more bread than cheese and the cheese really didn't have much flavor. The soup was ok, but had waaaay too much oregano in it and tasted a little ketchup-y. The beet and avocado sandwich (spelled 'beat' on the menu--was that supposed to be a Dr. Teeth joke?) was cold, soggy, flavorless...all around inedible. And we are FAR from picky eaters. I'm a midwesterner and will basically eat anything to keep from offending the chef. 

The bar decor (mannequin torsos with metal disc bedazzlement) was more Alexander McQueen than Muppet. Which is fine with me, but it didn't make any sense with their intended theme.

With so many good options in the hood, this one's a loser.
author: Kelly M.

description:
HAIR IN YOUR FOOD IS WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT HERE!!!....and not just one single hair in one of our dishes. 5 plates out of a table of 12 literally had hair in it.

UNSANITARY CONDITIONS. PEE all over the bathroom and CRAP on toilet seats. No wonder the hair in the food.

server could care less. their supposed endless mimosas come in airplane size plastic cups that they serve you in and u wait 45 mins for the next one. they tried to charge us for another endless mimosa when some of our party lost their cheap plastics airplane cups.

i order a grayhound after waiting at the bar for literrally19 mins and ends up being pure grapefruit juice. I kindly tell the neanderthal of a bartender whos been handling money while squeezing limes in drinks and she looks at me in a blank neanderthilian stare, shrugs her shoulders and in neanderthilian says to me "too bad... order another one then"

this place is a circus joke. especially the lack of management oversight on whats going on here. the owner should fire everyone beginning with the staff.
author: John S.

description:
Great drinks!!! It was hard just selecting one, so my friend and I each got two. The jalapeno poppers leave a lot to be desired, but the $1 sliders make up for it. The wings are also quite tasty. I wish I would have tried the "Death" wings because the Habanero simply wasn't hot enough (but it had a great flavor).

The vibe was pretty relaxed for a Friday after work, but I am sure business will pick up!
author: Ruby G.

description: I'm right there with everyone else who says they didnt want to review this spot in fear it would become too popular! I. Love. Dr Teeth. End of story--went here for my birthday and reserved some tables out by the cornhole field. You can probably imagine serving a bunch of people day partying might get a little annoying but the staff was kind, flexible and super engaging. Great bar food and drinks. LOVE THIS PLACE!
author: Jamie C.

description:
So this review is kinda old, because I hate this place. So I've been putting off my review. But here we go!

I've been here a total of four times and only was served once.  The first time I went was pleasant enough - some day drinking with an old friend I hadn't seen in foreverrrr, so the company was the most important part. We had the tatchos (AMAAAZING) and some fries and some drinks. Most of the time it took an act of congress to get a drink, even though we were at that long table right by the bar. Three stars for those bad ass tatchos!

So when the Living Social deal came out for brunch and Fernet shots, I was IN like sin. Went once with a group of about 6, and we sat on the patio. We are hungover and NEED brunch and mimosas, STAT. 15 minutes later, after having several waitresses walk by, look at us, and keep walking, I get up and go get menus for the table myself. A waitress immediately notices and comes by asking if we need menus. I thank her and say we have them but water would be great. She brings water.  Another 15-20 go by, with more waitresses walking by, ignoring us, bringing everyone and their mothers drinks and food while we wallow in our no-brunch sadness. WTF is going on here??? We say eff it, and get up to leave. As we are leaving the table, the waitress hurries back and wants to know if she can help us. Oh, now you want to help us. Awesome! Minus one star.

I come back another weekend with a friend hoping to use my deal, but it's packed. The wait is long, so I just say eh, another time, and leave.

Last and final time, its two days before the deal expires, so I like, NEED to use this bad boy. Get there before my friend, try to put my name in. It's packed, and I ask the guy how long. He said he doesn't know, at least an hour, maybe an hour and a half. I said I have my deal and it's only good till 2, and it's 12:30, so would it still be valid if the wait is an hour and a half? He rolls his eyes and says he doesn't know. Um, ok, well, can you find out? Then he gets testy and says he just doesn't know, he can't give me an answer, and I'm just going to have to risk it or come back another day. I said the deal expires in a couple of days and today is Sunday, so I pretty much can't come back. Not his problem, he says. Um, what? Again, WTF is going on here? I just want to use my freakin deal here people! He gives me some more BS about the wait and if my deal will be valid by the time I sit down, so again I say EFF IT and leave. Can I take away all my stars now? No? OK. One star.

Don't think I'll be headed back to this place... ever.
author: E. B.

description: Awesome place. So much fun. They have pitchers of Moscow mule, excellent tater tots, corn hole, and shuffleboard. Great place to hang out for lunch or to watch a sports game
author: Ian J.

description: This place has terrible service with terrible food. It shouldn't that hard to mess up a grilled cheese sandwich, but we ordered four at our table and the bread wasn't toasted and the cheese wasn't melted. The tater tots were soggy and gross. The plate of wings were undercooked and there was a large hair on the plate. The food took about an hour and was served to us cold. It seemed that the entire wait staff went out the night before on a drinking binge and forgot to bring their brain to work the next day, no one checked-up on us, they did a terrible job at re-filling our drinks. Its a shame because it has so much potential and i've been there before and everything was fine. Good news is I still had fun catching up with old friends, but this terrible experience prompted me to sign-up to Yelp just so I can warn people. Cheers.
author: Alyson S.

description: The tots - nothing to run out of breath talking about, but pretty damn tasty. I love the atmosphere. JAMESON ON TAP. Great place to catch up with your buddies in the afternoon. It's kind of funny though, the people you see stumbling out of here while waiting for a table at ChaChaCha's on a Friday night. Apparently, this spot is the hipsterest place to be.
author: Rosavida C.

description: This place was great! Happy hour prices were pretty good---$4 dollar wall cocktails and average bottled stuff $3. Service was great and didn't get annoyed when out group had soo many questions. It wasn't too full for happy hour so our group of 10 were able to sit altogether!
author: Seraphie A.

description:
nicely done, dr. teeth. you are more on the noisy-er side and hipsters flock to you but your food was surprisingly good. i actually wouldn't mind giving your place another shot. hey! i might even host a work happy hour here. the next time i am around, i do want to try your fernet on tap as i feast on your reuben egg rolls and tater tot nachos again. once you get me drunk enough, i will devour your ghost pepper burger as well.

one thing though: for a bar named after a muppets band, i was sorta hopping to see some muppet paraphernalia but sadly, there was none.
author: The Hangry Chef O.

description: This place was amazing! Glittered mannequins, awesome retro tunes ranging from 80's hop hip to Marvin Gaye and a stellar patio. Besides the general atmosphere the service was sassy and the food was delish. I would highly recommend  going there for breakfast. The banana French toast is bitchin. It's an awesome place to hid out from the regular mission crowd.
author: Christina R.

description:
I'm happy this bar joined the mission in the former Bissap Baobab space. This is a welcome addition to the hood. They have a drink menu with $10 specialty cocktails as well as decent beers, which are served in those glass jam jars that people use for canning fruits or whatever. that's a nice touch. 

They play movies on a few TV screens and have some pretty good music going at a tolerable volume. Would be nice if they had a dance floor, but a few of us made our own dance floor in the back! It was pretty full on a friday night but not like crazy sweaty & hot full...in other words, it was not living up to its name, but for me that was a good thing. 

I also walked by on a sunday and saw a lot of people inside doing the brunch/partying thing. If you have friends meeting you there, though, tell them to meet you at "Mayhem" because that is the official name, at least when it comes to online searches - despite the sign that says "Dr. Teeth & The Electric Mayhem" outside. A bit confusing. But overall this definitely adds to the ease of the 4 block radius bar crawl - elbo room, the lex, the phoenix, amnesia, beauty bar, little baobab & now, MAYHEM!
author: Shannon R.

description:
Been here once and it was a good experience.... the burger was REALLY good .... the tots could have been a little crispier but they were tasty and a pleanty.  
The waitress informed us that they make EVERYTHING themselves ... including the jalepeno poppers and the tots. 

This alone will make me go back to try other items.  

Lastly the steak salad was reccomended to us by oiur server but the steak on it was NOT good..... it was tough and the meat was too cold.... 

on a scale of 1 to 10
Burger 8
Tots    7
Steak Salad   4
Ambiance 6  (could use more dentist themed stuff)   :) 
Prices   7 
Service   8
Booze Selection 8
author: Jeremy R.

description: If you love cheap wings, great, come here. If not, this place doesn't stand out. Came here afterwork on a weeknight, and it got super busy, super fast. The waitress was running around, but we were left waiting for food, for drinks, for our check, etc. They can improve the seatings situation in here. I think I can explore other places for wings, but the name makes the place memorable.
author: Yolanda Y.

description: Dr. Teeth  & the Electric Mayhem = best name for a bar ever.  Was this the best bar I've been to ever?  Not necessarily, but the staff was super nice, drinks were good -- the ambiance could use a little work, but overall enjoyed it.
author: Mel G.

description: I had no idea what to expect from this place, but had heard from many people it was awesome and a great place to go to shows and go with a big group. The back patio with the steps is AMAZING on a warm night. They had me at "John Daly pitchers" but solidified my admiration with the mini sliders.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Went here with a few friends. The burgers are great. Found out the ghost pepper sauce on tater tots is like injesting fresh magma - not for the mild or medium hot crowd.  

They have Jameson whisky on tap, YES - ON TAP.  Atmosphere is cool, nice patio out back. Bathrooms are super nasty - normal dive bar condition. The surrounding area is definitely "up and coming" so be aware of that if you don't know the city.
author: Kyle D.

description: The outdoor garden here is super cute & the staff is very friendly. They have 25 cent wings on Wed & super cheap PBRs...  1 star off because the food was meh & I'm a vegetarian so although my co-workers always want to go here for the super cheap wings I always end up spending about $15 on a non-PBR beer & a sub-par appetizer. Please make a veggie friendly happy hr option!
author: E B.

description:
Came here for Saturday brunch around 1130. There was no wait so we grabbed a table on the patio out back. 

Service sucked.
not doubting the whole place overall, but our waitress in particular could care less about us . Took about 15 minutes until we saw her, and it wasn't busy at all, maybe 3 other tables. We had to go inside to get our own menus, which at first I didn't mind because I figured she might be busy.... But towards the end of the meal I realized she was just careless...

I think her name was Courtney. When she walked up and just asked what we wanted, no smile , eye contact , no greeting... When our food did come out the food runner was much more attentive in one interaction than she was the whole time . 
Eggs Benedict were good and I got the tater tots on the side ! 
My room mate got the Mission scramble with home fries which was delicious topped with avocado !!

Back to the service 
She never came back to check up on us after she took our order ... And we had to ask the busser for our check. This is what topped it off for me ..... 
I gave her the benefit of the doubt thinking maybe she was just super busy, being as I myself am a server, but she literally THREW THE CHECK AT OUR TABLE, you couldn't take the two extra steps to drop it off or say thank you at least?! Talk about lazy and rude 
3 stars: food was 4 but service was 1....
author: Ciafa P.

description: All I can really say is I had a lot of fun with the bottomless mimosas, can't remember much about the food. It's a fun place and I like the patio.
author: monica s.

description: Went here in the afternoon with two of my best friends. We ended up staying till close.  Great spot.  Bartenders were all very friendly and they have a very wide and creative selection of drinks.  The vibe is kinda different, which we appreciated, and we met some really fun people there.  There's skiball in the back, where they have a nice little garden, and the bar itself also has shuffleboard. Definitely worth a visit.
author: Mahima K.

description: The decor is interesting seems like a chill place but I was there Monday night November 18 ordered a jack and coke. 6$ sounds fine. Went back for another 8$ what? The bartender insisted, no it was 8, things seem off. If they make whatever price they want like that I'm never returning.
author: Shane L.

description: Crowded but not unbearable. Really great mac and cheese. Good prices.
author: Gee H.

description:
The last thing I want when I am out having fun with friends is to be surrounded by jeering perverts, hammered and cheering on the TV screen demeaning other human beings.  If I wanted that I would go to a porno theater, yet that is where I found myself at Dr. Teeth.

We went there because of its generally good ratings and overall, it seemed like an okay bar. The drinks were way over-priced, and it was crowded, but that was to be expected on a weekend in the Mission.  But then this movie that they had been playing in the background went from stupid 80's sexual to abusively "erotic".  I'm all for sexual freedom (and I get that it's San Francisco and there is bound to be a lot of it) but not when it involves captive naked women forced to fight each other in a ring while men watch and place bets while being aroused. At that point it is no longer sexual freedom but sexually demeaning.  It was the human equivalent of a dog fight which most people would consider cruel and demoralizing. Yet, when people were being treated in a way we wouldn't even treat animals they were drunkenly cheering it on! The atmosphere of the bar instantly felt more aggressive and unsafe. I grew increasingly aware of how wasted everyone was and how many girls were either nearly passed out or as uncomfortable as I was.  I could no longer enjoy myself (and I could no longer hear myself over the shouting) even though I was with friends. 

This was a couple of weekends ago and I have regretted not saying something sooner.  I don't know if this is a regular occurrence or if it was just going on that night, but on principle I will never go there again and will discourage any person with respect for women from patronizing this establishment.  There are hundreds of average bars in the Mission and from now on I will spend my time in the ones that do not objectify and offend at least half of their customers.
author: Katherine G.

description: YES! This bar has become my new favorite spot. Combine late night (cheap) snacking with beer and awesome cocktails and you have yourself a successful night. I've been here twice so far - once on Wing Wednesday (.25 wings) and once on a Saturday for bottomless mimosas. I would have given this place 5 stars as a bar but I deducted one as a restaurant for the mediocre brunch food. Anyhow, I'll definitely be back here soon to drink and drunch at night.
author: Jennifer F.

description:
Appropriately named depending on when you stumble in here.

I stopped in for Sunday funday and this place was in full effect around 5p.  Tons of people in costumes boozing everywhere.  The bartender was really nice despite all the commotion and promptly served me beer.  They're light on the list with a few macros in the bottle and Mirror Pond, Guinness and Trumer on tap.  Decent space totally devoid of any sort of Muppetry.

It was the opening of their patio which was an interesting event.  Cake, DJ, bags (or cornhole if you prefer) and people dancing.  The whole thing kind of felt like a frat party however it wasn't too bad chilling outside on the artificial grass letting the evening melt away and wondering just what certain costumes were supposed to be.  The patio is flanked by two buildings so depending on the season, getting here earlier will be better as the sun gets blocked as it's going down.

Mayhem for sure but my experience my get better as I come here more.
author: Steven R.

description: Love this place! Ive been here a good amount of times and it seems to never fail. If  your looking for a chill place to grab drinks and a quick bite, this place is perfect. The inside of this location is kind of small and can get really packed at times. Fighting for a table is pretty common around here. This is one of the better places Ive eaten at that has good bar food. I usually order the trio sampler where you can choose 3 things off their menu. Theyre really well known for their tater tots. Their truffled mac n cheese is bomb also. Besides the food, their drinks are also good. They have some really good mules here and you can also order them by the pitcher. Overall, this is one of the chiller spots in the mission and its a great place to go to with friends.
author: Lauren A.

description: Love the name, LOVE THE MUPPETS! Love the young crowd, and the deals they have! We came in one night (just because I love the muppets) and were surprised to be there for $1 taco night!! Amazing!
author: Krystina C.

description: i came here for weekend brunch for their bottomless mimosa special and had a somewhat traumatizing experience. There was one server for the entire restaurant, which was packed with a 45 minute wait. When we were finally seated, it still took a good half hour to even have our drink order taken. The traumatizing part was that there was one woman's restroom for the entire place with a toilet that did not flush and had a sign taped to it specifically stating that it wasn't working so "pee only, no poo," which others had obviously not been able to comply with. Women resorted to using the men's, which only half -flushed. Not a good idea for a brunch place serving bottomless mimosas....
author: Rochelle F.

description: Come here for Wing Wednesday on a Wednesday night. The 25 cent wings are amazing, and the atmosphere is always fun and lively. On warm nights the patio is always packed out back and I have been attending Wing Wednesday every couple of weeks for the past half of a year. Get 6 buffalo wings and 6 sweet habanero chili wings for $3 if you want to leave happy and full. Happy Wing Wednesday!
author: Ryan R.

description: Great wings, beer, and the owner, Mark is just a cool dude
author: Marc M.

description: Nice atmosphere and they serve beer in mason jars, which is cool. The Tatchos are worth the trip alone. I hear they have .25 cent wings on Wed, but haven't gone for that yet....
author: Adam K.

description:
This place is a little gem of happy hour bars in SF and the Mission!  I was turned on by the name and my friends rave reviews.  Next door to Cha Cha Cha, this is a fun and funky place for an after work snack and beer.  Happy Hour EVERY NIGHT, great menu-Truffle Tater Tots are no joke and the Death Wings will make you wish you had a gallon of milk to stop the burning.  

Friendly staff, great selection of yummy food, quick service with a smile.  Make sure you get here by 6pm to get a seat, otherwise you have to make friends quickly to nab a place to set your beer.

OH and people are cool and friendly here. They actually WILL talk to you and are not up tight and pretentious.
author: Denise H.

description:
For 25¢ a wing, you can get a plate of 8 wings for only $2 every Wednesday. That's right, a whole plate of tasty, flavorful, juicy, tender, and succulent chicken wings for just two dollars! It doesn't sound possible but Dr. Teeth and The Electric Mayhem has made it possible! This bar, located in the heart of Mission, is generally packed with friendly locals. The inside dining/drinking area is very crowded and seats are scarce even on the weekdays but the outdoor patio in the back usually has some vacancies. The Bartenders are extremely friendly. There is pretty much a full bar at this location and the bartenders are able to whip up pretty much anything you ask for. There is a decent selection of beer whether if you want it by tap, bottle, or can. The prices for drinks are very reasonable so having a few extra drinks with the wings won't hurt your wallet. There is a new special every day of the week besides Saturday and Sunday.

Other Specials:
Sundays - Buy a Shot, Get a Pony! (I haven't tried this yet, please post below if you know what it is)
Mondays - Burger and Beer for $10
Tuesdays - Trivia at 8PM (play trivia in a team, win prizes)
Wednesdays - Wings for 25¢
Thursday - $2 Tacos, 2 for 1 Margaritas

Source: http://wp.me/p2I7CM-1F
author: Damon F.

description: This place was super packed on Sunday at noon! You walk in and you're supposed to seat yourself, but there is nothing telling you to do so, there is a sign in sheet, but no one reads it, there is seating in back but no sign telling you so, so in the 5 minutes it takes you to gleen this information, the 3 couples that just came in behind you, took the last 3 available seats. There was an incredibly long wait for service, and for our food, and the noise level was way too high. I think it is understaffed? The decor was interesting, like a post-modern, da da, Bauhaus thing going on, like Thierry Guetta was the decorator.  The food was ok, not very hot though, and after several servers were asked, there apparently are no salt shakers in the restaurant. the Tot-chos (tater-tot nachos) were the redeemer here, very tasty and different.  But thats about it.
author: Jack W.

description: One of the first places I bring visitors from out of town - a very eclectic and San Francisco vibe that's good for brunch and watching basketball games. Spicy margaritas are good and cheap, their bottomless mimosas are strong and should be respected as such.
author: Liz G.

description:
This bar is totally lacking in personality, probably because they are new.  The decor is pretty interesting though...I really liked the bejeweled mannequins.  They also were playing old black and white westerns on their TVs...cool sure, as was everything to look at in the place, but it just didn't go together.

Overall just kind of a blah experience.  Probably a good place to go if you have a large group and don't care about the scene because there is no scene and there is lots of seating here.

The place is big for a dive bar, but I don't think they are using the space well.  they should really pop in a dance floor, and everything would be cool.
author: Caitlin H.

description: Mayhem will most likely be the death of me. Like the Calypso's Island from Homer's Odyssey, the bar will dangerously draw you in with a plethora of sexy bartenders serving you nectar of the gods. Mark is a gem who will pound a shot of fernet with you as your guilty pleasure songs play in the background. Don't forget to order and indulge in a mountain of tachoes (tater tot nachos) and sliders once you hit that blackout status. You will probably hate yourself in the morning but that's a problem for Future You.
author: Michelle N.

description:
After being recommended to this place by a fellow neighbor we went for dinner and we're pleased to discover a great burger joint.  Good beer on tap, wide variety of burger options, and great service.  I have come back several times (always for dinner) and have enjoyed the salads and tasty fried sides.

 My one big recommendation/complaint is the music is outta control loud.  I'm not a geezer but if I come in with friends for a Sunday dinner I don't want to scream over my food.  At this time there was defiantly not a bar scene happening so don't try to make it into one.  Keep dinner hours dinner friendly, otherwise those who want an enjoyable dinning experience will unfortunately have to find a new burger place.
author: Michelle M.

description:
"look me up, i am going away for 10 years... biggest meth bust in history.. so lets party"

always a good time with this diverse crowd.
the bar is comfortable even when its crowded. 
OUTDOOR SPACE. A++++ hard to find!
author: Meg W.

description: We originally came here because of a Groupon but have been back several times for 25 cent wing night on Wednesdays. The wings are great and the happy hour drink prices are cheap too. The only reason I took a star off is because it can be absolutely packed on wing nights and hard to get service if you don't have a table (which is impossible to get if you dont get there before 5:30), otherwise we love it. They also have shuffle board inside and TVs in the backyard area which are nice when the weather is great.
author: Aby M.

description: Their 25 cent wings on Wednesdays are amazing.  Watch out for the ghost chili wings, they are ridiculously hot.  The sweet habanero wings are my personal favorite.
author: Craig S.

description: Cool spot...went one saturday afternoon. Was cool to find out they have a patio in the back. Really cool spot to hangout on a sunny day.
author: Dilly M.

description: Two words. Wing Wednesday. (Four if you include "And BEER") Great place to go to for wings + drinks with some friends. I came here on a Black Wednesday.. so for those who are not familiar with black Wednesday, it's pretty much when all you friends come back to their hometown, and all you guys want to do is grab a drink! So it was a bit crowded but definitely had no problem getting my order of wings and beer! Definitely coming here again when I have a chance!
author: Lianne D.

description: The 3 stars is for the food,not the service. Went there for brunch on a Sunday. There was only one server, but it wasn't crazy busy. It took 30 min just to get water. The food actually came out before the water, so I'd say it took 40 min to get water. It's a good thing we didn't end up ordering real drinks. I would have given 4 stars for the food, but the service just messed this place up for me. Service: 0.5
author: Raechel U.

description:
home made spicy pickle juice.
what else do you want to know?
author: Helen N.

description: The best night to go is Wednesdays! $0.25 wings all night and they got Jameson on tap! Get there by 5pm when they open and snatch up a table as this place gets packed right when they open. Try the DEATH sauce, I dare ya!
author: Eddie B.

description: I had the grilled cheese bfast sandwich, and while it wasn't groundbreaking, the mimosas were good and i had a fantastic time! Did I mention the shuffleboard ?!?
author: Danielle D.

description:
Hipster-ish vibe/frat-party feel without the douches.

Awesome service, good hearty bar food. pricing is fair too.
author: Carmen S.

description: As a bar, it isn't bad.  As a Sunday morning brunch spot, it is amazing. The tachos (that is tater tot nachos, I know, your mind is blown too, they are FREAKING AMAZING) are to die for, the bottomless mimosas are delicious, and the fact that they have a back patio with corn hole, food, and smoking is great.  On a sunny day, get their early to make sure you can get room on the patio.
author: Dick S.

description:
Food was descent, service was terrible.

My friends and I went here the other day for their brunch special. We sat down at the only table that was available, which hadn't been wiped down yet. The check was still sitting there from the previous customers and there were crumbs all over it, understandable because they were pretty busy. The waitress came over, greeted us, and grabbed the check. She told us she would be right back with menus. Ten minutes went by and we started looking up the menu on our phones, because we were starting to get hungry and we thought we would be ready by the time she comes back. She finally came up to us with one less menu than was necessary, still hadn't wiped down our messy table, and explained that they were super busy. I could see that and gave her the benefit of the doubt. We ordered things like Eggs Benedict and tatchoes, things that don't take too long to make, and some coffees. She left and was totally absent for at least a half hour. By this time it had been about 45 minutes since we sat down and we hadn't even gotten waters. I had to take napkins off the table sitting next to us and wipe down our area myself. I eventually started to get worried that we had been forgotten and flagged another server down. I explained to him how long we had been waiting and that we didn't have our drinks or even our waters. I told him the description of our waitress and he apologized and came right back with waters, silverware, and napkins. Our waitress soon arrived with our coffees and put them down with a silent sneer on her face. I guess she was mad that we had said something. I work in the food industry and know about customer service. If your customers aren't happy you should apologize, explain the situation, and then make it up to them. Instead, she treated us like we were being a hinderance to her day. Eventually one of us got his food and ate the whole thing before we realized that none of us had a dish yet. We waited another 10 minutes before asking where the rest of our food was. I guess he had been given someone else's dish from another table and that he was getting another one. I still hadn't gotten my food and was starting to get hangry. By the time I got my lukewarm tater tot nachoes we had been sitting there for an hour and 20 minutes. 

I was pretty upset about it and hope that they learn how to be more efficient with their tables.

By the way. 
I still tipped, because I'm in the food industry and know how it feels.
author: Kate M.

description: Fast becoming my new favorite spot! This new/upscale mission bar solid beer selection, Jameson on tap, and a great funky/original brunch menu. They have a shuffleboard table inside also. The real gem is the backyard on a sunny day: multi levels, SUN, skee ball, TV, tables, SUN, grassy upper level with cornhole, and SUN! great spot for sunday funday.
author: John F.

description: Food was so bad! mozzarella stix tasted like a freezer. I get using frozen food and wasn't expecting anything too spectacular but yikes it was all bad. Nothing special at all.
author: Mckenzie B.

description: My friends and I came here with a party of 6 for brunch after a yoga session, a few weeks back. Five out of six ordered bottomless mimosas, and we definitely saw the bottoms of those mimosas (IMO) for far too long. For a $15 drink, I was a bit bummed that I needed to find a server or bartender on two occasions when all of us had emptied our glasses (and we were not guzzling, despite the tastiness of the mimosas!). Our server was kind, but pretty forgetful. Several of us were missing parts of our meal once everything was served, and once again needed to ask twice to have coffee, toast, etc. brought to the table. We are sweet people, I promise! Work on service and attentiveness, especially when it's pretty empty, and those stars'll keep coming.
author: Amy H.

description: I heard it from a friend that this place has awesome deals during the week. Starting with 25 cent chicken wings and a taco deal that we will check out later this week. The wings were freaking awesome. They were  spicy hot enough and tender and juicy. We order 20 of them and couldn't really finish them until we could catch our breath :) their beer selection was decent and price fairly. So stay tune for the taco review which will be coming real soon.
author: Jova E.

description: Great atmosphere and delicious food! Only problem was it is actually a fight to grab a table. I definitely recommend the Strawberry Pisco pitcher! Especially to share. Also the tachos and grilled cheese sliders were delicious. The grilled cheese comes on skewers and you can dip them in tomato soup! Inside is a bit louder but a fun atmosphere. Outside is chill but equally crowded. I would definitely come back and recommend this to a group of friends looking for a chill, fun night out :)
author: Claudia L.

description: I feel like 2.5 stars is more accurate, but I'll round down. This place was packed on Sunday at noon, which is understandable, but once seated, service and food were incredibly slow. A table freed up, but after waiting 20 minutes, the one waitress in our area hadn't had time to clear the table, so my friends and I did it ourselves. After another 20 minutes of waiting around, our order was taken. After another 15 minutes drinks hadn't been brought it yet, so my friend went to the counter to request our cups of mimosas/water and brought them back himself. We waited an hour for our food to come out (grabbed some bags of chips at the hot dog cart outside on the sidewalk about 45min into the wait). It finally came out and one order had been forgotten. We decided to cancel it, and they gave us a round of shots as an apology, which was nice. The food was ok (my omelette was lukewarm), but absolutely not worth such a long wait. At least the one waitress was still pleasant the handful of times we saw her despite having so many customers to tend to.
author: Hayley W.

description: I love this place. They sponsor our dodgeball team, and we come here after games. It's dark, there's shuffleboard, cheap eats, the decor is kitchy, and the bartenders are pretty cute.
author: Christina M.

description: I came on a saturday and didn't expect a 2 hour wait however, i thought its'prob worth it because of the ratings.  We waited for about 1.5 hour and thank goodness there was bottomless mimosas. We were sipping on our drinks while waiting for our table and somehow, it didn't seem that long anymore after 3cups.  When we got seated our server was reallly nice and was pretty quick with everything.  We ordered the tatchos and a burger and it was pretty good.
author: Susie D.

description: I was so excited to try this place because it had the .25 cent wing special on wednesday nights.  When our group entered the place, it was already packed.  I was amazed at how quick the wings were served upon ordering.  Anyways, if you want a seat, it is always best to come when they just opened.  We ended up sitting at the patio which quickly became chilly.  This also made the wings all cold which was not as enjoyable as it would have been while it was still hot.  Overall, a decent place to go for cheap bar food and I recommend ordering the BBQ wings.
author: Ann L.

description:
Huge fan of the Muppets. When I do an internet search and a bar called "Dr. Teeth and the Electric Mayhem" comes up, and I walk over a half hour their to pay my respects, and I get there and it isn't muppet themed, I'm a little upset.

I do like drinking draft beer out of jars, so they get one star for that.

and one star because there wasn't as many hispters as I would expect for the mission.

but where are the dang muppets?
author: Meowy C.

description: Epic back patio with bags, German beers in mason jars, and snacks and brunch for the hungry.
author: Megan G.

description: amazing drinks. Awesome bartenders. great music. super chill crowd.
author: Kareem H.

description: As far as bars in the Mission go, this may be one of my new faves!  From the double PBR cans to the all around vibe, I can't wait to go back!
author: Vanessa L.

description: One of my favorite bars for Sunday Funday. They have all of the necessary elements: tater tots (you can even get them with truffle oil- DIE), shuffle board, outdoor patio, bags (although the bags themselves are a wee bit deflated and could stand to be replaced), and the location isn't too shabby either!
author: Molly S.

description:
Death Burger with ghost pepper sauce?  I'll give it a try.

HOT! HOT! HOT! 

The wings are delicious, and any place that has Fernet AND Jamison on tap, instantly goes to the top of the list.
author: Mike I.

description: Tater tots and cocktails...after midnight.  Need I say more?  Probably not, but I will.  I love this bar. It's in a great location in the Mission near other bars and there is a bacon-wrapped hot dog stand outside in case you didn't get your fill of tater tots.  So let me talk about these tots since they are so awesome.  We always get plain and sweet potato with truffle - they are really good late at night when you are hungry but also want to get your drink on. They have a large variety of tots, too. Drinks are mediocre but just like every other bar in the mission. This is my go-to bar after hitting up Mosto for dinner/drinks.
author: Robin R.

description: Amazing drinks, great food. Outdoor patio. Really good vibe. The downside is it has gotten really crowded lately and the service/space is not able to accommodate crowds of people.
author: Aaron H.

description: Seriously, this place is junk food heaven!! The name alone was intriguing but once I saw the menu, I HAD to go here. Got a sampler plate of fabulous appetizers - Totchos (tater tots smothered with nacho-y goodness), corn dogs, and bacon/truffle mac'n'cheese! TO DIE FOR. Went a little early hoping to be able to hear ourselves talk and that was a good idea. Definitely recommended!
author: Danielle P.

description: mayhem or dr. teeth?...both and combination the answer...mission burrito and mission drinks...looking for mayhem and discovering the proper bar...with a group of dentists, self not, and finding name, dr. teeth, also suitable...cocktails and jar filled beers...shuffling and sliding pucks...a peer checking out the x-rays over the bar...confirmed to all belong to one person with gold crown...roll of tables easily pushed around to accomodate large groups...full from burrito before and passing on some sinful heap of fried and looking bad for you, but looking grubbin' good...drinks, giggles and a lil' mission mayhem to end the night...turkey holiday cheers...
author: Hen A.

description: Fun trivia night with some pretty awesome prizes! The beer prices aren't too bad either, and they seem to have some great food specials throughout the week. Just beware, some of those jalapeño peppers can pack a punch :)
author: Emily S.

description: Funky, Funky, Funky...like your local dive bar, which translates into welcoming and friendly!  Gotta love this place.  A delightful menu of stuff you've never had before (deep fried beets, anyone) and superb cocktails.  A word about their "death" sauce...they ain't kiddin!  Runny nose in under 30 seconds and tears in under 60!  This stuff is HOT!  While we were here for an early bird snack, looks like this place would be terrific for Happy Hour.  GO!
author: Howard B.

description: Food was not great. Service SUCKS! The waitress spilled my shot that I ordered and she should have brought a new one right away since it was her mistake, but it took her a reminder and 15 minutes to bring me a new one.
author: Stacy H.

description:
25 cent wings and $3 beers on Wednesday during happy hour (the wings deal is all night, though). What more can you want in life?

Get the sweet habanero wings; by far the best ones.
author: Pierre B.

description:
ah, i love this place!!

i came here on wednesday for their $0.25 wings (with a purchase of at least 2 drinks)

1) wings = 
       w/ sweet habanero chili sauce = love em!!
       w/ buffalo sauce= yes!!
      w/ death (deadly spicy) sauce = oh, you will break a sweat.. or cry
2) totchos (tater tots w/ nachos toppings) = yes!!
3) shuffleboard = yes!!!!
4) ambiance= i love it!
5) staff= super friendly!!
6) wait= get there early. there was a line waiting for this place to open!
7) cleanliness= heck yea!!

coming back? most definitely
author: Nance L.

description: Seriously, this spot can go f-- themselves. Completely crap (on the scale of WTF inept) service.
author: Guillermo K.

description: This is a cool spot.  It's right next to Cha Cha Cha's if you want something to eat.  Kind of dark.  No real dancing area if you're into that.  Music was decent.  Hung out with friend from out of town.  Wasn't spectacular.  It may have been a slow night.  We went on a Thursday.  Was hoping to see some kind of Electric Mayhem band playing.  If I was in the area, I would go back...but I wouldn't make it a destination.
author: Darin P.

description: My first time here and I was so excited for the 25 cents chicken wing wed. We ordered way too much!! Bought 20 wings and went to the back to meet some friends, they had a huge plate of wings also! I think we ended up wasting 25+ wings. I grabbed a wing dipped the whooe thing in red sauce and took a huge bite...HOLY SHIT!!!!! MY mouth was burning my eyes started tearing I couldn't breathe!!! I was literally dying from pain!! I thought the sauce was buffalo sauce it ended up being some "deathly" hot sauce! Wtf!! The pain finally stopped after 15minutes...30 minutes later I had a sharp pain in my stomach then I started getting light headed and almost fainted!! I felt like I was high and light headed, then I felt like throwing up, then almost passed out. I was sweating like crazy and it wouldn't stop! After trying to puke maybe 20 min later drinking some water I felt better. I have never felt that kind of pain in my life, I really thought I was going to end up in the ER! LESSON of my story, DO NOT EAT THE DEATHLY WING SAUCE!!! Besides almost dying I loves the backyard and margaritas.
author: Karen T.

description: Awesome Greyhounds with fresh squeezed grapefruit and vodka. The tat-chos were very good = nachos with tater tots instead of chips. Quick, friendly service. Would go back!
author: Sandy M.

description: Probably my favorite dive bar in the mission. The place gets packed so be prepared. Food is great, love the various choices for sliders and tater tots. Great little outdoor area, perfect on a nice Sunday afternoon. Very cool staff, good drinks, good eats, good people!
author: Phil C.

description: If you want comfort food I would have to say check it out! They have the best fried food I think I have ever had at a bar (jalapeno poppers are a must) and the tater-tot nachos are great! The service isn't the best if you're sitting at the bar you're fine but if you have to rely on the waitress your gonna be there awhile. still worth checking out for sure just know to be patient.
author: Mandi S.

description: I told the bartender i would tell all of you she makes a great bloody mary and i said i would yelp her name but they were so good i had a few and now i can't remember her name. She put bacon in my bloody mary... BACON! We went here off the living social and let me tell you it was fantastic! We all had something different and got to try a lil of each. The banana bread french toast was insane, truffle taters and wings were delish. My friend gad the death wings and it is not something my palate can handle but if you are interested in showing off how well a little wing can make you cry give it a go! Bottomless mimosas! Delightful! It was all good. Im going back. Hi 5s to the crew.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Went to redeem our ridiculous Thrillist Hangover Brunch deal this weekend and were fully impressed. Bottomless Mendotas (Beer w/ grapefruit juice) or Mimosas, 2 Brunch entrees, and 2 shots of Fernet. Needless to say we left very very drunk. So drunk that on the way home we stopped by Good Vibrations and made sex toy impulse buys. Yea, it was a good day.
As for the food, we got the Fried Chicken and Jelly Donut sammie with tots - yes, it was as devilishly delicious as it sounds. Really enjoyed this with some Sriracha. We also got the Classic Benedict with Canadian Bacon and Hash Browns. It was ok, flavorful but not mind-blowing. Luckily the portions were so large that we ended up eating all of the chicken sandwich and were too full to finish the Benedict anyway. Choose the tots, by the way. They're the exact ones you were served in your Middle School cafeteria. Nostalgic in the best way!
The service was pretty good. Minus one star because our server seemed annoyed that she had to come back 3 times before we were ready to order. My boyfriend and I are both servers and in our opinion it's common courtesy to allow guests to take as much time as they need to decide on their meals without any eye-rolling. By the third time she came (with very short periods of time between each check in), we felt we needed to order just so she wouldn't become more irritated with us. Other than this one little hiccup, we had a fantastic brunch. Our server even warmed up over the course of the meal and became much friendlier, so maybe she was just a little cranky being at work at 10:30am on a Sunday. Aren't we all.
This place is really creatively decorated, the menu is inventive and fun, and the vibe is nice and laid back. I hear their burgers are great too. We'll definitely be back.
author: Tanya K.

description: Hear about this place via word of mouth. I wasn't sure about it- but I really liked it. I was going to a show at the chapel and it was closeby so I gave it a try. It's seat yourself, so make sure you get there early if you're hungry. It is, in my opinion, a bar that happens to have good food, as opposed to a restaurant with good drinks.. I hope that makes sense. We didn't get any drinks, (under 21) but the food was pretty good in my opinion. The burger was okay- but the tots were pretty special! I got the buffalo blue tots and I thought they were outstanding. I've been seeing people complain in other reviews about the service. But it's really not bad.
author: Angelo C.

description: A bar named after a Muppet?  Awesome.  Had a really great time here watching the NFC Championship game.  Of course it helped that the 49ers won.  Huge celebration as time expired.  The staff were all very friendly and quick the whole day and there were delicious tots everywhere.
author: David P.

description: The brunch menu is a little limited because there were pictures on help of food some of my party wanted that wasn't available, but you can definitely find something delicious to eat on the menu.  Main reason for coming Sunday morning was bottomless mimosas for $15. Totally worth it considering one mimosa anywhere is like $7-8. And I reached a total of ten!  They were good and strong, and seriously bottomless...waitress made sure no empty cup on the table. It was also not crazy busy at 11am on a Sunday but towards the afternoon started to get more crowded. This is a great place for bottomless mimosa brunch with some pretty good eats :)
author: Ryan M.

description: Love this place. Good pub gub and great drinks. It's a little pricey but I always have a good time. Oh, and they have a great back patio.
author: Oscar C.

description: Crowded, mission hipster's paradise that is just so-so.
author: Ana F.

description: Had a sampler of fried pickles crab fries and grilled cheese bites. Served with tomato soup with 70s funk playing. Check out their huge back patio too....
author: Darren K.

description: I love this place!  I came on a LivingSocial deal and can't wait to come back even without one.  The staff is super friendly; the food totally solid and well-priced; the bottomless mimosas strong; the vibe superb.  They have a sunny back patio too.  It was just easy good times.  Also we didn't have to wait in line at all when we got there for Sunday brunch at 11 am.
author: Eve P.

description:
This bar is awesome. Wait staff is extremely friendly and they have a great cocktail menu. I especially liked this one that had Buffalo Trace bourbon and grapefruit juice (can't remember the name).

This place also makes SOLID bar food; lots of the classics, some unusual, but all done really well. We ordered the jalapeno poppers, reuben eggrolls and mozzarella sticks in a sampler platter (you get two of each) and they come with ranch, marinara, and thousand island dressing though the waitress threw in the chipotle sauce too. All really tasty!

We ordered the fried chicken sandwich with sweet habanero sauce - the right amount of heat balanced with sweet and a blue cheese bacon burger. For the sides, tot-chos (tater tot nachos- YUM!) and a salad. Believe the hype, these taters are da bomb!

Also, our waitress was incredibly friendly and provided wonderful service. Would definitely go back for the solid cocktails and really good bar food classics!
author: Steven H.

description:
Watch out for petty theft.  I got my wallet stolen from my bag under my table on Friday.  Told the bouncer and bartender and neither were very helpful.  They said, "it happens all the time at Dr. teeth"

Ive lived in SF for two years, mostly out in the Mission.  First time this has happened.
author: Tamara S.

description: The place is a old, dark literal bar, so thanks yelpers for only taking pictures of the food and not the actual place. The seats were old and torn and the stools didn't feel too sturdy. Very loud and dark so it's not a decent place to sit and have a meal, a total contrary of what everyone else was posting. The music was so loud, my ears felt like they were bleeding and it smelled like hobo. Much unlike the place itself, the food was really good. Tater tots were yummy, fries were good and I got a grilled cheese sandwhich with egg, crab and chicken strips. I paid $3 to get ONE lean chicken strip on my grilled cheese overall, which was dumb. Food is good, but I wouldn't agree with bars charging $10 for such simple meals. It also seemed like the waitress was pressuring me to submit an order and it was annoying. Its not like the place was full or anything. Please let me read the menu and think about what i want instead of coming to the table 3x asking if I'm finally ready.
author: Jacky H.

description: One of my go to bars in the Mission. I like that it's crowded but I can still always get a seat. Not only do they have some great cocktails (love the ones with fresh muddled fruit and freshly squeezed juices) but they also serve up some yummy food at reasonable prices. All the appetizers I've tried so far are great and the tater tots are amazing! Also, Jameson on tap? Come on, what more can a girl ask for?
author: Foodie K.

description: I speak only for weekend brunch, but they ran out of menus, drinking glasses and took forever to take our order. I felt bad for my friends who had the bottomless mimosas -as for awhile - they weren't drinking anything at all. I was visiting from SD so it was a huge waste of a meal. A ridiculous disappointment. The server was actually polite, but the team overall must have all been hungover from the night before. I've never witnessed such a bad-oiled machine. As for food- tator tots were good. My crab omelet was full of crab and for that I was happy. BUT my husband and sister got the Mission scramble and it was comical how terrible it was. The home fries were sooooo hard and his scramble looked like something leftover for a doggie bag. The server was polite and offered them the good (a safe choice) of free tator tots and I just gave my husband half of my crab omelet to make him feel less cheated out of a meal. I'm sure this place is great for a drink, but that's it!!!!!
author: Mindee P.

description: Wow. Douchebag central. And I'd really like to know why they named it after a Muppet show band when the bar has absolutely nothing to do muppets, puppets, or anything remotely of the like. They're just trying to appropriate the name in hopes it'll create a buzz. There is a buzz, but it's akin to the noise flies make when circling a pile of shit. I sent a letter to the Jim Henson Co. to let them know about the misuse of their intellectual property so hopefully they'll slap them with a cease and desist. They don't deserve to use the name. I came with a group of people and walked right out. The crowd was ridiculous as was the music. It was like someone plunked down a piece of the Marina in the Mission. This bar is a testament to the fact that the City is just not what it used to be. Alas...thank God for the East Bay.
author: Rebecca R.

description: If you had bought a voucher from groupon or living socials, I guess you just have to go but otherwise, don't even waste your time and money to check out this place. Most yelp reviewers for burnch at this place would understand what I'm taking about. Sketchy crowds, slow service. And MOST IMPORTANTLY they jacked up the prices of the food to match the vouchers' original values.That's FRAUD and living social and groupon should not do business with this type of restaurants. At the end, we gave the waitress a $5 tip on top the tax. She questioned us why?!!! How many times have you been to a restaurant when the waiters/waitresses question you about the amount of the tip??!? Should they understand the fact that customers decide on how much tip to give based on the value of the food and SERVICE?
author: Lan T.

description: Came here with a groupon for 20 sliders, truffle tator tots and 2 beers. Boy was that a lot of food. Glad the boyfriend and I took the waiter's advice and didn't order anything else. Sliders were okay, I tried one of each type (except the classic veggie). They were all okay, ordinary sliders. If I had to pick a favorite, it would be the reuben slider. Out of everything, I think I like the tator tots most. There was this board in front of us that we were trying to figure out what the hell it was (I'm a bar noob). And some guys came over to play with it and it looked interested. Didn't find out until we left that it was a shuffle board. Lots of TVs on the wall, so it's a great place to catch a game with decent food (that's decently priced too). I would come back to try other items on their menu and the shuffle board!
author: Linh T.

description: Bought a Living Social deal. Was skeptical and ended up Having a great time. Young hip crowd, everyone was friendly, patrons and staff.  Bartender Lia rocked, patio in the back looked fun too.
author: Susie G.

description: Love this spot - super chill, great beer selection, awesome food, and reasonably priced.  Seating is plentiful and comfortable, and you can most usually find your favorite (Bay Area) sports team on one of the giant TVs.  Used a Groupon here a few months back with no grief - and the sliders were amazing!  Juicy, tender, and perfectly cooked.  And tater tots?!  Can't hate on that.  Service is attentive enough...will definitely be back to this spot.
author: Jenna C.

description:
Yeah.
Went there for wings & drinks tonight 01/28/15.
Got there, it was packed, got in line (as civilized people who were taught right by their mamma do) at the bar. 
Couple of people ahead of us, obviously they get served first, all cool.
Then, when it's clearly our turn, the bartender/waiter throws us a quick glimpse, then heads straight to the other end of the bar & serves some people there (that came after us). Then, why not, let's serve some other new folks that just arrived.
All still cool, I'm not gonna lose my shit over this - but, just to be clear, bartender definitely saw us arriving & waiting there.
Well, finally the guy turns our way again, we've made it to the front of the bar, all looking good. Then, WTF, he literally looks at the guy behind us, right between our shoulders, and starts taking his order. Granted that tacky motherf&^$er had been obnoxiously calling for the bartenders attention, and that sucks for the poor biatch that's gonna date that uncultured douchebag that feels the need to elbow 2 girls out of the way to get to his stupid ass 25 cent wings 1 minute faster.
But that's irrelevant given the fact that the bartender had seen us waiting, and of course, us being IN FRONT of the dude, because well, WE F'ING ARRIVED BEFORE HIM. 

I don't care about not getting preferential treatment for being a pretty girl, but I sure  hate a) douchebag f'ing behavior being rewarded and more so b) service staff that was apparently bullied by the pretty girls in high school and now gets back at them by deliberately ignoring them and thinking that'll make us cry or whatever the f he was expecting to get out of his behavior.

Great job.
author: F F.

description: Got a groupon and came here after a hike on a Saturday afternoon. Had the truffle tatter tots and 2 of each of the sliders. I really liked the tatter tots and the meatball slider. Everything else was unimpressive. This place looks like it could be cool at night
author: Jenny C.

description: I went there to my "goodbye party" with 4 friends, and we had a blast. The waitress was so friendly, and the drinks were good enough for the price we paid, we played the table game  (that I dont remember the name), i had fun.
author: Danielle S.

description: Not the place to come for happy hour or right after work. The place was dead when we came by at 5:30 during the week. They didn't have a HH menu and all their cocktails were $10. I don't see this place as the kind of bar that should charge $10 a cocktail. Another issue was that they serve them all in martini glasses. Why  does an old fashioned need to be served in a big obnoxious martini glass? They seem more preoccupied with their large food menu then serving up reasonable drinks in the land of cheap drink heaven. For beer drinkers, like myself, they only offered up 4-5 which were the usual non-local suspects. The only thing that caught my eye was their brunch menu which had several breakfast options at around $6-8 and cheaper drinks than their cocktail list.
author: Cori W.

description: This place has never heard of the concept of customer service.
author: Tammy C.

description: Good chicken wings, slow service, pricey beer, creepy decor, and no online menu.
author: Captain B.

description: Shuffle board and tall cans of PBR, mix that with 25 cent wings!!! Great vibe, the old movies they play are fun and it is a good crowd most of the time!
author: Dimitri N.

description: Good happy hours (cheap margarita and taco nights), TOTCHOS, fun music sometimes, decent outside area in the back with ski ball.
author: Roxy B.

description: Great spot in the Mission. Sliders are really good and they serve food late. This quickly becoming one of my favorite bars.
author: Christy Z.

description: So any place that serves Jameson on tap automatically propels itself into the category of my favorite bars. Plus who can beat the reference in their moniker? Stand up and take note.
author: Jane K.

description: I've been here a several times now. This is a to-go spot for me and my friends on a Wednesday night (Wing Wednesdays). The atmosphere is really cool. There are TVs all over the inside with different sporting events on. The staff is very nice and will do anything to make you happy. There is a shuffleboard table, beanbag tossing in the back patio, and a skee-ball game. There are 4 different kind of wings that are offered as part of the 25 cent wings on Wednesdays: original, buffalo, bbq, and chili-habanero. They also have 3 dollar PBRs before 7pm. I would have to say that the chili habanero is out of this Earth. They are slightly spicy but it is sweet at the same time. It is the best!
author: Kevin H.

description: The place was packed but we still managed to get great service and our food came fast! We had two cheeseburger sliders and the corn dogs. Both were delish! Their drinks are tasty too. The Mule was to die for! Love the decor and can't wait to go back and play cornhole. Just hope it's not too crowded again.
author: Nicole O.

description: I happened on Dr Teeth while wandering the Mission last Friday night.  It was around 10:45 and we decide to pop in and check it out.  It was decently crowded, but not so much that I was uncomfortable.  The highlight for me was that of the four beers they had on tap, they had my favorite (Franziskaner) and my bf's favorite (Guinness).  The music was pretty good and there was a shuffle board!
author: Liz H.

description: Love their wings Wednesdays! Best day to try the death wing since most of you wont finish one. Ouch!
author: Jess H.

description: I love this hole in a wall $0.25 chicken wing eating happy hour spot. Try the death wings if you love spicy foods! Alcoholic beverages are cheap. Service is fast (although you might get that cranky waitress) but you would be too if you had to serve a crowd full of hungry eaters. I would definitely come back again on Wednesday for the wings!
author: Kelly C.

description:
I love many things, but I tend to love those things if they can be offered in bite size, personalized versions. Example: sliders and tater tots. 
I was super jazzed about their 10 slider meal, and I dove right in and went for two of each. The classic burger and the Reuben were pretty tasty, but I would only give the meatball a try one another time to see if they improve the marinara a bit. I'd ditch the veggie burger and the BLT altogether. I'd say that the BLT wasn't too shabby, but in it's place I could put more of something I love, so there you go. The veggie burger was in my opinion, inedible, so that says it there. 
Let's talk tater tots. Oh wow, my stomach just growled. They were awesome! We ordered the chili-cheese tots as they were the night's special, and we were not disappointed. This was enough food for three, easily, so split between two we actually had surplus tots and sliders. Worse things have been dragged home with me after a night out in the Mission, I'll be honest. 
The fifth star was in order as the waitstaff were ON IT. I love not having to ask for things like a fork, or a napkin, when clearly as habitual bipeds we don't eat with our feet and we often need our hands clean for things like high fives and stroking attractive facial hair on strangers. 
I'd make this a regular spot. Unpretentious, decent beer selection, and grub to keep your inner fat person satisfied while you enjoy a night in public. Win-win-win.
author: Kelly B.

description: So I've been here twice and both times I thought the staff was pretty darn cool. The place is suprisingly interesting with the decor and the atomosphere.  It doesn't look like much from the outside and the name but it's a cool roomy bar when you get inside.  The real prize is the 3 tier backyard complete with skee ball and some bean bag toss game that was probably invented by some beer drinkers in the mid west.  Bartenders are skilled and friendly.  Watiresses were nice as well and willing to hunt you down to deliver your drinks with no remorse.  It's also handy since it's up the street from MIssion Chinese so if you are on their waiting list it's a decent place to put one down when the wait is long. I'm pretty much planning to make a stop in here whenever I'm in the area.  I used to like Cha Cha Cha next door but this place is a bit less hecktic and pretentious.
author: Joco F.

description: FYI the owner is Mark, and now we're buddies, and I'm buying stock in this joint.
author: Greg H.

description: Lots a cool stuff about this place.  Good late night snacks and cocktails.  I will be back.
author: Ted t.

description: This place just opened close to where some friends of mine live. We checked it out on a Monday, I think. The drink prices were reasonable, the waitress was hot in a sexy, rocker, hipster way, but no one was there! I guess it was a Monday, but I'm sure this bar will eventually pick up some steam. It IS new...
author: David H.

description: gross mcnasty, watch out homies! this is where marina kids flock to when they party in the mission. this place seems to attract all types of douches and isn't very cheap to drink at. their whole thing is wings and tatter tots. both of which i've had and are mediocre. tried the mac n cheese once and it was minty! mint in my mac n cheese? its always a disaster at night, way too many people, so be prepared to get crappy service. I would recommend coming here on a weekday early afternoon or not at all.
author: Megan L.

description: We went here in the afternoon and it was pretty slow.  We tried the Reuben egg rolls, and while disturbingly delicious, they were a sincerely greasy mess.  I enjoyed the cocktails we ordered (which were a huge portion for the price) and the kitschy environment.  Did I mention they have a fake mustache & temporary tattoo dispenser?  Seems like a good place to go after a few rounds elsewhere to get some greasy late night food.
author: Sally L.

description: Fun atmosphere, good food, taater tot bar, grilled cheese bar and try the elk burger.  The waitresses all look like models and are down to earth.  It's not fine dining, but I'd definitely go back to hang out.
author: Jo A.

description:
Fun place! 

Terrific tator tots!

Interesting mixed crowd - a little young and too drunk for me.

Bartenders and servers are NICE!

An amazing patio!

Good tunes!

Yes!
author: Pam W.

description: Sometimes you just need bar grub that is a little more interesting than the standard and this place hits the mark.  Nice mix of people and very laid back.  The layout works well.  Some tables are high bar stool seating.  Others are lower with padded box type seats.
author: Carl C.

description: orgasm for 25 cents, those wings are a gift from god or a curse. 25 cent wings + those  cucumber drinks its dangerous... but worth it
author: Brigitte C.

description: Any place that shows Mexi-porn on the big screen is alright in my book.  I mean do you need anything else when you're a bit boozey on a Friday night?  Didn't think so.  I was so consumed by the waterfall shot, how could you not love this place?  Side note, they pour a mean shot of vodka, wooo it was rough.  I felt like I grew a furry chest by the time we got poured out of this place.  I am all about now working this gem into my bar rotation.  More please!
author: Nicole F.

description: Get over it people!! It's a fun name!!! Totchos are delish as well as everything else I've had here. It's pretty good bar food actually;0) My friends and I always have great time!! The last time we were here, the whole bar broke out in a full on sing a long! It was great! I think it's nice to have a little variety in the mission;0)
author: Veronika O.

description: I found the food to be really average. My sandwich wasn't anything special and tasted a bit bland. I got a buffalo chicken sandwich.
author: Rohan S.

description:
Went here for the 25 cent wings and they were excellent. Enviroment 
Was interesting. Place actually looks like a dive. Patio wasn't too bad. Mac and cheese was really good and the sweet potatoe fries were excellent. Not bad for bar food. Will be coming back.
author: Russell T.

description:
Love this place! the $.25 cent chicken wings are to die for!!  I faithfully come in and order 18 pieces of chicken wings for a grand total of $4!  ONLY ON WEDNESDAY!

My favorite sauce is the "Habanero"!!!!!!
BBQ sauce --  good..
Regular --- eww, no thanks
Death Sauce  -- speaks for itself, only tried one, waaaayyy to spicy for me!

the waitress I had that night was supperrr cool!..
author: LoLa L.

description: have become pretty solid regulars on wing wednesday and have yet to be disappointed. the wings are solid! my favorite are the buffalo and the sweet habanero. love that they have deschutes fresh squeezed on draft! service is fast and the fact that they have a back patio that gets sun for a long time is AMAZING.
author: Jamie R.

description: Shuffleboard and yummy sliders!  There's plenty of seating and they seem to get a fun crowd.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Pricey, although the food is excellent. Sometimes the service is okay, and other times it absolutely blows.
author: Alex G.

description: Lovely cocktails... will be back to pig out on tots...
author: Maximillian M.

description: What is that horrible, nasty, funky smell that does NOT go away.  OMG, straight smells like ass!!!! GROSS
author: Eve G.

description: This place was a blast!  Who can beat 2 for 1 margaritas??? You would have to be crazy to turn that down.  Food was great for bar food, fresh and tasty.
