I am very picky about guacamole but you could taste it was made fresh.  The corn dogs were awesome, and that honey mustard could be put on anything.  The staff was really fun and friendly... Ana was great!  Thanks again, I will be back.
author: Loretta M.

description: There are a lot of polarizing reviews for Mayhem so I want to offer a fair, balanced assessment: not liking Mayhem is like endorsing incest.
author: Andrew B.

description: Very fun bar. Gets crowded but the staff are always really nice and friendly. Love when the back patio is open. I've even reserved space for an event here and management/staff were all great to work with.
author: Ingrid R.

description: Awesome vibe early evening. If crowded, I avoid. No bar is good standing room only. How am I supposed to enjoy the tater tots? Dark woods, warm glow. Service is friendly, albeit shortstaffed. Oh and did I mention tater tots?
author: Boris C.

description: I ordered a white russian and got a shaken up foamy glass of milk with an almost imperceptible amount of kahlua in it.  I'm not sure if there was any vodka.
author: Mark S.

description: Amazing b & g for brunch . One of the best I've had. Menu kinda small tho
author: Chris A.

description:
I guess if you're into the hipster thing you'd like this place. Over priced beers served in mason jars and hipsters all around..
Thankfully it wasn't super crowded and we had a good enough time.
author: M A.

description: TOTCHOS.  dude.  so that's tater tots all dressed up in a nacho's outfit...cheese, salsa, sour cream, etc.  then there is mark, a really cool bartender (and maybe owner guy?) with a super sweet mustachio and he'll make you fancy cocktails until you run out of cash or fall off your barstool.  the crowd is pushing a marina-slumming-it vibe at times which makes me want to vom but it's not enough to keep me away.  they serve food until late which is good/bad to know cuz sometimes you don't really *need* totchos...
author: Emily T.

description: I love this place. Great environment. Plus they have great food . I went on a Wednesday and the special they had for Buffalo wings was unbelievable.  25 cent wings.. yes only  0.25 for each wing! at first I thought, for sure they are going to be nasty! but to my surprise they were soo good! I couldn't believe they would charge that little for something that good. Its great! I also heard on Thursday they have $2 tacos and 2 for 1 margarita specialt. i haven't done that, but if its anything as good as wednesday, I'll be sure to stop by one of these Thursdays to check it out and soon !
author: D M.

description: Awesome drinks, terrific service, and fun vibe! Glad yo have you, Mayhem,  in the Mission and I look forward to coming back!
author: Art A.

description:
I have been a Dr. Teeth patron for a few months now, usually stopping in on my way to somewhere else in the Mission. I was inspired to write this review tonight because I have been feeling particularly sentimental toward anyone who treats me like a human being lately.

I am originally a Midwesterner and world traveller since I was a child. I am not naive to large cities, but where I am from everyone--EVERYONE, gives you a "Hi, how the heck are ya?" every time you interact. I miss that.

A few days after I first moved here from the Midwest, I tried to help a dying homeless man and was tapped on the shoulder to be told that I shouldn't "mind him--he's just looking for attention." The man died. Being in the big city for over a year now, I could walk over that man without a second thought. I am not proud of that and have been regaining consciousness lately.

Dr. Teeth is an above average bar with an above average menu and patrons. There is nothing particularly out of the ordinary (San Francisco-wise) about this place.

BUT.

The bartenders here are like no one else in the city. They talk to you like a bartender should. Not just a "what do you want? Here it is, give me money." They are outgoing, fun and not to mention easy on the eyes ;).

Natalie and Mack go out of their way to make sure you are well watered and comfortable. They are my HANDS DOWN favorite bartenders in the city. (and I'm quite the bar patron)

If you want some actual hospitality, come here.
author: P P.

description: Because this bar has only been opened a week, I give it 3 out of 5. It's a huge space but I feel it needs a little bit more uniqueness (my girlfriend would agree). YES, it draws both hipster missionites and "others", and YES, it plays a variation of contemporary-yet average-mainstream music (which by the way,  seemed to sound a little repressed in volume), BUT not tied-in with a rockish bar  and lights set-up that is muppetesque in distinctness and appeal, then this bar is only as good as it's weakest feature...Mind you the drinks are good (try the blackberry fizz) and the pour...GENEROUS. Foodwise - well, it's typical bar food but definitely needs SALT, especially in the mac n cheese. Final suggestion: Pump up the volume in all levels.
author: Claude C.

description: Great tater-tots nachos. If you go you must get these! Good vibe. Bathrooms are a little scary.
author: James P.

description: Came here on a Saturday afternoon with no wait, nice waitress and a great ambience. I shared the Reuben egg rolls with Russian dipping sauce, jelly donut fried chicken sandwich and a bloody Mary. The food was more than enough for two. Egg rolls was yum, not sure if i'd get it again though. The sandwich was really Delish great combo of sweet and savory. Bloody Mary was pretty damn good though I don't drink much. This may be the new brunch spot that actually has good food.
author: Darnell L.

description: The grilled cheese rocks! My friends and I had a good time at this place. I didn't notice until later that there were spooky dental decorations all over.  I must have been distracted by the great food. While we were there we had great table service.
author: Marty W.

description: I've actually been here twice now, and it has a really decent atmosphere.. I have yet to try the food - but good lord, every time I go here I can smell the food so strongly and it looks REALLY good. It's actually on my to-do list to finally buckle down and try a dinner or lunch here soon =] Also, the servers and bartenders are quick to help and are extremely polite, I'll be back soon!
author: Terry B.

description: Burger was good but over cooked (really well done, not juicy) despite ordering it rare. This is a cool place to grab a beer, though. I'll have to give it another shot soon.
author: M R.

description: I think I find the decor so interesting that I kinda forgot what I had. I wasn't disappointed with the food, neither was I impressed. What I was impressed by was taking a look at the um, what is it called, the chart that tells you how spicy is spicy! I don't know, but I really don't wanna find out. Has anyone seen that video that went around on YouTube about this for awhile? No? YouTube it and then try the chiles!
author: Alexia R.

description: We went to Dr. Teeth after seeing a Groupon a few months ago...and were excited to try this new spot. However, when we got there for the Groupon offer, they told us it was only valid after 3pm and not during brunch - even though it said nothing like that on the Groupon or in the fine print. The manager indicated they changed their menu after the Groupon was issued. I felt like the restaurant was taking advantage of people as at least 3-4 other couples came in around the same time and experienced the same thing. So it seemed like a way to get people to come into the restaurant twice under the guise of a Groupon. We stayed and the food was actually not that great anyway. I will never return.
author: Eric W.

description:
Disclaimer: neither my friends nor I are hipsters, so if you want to know about the "hipster vibe", you should read a different review. This is just about food and service.

We had the Groupon for 6: 6 beers, 3 baskets of tater tots and 30 sliders. That was a lot of food for 6. I guess that's the good news, cuz it wasn't a lot of money ($86.85 retail value, according to them). The other good news: the sweet potato tater tots and truffle tater tots were good. The sliders were variable: BLT - good; classic slider - horrible, a dried-up disk completely unidentifiable as beef; meatball - tasty enough, but with virtually NO sauce; I didn't have the Reuben, but one of my friends ate quite a few, so I think that means they're good.

The (other) bad news: VERY inattentive service. I had to try to shout over the music to get our waitress's attention, cuz she never stopped by, and it wasn't busy. Took *forever* to get the drink refills and water (she had to be reminded about the water). Also all sorts of weird rules: you have to order sliders in batches of 10 (can't order 12, like 2 per person, say) and each time you order, you have to order at least two of any kind you want. And I woke up at 3am with a really bad stomachache; not sure what to attribute that to.

And oops, most of our gang didn't want beer, so we supposedly got our first soft drinks for free instead. One person had a cocktail (which he said was good). Only two of us had a 2nd soft drink, and the waitress made a big deal about having tried to verbally order some of our drinks so they wouldn't end up on our tab. But somehow the drinks bill came to $16? Just how expensive was that cocktail anyway? The waitress brought the bill in two pieces: tax on the Groupon deal ($4.61) plus the drinks ($16). So the final bill should have been $20.61, right? But no, it was $22.23. I didn't want to wait another however-many minutes or hours for her to come back and she's already told me she can't do math, so we just paid. It's probably something like tax on the drinks, but that should have been in the total before she brought the bill.
author: J T.

description: I'm always looking for a good new spot to try and last time I was on Mission I came across one of the best surprises in awhile! Mayhem has the perfect atomoshpere.. an amazingly fun place where everyone seems to be there to have a genuine good time. The decor is random and funky but that sort of rounds out the whole vibe. Drinks are super strong and even though I usually am not a fan of "speciality drinks" the blueberry drink I got was beyond belief! yummm!!! I thought the different hot sauces and grilled cheeses choices were cool but it was the ruben eggrolls that put the menu on the map.. i would say they should be featured on Diners, Drive-In's, and Dives but this place is not a diner, drive-in or dive so I guess thats out! lol It was a little cold to go on the patio but I'm already looking forward to better weather and getting the experience the whole place! love it!!!!
author: Christina P.

description: Typically I go to the bar just for drinks and to meet people but this bar is an exception. My friends and I will go to Dr. Teeth for their food because is so good. I recommend the grilled cheese and tomato soup. They have all different kinds of grilled cheese too so it is always fun to share with your friends. I watched the NBA basketball playoffs here last season and it got pretty packed but in general I think it is low key. If you are looking to have a wild night I wouldn't suggest Dr. Teeth but if you are looking to have a casual drink and food with friends this is the spot. Oh, and the decorations on the wall make this place especially unique.
author: Lauren B.

description: Came here recently for a birthday party. The waitresses here were amazing! Super friendly and flirty ;)- not the usual weird,hipster vibe at all. Our waitresses knew their drinks and suggested some great specialty ones. The menu is great. The tater tot bar is the main draw, but I went with my "mission" standby, the nachos. Do yourself a favor and go with the tator tots. This is their speciality and their salads are gi-normous!
author: David S.

description: I absolutely love this place! The owner Mark is a really great dude and super friendly, and Danielle is such a fun server! The grilled cheese was amazing! I love their outside area where they have cornhole. My new Mission bar!
author: Alex J.

description: We stumbled upon this place and let me tell you, it was incredibly lucky! The food is amazing, the drinks are delicious, and the server Danielle is fabulous! I recommend the hash plate, selfish!
author: Matthew G.

description: love this bar! real nice in summer when they open up the patio.
author: Bayboy L.

description:
There is nothing bad you can say about this place. Great addition to the mission district. The bartenders and waitresses make your feel welcome and never rush you. They have jameson on TAP.....enough said.

Food is great, drinks are great, the bar specials are great and atmosphere is fun. Hit this place up when your around the area.
author: alvin j.

description: order the peanut butter jelly burger its goooooooddd
author: Jenny P.

description: Great atmosphere, cheap drinks, good pub food. Plus they have a really fun shuffleboard table
author: sean m.

description:
I found this place on yelp and decided to try it out because the name really caught my attention. The area really isn't all that bad. There are a lot of areas in San Francisco that are "sketchy", you've just gotta be alert and aware of your surroundings. Anyways, I went on a Thursday Night and it was pretty packed. You seat yourself so thank god my friend and I were able to find a table. We flagged down a waitress who was very prompt, friendly and helpful. She checked up on us about three times to make sure everything was going ok and to see if we needed anything. She answered all my questions about happy hour here. They moved 2 for 1 margaritas and $2 tacos to Tuesdays and they still have $.25 wings on Wednesdays (which I will check out). There is a lot of food to choose from on the menu at very affordable prices. I bought a burger with fries and a margarita for $21 bucks... And their plates aren't sparse and they pour with a heavy hand. You really get your money's worth here.

Overall, I'm really impressed with this place. I love the lively atmosphere, the great service, food and prices. I will definitely be coming back to check out their happy hours and try out other foods on the menu. I would recommend checking out Dr Teeth & the Electric Mayhem if you're ever in the area and are looking for a good place to eat.
author: Rosa L.

description: Charging $3 for a Diet Coke for a designated driver? Really? That's fucking busch league. Way to promote responsible drinking by charging people for carbonated water and syrup.
author: Joshua T.

description: The food tastes canned, the service is crazy slow, and the music is too loud and obnoxious. I should have ordered one of their cocktails, maybe I would have left in a better mood.
author: Jamie L.

description: Went here last saturday after having dinner near by.  Good bartender recommended the double IPA from 21st Amendment.  The waitress was johnny on the spot whenever I needed a re-fill.  What more can you ask for?  I can't wait for the outdoor patio to open.
author: Peter R.

description: Got turned on to this place not too long ago! F-ing looooove this place. Drinks, food, shuffleboard, and a giant backyard patio. Awesome for happy hour!
author: Rouz E.

description: Unfortunatley my first post on Yelp is going to be a bad one. I should have written a dussin of positive ones after having experienced some of the amazing restaurants in this city. So for all of you out there who are considering this place: we waited 40 minutes for two screw drivers and a beer, 90 minutes for the eggs & toasts. The waitress was kind of a bitch and the food wasnt really all that good. Oh and it was expensive too.
author: Robin E.

description: The food is probably pretty good, but I'll never know. Took 35 minutes to get a seat. Then was seated for over a half hour with no greeting from server. After unsuccessfully requesting them to come take our order twice, I left and went to American Grilled Cheese Kitchen (best decision of my day). Might give it another try in the future, but definitely not on a Saturday afternoon!
author: Greg W.

description: I'm really wondering just where it is the other people here that complained about Dr Teeth have visited. True - the lighting is kinda low (as was noted in a previous review), but it IS a bar, that happens to serve good bar food. At least, I felt that it was more that than a traditional restaurant. It was like a high-end version of a place like Buckshot Grill in the Inner Richmond, but rather than more rock n roll vibe, it was sort of a Mission mishmash. The food is friggin' GREAT - and if you get one of the Tots plates, you had better bring another person with a giant appetite - they don't mess around at Dr. Teeth's on the portions! The drinks were good and strong, and not obnoxiously priced - they have a happy hour that starts later in the evening (around 10pm methinks), and the staff I met were super friendly, really helpful, nice folks. I'll definitely be going back...especially once they really expand their intriguing menu.
author: Marco M.

description: got a living social deal and fell in love with this place
author: Gaston E.

description: Man do I love teeth, one of my favorite spots to walk to on a sunny day in the mission.  Incredible patio out back with cornhole board, skeeball, and plenty of seats.  Great drinks, bottomless mimosas on the weekend, Jameson on top, 25 cent wing Wednesdays, and mother-effin Tachos/Crab tots.  What more do you need in life?
author: Ryan A.

description: This place is da bomb. My boyfriend and I bought the living social special so we could have a day out of Marin. We don't follow sports so we had no idea this would be such a go to place. We got there a little before 2pm and the brunch special ended at 3pm, and the place was mobbed. I asked a server what we needed to do and she said you may not be able to be served today due to the wait list, but talk to the manager behind the bar. I did and he made us our first of bottomless mimosas right away and we went to sit outside. We shared a table with some wonderful folks and the servers were very attentive. Our omelets were huge and delicious. The sweet potato tater tots are like dessert. The mimosas are mainly champagne with a touch of OJ and they kept serving after 3pm. The other patrons were so friendly and we found ourselves cheering for the Niners and getting involved in the game. It's not just a great restaurant or sports bar but a gathering place to meet wonderful people.
author: Meg T.

description: My buddy and I strolled into this crazy looking bar after chowing down a big dinner. We were amongst the only patrons over 35 years old. It was zany with interesting and crazy decorations...like Alexander McQueen decorating a set for a "Seinfeld" episode (really showing my age). It was packed, loud, chaotic, hot as a sauna, and fun. The bartender with the moustache was holding court and was very friendly. However, I wish my 3 Vodka 7s were much stronger. I don't enjoy ice cube diluted mixed drinks that are finished in 3 gulps. Oh well. The other patrons were dressed for partying in the mission...some donning wigs, fake glasses, headbands, tattoos, and even the occasional anime/manga character (one patron came in as Batgirl with her sidekick, Hello Kitty). It's fun to be young, wild, and free!!! Everyone was having fun. My complaint is that it was a bikram yoga sweat shop with it being packed. They need a ventilation system (a/c, fan, exhaust, etc....). Otherwise, it was a blast going back in time and being around those crazy 20 to 30 somethings for a few hours. After leaving this place, we needed a quick snack and headed 2 blocks to Hog and Rocks.
author: H E.

description: I can't even begin to describe how awesome this place is.  The western style eggs Benny is probably one of the best things I have had, besides the bottomless mimosas, but they only go till 3....PM!!! I feel like the last few times I was there, my glass of mimosa was never actually empty.  The servers were on us like hawks and there for every order we needed.  The Food, Alcohol, and Service were above and beyond any expectation!!  Oh plus they have Cornhole and shufflepuck!!
author: Austin L.

description: Good service (with a smile), good drinks, and great comfort food (gotta get the tot-chos!) However there is not enough seating or standing room on a Friday/Saturday night and the bathrooms are just nasty. Overall a cool spot to hang out - until it gets too crowded and you have to use the bathroom.
author: Anna C.

description: The drinks: 3 stars.  The food: 3 stars.  HOWEVER, we ordered two takeout burgers.  One with curly fries, the other with onion rings.  We got a lot of curly fries, BUT ONLY THREE ONION RINGS!  Hence the two stars overall.
author: N T.

description: wings cheap and finger licking good! (but you cnt take none to go so eat up). people are cool. bartenders make good drinks. good place to go after work to chill!
author: Chanta H.

description: surprisingly good food.  i tried the tot-chos, eggs benedict, and banana bread french toast last time.  all of it was good, but i liked the banana bread french toast the most.  coming from the east bay wasn't bad - bart and a few blocks walk.  i'd go back for the french toast.
author: V T.

description: We went there on a Thursday around 530 in the evening and it was pretty busy.  The waitress brought us water and menus really quick. The atmosphere was loud We ordered our drinks and waited a while before we got them.  I ordered a top shelf long beach and water.  We also ordered a sampler which was good. Then an order of nachos which was ok. When I received my check I was really shocked to see how much it was so I looked at it closer.  I thought I was charged twice for my drink so I mentioned it to the waitress.  Nope they charge $24.00 for that drink.  I know there is a little up charge for it but I've never been charged double. I will proceed with caution from now on after this incident. I still think someone made a mistake but I have them a chance to fix it but they didn't so here I am.  This also warning signs in the bathroom to watch for pick pocketers. Nice!! I thought maybe there would be a place like a hook under the table to put your purse but there wasn't.  I had to hold it on my lap while I ate. Not my favorite place.  Will I go back,  no!
author: Michelle T.
